author: {'steamid': '76561198978728954', 'num_games_owned': 810, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 1092, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1092, 'playtime_at_review': 1092, 'last_played': 1711870105}
review:
A solid beat-em-up, combined with Metroidvania-style unlocks in a 2D platformer. The reason this is such a good combination, is that finding a new power-up has a lot of implications. Not only can you access more areas of the map, but another layer of complexity is added to both the combat and the platforming (for example, the uppercut acts as a quasi-double jump, breaks red enemy shields, and launches enemies into the air). The Mexican aesthetic and goofy tone tie it all up in a nice little ribbon.

If you like best em ups, 2D platformers, or Metroidvanias even a little bit, I'm sure you'll find some enjoyment here.

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198308265246', 'num_games_owned': 2431, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 816, 'playtime_at_review': 816, 'last_played': 1712085407}
review:
Al fin pude quitarme este pendiente de encima y me sorprendió lo bueno que puede ser para lo cortito que es. 
Guacamelee es un correcto metroidvania que trae mecánicas beat em up muy bien implementadas haciendo así que no sea necesario un gestor de inventario y buscar el arma para tu tipo de juego, todo es puño, patada, llaves de lucha libre muy divertidas de ejecutar, los comandos de movimientos son relativamente sencillos y es sorprendente lo variado que puede ser el move set, está tan bien pensado que muchas veces vas a hacer combos larguísimos de forma natural sin realmente pretender eso y por ese lado es totalmente adictivo, diría que es lo mejor del juego.

Me encantó la estética con folclore mexicano, los colores creo que fueron muy bien elegidos representadose en una comedia bastante acertada un juego que no se toma muuuuuuuy en serio que digamos, la historia es simple, no se van muy por las ramas, los poderes especiales que sirven como ''llaves'' también son simples y que bien se pueden usar para encadenar combos.

Va sonar repetitivo, pero realmente lo mejor de Guacamelee es su sistema de combo y lo que más se va disfrutar. 
¿Vale la pena probarlo?, no hay duda, no va ser ni de cerca el mejor metroidvania de steam, pero fácilmente entraría en una gran selección y su sistema de combate le dan una capa de originalidad en un género algo saturado de cosas medievales, slash de espadas y magia.

Su duración pienso es perfecta, además es bastante intuitivo, es muy difícil perderte, ideal para la gente sin paciencia, eso sí, tiene alguna que otra zona complicada de plataformeo que hay que sortear con ingenio, pero como el luchador se maneja muy bien, tarde o temprano (más temprano) lo vas a terminar superando. 

Una muy buena opción para amantes de metroidvanias y jugadores retros de beat' em ups, lo recomiendo bastante.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075049053', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 362, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1711933824}
review:
a totally fun platforming game with a focus on kinetic, 1v100 combat scenarios. really fun chaining hits together, launching stuff around, and bouncing through the levels. really boring walking through boring towns, fighting enemies that sit still and tick down a timer and then hurt you, and playing simon says with the lame final boss.

great artstyle and pretty cool music. apparently this edition of the game adds some filler levels, which, despite the games relatively short runtime, was definitely felt. there were some levels where i was running around doing stuff, ended up back at the beginning through some neat looping level design, and then realised i was supposed to just leave at that point. it felt like i had got through all the warm up parts, and then right when the meat of the level was going to begin, it was over. i.e. these levels were all starter and no steak.

otherwise that's fine. maybe i will play guacamelee gold one day and update this review.

played on deck, experienced no issues whatsoever.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102818170', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1020, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 955, 'playtime_at_review': 1020, 'last_played': 1711740156}
review:
메트로배니아를 기대하고 이 게임을 산다면 분명 후회하게 될 것
스토리는 완전 선형적인 진행인데
중간중간 전맵으로 돌아가서 아이템을 먹으러 가는 게 이 게임의 메트로배니아 요소의 전부다
하지만 액션은 격투게임처럼 콤보를 넣을 수 있고 타격감이 매우 훌륭하다
정밀 플래포머 요소가 꽤 강한데, 스토리 진행하는데에는 높은 실력이 필요없지만
도전과제하기 위해 아이템을 수집하려고 하면 조금 어려울 수 있는 난이도를 가지고 있다
메트로배니아로서는 별로지만 플래포머랑 액션 게임으로서는 높은 완성도를 가지고 있어서 높은 평가를 주고 싶다

author: {'steamid': '76561198136046683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 283, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1711279491}
review:
Guacamelee is a charming metroidvania style brawler that focuses on combos, throws and aerial combat.

I say metroidvania-style, since while you do gain new abilities that let you access new places in old areas, the main path is signposted for you and exploration is not really incentivized unless you want to gather all the power-ups and secrets.

The combat system is great - responsive and impactful. The moves are also incorporated into the platforming challenges. Only problem is that Guacamelee is rather easy on normal difficulty.

On the whole I recommend this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198275469876', 'num_games_owned': 495, 'num_reviews': 268, 'playtime_forever': 1046, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1046, 'last_played': 1710117702}
review:
Espectacular plataformas 2D con un combate brutal.
Tiene cooperativo hasta para 4 personas.
La ambientación mexicana está muy bien lograda, mezclando lo mejor de la cultura. Desde el día de los muertos hasta la música, todo está hecho con cariño.
La historia no es la gran cosa pero el humor en ciertas zonas le da el toque.
Combina diferentes mecánicas para que no se sienta repetitivo en ningún momento, teniendo que jugar con todas y cada una de ellas. El diseño de niveles está muy bien pensado.
La pasé muy bien jugándolo. Lo recomiendo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032541079', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1991, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1991, 'last_played': 1709860134}
review:
Guacamelee! combina magistralmente los estilos de plataformas, metroidvania y beat 'em up. Todo bajo una cuidada y hermosa ambientación, basada en la cultura mexicana, que como buen ciudadano hispano he apreciado enormemente. A todo esto le suma humor del bueno y varias referencias a otros juegos clásicos, que los más veteranos detectaremos enseguida.

El juego en sí tiene una duración media y es bastante lineal sumado a una historia trivial que solo es una excusa. Su dificultad va de menor a mayor y presenta algunos retos complicados que en varias ocasiones nos obligará a repetirlos una y otra vez. Por suerte no llegan a ser frustrantes, ya que gracias a la delicia de sus controles, con un poco de práctica, tarde o temprano los superaremos.

Solamente le achaco que como fan de los metroidvania le faltó mucha más profundidad, pero definitivamente lo recomiendo para todo aquel que disfrute de los tres géneros mencionados al comienzo. Una grata sorpresa que bien vale la pena ser vivida.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974443732', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 775, 'last_played': 1710142627}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993946302', 'num_games_owned': 2989, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 1086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1086, 'last_played': 1708760415}
review:
Inizio subito con il dire che Guacamelee! è un signor metroidvania. A me è piaciuto praticamente in ogni suo aspetto. Bella grafica essenziale, belle musiche messicane, bel gameplay con combattimenti divertenti, belle le abilità che si prenderanno progredendo nel gioco, bello il modo intelligente in cui bisogna sfruttare queste abilità per progredire o ancora di più per trovare i segreti, bei personaggi, bei boss. Ho apprezzato anche la presenza delle sfide nell'inferno che costringono il giocatore ad usare o non usare specifiche abilità nei combattimenti o sfruttare le abilità al meglio per finire un percorso in un certo tempo prestabilito. È un gioco fatto con cura e lo consiglio senza riserve a chiunque sia appassionato di metroidvania o semlicemente platform 2D.
Il gioco ha solo un neo: l'esistenza di Guacamelee! gold edition. La gold edition è semplicemente lo stesso gioco con piccole differenze, un boss in meno e un paio di mappe in meno. Trovo perfettamente legittimo che dopo aver fatto uscire la gold edition, gli sviluppatori abbiano deciso di arricchire il gioco facendo uscire una versione più completa che è questa, la super turbo championship edition (STCE), ma che senso ha venderle entrambe? Ignari giocatori potrebbero comprarle entrambe credendo che siano giochi diversi, invece sono ESATTAMENTE lo stesso gioco (a parte quelle differenze citate poco sopra). Una cosa più onesta sarebbe stata vendere la STCE e includere anche la gold edition, in modo da permettere a chi vuole, di provare la versione originale, così come hanno fatto gli sviluppatori di Ori and the Blind Forest. Invece al momento sono in vendita entrambe e allo stesso prezzo.

author: {'steamid': '76561199517935282', 'num_games_owned': 989, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 600, 'last_played': 1709404798}
review: Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition is a great Mexican inspired Metroidvania with great beat 'em up style combat, well made level design and platforming, amazing art, and a really good soundtrack to boot. You play as Juan who must don the legendary luchador mask to save El Presidente's Daughter from the evil Calaca. The story has plenty tongue in-cheek humour and there is plenty of Easter eggs to other games found throughout the adventure. Took me about 10 hours to get through and just found it to be a great time!

author: {'steamid': '76561198104177230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1412, 'last_played': 1709397017}
review:
An sich ist das eigentlich ein cooles Spiel mit einer eigenen Art von Humor und einer gewissen Prise Magical Boy Vibe.
Mit voranschreitenden Spiel schaltet man weitere Kräfte/Kampffähigkeiten frei und muss verschiedene Bosse der Totenwelt bekämpfen. Die Tatsache, dass man zwischendurch als Hühnchen durch die Kampfgeschichte spazieren muss, bringt ihren eigenen Charme.

Mein Daumen runter liegt jedoch darin begründet, dass es sehr viele Stellen im Spiel gibt, die einfach unnötig schwer/unfair gemacht wurden. So muss man sich an vielen Stellen/Plattformen wortwörtlich milimeterweit durchwuseln, andernfalls schmiert der Charakter direkt ab. Im Kampf kann es vorkommen, dass plötzlich einem sämtliche Gegner auf dem Schoß sitzen, sodass man weder die eigene Spielfigur sieht noch sich irgendwie freikämpfen kann. Oder man trägt Schaden von einer gut entfernten Explosion, die einen trotzdem so trifft als stände man direkt daneben.

Die Bosskämpfe sind machbar, aber an einigen Stellen genau so frustrierend. Insbesondere dann, wenn die Spielfigur plötzlich beschließt sich nicht mehr an der Wand festzuhalten und somit mit voller Wucht eine Strahlenattacke abbekommt.
Zwischendurch dauert es aber auch etwas zu lange, bis die Spielfigur wieder aufstehen kann (ohne direkt danach wieder eine geballert zu bekommen, sodass sie wieder komplett flach liegt).

Es gibt in einem Gebiet Bonusherausforderungen, in denen man verschiedene Aufgaben Bewältigen muss. Diese bestehen entweder aus Kämpfen (Besiehe so viele Gegner wie möglich in kürzester Zeit / ohne Spezialattacken / ohne zu Werfen / ohne die Kombo zu unterbrechen usw.) oder schnell von A nach B kommen. Ich habe mich an 6 von bisher 8 "freigeschalteten" (der Zugang zu weiteren war durch einen mir noch fehlende Spezialattacken-Block blockiert). 2 finde ich (für mich) nicht machbar, da sie Milimeterarbeit beinhalten und ich irgendwann darauf keinen Bock mehr hatte.

Hätte man das Spiel im Verlauf herausfordernder machen wollen, so hätte man entweder Schwierigkeitsstufen einbauen oder erst nach und nach steigern sollen - aber nicht immer wieder zwischendurch Stellen einbauen, die Frustration gepaart mit Aggressionen hervorrufen. Das nimmt mir dann doch ein wenig die Spiellust, weswegen ich es zum Zeitpunkt dieser Rezension nicht abgeschlossen habe.

Ich werde das Spiel vielleicht zu einem anderen Zeitpunkt beenden und die Rezension eventuell (minimal) anpassen.
Wäre eigentlich ein Daumen nach oben gewesen, wenn meine Frustrationsgrenze nicht weit überschritten wäre 

[h3] Anmerkung [/h3]
Je nach Controller könnte die Tastenbelegung ein wenig anders sein.
Ich hatte einen von der Marke VOYEE, welcher mit der Switch kompatibel ist, da waren X = Y; Y = X; A = B und B = A. Die anderen Tasten waren die wie im Spiel vorgesehen.
Allerdings erkannte das Spiel den Controller auch nur, wenn er per USB-Kabel angeschlossen war. Per Bluetooth war der unsichtbar (obwohl mein Laptop mit ihm gekoppelt war).

author: {'steamid': '76561198384734058', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 1240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1240, 'last_played': 1709152690}
review:
Skakanie i Zabijanie wrogów. Ciekawa i nawet trudna platformówka
Zalecam granie na padzie a nie klawiaturze i myszce
Grałem sam i nie odczułem jakiegoś wybrakowania zawartości 

Trudność gry (według mnie) polega na skakaniu bo dostępnych ruchów jest dużo a do celowania nimi jest tylko jedna gałka pada (oczywiście do aktywowania ruchów służą wszystkie przyciski na padzie ale chodzi mi wyłącznie o sterowanie ich kierunkiem) połowa przycisków ma przypisane po kilka ruchów zależnie od kierunku 
a więc nie trudno o przesunięcie gałki jeden milimetr za daleko by wykonać inny ruch niż byśmy chcieli, i zdarza sie to często a w późniejszej fazie gry jeden zły ruch często prowadzi do ponownego przechodzenia etapu 

Backtracking'u jest dość dużo (na szczęście są teleporty), co chwile dostajemy nową umiejętność która pozwala nam wykonać ruch dzięki któremu możemy dostać sie w nowe miejsce na wcześniejszym poziomie, w większości przypadków te miejsca to po prostu punkty zwiększające pasek życia, energi i czasem superumiejętnośći lub pieniądze potrzebne do ulepszeń które nie są zbyt rozbudowane, ot więcej życia czy szybciej regenerująca sie energia 

Pomimo tych minusów gra ma dużo do zaoferowania :
Humorystyczną i klimatyczną fabułę opierającą się na kulturze meksykańskiej 
Różnorodny zestaw ruchów i umiejętności 
Zróżnicowani przeciwnicy i ciekawie zaprojektowane poziomy 
Poboczne questy
Kilka bossów 
Troche zawartości poza główną ścieżką

author: {'steamid': '76561198036150466', 'num_games_owned': 230, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 970, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 970, 'last_played': 1709153234}

author: {'steamid': '76561198094479567', 'num_games_owned': 520, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 1645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1645, 'last_played': 1708004507}
review:
Guacamelee is a delightful (albeit slightly dated) Metroidvania game that offers a user-friendly learning curve and an effortless integration of combat and parkour mechanics. I first played it on my PS4 in 2015, but was recently encouraged to revisit it after completing the Ori series, which also serves as an excellent introduction to the genre.

While the narrative in Guacamelee is minimal, it successfully intertwines with the gameplay and environments. The main characters are vibrant and fulfill their roles effectively, without overstaying their welcome. However, I cannot say the same for the villains (bar Calaca), as they provide little substance beyond comic relief, particularly in their disappointingly easy boss battles.

The true standout feature of the game is the aforementioned combat and navigation mechanics. The map is filled with various colored blocks, each corresponding to a specific move. As you progress through the game, you acquire these moves in classic Metroidvania fashion. By utilizing these moves, combat can range from straightforward to intricate. Although the variety of enemies is somewhat lacking, the game strategically places them throughout, constantly keeping the player engaged.

The parkour elements in Guacamelee deserve special mention, particularly during moments such as the Tule Tree, where movement and puzzle-solving are seamlessly combined. However, there are also instances where the movement can be frustrating, such as in the orb challenges. These segments push the game's mechanics to their limits, and the player may face consequences for any missteps.

Overall, Guacamelee provides a highly enjoyable, compact gaming experience that can be acquired for a super cheap discounted price. Prior to playing, I would recommend adjusting your sense of humor to align with the style of the 2010s, as the game frequently utilizes classic phrases like "derp" and "trollololol".

author: {'steamid': '76561198323682692', 'num_games_owned': 411, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 910, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 846, 'last_played': 1708012766}
review:
忘了啥时候免费领的了，以前看到过“墨西哥英雄大混战”这个逆天搞笑的中文译名下过盗版但是没通关，现在真结局通关了。应该算是早期独立游戏里相当精良的一款了。易上手难精通的战斗系统、巧妙地将战斗招式与能力锁设计相结合、独特的拼贴风格画面、王道又搞笑的剧情（当然达成完美的真结局还是挺麻烦）、浓厚的墨西哥风情还有超多游戏的彩蛋（例如《城堡破坏者》、《风之旅人》、《冥界狂想曲》、《VVVVVV》等）都是值得游玩的地方。

  生者和亡者世界的切换也是本作的一大特色，围绕这个系统做出了非常不错的关卡设计（[spoiler] 说真的，虽然踩一捧一不好，但我真觉得比sabotage做的《信使》要好玩多了。。。 [/spoiler]）跳跳乐挺多但是秒杀地形很少，掉下悬崖会光速给你传送回来，除了几个地方以及真结局所需道具的部分还是挺高血压的以外算是友好了。服装系统也有助于逃课，没有小鸡套和恶魔套我大概是看不到真结局的（doge）

  传送点较少以及最终boss是纯纯数值+机制怪，不满意。

author: {'steamid': '76561197991825366', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1708673483}
review: This game screams Mexican culture and vibrancy ranging from the music and colours to the aesthetic. Awesome combat mechanics with intricate fun combos combined with metroidvania exploration and progression. The platforming and jumping is like no other game I have played, imagine traversing realms mid jump in order to get to your destination, a spike wall that can now be stood on or a platform appearing beneath your feet. Really well made and a lot of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198177586287', 'num_games_owned': 104, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1134, 'last_played': 1706878185}
review:
I have played Guacalmelee before on my PS Vita (base game + DLCs which effectively amount to the Guacamelee! Gold Edition). The handheld provided a great experience with a good control scheme and good colors on the OLED. 
And now I have picked up both Guacamelee! Gold Edition and Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition on Steam.

Since the 2 games are related I will provide the same review for both.
[b]TLDR:[/b] If you are new to the Guacamelee franchise, it is a very fun and thoughtfully designed game and I highly recommend it. I would recommend the STCE over the Gold Edition for new players because it has more levels.

[b]Pros:[/b]
- Good music
- Thoughtful level design and teaching is done incrementally on the job, resulting in a good difficulty curve.
- Colorful theme.
- I am proud to say I 101% this game without referring any online guides (especially for hidden collectibles).
- Hard mode provides a good challenge and makes the bosses much more challenging.
- Practical quick travel system that does not take away from exploration.

[b]Comments on STCE[/b]
Having effectively 100% completed the Gold Edition twice (once on the PS Vita and once again on Steam), I took good note of the changes in STCE. Of course the main addition in STCE is the expanded map and levels but there are mechanic changes, etc. as well.
- STCE tutorial could have explained that Y (on a controller) also allows clinging to the wall
- Color saturation was changed, I didn't appreciate it on some levels.
- Using the bright purple color scheme provides a way to tell players that the attack is not dodgable but takes some of the immersion in some cases, eg: (spoiler) [spoiler] Lava attacks in the final fight should be orange. [/spoiler]
- [spoiler] Requires confirmation but I think you can unlock the happy ending with one less orb, or at least the cut-scenes will be unlocked in the menu? [/spoiler]
- Mixed feelings about combat balance since we have more health and stamina upgrades compared to the GE. This especially applies to getting gold medals in the Inferno levels, especially since we now have Intensio.

author: {'steamid': '76561198994773294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1706137020}
review:
As of January 2024,

Great game overall but with lots of bad parts that I'll list below 

Last stage seems so rushed, it just so unispired, like the devs rushed it to finish it quickly. It's just hard fights and use of last power which makes you fly.
The last boss is ridiculously hard, I one tried every boss but I gave up on the last one... Too bad...
This game is NOT for people with color blindness, there is a shield mecanic with color so if you don't see the colors, don't even try to play this game.
Lots of time, your controller will make the wrong power (you input something something else happens), it's infuriating and it happens a lot.
The travels stones are really badly located, might as well not put them at all as they're utterly useless due to bad location.
Some part of the game are extremely difficult randomly whereas it's overall great everywhere else. Make no sense at all.

The goods : Music is really awesome. I think that's one of the best things of the game. Anyway, all the good things about this game have already been said and are true. The game is really fun and well written.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104197959', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 583, 'last_played': 1705521207}
review:
Guacamelee! es un juego de plataformas con estructura de Metroidvania en el que tendremos que rescatar a nuestra amada viajando entre el mundo de los vivos y de los muertos durante la famosa fiesta del folklore Mexicano.

Durante la partida obtendremos dinero que invertiremos en comprar mejoras de nuestro personaje; buscaremos cofres muy escondidos para aumentar nuestras estadísticas de vida y energía, y encontraremos un simpático chivo que nos otorgará nuevas habilidades para seguir avanzando.

Una maravilla de juego plataformero con combates interesantes con dificultad en aumento, mucha exploración y una serie de retos adicionales para ser el autentico LUCHADOR.

author: {'steamid': '76561198276634938', 'num_games_owned': 10153, 'num_reviews': 1500, 'playtime_forever': 2460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2460, 'last_played': 1702389790}
review:
[h1]
我愿意称这款游戏为： 牛 战 士 的 奇 妙 冒 险
[/h1]

游戏主角给我的第一感觉就是成龙历险记里的牛战士，作为一款2D跳台游戏我认为游戏的质量是非常棒的。最抓人眼球的可能就是游戏的画风了，这个画风怎么说呢，有种中国古代版画内味儿。咱是一个粗人，这种感觉实在是不知道怎么表达。

从游戏性方面来说，动作流畅不拖泥带水，难度适中，作为一个手残的直观感受，虽然有些地方的容错率比较低，但是多试几次也就过去了，有些地方有点空洞骑士的感觉，但是相比空洞骑士而言难度低了很多。年兽追逐战那块有点奥日银之树的感觉，但是比奥日简单太多。
地图设计的也算是回环曲折吧，还有秋冬地图状态互换更加延展了地图的复杂性，虽然地图看起来蛮复杂的，但是归根到底还是一个线性跳台游戏，几乎不会迷路。
升级内容我也没看太明白，反正就是升级血量槽能量槽攻击力什么的，除了攒钱升级以外，还可以攒鬼头币解锁服装，比如鬼人服装无限能量但是不能不能吃血球，西装男攻击吸血但是血量上限低，这些服装花里胡哨的倒是还蛮有意思。
战斗系统的话我个人还是很喜欢的，就无脑按X然后打出硬直摁Y把怪扔向一边对其他敌人造成伤害，除此以外还有末日铁拳玩家最喜欢的上勾拳！！非常舒适。怪物类型我觉得还是挺单调的，玩到现在遇到的怪物类型一只手就能数个差不多，玩久了还是会有点审美疲劳。游戏也没有设置boss战，可以说是没设置吧，几乎之前出来的终场怪物到了后面也会作为精英怪出现。这些怪打起来还是蛮简单的，基本没有什么打不过的情况，真 老年人游戏。

游戏好像最多支持四人同屏联机，不过好像只能插手柄玩。我用的手柄，然后又插了一个手柄可以操控2P，然后插第三个的时候没反应了。不过这游戏也就两人玩吧，不会真有三四个人同屏玩的情况吧。

游戏没中文，我也懒得打补丁了，一个跳台游戏还看个锤子剧情，干就完事儿了。不打补丁的话很多地方还是看不懂，因为他们压根说的就不是英语，但是不打补丁对于理解剧情影响还是不大的，这么一点破剧情看画也能知道发生了什么事儿。

总而言之，如果你无聊逛库存的时候发现了这款游戏，那么我推荐你可以尝试一下，作为一个之前免费领的游戏我觉得质量可以说是爆炸了，而如果你还没有入手这款游戏的话，那么我推荐打折的时候可以尝试一下，游戏质量非常可以，实在不行买了过年跟来家里的小朋友玩也是非常可以的。

author: {'steamid': '76561198084344385', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 2141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2141, 'last_played': 1703931047}
review:
Хорошая метройдвания. В начале было предвзятое отношение по отношению к игре из-за ее стилистики, но оно быстро развеялось, сразу после встречи с главным злодеем, который похитил возлюбленную главного героя. 
К плюсам игры хотелось бы отнести удачную комбинацию классического платформинга перемежающегося с битвами и боевой системой завязанной на серии комбо ударов.
К минусам я бы отнес то, что из-за аляповатого оформления игры, во время боёв с противниками, во вспышках спецэффектов порой трудно бывает разглядеть положение главного героя, т.е. в каком месте мы находимся.
В целом игру рекомендую к прохождению, некоторые хардкорные уровни прямо доставляют эстетическое удовольствие любителям олдскульных платформеров.

author: {'steamid': '76561198357307915', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 670, 'last_played': 1703954129}
review:
メトロイドヴァニアを求めて購入し、クリアしましたが全実績解除するまで続かなそうなのでレビューします。

ノーマルクリアまでは１０時間程度、値段相応の体験は保証できます。
ただし日本語はありません。クエストでなにをしたらいいか程度は読解する必要があります。
メトロイドヴァニアに何を求めているかが個人差があるとおもいますので、個人的に思ったことを記載します。

[h3] これって正統派なのかな・・・と思う点 [/h3]
[u] 経験値、スキルツリー、成長要素がない [/u]
　好みの個人差あり。パワーアップは探索や購入のみです。
[u] 面クリ型のアクションゲームにちかい進行 [/u]
　かなりセーブポイントが置かれています。ボス前はもちろん、雑魚の合間に、アスレチックの合間に。
　４人の複数人プレイも可能そう？でガーディアンヒーローズ（古）のような体験に近いです。
[u] 装備なし [/u]
　あるのはコスチュームだけで、これはプレイ体験の味変用のみで強化されるわけはありません。
[u] 敵からのドロップなし [/u]
　敵が落とすのはお金だけです。
[u] 画面がみにくい [/u]
　複数人でプレイできるため、自身のステータス表示が小さく、残り体力が見にくいです。
　そっちを見てると今度は自キャラがどこにいるのかわからなくなることもしばしば。
　難易度を敵の物量で表現することが多く、上記の理由でちょっとストレスでした。
[u] パッドのボタン変更が不可能 [/u]
　ドッジはRTにしたかったのですが、LT固定でした。右スティックでも出せます。
　ちなみにドッジはかなり重要なのですが、一部の敵の判定が厳しかったです。
[u] 消費アイテムなし [/u]
　回復、リターンなどのアイテムなし。

上記を、引き算されてシンプルととるか致命的ととるかをご判断いただくことができれば幸いです。
最初に記載した通りセール中の値段を考えたら十分すぎるボリュームかと思います。

author: {'steamid': '76561198160741210', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 963, 'last_played': 1703699224}
review:
[h1] ¡Orale! [/h1]

Guacamelee makes it clear that it just simply loves video games. "Solid" is one of the very best compliments I can give to a game and I can't really find any better words to describe as such. It's an excellent tribute to Metroid-vanias as well as all of its other influences present throughout the entire experience.

+ Addicting combo-focused combat that also serves toward environmental traversal and exploration
+ Snappy/responsive controls and overall lighting fast pacing
+ Overwhelmingly passionate presentation across numerous aspects of the game from its art style/music/story/world/characters

author: {'steamid': '76561198021176531', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 568, 'last_played': 1703768892}
review:
I played through the normal campaign with my girlfriend and it started average, got quite good after 1 hour, and then truly disappointed us in the last 2. 
The game mixes your usual Metroidvania with beat-em-up and precision platformer mechanics. At first this paved the way for engaging gameplay, but eventually it just seemed like they jambled the poorest aspects of these mechanics together to form an unpleasant mess of a game.

By the time you reach the annoying and artificially difficult part of the story it is way past the 2 hour mark, and Guacamelee! becomes an experience unlike what it was up to that point.

Also, even though we played with two female characters, the game kept pretending it was one player who had selected the male character. If you're gonna allow this option in your game, it beats me why you wouldn't try and make it work properly.

60/100; will not play again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108144738', 'num_games_owned': 424, 'num_reviews': 193, 'playtime_forever': 621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 621, 'last_played': 1703417886}
review:
PRO: Contesto, piacevole, soundtrack, secondarie
CONTRO: Parecchie ingenuità, mondo bonus
VOTO: 7+/10

---------------------------------------------------------

Nel mio percorso di recupero dei metroidvania, che ho ignorato troppo a lungo, ho deciso questa volta di provare Guacamelee, nella sua versione rimasterizzata. Non ero super ispirato da questo gioco e i miei timori si sono abbastanza concretizzati, ritenendolo discreto ma mai brillante.

La direzione artistica è molto carina e originale, con uno stile molto azzeccato e una colonna sonora bellissima. Ho apprezzato il contesto messicano stereotipato, che crea situazioni simpatiche, resto bene anche dalla traduzione italiana. La costante ironia, con anche numerose citazioni, rende piacevole l'intera esperienza, riducendo però il coinvolgimento nelle scene più intense.

La storia infatti è piuttosto semplice e prevedibile ma efficace, con ottimi personaggi che sfruttano il folklore messicano. Buono anche l'uso delle missioni secondarie, poche e banalotte ma che aggiungono un po' di varietà.

Purtroppo, sulla lunga distanza, mi ha deluso anche il gameplay, che dovrebbe essere il cuore della produzione. Innanzitutto il level design è piuttosto basilare, rendendo il platforming limitato e poco interessante. Questo è inoltre ulteriormente semplificato dall'impossibilitá di morire cadendo, si viene solo teletrasportati a poco prima dell'errore. 

Meglio il combattimento, che ha anche alcune buone idee, ma che comunque finisce per stancare sulla lunga durata. È ben responsivo ma le animazioni non sono così fluide e, soprattutto nei combattimenti molto caotici, si finisce per non essere troppo padroni della situazione. 

L'elemento metroidvania è affidato soprattutto a quattro abilità, talvolta utilizzabili anche per aumentare la mobilità del protagonista oltre che in combattimento, che permettono di rompere blocchi colorati che impediscono il passaggio. È una soluzione un po' troppo grezza, avrei preferito una maggiore integrazione proprio nel level design, come del resto è possibile fare in certi passaggi. 

Carina la meccanica del cambio di realtà (mondo dei vivi e dei morti), che rende visibili o no elementi o nemici. Questa viene tuttavia inizialmente introdotta in un certo modo, poi scompare per diverto tempo e infine viene reinserita differentemente, causando qualche perplessità.

Quasi ogni elemento porta con sè alcune sbavature ed ingenuità, come il mercato (che funge anche da checkpoint) un po' confusionario e che dà poco la sensazione di progressione, i teletrasporti troppo rari, poche tipologie di nemici e una telecamera che non fa distinzioni tra zone non accessibili e aree segrete.

Buoni invece i boss, ben pensati anche se mai troppo difficili e ulteriormente facilitati dalla presenza di checkpoint intermedi in caso di morte (che ripristinano la vita del giocatore ma non quella del boss). L'intera avventura è quindi piuttosto facile e quasi solo in presenza di ostacoli o nemici che uccidono in un solo colpo.

È presente infine un mondo opzionale (El Infierno) che mette davanti a numerose sfide che sbloccano ricompense in base ai voti presi (bronzo, argento e oro). Ho completato un po' di questi livelli ma poi ho desistito per mancanza di voglia, terminando l'intera partita in 10 ore abbondanti.

In conclusione, Guacamelee è un classico del panorama indie ma secondo me ormai superato sotto quasi ogni aspetto. Se lo stile e il world building hanno ancora il loro fascino, il gameplay risulta troppo grezzo, finendo per stancare un po' sulla lunga distanza. Quasi ogni elemento ha una piccola sbavatura, mai grave e facilmente correggibile (in futuro proverò il secondo capitolo), ma rimane un buon titolo per i fan del genere. Per chi ci vuole approcciare per la prima volta invece consiglio di provare un prodotto più recente e rifinito.

VOTO: 7+/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198437430868', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 714, 'last_played': 1701649775}
review: Buenazo el juego, tiene un estilo muy bueno con toques mexicanos mejores que el "oye primos" con toques racistas y un humor re piola hacia el pueblo mexicano. El combate es decente agregando nuevas formas de hacer combos y enemigos mas complicados y variados que van evolucionando junto a las habilidades para un buen balance, también te deja mucho por explorar una vez terminas el juego gracias a poder acceder a nuevas zonas por las habilidades desbloqueadas y desafíos como un clásico metroivania. Ademas esta re piola la opción de jugarla con un amigo, aunque yo no tuve esa opción de probar

author: {'steamid': '76561198871692645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 2016, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1639, 'last_played': 1701952299}
review: Yeah it's cool and all, funny, enertaining... but then you play on hard and try to do the challenges... difficulty goes from 5 to 50 pretty quick.  And it's mostly a RNG based gank. If you get good RNG you can do good crowd control. If not... dead. Most of the time it feels like the red skelly bones are timed, and the yellow skellys go full ninja and never stop dodging if not to punish. Plus the stunlocks... and the one shots... it kinda becomes an exercise of patience until you get good RNG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198932729734', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1702950278}
review:
História nem um pouco complexa, porém muito criativa e cativante. O jogo possui vários momentos cômicos e alguns levemente tristes. É muito fácil perder as horas jogando, existem diversas habilidades a se desbloquear e MUITOS combos diferentes. 
O jogo possui uma dificuldade mediana em sua maior parte, porém possui certos locais que são extremamente complicados, mas a dificuldade é sempre divertida e te faz pensar além de apenas ter que dar porrada

author: {'steamid': '76561198007888370', 'num_games_owned': 612, 'num_reviews': 571, 'playtime_forever': 1101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1101, 'last_played': 1694350683}
review:
Nachooooooo!

…oops, wrong Mexican!

One of the best games I've ever played. Music is incredible, fighting is terrific, and story is outstanding. I strongly (and very subjectively) disliked the art style, but the game is so good that I got past my dislike for the visuals.

Guacamelee was the first game my wife’s boyfriend ever played to completion since he was a child and he absolutely loved it. The theme, the art style, the dialogues...everything.

I really loved that Guacamelee fuses platforming and combat in a way that other Metroivanias don't quite manage. In a lot of the classic metroid and castlevania games, different weapons and abilities open different doors or allow you to get to a new area, but this time each of your attacks is ALSO used for traversal, which is brilliant. 

There were things that just seemed impossible to me at first, that would invariably turn into cake in the most satisfying of ways. I remember when I got to the final boss, I was like ".....how?!?", only to be using my entire aresnal to take it down with ease a bit later. Right amount of challenge for me as well. It's tough, but not balls hard, and even though it's a metroidvania, I only got lost once.

I got it on sale long ago and I just liked how easy going it was in terms of the writing and art style. I loved how the combat is punchy and satisfying and seeing what different kinds of combos or strings I could pull off and since the game wasn’t very long I didn’t find it overstayed it’s welcome either.

Not to mention that it’s freaking hilarious. Seriously, if you like Metroidvanias and difficult platformers I couldn't recommend this games enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198892204023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 637, 'last_played': 1700901442}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025647144', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 1665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1665, 'last_played': 1700924578}
review:
Guacamelee! est un chouette Metroidvania situé dans un univers mexicain déjanté. Lucha Libre oblige, son gameplay est très orienté beat them all, avec de fréquents arrêts dans des "arènes" où vous allez devoir affronter des vagues de monstres avant de pouvoir progresser. Personnellement, les combats, c'est pas trop mon truc, mais en mode normal ils ne sont pas trop difficiles, et je dois admettre que quand Guacamelee! décide de faire de la plate-forme, il le fait super bien.
Donc oui dans l'ensemble je recommanderais ce jeu, mais plutôt pour ceux qui aiment tabasser des ennemis et enchaîner combos et esquives. Si vous préférez plutôt l'aspect plateforme et/ou exploration des Metroidvania, vous risquez d'être globalement déçus.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991161976', 'num_games_owned': 5773, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1700998918}
review:
2014년 발매로 2023년 기준 거의 10년 된 고전 게임이지만, 지금 해도 할만한 메트로배니아 게임. 

추가되는 기술-기능에 따라 갈 수 있는 곳이 늘어난다던가 하는 식으로, 이미 지나간 지도에도 다시 방문하게 만드는 방식이다. 떨어져 죽는 억울함을 많이 보완해줘서 헬스 차감없이 그냥 바로 앞 평지에 내려주기도 한다. 

멕시코, 루차도르, Day of the Dead를 유쾌하게 잘 묶어만든 게임이기도 하다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144178842', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 865, 'last_played': 1705411253}
review:
This game is amazing and an almost perfect plaformer.
The story is great, the interface is simple and functional, the controls are tight and almost always on point.
The visual style and the music is enjoyable.
The characters are wacky, believable and likeable.
The challenge for a normal gamer to beat the game is acceptable and the challenge for 100% runer is also doable.

I highly recommend this game, my rating 9,5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116090570', 'num_games_owned': 66, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1699277271}
review:
Guacamelee is a solid metroidvania-style action platformer with a great sense of progression and an inspired art style. The controls feel fluid, the combat is satisfying and all of the moves/mechanics introduced become an integral part of the player's moveset. 

Narrative-wise, it's pretty bare-bones and basic yet the characters are memorable and it doesn't take itself too seriously. The game got a little frustrating near the climax due to some questionable enemy design, but overall very enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963094949', 'num_games_owned': 421, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1699069155}
review:
Maybe it was great when it came out, but it's just... soooo easy and not in a good way.
It doesn't pose a challenge, it just throws color coded crap at you you need to use your color coded special moves on... it's just annoying not challenging. The same goes for the platforming. It's super basic and just throws annoying and frequent mid-jump "world transition" color codes at you.

The exploration is also spelled out for you. Color coded block? Don't have the color coded ability yet? Come back later, it's automatically marked on your map. Not like you can find anything exciting, it's just gold or more health or stamina, which you don't really need either of, because it's so easy.

Can't recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142943855', 'num_games_owned': 327, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1700034964}
review:
Beat Guacamelee! Gold on Switch a few years ago, felt nostalgic and decided to pick up this version on PC. This version has a few significant changes from Gold, but is ultimately the same game. Buying this gives you Gold as well, so recommend buying this and playing it, then going back through Gold if you want to see more.

This game is very underrated. Super tight combat based around spot-dodging/dodge rolls and using abilities and throws/slams to move enemies around into favourable positions for combos. Metroidvania-style exploration, great for completionists. Great music and simple but really detailed backgrounds and art. A story that doesn't get in the way of the gameplay, but gives just enough flavour to make things interesting. A must-play for fans of action platformers, Metroidvanias, or anyone that likes wrestling!

author: {'steamid': '76561198286689881', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1698710593}
review: Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition é um jogo que mescla Metroidvania com Plataforma, acrescentando ainda, elementos de Beat 'em Up. O game possui uma estética caricata e extremamente colorida, que contribuem muito para dar vida a temática mexicana do título. A jogabilidade começa no básico, mas com o avanço da história, vamos ganhando novas habilidades, que requerem certo domínio para serem usadas com perfeição. E você vai precisar destas em muitos momentos. A história é a mais clichê possível. Um ex vaqueiro vem do mundo dos mortos para o dos vivos, sequestra a mocinha e quer  dominar o mundo. Cabe a nós impedir o feito. A dificuldade na maior parte do tempo é tranquila. Os chefes não são difíceis, depois que você acha um meio efetivo para atacar, fica bem fácil. Porém, em certos trechos, ocorre um pico de dificuldade aqui e ali, que chega a ser incômodo. Basta ter um pouco de paciência, que depois de algumas tentativas, é sempre possível passar. Na oficina do jogo no Steam, podemos baixar diversas skins de personagens famosos de franquias consagradas, além de outros do próprio jogo. É muito legal, jogar por exemplo, com o Chapolim. É um dos jogos mais coloridos que já joguei, e fiquei encantado com isso. Podemos alterar entre os mundos, mudando a própria coloração dos cenários, e isso é fantástico. É um game relativamente longo para os estilos de jogos abordados no mesmo, mas vale a sua imersão. Todos os personagens são extremamente carismáticos. Possui conquistas e localização para o português, e muitas referências a outros jogos. Recomendo !

author: {'steamid': '76561197995179518', 'num_games_owned': 560, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1701288576}

author: {'steamid': '76561198111877115', 'num_games_owned': 1373, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 477, 'last_played': 1698637335}
review:
Я люблю метроидвании, но это не метроидвания, а безыдейная дрочильня. Начинается всё хорошо - и юмор, и атмосфера, и платформинг, и мини-квесты, и переключение между миром живых и миром мёртвых, и превращение в курицу. Ух как звучит, да? Так вот в какой-то момент это всё заканчивается (я не шучу, прям заканчивается). А начинается тупорылое дрочилово с попытками попасть в тайминги при помощи убогого управления. Нет, именно с прыжками всё хорошо, персонаж ощущается и промахнуться трудно. Но вот рывки - это садизм. Почему-то разработчики решили сделать их не на направление+рывок, а рывок с зажатым направлением. Это сложно объяснить, нужно почувствовать. Когда ты в стопиццотый раз делаешь одно и то же, но отчего-то как надо не работает. Я прошел много жопоразрывных мест, пару раз хотел бросить, но знаете что? Я и бросил. На предпоследнем уровне. Почти в его конце. Больше, чем от идиотского платформинга, я устал от того, что игра спамит одних и тех же врагов, что я видел ещё в начале игры, но теперь волнами, с защитными полями, в разных комбинациях, в разных мирах. В какой-то момент я понял, что мне надоело и наскучило. Я мог бы включить трейнер какой-нибудь - обычно я так делаю, если игра интересная, но скилла перестаёт хватать. Мог, но зачем? Сюжет скучный и вспоминаешь о нем раз пять за игру. Всё остальное время это прыжок, рывок, толчок, прыжок, красный блок, синий блок, жёлтый блок, зелёный блок, белое поле, красное поле, зеленое поле, синее поле, прыжок, рывок, толчок, игра крайне затянута, прыжок, красный блок, синий блок, насрали кучей бессмысленных комбо, жёлтый блок, зеленый блок, чтобы получить хорошую концовку, нужно пройти кучу безмерно болезненных челленджей, белое поле, красное поле, на золото, прыжок, толчок, толчок, толчок, меня что, насилуют, толчок, толчок, уличный толчок, толчок, кал, кал, разработчикам желаю убиться об синий блок, зеленый блок, красный блок, желтый блок, головой, разбрызгать мозги на белое поле, жёлтое поле, красное поле, красное поле, убивать, убивать, дока 2, двойной прыжок, фиолетовый блок?!!

P.S. А так игра красочная и позитивная.
P.P.S. Хорошо, что не купил сиквел. Видать, Тонакатекутли уберёг, как говорится.
P.P.P.S. Прошёл таки предпоследний уровень, завалил Ягуара и дошёл до храма. Увидел порталы, глянул на ютубе, что меня ждёт и окончательно задушился, но кое-как прошёл финал игры с трейнером, что не спасло меня от ублюдочного платформинга и ещё более ублюдочного последнего босса во второй и последней его фазе. А в конце меня ждал мультик в два кадра с плохой концовкой, потому что я не выполнил сраные челленджи. Разработчики конченые. Отбитые наглухо.

review: The game is a very well made metroidvania with controls that work quite well and a cute art-style.

review: 非常好玩。总体难度不高。打击感很棒，连招连起来非常爽。跑酷有点难，梦回“苦痛之路”。几年前白嫖的游戏，一直没玩，最近下载玩了一下才发现这游戏这么好玩。非常推荐。

review: Loved this one. The gameplay is addictive, characters, dialogues and humor work and its colorful style is really captivating. Sure, it's very derivative of other games, but Guacamelee doesn't try to hide it at all and at times it just feels like you're playing a Mexican-themed parody of them. 4/5

author: {'steamid': '76561197992211191', 'num_games_owned': 324, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 782, 'last_played': 1697752011}
review:
Jeu pas dur, fun, facile à prendre en main, des références d'autres jeux-vidéos présent dans la map, au premier abord on a l'impression que les graphismes ont été fait par un enfant de 6 ans mais plus on avance plus on voit que le jeu est travaillé tant sur le gameplay que sur l'histoire (ça c'est pas vrai par contre), les pouvoirs trouvés peuvent paraître nul également mais une fois tout maîtrisé cela devient un réel plaisir.

En somme un bon "MetroidVania" 

PS : Mettez moi des avis positifs bande de chiens à moustache

author: {'steamid': '76561199142967217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1430, 'last_played': 1697669429}
review:
Jogaço, tá? É extremamente divertido explorar o mapa e, principalmente, descer a porrada nos inimigos! Você vai aprendendo novos poderes conforme avança, o que te possibilita ir criando combos cada vez mais cabulosos, à medida que vai aprendendo e pegando o jeito dos golpes. O jogo também tem trechos que vão exigir bastante do seu manejo com as habilidades. A história é bem bacaninha, tem seus momentos tensos e tenebrosos, mas, como um todo, é super bem-humorada. Uma das coisas que eu acho mais legais nesse jogo são as REFERÊNCIAS! E bota referências nisso! Pokémon, Super Mario, Donkey Kong, Mega Man, Zelda e até mesmo Castle Crashers; todos referenciados de alguma forma nesse jogo. É muito massa você parar numa parte do mapa, olhar um cartaz e pensar "ah, esse cara aqui é daquele jogo lá!" Sei lá, é uma sensação muito massa, haha! A minha única crítica são as batalhas de chefe. Não que elas sejam ruins!! A batalha contra aquele esqueleto de três cabeças, por exemplo, é MUITO boa!!! Mas, num geral, eu acho que elas são muito fáceis de pegar. Os bosses não têm muitos padrões de ataque, o que faz você decifrar eles muito facilmente. Aí, depois que tu pega o jeito, acabou, você não toma mais dano. Mas eu não acho que isso tira o brilho do jogo. É só um detalhe que eu desgostei um pouco. Vou tentar zerar no difícil depois pra ver se fica mais interessante...
Num geral, eu acho o jogo é muito bom! Se pintar uma promoçãozinha aí, o jogo ficar naquele precinho camarada, eu recomendo demais você o compre! O jogo também tem suporte à oficina da Steam, ou seja, você pode zerar a campanha toda com lendas como Finn e Jake, He-Man, Samus Aran, Homem-Aranha e até mesmo o nosso saudosíssimo RATINHO. Se isso ainda não te convenceu a comprar, rapaz... tem que rever as suas decisões aí, hahahaha!

author: {'steamid': '76561199089770633', 'num_games_owned': 178, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 861, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 852, 'last_played': 1699556589}
review:
Guacamelee es un juego de acción y plataformas que se destacó por su originalidad y diversión. En cuanto a su dificultad, ofrece un equilibrio interesante. Si bien presenta desafíos en forma de combates y acertijos, no llega a ser excesivamente difícil, lo que permite a una amplia gama de jugadores disfrutarlo.

La historia de Guacamelee es cautivadora. Se centra en Juan Aguacate, un aguacateador convertido en luchador de lucha libre para rescatar a su amada, Lupita. La narrativa se desarrolla en un mundo de mezcla entre el folklore mexicano y el inframundo, lo que le da un toque único. La trama es humorística y llena de referencias a la cultura pop y los videojuegos.

La ambientación es uno de los puntos fuertes del juego. Los gráficos son vibrantes y coloridos, con un estilo artístico inspirado en el arte mexicano tradicional. Esto crea un ambiente único y atractivo que se siente fresco y original.

La música de Guacamelee es simplemente genial. Combina ritmos mexicanos tradicionales con toques modernos y vibrantes. La banda sonora añade mucho carácter al juego y se adapta perfectamente a la atmósfera general.

En cuanto a las referencias, el juego está lleno de ellas. Desde homenajes a otros juegos populares hasta guiños a películas y cultura pop, Guacamelee es un festín para los amantes de las referencias y los Easter eggs.

Para mí, Guacamelee es una experiencia de juego única que combina una historia interesante, una ambientación atractiva, música increíble y un buen equilibrio de dificultad. Si bien disfrute más el 2 (Al cual le tengo pensado hacer una reseña más adelante), Sus numerosas referencias, su historia y su estilo visual distintivo hacen que sea una experiencia memorable para cualquiera.

review:
Guacamelee is simple but wonderfully charming game that I had a lot of fun with. I somewhat took my time with it and got all achievements (besides one that required me to play through the game a second time) in about 15 hours and I enjoyed all of it, not at any point was I frustrated or lost on what to do. The art style and vibe alone make this game worth it, definitely recommend.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198246069650', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 873, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 873, 'last_played': 1691856940}
review:
Guacamelee Super Turbo Championship Edition Review

Review is after completing the main story missions and a few of the initial side quests.
[hr][/hr]


[b]Story[/b]
The story is about Juan (a simple Mexican agave farmer) and his quest to rescue his crush El Presidente’s daughter from an evil undead Charro. The story is simple but the main attraction of the game is its humor and its colorful art style. The game has no voice acting; only having dialogue prompts, but that dialogue is also laced with good humor. Along the way in his rescue his crush Juan meets a bunch of helpful characters who teach him the moves and powers required to become a luchador. It turns out that Juan must become a fully fledged luchador to save his beloved. He also meets a cast of enemies who are also similarly hilarious. Overall it was an enjoyable story that was wonderfully inspired by Mexican culture. 
The only complaint I have is regarding the ending of the game. The game requires you to find about 6 hidden items in order to get the good ending. This only becomes apparent after playing the game and receiving the bad ending. The game doesn’t tell you that you need to find all these hidden areas (in addition to the hidden chests), at least I don't remember any prompts or hints about these hidden areas. Thankfully a good auto save point just before the final boss battle allows players to backtrack through the maps, collect the hidden items and thus get the good ending. I did not fulfill this task as I did not have time to backtrack.


[b]Gameplay[/b]
This is my first Metroidvania style game and so I played on Normal difficulty. The gameplay was very entertaining because it had a healthy mix of platforming and combat. Platforming and exploration required creative use of the various luchador powers as well as excellent timing. Because of this getting to some hidden chests required a lot of retries and button mashing. I was not able to get to all the hidden chests but I managed to get at about 75% of them. The combat was very satisfying, supported by a great enemy variety. The enemies are also colorful and have a variety of attacks. The luchador costumes were also very amusing in their functionality and they are unlockable after earning special coins through gameplay: as it should be! As I remember when it comes to backtracking, all the enemies did not respawn; which is so refreshing, because I was dreading the grind. But fortunately only some of the enemies respawned or was it the enemies I skipped? I don't honestly remember. But either way backtracking wasn’t a slog. Out of all the powers I think Pollo power is unmatched. I won’t spoil what that is but it matches the game’s humor and themes very well. 
As mentioned I did not backtrack to find all the hidden items required to get the good ending of the game. I tried out one of those hidden areas and got the hidden items but backtracking felt tedious. I understand that one of the draws of Metroidvania games is backtracking to previous areas to collect the hitherto inaccessible areas or show those tough bosses who’s the hero of the story. But this is not my choice so I did not backtrack much; I found it tedious after a while. The only annoying part of platforming were the portals. There were some parts at the end where quick reflexes were needed to move forward through the portals. I found this tedious and unenjoyable compared to all the other excellent platforming sections.


[b]Graphics[/b]
The art style was colorful and lovely and subsequently the graphics were also vibrant and refreshing to look at. This is one of those game that will look good regardless of whether you have a low range or mid range graphics card. Backgrounds, enemies, bosses and allies have the same lively color theme. An absolute treat to look at.


[b]Controls[/b]
Played using the Xbox controller attached to the PC. A controller is mandatory for this game. Some button mashing was required at times and at times attacks did not register correctly. So there were some frustrations but they did not prevent me from finishing the game. 


[b]Side Missions[/b]
There are a few side missions in this game. I was only able to complete a handful of these. For most of them I couldn’t find where to go to complete them so they were simply forgotten as I progressed.


[b]Music/Soundtrack/Voice[/b]
The game has no voice acting which I did not find to be a negative. The soundtrack was thematic and adequate and all the funny sounds accompanying power ups encounters and combat filled out the gameplay experience nicely!


[b]Performance[/b]
Experienced no crashes and the game ran smoothly on my PC (which is a mid-range PC). It did not cause undue heating of the CPU and GPU.


Overall Score 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198082665005', 'num_games_owned': 470, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1412, 'last_played': 1694274615}
review:
Guacamelee é um jogo de plataforma com aspectos metrodivania.
A jogabilidade é bem intuitiva e não pune os jogadores menos acostumados.
Gere combos astronômicos detonando as hordas de esqueletos.

A história é muito bacana e engraçada.
Você pode se aventurar sozinho ou com até mais três amigos usando o local co-op ou o Steam Remote Play.

Contém novas fases, gráficos melhorados e algumas habilidades novas quando comparado com a primeira versão do jogo.
Comprando esta versão, ganha de presente a primeira versão do jogo também.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139597776', 'num_games_owned': 148, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1357, 'last_played': 1611685489}
review:
It's one of the rare games I can just play and have pure fun with, no distractions, no hard planning or thinking. Just enjoy
Also, it has a banger soundtrack

review: I originally played Gold Edition because I could only play Steam games on a Mac at the time and I enjoyed it.  This version has more challenges, extra areas, and a couple new abilities, including an overdrive mode.  I wish that they'd just upgraded the gold version or at least gave a discount, but if you haven't played either, go for this one.  It's a fun metroidvania with a huge emphasis on combat.  Just be ready for some of the optional challenges to be of the butt-kicking variety, especially if you want all the rewards for finding those bonus orbs (which you will...).

author: {'steamid': '76561198898437440', 'num_games_owned': 234, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1209, 'last_played': 1587412508}
review:
Un metroidvania un poco corto pero bastante único y con mucha personalidad. 

El estilo basado en la cultura mexicana y un poco cartoon esta muy bien logrado y es muy bonito visualmente.

el sistema de combos es bastante completo hasta el punto de llegar a ser un poco complejo si queres sacarle el maximo potencial.

pese a ser un juego bastante sencillo te lo vas a pasar bien jugandolo.

Recomendado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198284336872', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1693323350}
review:
8/10
Esta bastante bueno. El diseño gráfico es agradable, capaz llega algunos momentos de que tantos efectos de vídeo me hacen perder al personaje de vista. El hitbox es medio raro, porque hay algunos ángulos en los que les intentas pegar a los bichos y fallas, pero seguido a eso ellos te pegan y aciertan. 
Los bosses estan realmente bien logrados. Los ultimos dos si son dignos de llamarse "final bosses".
Hay un par de referencias que vi que me cayeron bastante graciosas.
En fin, recomendado si no sabes a que jugar.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997652408', 'num_games_owned': 1197, 'num_reviews': 303, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1693051413}
review:
[quote=author] [b] Diğer oyunlar ile ilgili incelemelerime / indirim duyurularına ulaşmak için;
		https://store.steampowered.com/curator/37884261
		 [/b] [/quote] 
		 
		[h1] Kıssadan Hisse [/h1]

		Taco eşliğinde meksika kültürüne ait müzikler, görseller, kültürel motifler ile metroidvania keyfi.
		
		[h1]  Oynanış & Görseller  [/h1]
		
		Yıllarr yıllar önce kısa bir süre baktığım ancak o dönemler metroidvania ile çok haşır neşir olmadığım için oynayamadığım bir oyundu Guacamalee. Kütüphanemde oyunlara bakarken Super Turbo versiyonunu gördüm ve bir dalayım dedim. Sonuç oyun hiç fena değilmiş.
		https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3025958093
		Sıradan bir çiftçi olan Juan, meksika kültürüne özgü Ölüler günü etkinliklerine köyüne eski arkadaşı ve platonik aşkı olan başkanın kızı ile eğlenirken baş düşmanımız iskelet Carlos köye saldırır ve başkanın kızını kaçırır. Juan da durur mu kurtarma operasyonuna çıkar. Bu yolculukta karşımıza gizemli bir maske çıkar ve bizi çok güçlü bir güreşçiye çevirir. Bu yeni aldığımız güç ile kurtarma maceramız başlar.
		
		Oynanış olarak oyn metroidvania, ancak yeni aldığınız özellikler ile çok backtracking yapmanız gerekmiyor, yani yaparsınız ancak kazandığınız ödüller hp artırma, stamina artırma vs. Yani bir özellik aldınız haritanın taa en başına koşup ordaki kapıdan geçin çok yapmamışlar. Bu açıdan güzel diyebilirim. Böylelikle çok ileri geri saatlerce dönmüyorsunuz.
		
		Dövüş sistemi biraz basit kalmış ancak eğlenceli, yapabildiğiniz 3-4 vuruşlu kombonuz ve düşmanı güreşçi gibi sağa sola fırlatma özelliğiniz var. Yer yer oyun sizi kısıtlayıp ilerlemek için belli düşman dalgalarını öldürmenizi bekliyor. Onun haricinde çıkan düşmanlara çok durmanıza gerek yok çünkü öldürmek için çok motivasyonunuz yok. Karakteriniz oldukça hızlı koşuyor böylelikle haritada hareket etmek eğlenceli oluyor.
		https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3025958421
		Oyunun daha eğlenceli, sonuna kadar gitmemi sağlayan kısmı oyunun platform mekanikleri oldu. Yeni aldığınız çeşit çeşit özelikler ile ( özellik olarak tavuğa dönüşmek bile var. Evet evet tavuk ) gittikçe zorlaşan platform mekaniklerinin üstesinden geliyorsunuz ve bu kısımlar oldukça keyifli.
		
		Oyunun Super Turbo Editionda yeni bir alan, yeni bir boss, yeni kutular vs geliyor. Ayrıca oyunu 4 arkadaşınızla birlikte local coop olarak oynayabiliyorsunuz.
		
		4-5 saat eğlenceli vakit geçirebileceğiniz güzel bir oyun.
		https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3025957937
		[h1] Artılar [/h1]
		[list]
			[*] Çok eğlenceli platform mekanikleri
			[*] Güzel boss savaşları
			[*] Çok görmediğimiz meksika kültürü 
		[/list]

		[h1] Eksiler[/h1]
		[list] 
			[*] Dövüş sistemi biraz yavan 
		[/list]

		[h1]PUAN: 85 / 100[/h1]

		[h1] Kapanış [/h1]

		Genel olarak değerlendirildiğinde  metroidvania ve platform oyunları sevenleri memnun edecek seviyede bir iş var. Meksika kültürüne ait bir hikaye ile gelin Juan'ın manitasını kurtarın.
		
		İyi oyunlar!

author: {'steamid': '76561198216283357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1149, 'last_played': 1679849349}
review:
Amazing platformer and good hack-and-slash. A solo experience, but definitely better with 1-3 friends.

The platforming is challenging, but doable. It will frustrate you, but it feels fair. The puzzles can be very clever and are imaginative.

The fighting aspect is fun and offer a break between platforming. It can be a challenge if you play solo. Being with a friend makes it the much easier.

The humour and tone are nice, the aesthetics are breathtaking, and the music adds to the good ambience.

Definitely worth buying and playing once, twice or more. As a plus, it is not one of those games that is impossible to finish at 100%. Stop reading. Go play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198340654979', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1354, 'last_played': 1692780134}
review: Perfect Game #26, Guacamelee! STCE.  A great blend of some of my favorite genres.  It sounds a little crazy to say that a platform-fighter metroidvania adventure game would work, but Guacamelee pulls it off fantastically.  The combat is fluid and there is a lot of depth to the system.  The world is filled with secrets and is really fun to explore as well.  The areas are detailed and filled with easter eggs of other games.  The characters are very funny, but can be a little over the top at times.  Overall it's definitely worth checking out, even for the combat alone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198302925456', 'num_games_owned': 66, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1692042290}
review:
Man I wish they made a third game rather than branching out. These games just get better the more I play them. Nobody would be able to tell that this is over a decade old.

I love the new content from this version, however I wouldn't recommend it for first time players. It adds a mechanic that doesn't quite fit in that well with the main bulk of the game, and the mandatory additional areas really slow down the pacing. It's sort of like Ori definitive edition in that sense, except at least in that game the new content was optional.

I also noticed that the music was super repetitive this time around. A couple more tracks couldn't hurt. Glad the sequel addressed that problem.

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198064045120', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1691163952}
review:
I wasn't planning on playing this until it was chosen as the Game of the Month for August 2023. I like metroidvanias and I figured why not give it a try.

What I liked:
* The colours and the music. It's surprisingly beautiful.
* The platforming sections get more frustrating towards the end but the game is short enough to suffer through some moments. I liked that falling off the stage wasn't instant death.
* Fighting with the different coloured shields takes some getting used to, but it's a fun mechanic.
* Some other mechanics are introduced that make battles interesting to say the least.
* One of your forms is hilarious to me.
* There are some easter eggs of different games (especially the song in the final dungeon ha!) that makes progressing fun to find the next thing.
* Boss fights are fun enough and easy to figure out.

What I didn't like:
* The story was not too interesting and the ending was abrupt to say the least.
* Falling off the stage is fine, when you fall into lava your transported back to the save point...
* Combat gets messy when there are a lot of enemies in the area. Your fall animation is painful because it takes a long time. There's one particular punchy enemy that drove me crazy because of the loop of falling and him beating me I would get stuck in.

It was a fun experience and I can recommend this game for people who liked the mechanics in the Messenger but who would like a little bit less challenge.

Кулачная боевка с примитивных навыков довольно быстро обрастает обширным списком приемов и комбинаций, платформинг также усложняется умело выстроенными препятствиями и различными механиками. Действия насыщены приятными аудиовизуальными эффектами, управление доступное и честное. Поставил русификатор от Zone of Games и с кайфом пробежал игру кидая нечисть на прогиб, хочу ещё

author: {'steamid': '76561198076154025', 'num_games_owned': 230, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1692058722}
review:

review: Notable metroidvania muy competente en todo, me ha sorprendido para bien tanto la BSO como el punto temático del combate. Sólo me tira para atrás el plataformeo, a veces excesivo y con un punto de exigencia mayor de lo que suele ser habitual en estos juegos. Con la miriada de metroidvanias que hay, muy orientados sobretodo al estilo de Dark Souls a causa de Hollow Knight, éste es full old school classic con el punto de dinamismo y flexibilidad que necesitan estos juegos en estos tiempos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198366671300', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1689193820}
review:
Drinkbox games is one of the best at these kinds of 2d metroidvania platformers.  In fact, I think the platforming in their games is better than anything in Hollow Knight, and about on par with the Ori games. I particularly love the difficulty tuning.  The game keeps throwing new enemies, new mechanics, new traversal methods and areas at you but it never feels overwhelming because the difficulty curve rises at just the right pace.  The difficulty always feels just right, keeping some pressure on your but without abrupt spikes, just right to maximize fun.

I can't praise most of the game too highly enough with the sole exception, sadly, of the last phase of the last boss Calaca.  He's very big, too big for all of him to fit on the screen at one time, which make the tells for his attacks kind of hard to read sometimes.  Jaguar and Flame Face are both more fun to fight imho.

author: {'steamid': '76561198874036113', 'num_games_owned': 197, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 896, 'last_played': 1690161593}
review:
En abril de 2013 se lanzaba este juego para la PlayStation 3 y la PS Vita,  recuerdo que me gustó mucho el arte conceptual y el diseño del mapa y ya que en aquel entonces no tenía una consola lo jugaba en el almacén de un centro comercial cada que podía. Años después este juego se convirtió en el primero que pirateé en la primera computadora que llevaron a casa, nunca me lo pasé ya que me daba pereza ejecutar los combos con teclado XD.

Sim embargo, ya con la oportunidad de comprarlo y jugarlo puedo decir que este indie es sumamente bueno. Tiene un muy buen diseño de niveles, la verticalidad de sus mapas es adictivo y la simplicidad del combate es una de sus mejores cartas de presentación. La variedad de enemigos y jefes es muy decente, cuando crees que ya no verás más arquetipos de enemigos te sueltan uno nuevo acorde a la temática del mapa que te hará variar la forma en que has estado combatiendo, haciendo mucho más dinámico el gameplay y aportando a tus skills. Los obstáculos dentro de cada mapa son igual de retadores, no son nada del otro mundo pero sí que te harán pensar un poco y te retarán a mejorar/coordinar el timing de pulsaciones de tu teclado y mando. El "único defecto" que puedo ponerle a este juego es la simpleza de un par de combates con jefes, fuera de eso todo en cuanto al gameplay está correcto. Y, además, contiene una buena parte de secretos aún por descubrir y pequeñas misiones secundarias en los poblados de algunos mapas e incluso desafíos de habilidad.

De la historia, música y diseño artístico tengo que mencionar que son exquisitos. En tema de trama no esperes algo presentado a la altura de los metroidvanias más de culto pero sí que es una historia entrañable con un final que sí te hace sentir un vacío, más aún con la última imagen después de los créditos.

Este juego es muy recomendable, me hace querer sacarle todos los logros y darle otra pasada en la dificultad difícil. Después de 10 años de su salida estoy contento por haber concluido su historia. Recomendado.

author: {'steamid': '76561199403686284', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 598, 'last_played': 1687457628}
review: I bought this game due to being a big fan of metroidvanias. And this game didn't disappoint! It perfectly nails mashing together metroidvania and beat-em-up gameplay, with the combat itself being great overall, never getting boring. Though it's relatively linear compared to most metroidvanias, its platforming segments are very well designed, integrate well into the world map, and backtracking is completely optional! It also has bosses that are hard-but-fair overall, and stand out! It also has a ton of cute little references to other games, memes, and pop-culture in general. The characters are also very memorable, and are written very well too. Overall,  if you like both metroidvanias, and Devil-May-Cry-style combat, I highly recommend the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198147938706', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1095, 'last_played': 1688236811}
review:
From my perspective it's a must play for metroidvania fans. But be ready for some challenge if you want to make it 100% , because it can be tough. It has LOCAL coop for 4 players and great vibe. It's more linear than other metroidvania's but it compensates with more engaging combat. Last but not least controller is recommended, it is possible to play on keyboard all though it's not as comfortable as it would be. 

Play it, complete it, don't regret it

author: {'steamid': '76561198063035714', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 1255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1255, 'last_played': 1687340005}
review:
[b]TLDR: INDIE METROIDVANIA WITH A REALLY COOL THEME AND ARTSTYLE AND CO-OP (!!!), PLAY IT[/b]

[b]Guacamelee[/b] is a 2013 indie game (2014 for this rerelease with extra stuff, technically), one of DrinkBox's first games (their third, to be precise).
[i]Though even if I didn't explicitly say it, you could've probably told what timeframe this was released in considering the game's humor and constant gamer references throughout the entire world.
Including that one side villain that, in no uncertain terms, says [b]"Trololololol!"[/b] to your face.[/i]


It's a mix of a platforming metroidvania and a brawler, with simple and easy-to-grasp controls (basic attacks, a grab button with aimable throws, and directional special moves like Smash Bros.) but a LOT to do with those controls.
Progression is pretty standard, as you might expect; you explore areas to the extent your initial abilities allow, and gradually unlock more skills as you play to open up the way to more and more interconnected areas (abilities you get from breaking... [b]Choozo statues[/b], yes this game wears its inspirations on its nonexistent luchador sleeve).

All of your BASIC fighting moves (standard attacks and grab/throw attacks) are available from the start, but you CAN buy some little side upgrades for those from the shops on every savepoint.

Yeah, you get money (Pesos, fittingly) from beating up enemies, as well as silver coins as unique collectibles that can be used to unlock [b]costumes[/b] that (mostly) give special effects and act as sidegrades (one good effect, one bad effect).


Speaking of pesos... Yeah, it's a mexican-folklore-themed game. A [i]VERY[/i] mexican-folklore-themed game. You can probably tell from the artstyle and screenshots already, but both the visuals and the music [i]heavily[/i] help carry that vibe along.
It's a weird mix of that type of theming with 2013-era humor. Obviously not everone is going to [i]like[/i] that type of humor but it's honestly inoffensive enough to not really detract from the overall story and writing (and hell, it's a bit [i]nostalgic[/i] in its own way).


Obviously like any good Metroidvania there's a TON to explore. All the areas are interconnected, and you can unlock teleport spots in (almost) every area to quickly warp from one to another. The map also handily marks walls that require specific abilities to break (the ones you unlock as you go, which are all color-coded for convenience) and keeps track of your item discovery percentage in every area, so you can comfortably head back and check for any small paths you might've missed on your first run through.


This isn't a TERRIBLY long game, you can beat it in about 3-4 hours. I know [i]my[/i] Hardmode run just now to finish 100%ing the game was a little over 4 hours, including all my deaths from... it being hardmode.
Without doing any sidequests (yes, those exist) or going for all collectibles, anyway.

But that's for the [i]BAD[/i] ending.
Yes, without spoiling anything, this game has MULTIPLE endings. You'll be expected to get the bad one on your first go, as [I]right[/i] before it ends it introduces an entire SEPARATE set of Macguffins to collect, all of which will be on entirely new parts you hadn't even THOUGHT were there before. Adds a GOOD chunk of extra playtime. My 100%ed savefile with all the extra content done ended up being about 11 hours long or so.
...Some of those collectibles are also kind of CBT to collect, or even to FIND [b](looking at [i]you[/i], Forest del Chivo)[/b] but hey, that's the point of it being extra challenges to earn the better ending.
You [i]might[/i] need to look up a guide for that specific one though.



Anyway yeah I've rambled on enough, it's a good game and it's cheap. Get it. It's fun, [b]ESPECIALLY[/b] if played co-op.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011371788', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 667, 'last_played': 1536250353}
review:
This is the best non-Metroid Metroid that exists. Yes, including the Castlevanias. Everything that makes the genre great without the fluff of experience points, endless inventories and weapons that do +1.5% damage. Guacamelee looks great, the animation is on point, the challenge is well calibrated.

Two criticisms I'd have is that the "good" ending is hidden behind some very difficult parts of the game which I did manage but I think it is a shame that most people won't see. And the music is not bad, but is only kind of there and not exciting enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998836780', 'num_games_owned': 330, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 1258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1258, 'last_played': 1687069028}
review:
Very unique brawler/metroidvania. Great combat, music, platforming, interesting bosses, and extra challenges make it a great game. The cartoon graphics and brawl combat make it stand out from others of the genre. Difficult but rewarding challenges.
Main game took 9 hours. With extra challenges and achievement hunting, it took 21 hours.
Got it free, but it is definitely worth $5 to $10. Highly recommended

author: {'steamid': '76561197993566775', 'num_games_owned': 1474, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1455332341}
review:
A very worthwhile metroidvania with an OUTSTANDING OST. The soundtrack alters between a major and minor scale [spoiler] when you alternate between the world of the living and the afterlife [/spoiler] which is a very nice touch, besides being an essential mechanic.

Some cool Easter eggs and humor along the way.

Steam workshop and community has made a variety of neat skins for your characters to keep things fun.

Turbo championship adds additional challenge rooms to perfect your art of the lucha and lay the smack down on los demonios.

For the record, I've completed this game on a different platform, hence the low playtime on steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115614519', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1053, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1031, 'last_played': 1686745565}
review:
什么垃圾游戏。就美术风格很特别。手感一塌糊涂……特别是阴阳切换，什么鬼。凭什么处在另一个位面的敌人，我打不到，它却能打到我？？有很多高难度操作，一路上基本没有用到，但是拿面具的时候就各种要求。
不要被它的动作游戏外表所蒙骗。实际还是蔚蓝这种跳跳游戏。人家还知道跳过一段给个记录点。他妈的大树那个面具，死了从头再来.
依托答辩
