author: {'steamid': '76561198046527013', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 939, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 939, 'last_played': 1671826443}
review:
Хотите верьте, хотите нет - в 2013м году я проходил эту же игру, только в издании Gold Edition, получил море удовольствия, наделал кучу скриншотов, опубликовал их в галерее. В 2022 году я играю в Super Turbo Championship Edition, получаю море удовольствия, делаю кучу скриншотов по мере прохождения, сравниваю их с теми, что девятилетней давности - и они, сука, одинаковые :D Та же самая весёлая бравада, те же гэги, визуальные находки - не постарели будто ни на день вообще. Магия какая-то. Публиковать скрины повторно, разумеется, я не стану.

Guacamelee! - это всё тот же аркадный битэмап-метроидвания, действие которого разворачивается в безумных мексиканских окрестностях под энергичные треки, пронизанные вайбом латинской америки. Потеряв всё, наш герой Хуан вернётся с того света, спасёт девушку и покарает всех подручных злодея, прежде чем сойтись с тем в финальной схватке, согласно тропу мужчины-мстителя.
Игровой процесс примерно поровну разделен между исследованием локаций, решением загадок и сражениями с противниками на небольших аренах. 
Заспамить всех врагов одной атакой дальше первого часа уже не получится - они разумно обзаводятся специальными цветными щитами, каждый из которых нужно разбить единственным ударом нужного цвета, цвета же привязаны к разным спецприёмам, так что пользоваться приходится всем, и боёвка не слишком приестся даже к концу истории (данные слова отражают мнение автора и не являются публичной офертой).
Две концовки - и хорошая стоит того, чтобы получить её после обычной.

Новое издание привнесло с собой мультиплеер до 4х игроков - не пробовал, сказать нечего. Но да, сверху загорается небольшая подсказка по присоединению дополнительного бойца на экран.
Стали доступны две большие области. В частности, рыбацкая деревня, чей лор связан с помощницей ГГ, ранее известной разве что тем, что она защитница лучадорской маски.
Добавлен новый босс 3-в-1, элегантно введённый даже в старые сценки.
Из новых же игровых особенностей - мерцающие фиолетовым враги, чьи атаки в принципе не блокируются и не доджатся. К счастью, таковых за всю игру встречается немного. Ещё теперь можно активировать "devil trigger" при накоплении новой шкалы ярости - действительно, позволяет наваливать прорву урона, хоть и опционально им можно не пользоваться вообще. Рискну даже заявить, что новая механика ломает грамотно выстроенную сложность оригинала, мотивируя врываться в толпу, аннигилируя любые щиты с одного тычка и одновременно восстанавливая герою здоровье. Поэтому, наверное, для меня это весьма спорное изменение. Я, как и раньше, использовал комбо и чувствовал себя превосходно, активируя ярость раза 4 за игру всего, причём пару из них уже на финишной прямой, когда игра, под раскаты грома с молниями кидает в игрока всё что у неё есть, в тщетных попытках остановить причинение справедливости в отношении главзлодейца. Не используйте ярость, особенно на боссах, оставьте себе челлендж!

В остальном, это та же игра, которая и до "ремастера" была почти что эталоном того, как нужно делать приятные игры. Какое из изданий лучше - решать уже вам, в отзывах стима встречаются защитники и того, и другого :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198165472708', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1026, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1026, 'last_played': 1685286085}
review:
Nice game, a little bit short. Map seems huge, but a lot of these spaces are traversed rather quickly. Mechanics are fun, combat, while not being exceptionally deep, is addicting, and only extra challenges make you master it. Can sometimes be a little frustrating, but not to great degree.

P.S. If you're stuck (especially on true ending requirements) and you looked up the guide, make sure you're looking for a guide for this particular version, don't repeat my mistakes.

review:
재미는 있다. 미친듯한 레벨디자인과 액션성, 극악무도한 패턴과 악랄한 적 배치.
욕을 박박하면서 끝까지 갔다.
하지만, 마지막 보스의 말도 안되는 패턴을 공략해보려고 동영상으로 보고... 시간낭비하기 싫어서 곧바로 때려치고 삭제했다.
그전까지는 욕하면서도 재미있었다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143398009', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 517, 'last_played': 1710736148}
review:
Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition es un juego de acción y aventura desarrollado por DrinkBox Studios. En este juego, los jugadores controlan a Juan, un aguacate cosechador convertido en luchador enmascarado, mientras lucha a través de una tierra mágica de inspiración mexicana para rescatar a su amor perdido.

En términos de jugabilidad, Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition ofrece una experiencia de lucha fluida y divertida que es fácil de aprender pero difícil de dominar. Los jugadores tienen acceso a una variedad de movimientos y combos que pueden utilizarse para derrotar a los enemigos. Además, el juego cuenta con una mecánica de cambio de mundo que permite a los jugadores cambiar entre el mundo de los vivos y el mundo de los muertos para superar obstáculos y resolver acertijos. En términos de jugabilidad, Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition recibe una calificación de 9 sobre 10.

En cuanto al apartado gráfico, Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition cuenta con un estilo visual único que combina elementos de la cultura mexicana con un estilo de dibujos animados colorido y vibrante. Los personajes y los entornos están diseñados con mucho detalle y son muy atractivos a la vista. En términos de apartado gráfico, Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition recibe una calificación de 9 sobre 10.

En términos de rejugabilidad, Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition ofrece una campaña en solitario que puede completarse en alrededor de 6 a 8 horas, dependiendo del nivel de habilidad del jugador. Sin embargo, el juego cuenta con varios desafíos adicionales que pueden desbloquearse después de completar la historia principal, lo que proporciona horas adicionales de juego. Además, el juego cuenta con un modo cooperativo local que permite a los jugadores jugar juntos en la misma pantalla. En términos de rejugabilidad, Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition recibe una calificación de 8 sobre 10.

En cuanto a horas de juego, Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition ofrece una experiencia de juego corta pero intensa. Aunque la campaña en solitario se puede completar en alrededor de 6 a 8 horas, hay suficientes desafíos adicionales y modos de juego para proporcionar varias horas más de juego. En términos de horas de juego, Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition recibe una calificación de 7 sobre 10.

En general, Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition es un juego de acción y aventura emocionante con una jugabilidad fluida, un apartado gráfico impresionante y una buena rejugabilidad. Con una calificación promedio de 8 sobre 10, Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition es una excelente opción para cualquier persona interesada en los juegos de acción y aventura con una temática única y colorida.

author: {'steamid': '76561198826986913', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1903, 'last_played': 1683700635}

author: {'steamid': '76561198029641873', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1058, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1058, 'last_played': 1683644938}
review:
+ fun combat system
+ cool abilities for both combat and navigation
+ a decent amount of secrets
+ lots of optional and challenging platforming and combat challenges
+ nice music

- combat can feel a bit imprecise sometimes
- backtracking can become a bit cumbersome due to limited fast travel and disjointed maps
- a few later challenges can become pretty frustrating
- a rather cliche plot

overall: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198050628629', 'num_games_owned': 1688, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 897, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 854, 'last_played': 1683554032}
review: Когда-то приобрёл Guacamelee! Gold Edition, но так и не прошёл, что-то мне не зашло. И тут пару дней назад заметил, что у меня в библиотеке безвозмездно появилась Super Turbo Championship Edition. Этот благородный порыв разработчиков смутил меня и мне стало неудобно за то, что я не уделил ранее этой игре должного внимания. Оказалось, что это очень достойная метроидвания. Не фанат такого визуала, но к нему быстро привыкаешь. Можно сказать, что его схематичность даже облегчает прохождение, т.к. меньше отвлекает во время напряжённых попрыгушек или боёв. Управление очень удобное. В общем, рекомендую всем любителям метроидваний или просто платформеров. Хотя у этих любителей, скорее всего, игра уже есть давно. Десять лет прошло как-никак. Хорошие всё-таки ребята эти DrinkBox Studios.

author: {'steamid': '76561198188664927', 'num_games_owned': 1605, 'num_reviews': 386, 'playtime_forever': 767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 767, 'last_played': 1682106608}
review:
[quote]Follow my Curator page, [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/41363546-Fruit-N-Doggie-Reviews/]Fruit N Doggie Reviews,[/url] so you can be updated whenever I post a new review.[/quote]
[h1]Overall Rating - High Quality ★★★★☆[/h1]

[h1]First Impressions[/h1] 
Guacamelee! (GM) Super Turbo Championship Edition was a local coop game that I played over at a friend's house. It's a title I already owned, but when you're trying to find any Steam game with local coop, there's only so many options available. Based on how it went playing with friends, I was slightly concerned about trying it on my own, because even when we juggled health and lives, we kept failing to clear certain fights. Surely I'd be screwed by myself. 


[h1]Gameplay[/h1] 
Taking the role of a luchador, you might assume that GM would be a beat-'em-up or brawler of sorts. With respect to the combat, it more or less plays that way, as you combo and grapple your foes. However, it also has Metroidvania aspects, as you'll return to previous areas with new abilities, unlocking paths that were blocked off before. Most of the moves revolve around combat to some degree, such as uppercuts and headbutts, but they also have relevance to platforming. For instance, when you can switch dimensions, this is needed to create and pass through floors and walls, but also puts you into the same plane as the enemy. Otherwise, they're apparitions you can't hurt, while they can still attack you. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2961799363
[h1]Controls[/h1] 
There aren't many situations in GM where you'll be dealing with platforming and combat at the same time, but with abilities covering both matters, your move set is pretty consistent in either situation. After acquiring so many moves, it can be easy to mix them up, though the mistake I made most often was whether I changed into a chicken or switched planes. It's also theoretically possible to pull off some complicated combos, but I tend to use simpler ones myself. Overall though, I think the controls worked quite well. 


[h1]Story[/h1] 
Having been cheated out of his glory, after making a deal with the devil, Calaca overthrows him and plans on becoming the ruler over life and death. After invading the mortal realm, he kidnaps the main character's love interest, kills him, and creates his own adversary. For it was written that a recently murdered agave farmer would become the luchador of justice. In some ways, I think the villain is overshadowed by his more eccentric followers, as he's a pretty generic foe. Although I enjoyed the story overall, I was bummed that there wasn't an overview of what happened to all of the characters after beating Calaca. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2964826628
[h1]Visuals[/h1] 
Honestly, I love the presentation of GM. It's flashy, colorful, and really invigorates me while I'm playing. You always know when you find a secret or clear an arena battle, because the game does a small celebration. Plus, who can really hate smashing a pinata? Also, with the alternate dimension, every screen has two variations, though its not always much of a difference. Sometimes it's just water being swapped out for lava or a color swap, while other times a destroyed village is inhabited by several skeletons. 


[h1]Sound Design[/h1] 
Inspired by its Mexican theme, the instruments used for the music consists of items like trumpets, guitars, drums, and I believe the harp for some of the underworld tunes. Since you'll swap back and forth throughout the game, there's a version of the music for both dimensions, with some of the underworld interpretations being pretty creepy. Otherwise, a lot of the music is fairly bright and lively, favoring the idea of a celebration more than the skeleton army's invasion. Ah well, they died once, surely they'll do so again. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2964826018
[h1]Pros[/h1] 
🌟 White knights might complain about supposed racism, but they're just projecting. GM is awesome because it celebrates Mexican culture, not lampoons it.
🌟 I enjoyed the game's sense of humor, although I didn't need an old goat hitting on my mother. 
🌟 There's a fast-travel and mini-map system that helps players navigate around the game. 


[h1]Cons[/h1] 
❌ Due to some insta-kill obstacles, a few checkpoints can be a bit annoying. The fast-travel system also would be improved if you could move from checkpoint to checkpoint. 
❌ Sometimes, I wasn't always clear what color the shields were around enemies. I'd mix up the blue and green or yellow and white. 
❌ A faster run would have been a nice way to get around quickly, as your move-set doesn't always help with that. 


[h1]Tips[/h1]
🔍 I preferred saving my money for the more expensive upgrades, or ones I knew would be immediately helpful. For example, increasing my stamina regeneration. 
🔍 You have invincibility while grappling, but there will be times when you need to dodge attacks. When I forgot that was available, I always paid for it. 
🔍 Due to how many abilities there are to unlock, I wouldn't bother exploring too much in the early game. 


[h1]Final Thoughts[/h1] 
Give me a Metroidvania game set in the dark ages or a sci-fi landscape, and I'll likely enjoy it. However, with so many cultures and options available from our own world, it's refreshing to see something different. Wrestling isn't what would normally come to mind for a platformer, but such moves were incorporated suitably for a game like this. There's some rough spots where a quality of life change here and there would be nice, but aside from a few nuisances, I enjoyed my playthrough of GM, earning most of the achievements from getting all of the optional content. For those who have difficulty with platforming, I could see a few portions being roadblocks, so you might want to have a ringer who could join you in coop in case they're not your forte. Otherwise though, I'd recommend getting GM.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113761562', 'num_games_owned': 1025, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 980, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 978, 'last_played': 1685289715}
review:
Изначально игра привлекла своим визуальным стилем. Он "колоритный" во всех смыслах: выразительный, узнаваемый и пёстрый.

Сюжет хоть и прост, но напичкан шутками, от которых если не хочется посмеяться в голос, то хотя бы выдохнуть носом чуть больше обычного.
Боёвка настолько комплексная, что к концу прохождения становишься циркачом, жонглирующим супостатами: перекат, апперкот, дэш в сторону, приземление с ударом, захват, бросок противника в толпу — взболтать и смешать, пожалуйста!

Платформенные секции также проверяют реакцию и моторику. Некоторые экраны вынуждают комбинировать столько спецприёмов, что со стороны игрок напоминает, скорее, пианиста в момент исполнения Шопеновских этюдов.
Но самое приятное то, что сложность нарастает плавно на протяжении всей игры, поэтому обучение происходит практически безболезненно.

Звуки ударов сливаются с ритмами марьячи, подгоняя к неизбежному финалу.
Каждая смерть — это в 99% случаев ошибка играющего, а не плохой геймдизайн.

Тот редкий, конкретно для меня, случай, когда хочется пройти игру повторно, но уже на высоком уровне сложности.
Не бойтесь влюбиться в Guacamelee!, и она ответит вам взаимностью!

Плюсы:
+ Мексиканский сеттинг со всеми полагающимися аттрибутами
+ Плавная кривая сложности
+ Комплексность боевых и платформенных секций
+ Справедливый вызов при попытке пройти игру на 100%
+ Скины для протагониста в мастерской Steam выглядят как контент из платных DLC (Фин, Кратос, Уолтер Уайт и т.д.)
+ Локальный кооператив на двоих

Минусы:
- Малое количество доп. заданий

review: Such an unexpected gem.  I was expecting a straightforward beat-em-up.  What I encountered is a metroidvania with an entertaining story and a deep move set.  Great roster of interesting enemies on whom to try the ever-expanding list of combos.  Try this one out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198190380543', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 603, 'playtime_forever': 1349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1349, 'last_played': 1679758613}
review: Guacamelee! is simply an amazing metroidvania with a Mexican setting. The art-style has a cartoonish angular look, which may look a bit weird at first, but it fits well and establishes the game identity, since it’s immediately recognizable. It has a lot of charm and humor as well. The story is basic, with the game shining in the gameplay. To be honest, it’s nothing you haven’t seen before, but it’s well implemented. The game is fun, and the controls feel right, both in combat and platforming sections. Combat is melee focused, where you combo normal attacks, throws and specials moves. A clever design choice is that these special moves are also used in movement and are needed to access some optional areas, and in true metroidvania style, some areas aren’t accessible during your first visit. The map does a great job marking those spots, so you can easily return later when you have the necessary abilities. The soundtrack is also great. Given the setting, I was afraid it was going to be very Mexican, but to my surprise, it’s way more modern and videogamey, while still being Mexican inspired. I was humming along a lot of times. It’s also a great game to hunt 100% completion. Some optional challenges can be a bit harder, but there’s nothing hardcore in here. More importantly, it doesn’t feel like a chore. The Super Turbo Championship Edition is also the definitive version of the game, with more content added. Not only that, but that content is seamlessly integrated. I only played this version, and I couldn’t tell what was the original and the new content. It was all great. And there’re also more good stuff, like 4 player co-op and a Steam Workshop for custom costumes. I had a great time with this game, and it’s an easy recommendation. Definitely worth your time and money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026180488', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1275, 'last_played': 1679692948}
review: So much to love about this game. Great combat, great platforming, cutesy story, all wrapped up in a thematic package that 100% commits to the bit. Uppercutting and suplexing and luchadoring will never get old. The platforming challenges were just difficult enough to be satisfying. The game is also super forgiving, dying doesn't yeet you back to the start and force you to replay repetitive bits. Hard mode provides a solid challenge. Right when I thought I had the combat pegged and could wipe bosses without getting hit, hard mode told me to sit down and gitgud. It wasn't agonizingly difficult, just enough to freshen up the challenge again. Guacamelee is a goat punch of charm right to the chest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071372077', 'num_games_owned': 222, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 874, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 874, 'last_played': 1646338957}
review:
En pocas palabras:

Si excluyo Hollow Knight, este Guacamelee! es el juego con el que mejor lo he pasado en los últimos tiempos. Es realmente divertido. De 11 en este sentido. Y también es el juego que he desinstalado con más rabia nada más terminarlo. Aún así es un juego sobresaliente (a pesar de la estúpida decisión de diseño tras su final), que seguro reinstalaré (o cuya segunda parte compraré) y que recomiendo por 10, 15 ó 20 euros, lo que estimes conveniente. Porque los vale.

---------------------------------------------

Lo mejor:

* Inteeeeennnsoooo!!!
* El chivo.
* La locura y la alegría general que contagia su gameplay.
* Que no deja de añadir mecánicas hasta casi el final del juego.
* La mezcla de géneros y estilos.
* El arte gráfico (le va como anillo al dedo).
* La banda sonora (y los efectos de sonido).
* El diseño de zonas, mapeado, habilidades. 
* El control del personaje, magnífico.
* Divertido a rabiar.
* Técnicamente excelente.
* Casi cualquier cosa que se diga de él.

Lo bueno:

* Todo es excelente.

Lo malo:

* Nada.

Lo peor:

* Su final. Lamentable por varios motivos.

--------------

El final de este Guacamelee! es lamentable (ojo contiene spoilers) no solo porque te escamotéa "porque si" un final bueno del juego dejándote con mal sabor de boca gratuito.. ya que tu lo has completado de manera correcta y satisfactoria. Esto ya lo hemos visto muchas veces antes y en muchos juegos. Y siempre es una mala decisión. Pero bueno. El final de Guacamelee! es lamentable, sobre todo, porque sus desarrolladores decidieron que es OBLIGATORIO conseguir ciertos objetos y superar ciertas zonas ocultas (y bien ocultas, ojo).. si quieres alcanzar un final (que no sé si será el único) aceptable del juego. Y no te lo indican en ningún momento del juego. Aunque lo hicieran, es como si Hollow Knight, para "sentir que lo has terminado", cuidado, te OBLIGARA a superar sus zonas opcionales, como el Sendero del Dolor. Esto es un sinsentido y una decisión de diseño ESTÚPIDA en un juego, que por lo demás, es redondo. De 11 sobre 10. Y esto es lo que te hace enfadar de verdad: "¿por qué estropear ASÍ un juego tan bueno?"

author: {'steamid': '76561198051121530', 'num_games_owned': 455, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 688, 'last_played': 1679246468}
review:
Бодрая игра в любимом жанре, в своё время прошедшая мимо меня. Незамысловатый сюжет, относительно невысокая базовая сложность. Интересная механика боя против щитов разного цвета плюс необходимость иногда переключаться между мирами в бою - лайк! Разнообразные боссы: встречи с каждым новым ждал с нетерпением, ни один не разочаровал.

Из минусов отметил бы разве что отсутствие списка активных побочных квестов где-нибудь в интерфейсе и некоторые бесящие элементы платформинга (благо, в стороне от основного сюжета).

Любителям метроидваний - рекомендую. А меня ждёт вторая часть.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096173256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1917, 'last_played': 1678776106}
review:
Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition é a versão melhorada de Guacamelee! Gold Edition, onde refina e melhora alguns pontos, para entregar uma experiência mais agradável que a do game original.

Acompanhando Juan na sua jornada para salvar sua amada, o jogo traz referências a cultura mexicana, memes (onde a maioria  deles estão datados nos dias de hoje) e ao próprio universo de jogos, seja em cartazes nas cidades, na luta contra chefe ("sua princesa está em outro castelo") e até no próprio nome dessa versão deste jogo.

Como um bom metroidvania, o jogo apresenta um ótimo mapa. Que é dividido em área especifica e geral. Os coletáveis (que aqui no caso são baús) ficam destacados no mapa, quando encontra-se um e não o pega naquele momento (isso ajuda no backtrack, caso esteja buscando o 100%).

Na parte de melhorias, agora a vida dos inimigos é mostrada. Existe um novo poder chamado MUY MACHO, onde você enche a barra após vencer os inimigos, quando completo, pode ativá-lo e por um curto período de tempo o personagem entra em modo berserker, onde seus golpes causam mais dano. Ótimo para ajudar em arenas com inimigos fortes ou na luta contra chefes. Alguns desafios da área El Infierno foram balanceados, onde o resultado ou detalhes de como alguns desafios são conduzidos foram modificados.

As fantasias (equivalente a armaduras, onde concedem um determinado poder cada uma) são adquiridas de maneira diferente nessa versão. Existe uma moeda própria para comprá-las, que se consegue em alguns baús e quando concluí-se as arenas. Não é possível conseguir todas as fantasias de primeira, em compensação elas são divididas entre os saves. Então você pode conseguir metade no primeiro slot de save, a outra metade no segundo save e os dois save terão todas as fantasias.

Se você não conhece a Gold Edition, é super recomendado começar pela Super Turbo Championship Edition.


Extra!
Achievements: 

Os coletáveis ficam marcados no mapa, a porcentagem é aumentada conforme mais baús são coletados e não o quanto se explora (além do fato de mostrar a porcentagem em área individual, ajudando a ter noção de como está indo).
Deixe os desafios do El Infierno para o final, onde terá todas as habilidades. De preferência após fazer o final verdadeiro, onde vai conseguir o poder do voo. Se focar em fazê-los na primeira run, pegue fantasias que ajudem neles (El Portero e Alebrije).

author: {'steamid': '76561198256129666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 734, 'last_played': 1678330982}
review:
Quando comecei a jogar, não imaginava que teria mais um jogo de plataforma que um jogo de pancadaria. A sorte é que os comandos são muito responsivos, o que evitou culpar o jogo após falhar em alguns trechos mais do que gostaria de admitir.

A campanha começa em um ritmo normal, mas aos poucos, conforme ganhamos novos poderes e habilidades, torna-se necessário realizar diversas manobras pelos cenários para avançar. Elas requerem pular de uma parede para outra, trocar de dimensões e usar portais, entre outras coisas, quase sempre em uma velocidade e coordenação que chegam a bugar o cérebro.

Ao final de uma jogatina de duas horas, meus dedos estavam genuinamente doendo.

Sobre o combate, ele é divertido, porém pouco desafiante. Uma nova dificuldade é desbloqueada após zerar, mas não cheguei a testar para ver como se difere da dificuldade normal.

Podemos executar combos e desencadear golpes em sequência com certa facilidade, desde que esquivando na hora certa. É bastante intuitivo, pois os poderes são desbloqueados aos poucos para que consigamos nos acostumar. E ao contrário da movimentação pelos cenários, não precisa tanta agilidade.

Em termos técnicos, apesar de antigo, Guacamelee apresenta gráficos muito bonitos. Esta é uma característica normal nesse estilo gráfico, afinal é desenhado à mão. Provavelmente, se jogarmos daqui a 10 ou 15 anos games como este ou Ori, continuaremos achando que são obras artísticas incríveis.

Por fim, o áudio tem várias músicas divertidas e animadas, inspiradas em ritmos mexicanos, mas também não faz feio quando o assunto são os efeitos sonoros ambientais, de monstros e pancadaria.

Por outro lado, não há dublagem. Isso deixa a sensação de vazio no mundo, sendo, portanto, um fator negativo, ainda mais considerando que com personagens tão excêntricos seria divertido ouvir suas vozes para conhecer as nuances de suas personalidades.

author: {'steamid': '76561198797494375', 'num_games_owned': 1102, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 1198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1198, 'last_played': 1678285642}
review:
해당 Super Turbo Championship Edition(STCE)은 gold edition은 업데이트 버전입니다
Guacamelee 1을 플레이 하고픈 분이시라면 해당 버전을 플레이 하세요

한글화가 되어있지 않아 스토리 이해가 아쉽지만, 진행이 안되거나 몰입도가 깨진다거나 하지는 않습니다
액션과 위트 자체만으로도 재미있어요

스테이지와 스토리를 진행하면서 차근차근 기술을 하나씩 알려주는 점이 좋았고
기믹 파훼에 충분히 기술을 활용하게 해주는 점도 좋았습니다

재밌단 말이 저절로 나올 정도로 플레이했던 게임이네요
손이 조금 꼬일지라도 충분히 도전가능하고, 재도전 기회도 무한에 가까우니 주저말고 플레이 해보세요
추천합니다!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198062925091', 'num_games_owned': 863, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 815, 'last_played': 1678255572}
review:
Time for a real review for this game.  Is it fun?  Yes.  Is it Well made?  Absolutely.  Is it hard?  Let's put it this way.  Checking the achievements - which you get some of for standard actions such as completing boss fights or areas - only 40% of all people playing this game have made it past the first boss area.  Only about 20% have made it as far as the last area, and less than that have finished the game.  These stats roughly apply to both this version and the gold version.  So, all these reviews saying the game is easy to average difficulty - no it isn't.  Not even remotely.  This is pro level stuff.

Expect to die.  A lot.  And I mean a LOT.  Expect to find many areas where your average player will just give up and quit playing from sheer frustration or genuine lack of knowing how to proceed.  Which is a shame, because it really is fun and well made.  And it is generous with power ups.  But it's hard.  Very.  Only masochists, people with endless patience, or pro level platform gamers need apply.

Do I recommend it?  Yes.  Just know the truth of what you are getting yourself into.   The one thing I will say helps is that it is sometimes forgiving where you continue from when you die, and it's not a game over kind of death, just a teleport back to the last save altar if you die from damage (with whatever fight scenario you were in respawned), or last ledge you happened to be standing on if you die from falling.  Don't mistake me saying that for oh so it is easy.  It's not.  Again, only 40% of all people playing this game even made it past the first boss area.

TOP FUN THINGS TO DO:
⭐️Fighting bosses.
⭐️Jumping puzzles.

THE UNIQUES:
💎Becoming a Luchador

PLAYER GAMING REQUIREMENTS:
💼 Platformer.
💼 2D.
💼 Metroidvania.

PROS:
+ Most of the jumping puzzles are decent.
+ Colourful artwork.
+ Co-op mode.
+ Can be replayed!

CONS:
- Tedious combat.
- Map can be a little confusing.

VERDICT:
Guacmelee! Is a mediocre Metroidvanina, there's plenty of other games that do this better, which may put some players on the fence about this game, such as myself. It hasn't got many downsides but the gameplay tends to play it safe with the combat, which to me, is a very important part to this type of game.

They did a fantastic job with the jumping puzzles, this is where I think the main enjoyment is at and it's very rewarding when you complete the puzzle. The next thing that should be mentioned would be the artwork, it's so colourful and vibrant that it kept me interested for a while.

Overall Guacamelee! Does deserve to be played but know that other games do this a lot better, getting it on a sale would be the wisest move.
Total Score = 58/100.

GAMEPLAY:
Guacamelee! is a hybrid 2D Metroidvania style action platform and brawler. Players control the luchador Juan and explore an open, non-linear world to complete the central story objectives while collecting necessary character upgrades and battling enemies. Coins collected from defeated enemies are used to buy new skills at shops, which also double as checkpoints. The game features drop-in co-op play, with the second player assuming the role of Tostada, Guardian of the Mask.

SIMILAR GAME LIKE THIS? / REVIEWER PREVIOUS EXPERIENCE:
Hollow Knight, Rain World, Dead Cells.

■■■■■□□□□□ 5 / 10
Nachoooooooooo!

RECOMMEDED SPECS
It'll run on anything.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025522562', 'num_games_owned': 1499, 'num_reviews': 242, 'playtime_forever': 752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1677287970}
review: Enjoyable metroidvania with a twist. Lots of humor and some great platforming. The fighting combosystem is quite extensive and hard to execute on, so lots of training is recommended. On normal, most enemies are manageable using a small combo set.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060769335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1676803837}
review: Guacamelee is a fun game. Its metroidvania aspect is really streamlined so there isn't much exploration to really be had so if you're looking for that this might not be quite what you're looking for. However, once you get past its slow startup and you unlock most of your moves the beat em up part of the game becomes really fun and satisfying. It also has a lot of charm, humor, and is chock full of references to classic indie games. Overall it was a good experience and I'd say if you're considering it, it's worth picking up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009443460', 'num_games_owned': 1008, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 944, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 944, 'last_played': 1676852431}
review:
Great game. The fighting, the controls, the progression, everything feels polished.
It has a couple of parts, near the end, that may prove a little hard, specially for the newcomers to the genre.
In all other aspects this is a very good title for newcomers. But because of the late game difficulty I wouldn`t recommend it to new players of this genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005521377', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1677005629}
review:
This Metroidvania is goofy in the best possible way. I personally love the style of the game, but I think if you're sensitive to cultural appropriation you might dislike this game.

The platforming is pretty great, but its the interesting combat system that really sets it apart. It's based around making combos by throwing enemies into one another, uppercutting them into the air,  and keep hitting them in the air to keep the combos rolling.

My main gripe with the game is its inconsistent difficulty curve. It's boringly difficult during the first half or so, allowing you to pretty much turn your brain off and faceroll the fights. It doesn’t really motivate the player to explore the move sets. Enemies die so quickly there isn't even that much opportunity to practice, even if you're looking to. During the later stages of the game suddenly the difficulty jumps up hardcore. I actually think this makes for a better game, but it's quite a jarring transition.

You might start this game off by thinking it's a fun little platformer fighter to unwind with, but suddenly you're forced to become serious and have to completely change the attitude with which you play. 

The game would be far better if the difficulty gradually ramped up between 5% and 75% of the game

review: Guacamelee 1 is a classic metroidvania. Far more linear than some of its peers, but trading that off for some of the best combat in the genre. With tight gameplay wrapped up in a very unique aesthetic which pays homage to Mexican culture, it's an easy recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151375933', 'num_games_owned': 243, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1676081183}
review:
Disclaimer: I don't usually play metroidvanias or platformers, but I can sometimes enjoy them
... so you can assume I didn't like Guacamelee as much as I wish I did.

I expected something funny. The game name is pun! There's posters that reference other games and overly festive music every time you learn a new ability. And yet, plot cutscenes don't even contain an ounce of humor.

I expected something fun to play. Fighting enemies at the start was fun; trying to aim for a higher combo by throwing the enemies around and all. But by the end of the game, I felt like combat arenas were just mindless enemy spam, and although I got new abilities, I was worse at fighting them off.

There's also a difficulty spike where the game suddenly expects you to complete really long screens that include platforming and combat without dying in lava. Because falling into lava or running into blades kills you and respawns you at the last checkpoint, but falling into poison or falling into the void teleports you back to the last platform. You go from being able to retry the last jump you missed, to having to do harder platforming without failing once.

Similarly, there's that one screen where you need to do dodge, double jump, air dash, switch dimensions and up-B in a very short amount of time. It's the only instances where the game asks you to do that; and no it wasn't in a sequence of levels with increasing difficulty, it just happened to be there. Also, there's two autoscrolling tower levels. That's one too many.

Other annoying points were that the controls were too tight for me (the up button *must* be pressed before B or the ability doesn't activate) and that the final boss is different from all the other fights: [spoiler] it's more of a puzzle where you need to figure out what you're supposed to do, while all the other boss fights were hitting the boss until it died[/spoiler].

For a game that I expected to make me smile, I ended up feeling frustratingly weak. It feels like a very well-polished student game that's just not that interesting in the end.

TL;DR I know I'm not good at this kind of game, but the difficulty spike is awful

author: {'steamid': '76561198309690787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1676052831}
review:
I can't possibly say no harder to a game than this one. It takes every lesson from prior titles, and iterates on all of the worst aspects, while removing anything good. This process is done, as they constantly reference other, better media, reminding you of precisely how bad this game actually is. 

I think the worst aspect of this, is that you don't truly understand how bad it is until you can no longer return it, as it unfurls into some twisted lovechild of the worst metroid puzzles, and pieces of actual, factual, Kaizo trash.

The game's incredibly slow controls and sluggish response time feels more at home in a souls title, but enemies there move at compensatory speeds; unlike this title.

The boss that finally killed this for me was (I believe) the second boss, the angry lady along with the design of everything between her and (the genius tbh) small hole upgrade.

Any room and space I entered I could hear myself asking "Would it be possible to make this room more infuriating than it is right now?" the answer was always no.

her design was so annoying and opaque with endless frustration exponentially compounding with every phase that I genuinely wanted to break my controller. The final phase, which I assume was built to make you use the previously introduced shield mechanics, requires RNG to ensure both are in a vulnerability phase at the same time, near enough to hit, reachable, and with you not in some 2 second long knock back, or in the middle of doing literally anything.

I should have tapped out at the Bowser boss in temple 1. I should have realized the Kaizo DNA present. Especially with the variety of slowing mechanics that were layered atop a boss where you would be given almost no time to escape from.

I spent most of my play time unable to control my character, or waiting for my character to get back up after some random thing happened. 

Further; floaty platforming controls, without a reliable double jump, on platforms barely wide enough to have hit detection, right at a timed switch... Right outta mario maker's worst.

I'd love a refund; especially since it would have taken a substantial amount of effort to make a product this fantastically bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119634375', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 659, 'last_played': 1675638234}
review:
I will start off by stating that I don't typically enjoy metroidvanias but this game was one of the exceptions. 

Gameplay:
Truly wonderful! Very addicting! Action-packed! This game gives you a range of abilities and combos that seems overwhelming as every single button on the Xbox controller does a different attack/move but you adjust to it and I would say it is easy to catch on. 

Atmosphere:
This is really where the designers nailed it. The design is absolutely stunning and really gives off what Mexico would look like in a video game. Many cultural references were nailed beautifully in this game. The catchy music, bright visuals, and character designs are well done, to say the least. The designers were clearly passionate about this game and it is easy to see.  

Storyline:
This is actually where the game is weakest. The story is pretty bland, very much of a Super Mario game in which you have to go save the princess type of thing. In fact, there was a couple of Mario references in the game which I thought was hilarious (also a reference to Metroid so these designers love Nintendo). There is an ending and an alternative ending...but the amount of work you have to do for the alternative ending for what you receive...not really worth it. You could beat the game and then watch the other ending online without the hassle. You gain only one extra ability if you wish to continue playing and collecting orbs which you will pretty much only use to break purple barriers. I expected a new suit or at least something other than just a new slideshow for going to the extra mile. 

Price:
It's worth it! However, it's an older game so you may as well wait for it to be on sale if you waited to this point.

Conclusion:
There is a reason this is a well-known indie title. The design and gameplay push this game to be one of the best metroidvanias I have played in a long time. This game can beat around 8 hours which is the perfect time frame in my opinion (10 hours if you want the alternative ending). If you want to give a friend a game, this is a great present for Cinco De Mayo. 

Score:
8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198401297077', 'num_games_owned': 106, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 595, 'last_played': 1674581944}
review:
Este juego es un metroidvania basado en la cultura mexicana que tiene bastante carácter, por un lado, tiene, en su mayoría, un diseño de escenarios espectacular. Las ciudades son preciosas y están cuidadas hasta el más mínimo detalle. En un goce visual. Por otra parte, tiene un combate bastante entretenido y conforme avanzas en la historia puedes hacer más convos, a la vez que aparecen nuevos enemigos con distintas debilidades. En este sentido el combate es muy entretenido. El apartado musical también está muy bien conseguido, tiene canciones populares que conjuntan perfectamente con las ciudades. Conforme avanzas, no todo es pelear, hay partes de la historia donde tienes que hacer parkour y utilizar tus habilidades para continuar. Tiene unas cuantas misiones secundarias que son bastante entretenidas pero son cortas. También, hay lugares donde puedes probar tus habilidades haciendo desafíos. La historia está bien y los personajes tienen bastante carisma. El problema que yo encuentro es que, en el nivel final, empieza a empeorar visualmente y es muy tedioso. También que los bosses son bastante faciles, tiene un modo dificil pero no lo he probado. Aunque si quieres que sea un reto puedes ponerte el traje de piñata y sufrir. (Se pueden comprar mejoras y trajes con el dinero del juego). 

El juego en sí, dura unas 9 horas yendo con tranquilidad y completando algunos lugares al 100%. Para completar el 100% supongo que son unas 20 horas aproximadamente. Con todo esto, recomiendo el juego porque es bastante bueno y no dudes en probarlo si lo tienes gratis. Si tienes pensado comprarlo te diría que lo puedes comprar perfectamente al precio al que está, aunque si no tienes prisa, puedes esperar a las rebajas. También tiene multijugador local de hasta 4 jugadores. Por último, hay otra versión del juego pero esta es más completa. 
Overall: 7.5/10

review: Jogo do estilo metroidvania muito divertido e viciante, humor com várias referências de outros jogos, música estilo latina que fica no ouvido e na playlist. A minha parte favorita é o Inferno com diversos desafios que te obrigam a usar todo o que aprendeste. Recomendo não só o jogo como também acabar com 100%, e outra run no hard mode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099458236', 'num_games_owned': 1666, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 563, 'last_played': 1653524818}
review: A classic of modern platformers. Played it on the Vita but was never able to finish it, and I'm really glad I revisited it. Fantastic art design and very fun combat with none of the boring design choices a lot of modern metroidvanias love to include. It's also a cute homage to videogame and mexican culture (with a really good mexican spanish localization). Very recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978029151', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1678411646}
review:
I just discovered this game.  It was sitting unredeemed in a Humble Bundle from 2016.  I went in with no expectations and was blown away.  So damn fun.  Clever writing - Monkey Island level humor.  Great platforming, great fighting.  Buy it immediately.  Play it.  Enjoy it.  Then go buy the sequel.

Side note 1) I really hope they are working on a Guacamelee #3
Side note 2) If not, I would totally buy a chicken-only Mexiverse adventure.

author: {'steamid': '76561199206352250', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1071, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1071, 'last_played': 1672610052}
review:
Ahora que me lo he pasado al 100% puedo decir que este juego no pasa con pena ni gloria, ¿Por qué?, porque ya a mitad de juego este se pone repetitivo y no logra innovar en nada, haciendo q tengas ganas de dejarlo ahí. Como 11 enemigos sin contar las variaciones de algunos enemigos que están ahí porque sí, un juego literalmente lineal porque no te dan una pista de por donde tienes que ir, te lo dicen, algo que en un metroidvania el cual trata mayormente de explorar pues igual y está algo pendejo. 
Puzzles jodidamente iguales unos a otros: salta, usa una habilidad, agarra lo que hay ahí o pasa de zona, ni siquiera un desafío con mini-jefe o un acertijo q te haga pensar. Y los trajes ni hablar, te pasarás olvidando de que existen si es que no te acuerdas de darle a la E en los puntos de guardado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198727195683', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 487, 'last_played': 1566070115}
review:
Muy buen Juego la Estetica es basantante acertada a la representacion de Mexico apesar de estar basada en los diseños tipo cartoon Network pero dejando de lado, el gameplay es muy limpio y divertido emplea varias mecanicas que desafian tu experiencia los niveles son muy interesantes ademas de los puzzles, requiere tiempo pero vale la pena encontrar todas las zonas y articulos, ademas de los disitnos trajes.

La historia es interesante e insita acontinuar con el juego, la verdad es muy recomendado y no se arrepentiran de jugarlo y la segunda entrega tambien mejoro muchas cosas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053060154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 1114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1111, 'last_played': 1672379539}
review:
Guacamelee is a solid title, and is a game definitely worth playing through. With good gameplay, good atmosphere, and good music; this cross between a metroidvania platformer and a beat'em up combo fighter is both satisfying and fun.

Grapple an enemy and kick them into a group for a big knockdown. Grab hold of a flying chupacabra and piledrive it into the earth. Dash punch into an uppercut and headbutt enemies into smithereens. The combat is pure fun, and isn't all that hard (bosses can be tough), even on hard mode.

The platforming is where the challenge lies, especially in the optional sections like Tule Treetops and Cueva de la Locura. These two lategame sections are unbelievably tough but are actually really satisfying to beat. Although you [i]do[/i] have to beat them for the alternate, and in my opinion, more satisfying, ending.

This is a game you've probably heard of, but maybe never actually seen gameplay of. It's done crossovers with everything from Brawlout to Dead Cells. Its reputation preceeds it, and for good reason.

I turned myself into a chicken. Funniest shit I've ever seen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048226459', 'num_games_owned': 584, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 980, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 980, 'last_played': 1672362827}
review:
[h1]Guacamelee! STCE 100%[/h1]

[b]Single Playthrough: [/b] maybe 10 hours 
[b]Time to 100%: [/b] roughly 15 – 20 hours
-I’d recommend searching the steam guides for the code to skip straight to hard mode without having to playthrough it once. Saves a lot of time and energy

[b]Difficulty: [/b] Difficult at times
-You can make the playthrough itself fairly simple by getting all the health, stamina, and special upgrades to make bosses and challenge arenas simpler.
-There are challenge rooms that require you to test gold in all aspects of the game, but you can hold them off until the end once you’ve grasped the games mechanics

[b]Overall: [/b] Worth getting 100%
- The game is a mixture of tight combat, traditional metroidvania discovery, great art style, and references to other games / media that just add to the humor of the experience. Really solid experience, definitely worth your time!
... Not to mention there’s 4 player co-op for additional replay value and good times!

review: I really wanted to like it because I love the Mexican art and the characters, but the "Metroidvania" aspects, and admittedly I'm not super familiar with that term, felt like repetitive busywork. Mostly I just felt stuck a lot. Maybe if you were super in love with the gameplay that'd be bearable, but I wasn't. Also I've heard people say just get the gold edition instead of STCE.

author: {'steamid': '76561198847732280', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1989, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1989, 'last_played': 1656115746}
review:
Diría que este es el mejor juego que recomiendo para comenzar con el genero Metroidvania

Por supuesto que hay bastantes juegos mejores, pero este titulo tiene algo que se me hace muy especial.... empezando por el hecho de que no es muy largo (te toma unas 7 horas la historia principal), una historia bastante sencilla pero entretenida, un gameplay exquisito basado en combos y un mapeado muy genial y suprema mente sencillo de entender; Por ejemplo las zonas a las que tienes que ir mas adelante en la historia están cerradas con un bloque de un color muy especifico, para cuando obtengas una habilidad de ese color en especifico te acuerdes y vuelvas a descubrir que hay allí. En términos de dificultad pues el juego no es muy exigente, quizá lo mas complicado sean algunas zonas de plataformeo opcionales  y poco más.

en conclusión bla bla (no se organizar ideas) xd 
Recomiendo Guacamelee a cualquier personas; si te gustan los metroidvanias, si no te gustan, si nunca has jugado uno, si no te gustan los videojuegos etc

A narrativa é simples, porém muito divertida. Ao longo da aventura, Juan encontrará tanto aliados quanto inimigos que se destacam por serem carismáticos, engraçados e visualmente interessantes. Piadas a respeito da cultura mexicana e luchadores são uma constante, mantendo o clima leve, apesar de ser uma trama que envolve o exército do inferno.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126767270', 'num_games_owned': 332, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1671876263}
review:
設計非常精妙的動作遊戲

除了摔角連技外
還有切換模式(雞/界)增添遊玩要素
過圖跑酷需要善用上述機制
手腦並行反而經常手忙腳亂

美術風格也相當優秀
主角服裝BOSS怪物皆富有特色
切換不同世界，場景更有兩種不同風貌
可以感受出製作的用心

難度方面極度推薦控制器操作
有些環節稍微需要練習技巧才能通過
所幸遊戲重生點設計十分親民
至少簡單模式只要重複嘗試幾次應該就能順利通關了

相對地也含有不少隱藏要素
支線任務不少都不知道要去哪解
部分成就和寶箱更是要求操作技巧
對強迫症全蒐集型成就玩家恐怕是個挑戰

在下身為休閒玩家還是見好就收
一周目通關好評收工

author: {'steamid': '76561198202713148', 'num_games_owned': 57, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 963, 'last_played': 1706455335}
review:
Between the gameplay, the visual presentation, the always-upbeat soundtrack and the characters, it's clear Guacamelee's main objective is for you to have as much silly fun as possible

There's no greater philosophical themes, or finger-breaking difficulty for difficulty's sake; Just a charming, vibrant adventure oozing with love for Mexican culture and the Metroidvania sub-genre

Beating up hoards of skeletons, while jamming out with the ever-cheerful OST, puts you in a zen mode I can't quite explain, it's a sort of "relaxed excitement"

----------------------------------------------------------------

As for some notable flaws:

- Despite being a Metroidvania, the game is oddly linear, your next destination is always clearly defined and there is always only one area you're really meant to be exploring at any given time; the world doesn't quite feel like a real place the hero is traversing, with choices and branching paths, but just a video game map, which is fine for Guacamelee's size and fun-centric design, but noticeable enough

- Hard mode; It's pretty much just normal mode, except all the enemies have more health, and deal more damage,  which results in a second playthrough that just seems... slower and duller, as every foe gets an artificial boost - you'll be executing the same combos over and over and over while the baddies' healthbars barely budge, it simply gets boring compared to the fast paced normal mode

- This is a pretty personal nitpick, but I believe text boxes are a very overlooked part of a game's aesthetic; A good text box can add so much personality and flair to the characters and the game as a whole - take Celeste's text box for example! A sleek, textured backdrop displaying a beautiful, hand-drawn, 2D animation of the currently speaking character, while adorable gibberish mimicking human speech plays over every rapidly appearing letter, it's so fun! Guacamelee, despite having so much personality otherwise, really drops the ball in the text box department, giving us little more than a solid-color shape with no animation, and a single, mediocre sound effect, maybe I'm weird, but it is honestly the worst part of the game for me

----------------------------------------------------------------

At any rate, don't let the fact that the cons section is the longest part of this review fool you!
Guacamelee is overall a delight to play through and complete

If you're a fan of goofy, energetic escapades, that don't take themselves too seriously and are just laughs all the way through, definitely give Guacamelee a shot!

author: {'steamid': '76561197999077438', 'num_games_owned': 322, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1689438492}
review:
This game is fun and beautiful to looks at.

The only thing I have problem in this game are the difficulty spikes... Most of the jumps and puzzles are very simple almost boring and repetitive and then you get to the one section in whole level that seems almost impossible.

This game also can't decide if it wants to be a jumping puzzle action game or arena beat the up game because it wants to do both but not's not great at either.

If you like platformer or metroidvania games give this game a try but be aware it can be frustrating at times

author: {'steamid': '76561198104914880', 'num_games_owned': 1598, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1666688027}
review:
This game is called Guaca melee, but the combat just sucks.
You're learning cool combos, but there is hardly anyone to use them on.

There are only a few boss fights, and the rest is just getting swarmed by a bunch of mobs that all have certain conditions.
Like, go to death realm, break his shield with green attack, go back to death, oh there is a fucker up that you can't get to because you're melee.
It's so frustrating, and it breaks the flow of the game.

Is it an alright game? For sure? Would I recommend it? No.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128244632', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2112, 'last_played': 1670291714}

author: {'steamid': '76561198055255783', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1666644051}
review:
Guacamelee is a pretty fun metroidvania. The idea of your standard upgrades being combat moves was wonderful as is the combat. The art style and mexican themes are quite charming. Most of the game is running through corridors and fighting enemies in an arena but it's broken up by really fun platforming sections. The one thing I didn't like about this game but gave me a sense of nostalgia are the very dated video game references that remind me of the old days of the internet/youtube.

My play time is around 11 hours but I play this on my steam deck without setting up cloud saves first so the 4 hours is NOT my actual play time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015466081', 'num_games_owned': 334, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 789, 'last_played': 1666550256}
review:
Метроидвании и платформеры абсолютно не мои жанры. Так я думал довольно долго, со стороны все эти прыгалки-бегалки взад-вперед совершенно не цепляют. Ну какой смысл бегать по локациям в сотый раз, зачем этот бэктрекинг, еще и в 2д, не понятно, навалите лучше сюжету и моральных диллем. Но, как говорится, у меня просто метроидвании нормальной не было. Так что Guacamelee! стал для меня первым. И на корню срубил все мои предрассудки. 

По-началу он зацепил меня своей внешностью, сочная картинка, красивые анимации, а простота идет только на пользу, выделяя все самое выгодное и убирая ненужное. Затем, подключается звук - музыка в мексиканском стиле, трубы, гитары, все это буквально переносит тебя в жаркую Мексику (отдельный кайф ушам - при переходе в мир мертвых музыка становится будто бы дальше, появляется легкое эхо труб, а часть партитуры исчезает). Ну а потом, когда ты уже очарован, начинается геймплей. И самое мягкое как его можно было бы описать - это затягивающий. Ты движешься сквозь врагов и платформы, сквозь секретные локации и хабы, суешь свой любопытный нос в самые отдаленные уголки карты. Каждый раз, когда вроде бы можно уже и закончить, ты вспоминаешь, что хотел сходить еще сюда, вдруг там что-то интересное. Так и сидишь, насилуя геймпад, пытаясь пробиться в очередную секретку.

Ну а когда ты уже растворился в геймплее и дизайне, ты понимаешь, что тут еще крайне интересно следить за диалогами, как минимум от того, что они полны годных шуток. Каждый раз ломая статую, открывающую новое умение, к тебе подходит человек-козел, и каждый раз он по-новому ругается на то, что ты сломал ЕГО статую (одну из них, он так старался, тащил на вершину огромного дерева, только для того, что бы проучить нашего лучадора - статуя фальшивая и не дает никаких новых умений). Ну а боссы, каждый из них яркий и харизматичный, ты буквально ждешь встречи с ними (к тому же файты с каждым - уникальные и очень интересные (хотя несколько странновато разнятся в сложности, самый сложный файт выдался в середине, с Ужасным Трио, на мой взгляд даже сложнее финального босса)).

Guacamelee! - это отличный способ познакомиться с метроидваниями и полюбить их (возможно не все и не сразу, но первый и довольно широкий шаг стоит сделать именно отсюда). Едва ли не идеальный представитель жанра как платформеров в целом, так и метроидваний в частности.

author: {'steamid': '76561198207417937', 'num_games_owned': 512, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1666122242}
review: Guacamelee is that trip to Mexico you've been planning if Mexico was a Metroidvania series of connected dungeons. The level design and abilities are all by the numbers, but the beat-em-up combat is really fun and the visual style and music are excellent. This one is on the easier side but it's also short enough that it never gets boring dunking on all those skeletons and Mexican mythology creatures. You can turn into a chicken so it's of course the best game ever.

Got the Platinum for this on the Playstation Vita and was excited to give it another go just for fun; still a great game that holds up after all these years.

author: {'steamid': '76561198803090661', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 904, 'last_played': 1689286739}
review: This game has been one of my favorite nostalgic games growing up. I've done full playthroughs of this game every 4 years since 2014. I don't know how that coincidence happened but it just did. In 2014 I did a full playthrough of the game on easy mode, in 2018 I did another full playthrough, got the secret achievement and I did a little more by trying it out on hard mode and in 2022 I got all of the achievements to the game. Every time I return to this game I've enjoyed playing through it like it was my first time. I don't regret playing this game and that's why I leave my review as positive.

review: Finally got around to playing this game and it was a ton of fun! A great entry in the metroidvania genre. I love that there were lots of pure platforming bits as platformers are another favorite genre of mine. I also enjoyed the arena fight mechanic where you're locked into a challenge that you must overcome. There's heavy use of platforming and these arena battles throughout the game. Check it out if you're a fan of metroidvanias!

review:
Jogo de plataforma indie. 
Tem uma campanha curta, que dura ali entre 5h a 8h, depende da dificuldade.
Mesmo com uma campanha curta o jogo tem uma imersão, mostrando duas certezas: a vida e a morte.
O jogo é bom e vale a pena em uma sale.
Para platina, cerca de 30h.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107785590', 'num_games_owned': 719, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1663594127}
review: 喜加一小游戏本以为也就图一乐，却出乎意料地好玩。横板动作/平台跳跃有空洞骑士和奥日内味了，比空洞骑士简单，画面艳丽程度与奥日有一拼，美术风格独特，关卡设计精妙，打击感十足，NPC鸡哥还会手把手教你各种花里胡哨的连招。可惜没中文 剧情玩得一知半解，大概就是筋肉兄贵变身为摔角猛男一路暴打反派最终营救出被绑架的未婚妻这么一个故事。非要说缺点的话那就是BOSS太少，建议再加10个BOSS让我捶一捶

author: {'steamid': '76561198036806268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1547452924}
review:
This game is a hell of a lot of fun.  Amazingly great Metroidvania, with a lot of fun jokes thrown in.  Sorry, if this offends you, no one give a crap.  I love the Mexican/Dia de los Muertos aesthetic, if you get offended by it occasionally poking fun at itself, well, that's your problem.

Absolutely worth a buy.  This game kicks almost as much butt as the protagonist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074776927', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1663188085}
review:
This game is very very short. You unlock abilities very often, and none of them feel nearly explored enough. For a metroid-vania game, i'm left with a strong unresolved feeling after finishing the main story. To my disappointment, you cant play as the woman luchador in a 1-player game.

The final boss is designed poorly. Throwing out random attacks without showing super short (specific-to-each-attack) warning animations, if at all (this is also present in a few other normal enemies), and doesn't give the player enough time to discern which movement/dodge options you have to handle each attack. And the laser attacks have annoying hitboxes that extend wider than they look.

If the game is on sale, then maybe give it a try. I don't think this is something i'd ever want to play a second time. Oh also the game has a lot of references to other games if you're into that

author: {'steamid': '76561198105614513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 564, 'last_played': 1662976151}

hopefully they fix the mechanics (phasing) and add more on guacamelee 2

author: {'steamid': '76561198177558007', 'num_games_owned': 515, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1592847205}
review:
This is a solid indie metroidvania, the artstyle combined with the mexican thematic makes this so unique and cool to look at, I mean, just look at the enemies in the store images, they express everything you need to know.
The platforming is fun, it is not impossibly difficult but it does expect you to use your newly aquired powers in their totallity, forming combos with each other. 
I think the metroidvania aspect is a little bit "weaker"? Like it feels really streamlined and handholdy. 
I also liked the humor.
I finished this in about 6 hours, if for some reason you are the kind of person worried about price/hour, 2 bucks when in discount or the 10 dollars it asks by default is completely worth it.

I did enjoy the boss fights a lot, especially the last one. I just wish the game had some difficult post game content as there is none.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096663928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 426, 'playtime_forever': 592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 592, 'last_played': 1661278340}
review:
Серия самых коротких рецензий:

Очень хорошая (7.5 из 10)

P.S.: Расшифровка:

Трэш — знакомиться с игрой рекомендуется исключительно тем, кто в диком восторге от описания, скриншотов и продолжительности. Остальным, из контакта с этой игрой, только тыкать палкой, как ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ку на дороге.

Так себе — в основном, эта игра предлагает меньше, чем вы увидите из описания и скриншотов. Рекомендуется только тем, кому вышеперечисленные критерии окажутся «зашибись».

Нормальная — неплохая игра своего жанра. Сами судите по описанию, скриншотам и продолжительности. Игра, примерно, соответствует своему наполнению.

Хорошая — весьма неплохой представитель своего жанра. Многие могут найти тут «свой шедевр». Зачастую, игра приятно соответствует своему описанию и скриншотам.

Отличная — эти игры, зачастую, превосходят свои первые впечатления, основанные на описании и скриншотах (в расчёт не берём репутацию, ибо «тот кто знает, тот поймёт»). Хорошие представители своего жанра.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171050929', 'num_games_owned': 2009, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 1232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1232, 'last_played': 1564469162}
review:
[b]Guacamelee! [i]Super Turbo Championship Edition[/i][/b] es de los mejores metroidvania que podes encontrar. Super divertido y con un buen toque de humor.
Somos Juan, un luchador que se enfrenta a la muerte para rescatar a su amada. Exploraremos los rincones del mundo de los muertos y los vivos en búsqueda de Lupita.
Tiene un lindo sistema de combos haciendo que el combate sea muy divertido, la exploración una vez consigamos ciertas habilidades, será bastante mas sencilla.

9/10 Finkitos

author: {'steamid': '76561198061481125', 'num_games_owned': 73, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 647, 'last_played': 1660701101}
review:
Mola como han hecho lo de viajar entre el mundo de los vivos y el de los muertos.

Reconozco que solo por la temática mexicana ya me tenían casi convencido (la banda sonora es genial) Luego al jugarlo he visto que además de ser bonito artísticamente también es pura calidad en el resto de apartados.

Los gráficos y diseño me flipan porque recuerdan a la serie de animación Samurai Jack (2001) Luego está la jugabilidad con diferentes técnicas para hacer combos a los monstruos, si aprendes a hacerlo bien no les dejarás ni respirar.

Aunque se podría considerar un "metroidvania" por su exploración del mapa, conseguir mejoras, etc. va muchísimo más directo al grano que otros juegos de este género que suelen tener un sistema muchísimo más complejo.
Por ejemplo no tienes armas ni equipo, vas a tortazo limpio aunque puedes comprar diferentes trajes de lucha libre con habilidades pasivas. Además de la historia principal hay misiones secundarias, secretos escondidos y hasta distintos finales.

Tiene más dosis de plataformeo de lo habitual en este tipo de juegos, cosa que a mí me ha gustado mucho, pero lo comento igualmente como dato relevante.
Muy buen videojuego, lo recomiendo.

Esta ha sido mi reseña y al que no le guste que le den. 8/10

review:
A somewhat challenging, somewhat relaxing, mostly feelgood, Metroidvania game with a fun Mexican setting. Colourful and cheerful visuals and music. Awesome humour and lots of pop culture references.

Gameplay-wise it's a pretty basic Metroidvania. During the game the player unlocks extra combo's and special moves. The special moves also unlock new parts of the levels.

Fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198155946727', 'num_games_owned': 304, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1660470340}
review:
I think.... It's Ok?

UPD: After 44 days I can figure out my opinion about the game. It has many abilities, pretty graphics, nice costumes and problems. Guacamelee has poor music, no voices, easy bosses (but stylish). The game tells you what you need to do with help of colored bricks (I think it is not the best practice). The number of abilities is really large so sometimes you should miss press the buttons. Oh, and the game is way too long. I think, one location could be easily cut out.

But, for 2014 it is a nice game. There were no platformer bangers like we have now. It is only the 2nd game from DrinkBox and the 1st in that genre. So, despite all problems, the game is nice, but outdated.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009674175', 'num_games_owned': 632, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1477, 'last_played': 1659449827}
review:
Recomendable no, ¡¡HIPERRECOMENDABLE!! Como cosas positivas a destacar: la ambientación rollo mexicano, su traducción a español (que no sé si es traducción o V. O., pero es MAGNÍFICA), sus miles de referencias a otros juegos como Metroid sobre todo, el modo de animación e ilustración del juego que es espectacular visualmente y los cientos de huevos de pascua y referencias a otros juegos con traducciones literales en español que se pueden ver a lo largo de los mapas del juego.

El único contra que le podría sacar es que no sea más largo el juego y que por desgracia no tiene un «posgame» digno, pero es algo común en los juegos de esta categoría, la batalla contra el jefe final es el desenlace y no hay nada más allá después de ella. Pero está compensado por sus dos finales que aumentan la durabilidad del juego un buen cacho.

Es un 10/10, un juego de los que hace tiempo que no disfrutaba, enganchándome como cuando tenía 12 años.

P.D.: Recomiendo pasar por la Workshop y echar un vistazo a los trajes personalizados, hay uno de Samus Aran que es fabuloso, y también otros tantos de personajes famosos de otros videojuegos que te brindarán una experiencia de juego espectacular.

author: {'steamid': '76561199229887596', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1660389945}
review:
A simple but well-done Metroidvania. With charming graphics and and a nice soundtrack, the Mexican Luchador theme exudes all of it charisma through the screen, short npc text lines and straightforward story. The combat is responsive, fluid and quite entertaining. The combo possibilities are quite varied considering you have only two buttons. The special moves are colorful and remain useful and powerful through the whole game. The enemies variety and mechanics keep you entertained with the combat and challenges all the way through, with that said, this game is on the easier side, very few battles, be it with bosses or regular enemies, will prove much of a challenge to most.

One bad thing this game have is the lack of a sidequest tracker. While said sidequest aren't long or complicated to the point of escaping from your memory, it can get bothersome to remember where you stopped at with certain quests between longer breaks.

All in all, a good game, grab it if you have the spare cash. Plus there is coop up to 4 people. 
7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198106511544', 'num_games_owned': 1624, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 528, 'last_played': 1659808331}
review:
[b]Sights & Sounds[/b]
- It's hard to find a good place to start when every aspect of the presentation is so good
- The style of the both characters and environments is fantastic. I particularly like the villains
- The music is so good. Almost every song is a banger

[b]Story & Vibes[/b]
- The story is your basic "save the princess" archetype, but it's effective here because of all the level design. Going through the diverse towns and environments with NPCs directing you and cheering you on gives you a sense of progression
- With all the humor and bright colors, the game is very inviting. Those aspects make you want to keep playing it, if that makes sense
- The humor deserves special attention. There's some clever writing in here (i.e., Fray Ayayay)
- All of these factors contribute to what feels like a cohesive, well-crafted world to play around in

[b]Playability & Replayability[/b]
- The attention paid to the other aspects of the game should clue you in to how good the gameplay is. It's outstanding
- This is much better on a controller. I found myself naturally fighting with the d-pad and platforming with the analog stick
- The fighting mechanics are quite good. By the time you pick up all the skills and abilities, fighting feels like you're playing Smash Brothers with additional platforming options
- Being a 2D platformer in the Metroid vein, a lot of those skills you pick will also help you solve platforming challenges and reach previously inaccessible areas
- Some of those puzzles are really quite challenging, and fit in well with the excellent level design
- I absolutely want to pick this one back up for a 100% run someday. It's all good enough to reexperience

[b]Overall Impressions & Performance[/b]
- This game is just pure fun. I had such a great time playing it
- Everything ran beautifully and bug-free

[b]Final Verdict[/b]
- [b]10/10[/b]. In the 2D platforming genre (including so-called "metroidvanias"), this stands at the top with games like Super Mario Bros. It's a masterpiece. I'd recommend it without reservation

author: {'steamid': '76561199196315508', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 943, 'last_played': 1659853515}
review:
很不错的类银河恶魔城游戏，在小体量的游戏里面算完成度和趣味性比较高的。（游戏又名论平台跳跃和搓招游戏混搭可以有多好（zhe）玩（mo））

正常通关大致在5-8小时左右，不是很难，但是为了打出真结局（也就是集齐面具碎片）或者全收集可能比较久（并且难度相对于正常的游戏流程来说拔高了很多，建议喜欢挑战自我的去尝试，佛系玩家慎重），不过令人称道的是该游戏的隐藏房都是很明显的地方，不至于找不到/背板，个人觉得最难的是树顶那块，玩的时候心态炸裂，雪山和最终boss倒是半个小时就搞定了，10个金盘那里花点耐心（如果看到这你还没买该游戏，不想打这10个金牌赶快换另外一个版本）。想到了难度可能比这个高一点的跳王游戏下面的评论：这不是骑士救公主的故事，而是骑士配不配得上公主的故事。我是真的看不得bad ending，很多时候都是咬咬牙打过去了。

剧情的话正如上文所说就是个骑士救公主的故事，但是结合了很多墨西哥的当地特色，比如说死者世界等等，而且结合得很完美不生硬。不过说实话我本来英语就不会=好，对话里面还有很多墨西哥的俚语，导致有时候读懂对话需要花一点时间。但是如果你对墨西哥文化感兴趣，这款游戏买就对了！

author: {'steamid': '76561198080756721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1659356729}
review: I would love to talk about the gameplay, level design, enemy design, music, writing, etc. I would love to, but unfortunately the devs for this game decided to make an asinine control scheme and then refuse to let me rebind it. This is more than just petty, stupid, and lazy, it also shows a supreme lack of consideration for accessibility. Yes technically you can remap controls through steam, but that's like serving someone a meal covered in shit and reassuring them that if the shit bothers them, you can use the table cloth to wipe it off. Yes I could, but I could also shove a negative review down the developers throat and remind them that not everyone who plays their game is going to think that dodge belongs on the right stick, you dumb, arrogant fucks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198440874884', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 996, 'last_played': 1658979436}
review:
Hardly a game, but a TORTUE.
First, the protagonist Luchador has a terrible face.
I have to say the game features great Mexican El dia del muerto art, but a good game or a game means more than its artistic characteristics.
I came to give a thumb-down review because the game lost its gaming core, more like a visual fiction cliche.
Maybe the studio staff comes to the living world just to have reunions with sus familias?
That 's it. A terrible game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107064234', 'num_games_owned': 110, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 486, 'last_played': 1658914556}
review:
It's not really a bad game totally. I really liked the setting and the design.

Writing was poor though, I feel like, especially when it came to pacing and the REALLY REALLY REALLY REALLY REALLY REALLY REALLY TERRIBLE HUMOR. gameplay got repetitive really quickly. The combat got so bad that it basically devolved into the game throwing as many enemies as it can on screen at a futile attempt at difficulty.  And, for a relatively short game, it felt like it was too long which is always a bad sign.
