author: {'steamid': '76561199230769083', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 902, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 902, 'last_played': 1658501479}
review:
Потрясающая игра, действительно классная. Сколько же разных идей и механик в неё заложено - хватит на две-три полноценных игры. Всё прохождение постоянно учишься новым приёмам и развиваешься. Бои интересные, соперники разные. По мне, так тот же Hollow Knight скучноват и затянут, а тут - сплошной задор и веселье.  
Проходили вдвоём, в локальном коопе. По факту, не сильно сложно (ИМХО, за это жирный плюс), т.к. один из убитых игроков через некоторое время возрождается, но очень увлекательно. Маст хэв! 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198144958997', 'num_games_owned': 446, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 487, 'last_played': 1659868327}
review:
Давненько я не ощущал челленджа от подобных проектов. Хватило прям с лихвой. Особенно мне понравилось, что в игре все эти супер-удары обязательно использовать не только для того чтобы нанести противникам серьёзный урон, но и чтобы достигать каких-то платформ. Обычно когда тебе, например, необходимо запрыгнуть на верхнюю платформу, то мало сделать один прыжок. Тебе ещё надо выполнить силовой удар вверх, чтобы приподнять своего персонажа ещё немного выше. Обязательное использование такого приёма меня прям изрядно удивило. Особенно когда приходится применять комбо их таких способностей для достижения более дальних платформ. 
А способностей прям дофига. Хоть разработчики и попытались все их грамотно уместить в паре клавиш, сочетая с кнопоками передвижения, но я вплоть до финала никак не мог их машинально выучить, из-за чего часто совершал непреднамеренные смерти. Не знаю какого играется на геймпаде, но лично для меня это первая игра, чей совет по использованию оного я хотел бы выполнить, пусть даже если я практически никогда не держал в руках этот геймпад. 
И всё же в целом управление вполне себе мне подчинялось и не было такого, чтобы мне приходилось воевать чуть ли не с самой игрой. Может разве что мне не нравится что главный герой слишком сильно отталкивается от стены, не позволяя забираться по ней не перепрыгивая на другую, как в Hollow Knight. И речь не то чтобы про это, ведь со временем мы сможем тупо бежать по вертикали. Просто если ты случайно отпрыгнешь от стены над пропастью, то 95% это приведёт к смерти, ведь ты не успеешь ухватиться обратно за неё, ты далеко отпрыгнул. Да и рывок в воздухе по диагонали не шибко спасает положение, чтобы благодаря ему вновь вернуться. В общем меня это довольно сильно напрягало всю игру.
Самой слабой частью игры я посчитаю боссов. На фоне интересных платформенных испытаний и челенджовых схваток с группами противников битвы с боссами никак не ощущаются. В моментах с ними ты просто отдыхаешь, просто потому-что ты не ощущаешь битвы с ними. Вся сложность в них - это следование их патернам, что не так уж и трудно. Более того, на половине выбитого из босса здоровья игра делает чекпоинт, чтобы ты потом не бил его с самого начала, если вдруг ты не успел нанести последний удар до своего проигрыша. Битва с ягуаром мне больше всего понравилась. Он хоть в целом ощущается как усиленный рядовой противник, который может перемещаться между временными промежутками (чему необходимо учитывать чтобы хоть как-то его задеть), да и требует от тебя неплохой реакции, но в ним реально не заскучаешь. Даже финальный босс так хорош только на половину. А остальные ни о чём на фоне внезапных челленджей с группой рядовых противников.

author: {'steamid': '76561198979187773', 'num_games_owned': 114, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 526, 'last_played': 1671745058}
review:
I think guacamelee! STCE is great game even tho it's super old game, but still it hold itself well.
If you are thinking what is the best edition, gold or STCE. it's STCE. I know gold have more achievements but this one is more packed with new boss, enemy and level. yes, i don't have gold but i showed my cousin screenshots of my gmae and he didn't know who are the boss or an enemy so i know what the best. trust me get this it's way better then gold.

as for the game. the game is old and have basic platforming but it use the environment to make a puzzle so it can make unique gameplay making passing a platforming level super fun and feel super smart when passing it.
the story is basic but yet making you have sympathise to the protagonist and understanding he's childhood and the villain isn't just "there" he have back story and not making him evil for nothing.
the art style is amazing making you forget that is a 2014 game.
the combat is good and have good ideas but the some enemies are hard to beat but good thing there are not a lot of them.

guacamelee! is old but good game basic platforming but interesting gameplay and i think if you don't like metroidvania like me. i think you like it as i did.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047594791', 'num_games_owned': 484, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1658303306}
review:
Bei diesem Spiel wünschte ich mir echt ein richtig Bewertungssystem... Meine Güte frustriert dieses Spiel zum Teil enorm! Ab ungefähr 1/2 - 2/3 des Spiels wirst du fast nur noch in Instadeath-Arenen geschmissen die jeden noch so kleinen Fehltritt direkt mit dem Tod bestrafen. Wozu hat man dann überhaupt ein Lebensbalken, wenn jeder Hit quasi dein Tod bedeutet? Entweder, weil du danebengesprungen bist/ geschlagen hast oder weil dich ein Gegner trifft und du deshalb in die Instadeath-Trap fällst. Ich finde die Kämpfe so wie sie sind schon mehr als knackig genug: Ständig zwischen den Ebenen wechseln, den Überblick über die Schilde nicht verlieren und gleichzeitig den Gegnerischen Angriffen ausweichen (teilweise auch 10 oder 12 Stück auf einmal. Aber wie gesagt, das reicht noch nicht, es muss NOCHMAL schwerer werden und mit jeder Arena die du machst denkst du, viel krasser als das wird es kaum werden und du bist getäuscht. Aber anders als bei guten Soulslike Spielen ist finde ich hier der Frustfaktor immens viel höher!
Anyway.. wenn dich das alles oben nicht abgeschreckt hat, dann solltest du das Spiel definitiv spielen, da es abgesehen davon echt ein gutes Spiel mit großartigem Humor ist!

author: {'steamid': '76561198310363049', 'num_games_owned': 653, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 979, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 979, 'last_played': 1658152291}
review:
I'd say I enjoyed this game 70% of the time. What starts off as a fun game though has a few noticeable flaws as the gameplay progresses. Being colourblind of certain defects, it was a tad frustrating to notice the difference between the yellow and green against the backgrounds which can make certain attacks against bosses frustrating. That and if you want the 'good ending' and want all the Chac Mools, the orb in the Sierra is quite possibly one of the hardest things to do and killed my love of the game. You either need to be very good or very lucky to get past one of the screens. That being said I'm 37 with a full time job and can only game when I can so someone younger with faster reflexes and time could probably garner more enjoyment.
It's a well made game but keep these frustrations in mind and maybe pick it up on sale...

author: {'steamid': '76561197970633599', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 825, 'last_played': 1655496956}
review:
Are you're looking for a Metroidvania, but you're tired of aliens, anime, and dark, depressing games that take themselves too seriously? If so, then it's time to play Guacamelee. 

I'd give it a solid B. It's neat that combat abilities also serve as mobility enhancements. So the uppercut is also a super-jump, etc. The world is very colorful and detailed, but probably too slick. I think it would be more charming if it had less polish. There's also WAY too much going on in the background. You can see this in the screenshots. It kind of blurs all the areas together in my memory. 

My biggest complaint is that when you get hit, it takes too long for you to get back up. You have i-frames, but the animation slows everything down and makes the combat feel water-logged.

Overall, a genuinely funny and unique Metroidvania for when you need something different.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111017069', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 903, 'last_played': 1629674647}
review:
Guacamelee is pretty much the perfect game to introduce people to not only the metroidvania genre itself, but just gaming in general. This game overall is fun, simple and not hard, although some sections spike the difficulty like the last rival fight. But besides that, it perfectly mashes the genre with the mexican culture of Lucha Libre in such a way that Mucha Lucha would be damn proud. 

This is the best version to play as it also has Co-Op on top of some little extra things the Original and Gold don't have. If you have your doubts, buy it on sale. It won't disappoint.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002067150', 'num_games_owned': 379, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1656531779}
review:
This is a best-case scenario for indie Metroidvanias.  Great art design and aesthetic, fun characters, and most importantly a solid core gameplay loop.  Every new upgrade flows together perfectly both in combat and in exploration, until by the end you're fighting and traversing by chaining multiple moves together in a way that feels extremely satisfying and rewarding.

Overall just a fantastic game, no qualms about recommending this one. <3

review: Despite the obnoxiously long name, this is a short and very fun action-packed metroidvania. The combat feels like a beat em up, the soundtrack/visuals are vibrant, there are some pretty funny jokes/references to other metroidvania games, and the platforming is fun/challenging.

author: {'steamid': '76561198342024745', 'num_games_owned': 466, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1654308683}
review: This is a really fun metroidvania with a lot of charm. The visuals and audio are incredible, but the real star here is the gameplay. There is plenty to do, and it is very well paced so you wont get bored. Most metroidvanias I have played dont have great combat, but here it feels very fluid, and many of the combat abilities can also be used for movement, leading to a very cohesive experience. 10/10 fantastic game

author: {'steamid': '76561199033894989', 'num_games_owned': 61, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1743, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1743, 'last_played': 1653867036}
review:
Un juego entretenido, con buenas mecánicas y un buen desarrollo de habilidades. Sin embargo, se queda en ello, un plataformero exigente que te pone a prueba, pero que no quedará grabado en tu memoria como un juego memorable y digno por conseguir. ¿Quieres un reto y pasarlo bien mientras juegas? Cómpralo sin duda. ¿Quieres un juego que trascienda y rompa los esquemas de los plataformeros? Quizá hay mejores opciones en el mercado. 

_____________________________________________________________________________________

A pesar del trabajo que conllevó la construcción del juego y los diferentes escenarios, en ocasiones esta misma construcción hace que no se sienta inmersivo. Es decir, las misiones y mecánicas dan una sensación de “‘ve al punto A’, ‘oh, ya fuiste y aprendiste una nueva técnica, es momento de que vayas al punto B’”, y así sucesivamente durante gran parte de la trama del juego (por no decir toda, ya que para el 100% sí hace necesaria la exploración autónoma). Esto le quita atractivo, ya que, por sus dinámicas, y hasta cierto punto su dificultad, tenía todo por delante para convertirse en un juego que te llama, engancha y te exige jugarlo. 

Personalmente siento que esto es producto de una historia más bien floja, utilizando el típico recurso de la damisela en peligro y el pobre enamorado que debe convertirse en alguien lo suficientemente fuerte como para afrontar el peligro y rescatar a la doncella de las garras del mal. Esto conlleva a que el juego pase sin pena ni gloria en cuanto a trama se refiere. Un ejemplo de este apartado podría ser el personaje femenino, al que uno accede por medio de la máscara. A pesar de que uno la utilice en todo momento, y juegue con el ‘personaje femenino’ (que lo único que varía es la skin, más no la jugabilidad, ya que es idéntica) durante el desarrollo de la historia se hace evidente que uno continúa jugando con Juan, nuestro héroe primario. Esto le quita seriedad y razón de ser a las skins entre masculino y femenino, ya que siempre el protagonista es el masculino. Si quisieron implementar el personaje femenino debieron darle el protagonismo que merecía, de resto me parece simplemente una pérdida de esfuerzo por parte de los creadores del juego. 

Quizá una respuesta a este fallo en la trama podría atribuírsele a que es un juego independiente, y que por tanto no posee los mismos recursos que un triple A del cual se espera que sea lo mejor y lo más esperado. Si bien esta podría ser una razón, siento que sería brindar excusas a esta falencia que posee. El hecho de que sea independiente no implica que tenga que ser lo mínimo. Al contrario, como la creación del juego requiere de un esfuerzo gigantesco para poderlo publicar y comercializar, se hace necesario que se pula hasta los mínimos detalles con el fin poder continuar con secuelas. Aunque, puesto que existe Guacamelee 2, parece que sí cumplieron los mínimos y eso representó esos frutos. Espero puedan continuar mejorando. 

Un aspecto en el que sí resalta y que lo hace un juego llamativo e interesante es la dificultad. El juego es accesible para cualquier persona acostumbrada a jugar juegos de plataforma (tipo Super Mario Bros), y gradualmente comienza a hacerse exigente en algunos apartados. Ahora, si eres una persona completista, que busca encontrar cada opción que te permite el juego, buscar todos los secretos y llegar a cada lugar disponible, en otras palabras, completar los logros y llegar al tan anhelado 100%, tienes un excelente desafío por delante. Los apartados de los retos del Infierno ponen a prueba de ensayo y error, concentración y precisión a cualquiera que lo intente. Fenomenal, excelente punto para el juego.

Los enemigos son variaciones de uno mismo: los esqueletos. Estos son los que conforman el ejército de Calaca (enemigo a derrotar). Una idea base y acorde con la trama del juego son los esqueletos, los cuales se relacionan fácilmente con la muerte. Además, las diferentes formas en que se presentan, así como la manera en que hay que derrotarlos, hacen que sea una idea sencilla pero bien desarrollada. Así es como debe ser. Quizá uno esperaría gran variación de enemigos, pero la forma en que presentan a los diferentes esqueletos responde a lo que uno demanda en cuestión de adversarios. Este aspecto de los enemigos, también se relaciona con la mecánica del cambio de las dimensiones, la cual se utiliza en su justa medida, incrementando la dificultad y forzando la práctica con el fin de pulir y ser preciso a ala hora de utilizar alguna habilidad y/o golpe. Excelente. 

En lo personal el mejor plataformero que he probado es Hollow Knigth. Pero siento que este último no hubiese sido posible sin la existencia de Guacamelee. Los de Hollow identificaron, explotaron y desarrollaron ese talón de Aquiles que tuvo Gucamalee y crearon uno de los mejores juegos que he podido conocer.  

Pdta: Reseña realizada después de jugar un total de 29 horas según Steam, y luego de haber completado la totalidad de los logros. Que buen desafío.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139480922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 192, 'playtime_forever': 404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 404, 'last_played': 1654080264}
review:
[h1]My Thoughts[/h1]
One day I opened up Steam and I saw a new game that I hadn't bought. That game was Guacamelee. I was kinda surprised and saw that others also got it for free. Now I didn't have any interest in this type of game so I didn't play it for years. But now I have finally come around to it.

Overall the game isn't half bad but not great either. It doesn't have that many outright flaws, it's just that it doesn't do anything special to make it stick out from other Metroidvania's.

[h2]Story[/h2]
Story-wise the game isn't good at all, it rushes the player towards a plot point. None of the characters are interesting.

[h2]Gameplay[/h2]
The combat quickly wears off its charm, for me at least, it's a bit too simple and easy, there's no real challenge in combat arenas until they start throwing some instadeath mechanics in the mix, which are more frustrating than anything else. Also, the combos, there's pretty much one combo, there's going to be a new ability here and there but not change much in terms of combos. 

Boss fights are pretty good, I loved the one against 'The Terrible Trio', it felt very unique and fun to play. It's just there are barely any of them here, there are 5 in total and 2 of those are so bland and forgettable.

The controls are kinda clunky. Especially the later areas are sort of frustrating because of this, all the special moves are bound to 1 button, the only difference is the input of the analog stick. Now, this is way too easy to miss input since a thumbstick isn't the most accurate thing there is. Platforming suffers heavily under this, again at least for me. In the later areas, you have to quickly switch between worlds, use specials, et cetera. So this was rather frustrating than rewarding.

[h2]Sound[/h2]
The audio is decent, hits feel rewarding, and so on. The music is alright, it repeats the same handful of tracks over and over which eventually gets tiring, but at the start, it's quite charming, except for one track that sounds like it's made by some mentally defective child.

[h2]Visuals[/h2]
Visually the game looks good, as you can see by the screenshots. It has its charm but, again, it wears off after a while. Enemies do look unique throughout the game.

There's one major complaint I have with the visuals and that is the top bar. When playing solo there's no reason to constantly see "Press > to join" times 3. It just looks ugly and obnoxious.

[h2]Conclusion[/h2]
All in all, it isn't a bad game, not even close. But the thing that stops me from recommending it is that it's very bland and quickly wears off the charm it has going for it. Combat gets stale fast, the story isn't interesting in the least, and the soundtrack or visuals aren't strong enough to carry it. 
I don't want to say you can't enjoy this game, it's just that I didn't enjoy it enough to give it a recommendation.
[h3]Rating[/h3]
4,5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198821040159', 'num_games_owned': 185, 'num_reviews': 305, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1654009222}

author: {'steamid': '76561198021868179', 'num_games_owned': 1721, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 518, 'last_played': 1653859929}
review:
Kurzweiliges Metroidvania!

Contra:
- Komplizierte Kombos. In einer Quest lernt man coole Kombos, mit denen man seine Angriffsfähigkeiten toll kombinieren kann, aber die bestehen aus so vielen verschiedenen Moves, dass ich im echten Kampf immer nur komplett einfache Dinge verwendet habe, weil ich mir die langen Abfolgen niemals merken könnte.


Pro:
- Ulkiges Setting
- Fairer Schwierigkeitsgrad
- Amüsante Nebenquests
- Fortschritt gut dosiert. Der Abstand von einer Fähigkeit zur nächsten fühlte sich gut an.
- Gute Steuerung mit Xbox One Controller
- Viele Upgrades, die auch wirklich nützlich sind. Fand es sehr motivierend die Kisten in den Levels zu suchen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100211395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1653708270}
review: I don't know if I and so many others had lower standards when Guacamelee originally launched or something changed in some updates, but I have never been more frustrated with the controls and overall design in a game in my life. A lot of the "skill" involved in this game involves platform puzzles that requires split second switching between dodging, double jumping and special moves. the problem is that all the specials are assigned to one button and a directional which is way too easy to  mis-input, their not quite responsive enough, and to top it all off I can't even remap the controls. So what happens is that you end up doing the same room for hours (or at times feels like it) knowing full well what needs to be done but not being able to because you're wrestling with the controls. That's just bad design.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018417063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1654638809}
review:
It's a game i wanted to like but it has too many issues that end up pilling on top of each other ultimately making the game a slog to play.

It's supposed to be a "metroidvania" style game but its overall designed in a way much more akin to a linear action game. Which is frustrating for me, someone who doesn't like metroidvanias, because i would much prefer that the developers made a linear action game instead. I ended up just rushing to the end without doing any optional content or side quests. It took me about 4 hours to finish the game.

There are too many platforming elements. They are tedious and it gets bogged down with gimmick after gimmick. The combat is more enjoyable and it would've been preferable if that was the focus of the game.

The combat starts out OK, but it also gets bogged down with gimmicks very quickly. By the end of the game, the player is forced to use about half a dozen different skills and abilities to even damage enemies. It doesn't make the combat challenging or varied, it just turns the whole thing into an unfun, overly complicated slog.

There's little story in the game and infrequent cutscenes (unskippable). However, the small amount of story and cutscenes that are in the game are quite terrible. Would've preferred that there was zero dialogue and the story was told through animations. The developers, in particular, have a terrible sense of humor.

The difficulty is all over the place. The game for the most part is quite easy, but every once in a while the player comes across certain rooms of platforming or combat that are just backbreaking hard.

The final boss is awful. Impressively terrible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087725353', 'num_games_owned': 1031, 'num_reviews': 332, 'playtime_forever': 567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 567, 'last_played': 1653085748}
review:
В начале игры нас убивают и крадут нашу женщину . Потом мы в загробной мире находим маску Вана Даркхолма и становимся бойцом гачи либре и отправляемся мстить! Мацаемся со страстными мексиканскими мужиками и как только догоняем злодея, он превращает нас в петуха. Потом волей случая наш петух находит другого петуха и это оказывается дьявол, которого главный злодей также превратил в петуха, так как дьявол не дал ему получить главный приз за игру на гитаре...
10 петухов из 10
10 объятий с мужиками из 10
Финальная оценка 8/10, так как нефиг хард сложность прятать за первым прохождением и отбирать у такого профессионала как я возможность бороться с мужиками более напряженно и страстно.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090633251', 'num_games_owned': 137, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2225, 'last_played': 1652621519}
review:
光看畫風害他在我的收藏庫躺了好久，但玩了發現相當好玩。

2D橫版類銀河戰士惡魔城，隨著劇情的推進將學會數種招式技巧，組合起來打小兵或頭目都有一定的爽度。遊戲中還有收集要素，隨著招式技巧的解鎖，許多本來無法打破的障礙或過不去的地方將可以過去。不過有些地方難度不小，需要練習很多次才能解鎖

收集的碎片有四種，血格碎片、能量格碎片、怒氣格碎片、面具碎片。最後一種是跟完美結局有關，收集五片能解鎖最後一項技能小雞飛。第六片打倒最終BOSS得到，收集6片觸發完美結局。沒想到破完普通難度跟困難難度，達到100%全收集，這樣也花了37小時。還滿推薦玩的

author: {'steamid': '76561198148681294', 'num_games_owned': 392, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 503, 'last_played': 1651769839}
review:
[h1] 麻雀虽小五脏俱全 [/h1]

作为一款银河城，Guacamelee!在满足一切银河城要素的同时又足够够精致、足够特别。游戏的完成度和各方面素质都极高，虽然体量不大（不到7h真结局），但整个流程足够顺畅且舒适，几乎没有尿点和粪点，这是近年的银河城都很难以做到的。下面进行逐条猛夸：

+ 美术和音乐完全围绕墨摔打造，在同类游戏中几乎没有相似的美术风格。虽然故事是经典老套的英雄救美，但是和主题的糅合相当合适。经典的墨西哥亡灵节元素也和游戏机制搭配到位，后期音乐也借此进行了发挥，整个游戏的包装让人感觉从头到脚一以贯之，十分协调。
+ 人物的台词、游戏内置的彩蛋，足够幽默，是会令人会心一笑的程度。
+ 作为银河城最核心的游戏性，游戏围绕的主要是两点：一是主角作为墨摔英雄的摔跤技能的获取，二是[spoiler]后期亡灵世界的切换[/spoiler]。二者都足够特别，且上手容易，操作上限也高。普通结局的通关仅需掌握这些机制，但真结局与后续地狱内的金牌挑战则需要不断磨练机制键的搭配，这些学习过程被安排在小体量游戏的有限时间中压缩得相当合适。（以及很难说暗影火炬城的连招系统没有受本作的启发）
+ 游戏内各种细节抠得相当的到位，最喜欢通关完两个结局一一对应的ppt播片环节，看得出制作组的用心。

谁说银河城一定要做到10+、20+甚至40+h的游戏流程呢？只要足够完整、足够精致，好作品能花十个小时以内的时间把故事说得足够精彩。如果硬要说这作有什么不足就是游戏地图在精巧程度上有待提高，部分特效比较塑料；但总而言之，玩了近年各种粪作银河城，再品这种经典老作，属实是涤十年尘土肠胃。建议大家都来品尝。

[h1]BBBB的Metroidvania评分表[/h1]

│地图系统▪▪▪▪│ ★★★☆☆│

author: {'steamid': '76561197996645789', 'num_games_owned': 378, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1650521929}
review:
It's....okay. I think this game is like, the perfect candidate for a "Maybe" recommendation tag on Steam. I've bought both this and the older Gold Edition and probably have 20 hours as a whole across them both and I've bounced off them each time. 

The core gameplay is fun: grappling and throwing enemies around, including into other enemies is a neat twist on the usual combat for these kinds of games. The graphics are colorful and vibrant. The music is catchy. It's not terribly long or the sort of game that pads out its runtime. Some of the dialogue can be funny. 

It's also the sort of game that trades story for gaming references and jokes that are kind of run into the ground like an episode of Family Guy. I would've appreciated a little more story or worldbuilding for as colorful as the world is, it's mostly a vehicle to give "hey I recognize that thing"-style references to other video games. This doesn't always have to be a dealbreaker, but in a Metroidvania you should want to explore the world because that's a big part of the genre's concept and Guacamelee's world isn't...interesting enough on its own to want to explore. 

It's also kind of exhausting to play: by the end, the final dungeon, once all the mechanics are unlocked, enemies have a laundry list of things you have to do to be able to kill them (gotta be in the right dimension, gotta attack them with the right color attack, gotta dodge X and Y attack, but you can't dodge Z, etc) and the fights themselves turn into chaotic clusterfucks once 3+ enemies are on the screen where the action can be difficulty to follow and I just wasn't having much fun with the core combat anymore. The mechanics seem to build on in a way that's there to make it harder to kill enemies rather than to create any kind of fun variations on the core combat loop, such as giving them the ability to teleport away from you mid-combo to break up your all-important combo stack or the ability to be immune to all damage except certain attacks. 

And then little problems like some really questionable hit detection or a boss bugging out and changing attacks mid-animation, etc.

It's also a really platforming-heavy game with some puzzles that require precise timing and a section midway through the game (the volcano) where they throw in a lot of instant-death mechanics that just...grate.

So...it's a "maybe" game. Maybe it can be a game you really dig, if the above doesn't really bother you. I'd wait for it to go on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134208288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2026, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2026, 'last_played': 1650080851}
review:
[h1]¡Ay, güey! Que buen juego [/h1]

Metroidvania Clasico, que no es innovador pero que cumple con todo lo que un metroidvania debe hacer.
En resumen simple y satisfactorio, . 
en oferta esta a menos de 2 dolares y vale totalmente la pena.

como puntos a destacar:

[h1] Curva de Dificuldad:   8/10[/h1] El juego es bastante facil lo suficiente como para iniciar una partida en dificil desde la primer Run, tiene sus picos de dificultad en el ultimo tramo del juego y en los desafios que son opcionales.

[h1] Rejugabilidad : SI [/h1] para sacar el 100% me tomo 2 partidas y menos de 25 hrs .[spoiler] lo cual pudo ser reducido si hubiera sabido que usando el codigo konami puedes iniciar desde el inicio en dificil sin tener que pasar el juego 1 vez  [/spoiler]

[h1]Ambientacion: SI  [/h1] El juego es simpatico y agradable a la vista, si bien no sale de los tipicos cliche de la cultura mexicana sigue añadiendo algunas cositas que te hacen ver que almenos hicieron su tarea investigando para dar un contexto a todo el juego

[h1] Historia: Clasica [/h1] Si bien no innova en su historia sigue estando dentro del estandar de un videojuego por lo que  es buena.

[h1] Banda Sonora 10/10 [/h1] creo que cumple su funcion es pegadiza y facilmente reconocible le da una identidad al juego, combinado con su ambientacion es un 10/10

[h1] Jugabilidad 8/10[/h1] No considero que tenga una mala jugabilidad pero hablamos de un juego con unos cuantos años encima y aveces se le nota un poco que el movimiento es un tanto torpe ,pero nada grave

[spoiler]Pd: Pinche desarrollador que se le ocurrio hacer que debamos transportar un pollo a lo largo de un nivel con pinchos y con limite de tiempo, ojala que le vallas a poner limon a tus tacos y este seco. [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561199013085125', 'num_games_owned': 582, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1650070759}
review:
Le jeu est vraiment fun dans l'ensemble,

J'ai eu l'occasion d'y jouer une première fois à la sortie sur Wii U et de le finir à nouveau aujourd'hui en coop ! Et force est de constater que c'était aussi plaisant qu'à l'époque, ce jeu a quelque chose d'intemporel qui en fait un classique de l'indé à mon humble avis. 

Les contrôles sont nerveux, les phases de plateformes ne se répètent jamais et savent poser de la difficulté quand c'est nécessaire, le panel d'ennemis est cool et permet de faire des compos qui forcent à "réfléchir" pendant les combats, les animations sont franchement propres également !

Sans parler des graphismes qui pour moi donnent vraiment un sacré charme au jeu. Je suis également assez fan des charadesigns ! Mais également l'ambiance sonore et les ost qui sont très bonnes, bref, y'a beaucoup à dire.

L'histoire est clairement en fond, mais sa simplicité fait qu'on est totalement plongé dans tout ce qu'elle enrobe: humour et folklore parsèment la narration et c'est une très bonne découverte pour moi. Que ce soit les dialogues, les techniques, certaines quêtes secondaires.. Je n'ai jamais trouvé qu'un élément était en "trop". 

En bref, c'est un excellent métroidvania, la seule critique que je pourrais faire c'est que le mode coop est en "local", ce qui ne permet pas au joueur 2 de bénéficier de sa propre caméra. Elle est toujours centrée sur le joueur 1 tout en essayant de "garder" tout le monde dans l'écran, ce qui rend certaines phases de plateforme laborieuses. 
Mais encore une fois cette difficulté ne survient qu'en coop.

Le jeu vaut totalement le détour !

author: {'steamid': '76561198346433358', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1650750351}
review: I usually wait longer before I write my reviews for games on Steam, but I guess this time is different. I opened the game for the first time and played for 1.5 hours straight and now I'm writing this review. The game is SUPER fun. The fighting mechanics are surprisingly smooth and enjoyable, especially the multitude of combos that you can perform. I also like the visual style and the soundtrack a lot. Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561197968325520', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 644, 'last_played': 1650057795}
review:
A love letter to Metroid/Castlevania and 2D platformers of the past while being incredibly unique at the same time. Rather than shooting or whipping, Guacamelee feels like a beat 'em in a Metroidvania world. The attacks and combos feel incredibly natural and intuitive and when thing get chaotic, it's great fun suplexing and piledriving enemies into each other.

In addition to the combat, there is some challenging platforming but I never thought it was unfair. The controls are tight, response and if you made a mistake, it's your fault.

I absolutely love the story and the humor of the game. While other games like this feel a little forced in humor, and dialogue, you'll find yourself chuckling to the smallest things and the entire thing just feels so charming.

I can't recommend the game enough if you into Metroidvania games and want something a little different from the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198834525928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1650566066}
review:
Ótimo jogo, muito divertido. Farei algumas ponderações. 

PROS:
1. DIVERTIDO.
2. Satisfatório, é um daqueles jogos que você vai ficar satisfeito ao realizar os combos. 
3. Personagens carismáticos. 
4. Você pode customizar seu personagem.
5. Exploração recompensadora. 
6. Graficamente falando, o jogo é muito bem feito.
7. Puzzles inteligentes e bem colocados. 
8. Fazia tempo que não me divertia tanto em um jogo de plataforma. 
9. Sistema de movimentação excepcional. 
10. Pós game formoso. 
11. O sistema de troca de dimensões é MUITO bem feito. Adiciona um charme ao jogo. 
12. Excelente trilha sonora.
13. Mapas diferentes um dos outros com excelentes detalhes no fundo. 

CONTRAS
1. Excessivamente fácil. Os únicos desafios que senti foi nas plataformas ou puzzles. 
2. Combate repetitivo.
3. Inimigos repetitivos.
4. Boss fights muitooooo fáceis, tirando o Calaca que é o final boss, não senti desafio. 
5. Senti falta de mais habilidades. 
6. A exploração podia conter mais mistérios. 
7. Esperava mais bosses ou pelo menos mini bosses. 

Resumo:
A história é simples, porém bem feita. Um dos maiores acertos do jogo é a questão do mundo dos vivos e dos mortos. Você está em um mapa, e ao trocar para dimensão dos mortos, você descobre segredos entre as falas e as missões segundárias dos personagens. Isso é algo muito bacana, da vontade de platinar o jogo. 

Se recomendo? Com certeza. Ainda mais com as promos frequentes que tem. É um excelente metroivania focado na plataforma. Você vai se divertir muito.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198191911057', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1650000961}
review:
Love the aesthetic, love the music, it runs well on a potato. The characters are colorful, and the look of the game screams fun.

But It was way more platforming that I expected or wanted. Did not like the combat having to switch into different dimensions to fight. The upgrades were meh, the power ups weren't anything special, and the combat was fine. I just did not like finishing a platforming section, only to reach the next screen which is also a platforming section. Felt like it was a platformer more than a lucha metroidvania. 

I wanted to like it, but its just not my jam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001293536', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 822, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 798, 'last_played': 1649953278}
review: This game is bullshit I am on the path to the great temple where I must kill kamikaze enemies that bull up and will knock you back even if you are far away from them. You can't touch the floor since it's instant kill and you run out of the up attack and side attack and only 9 second to kill the kamikazes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041899839', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1649873102}
review: Game looks and runs great, and this newer version has some welcome additions, but there's not nearly enough new unlocks and upgrades to level out your character to address some of the harder challenges. The big detractor from my endorsement though? The mechanics for some of the platform based challenge are borderline awful, and their increasing frequency near the final portion of the game, made this game insanely frustrating. The kind with one-hit kill traps, annoying enemies with unblockable attacks and unfun mechanics tossed in for no apparent choice other than making the challenge just straight up hard. I think this is the main problem with a lot of metroidvania style games in this vein, but the unique issue with Guacamelee is that all of the abilities require precise input. If you've ever played a fighting game for the 5th or 10th time and you're trying to nail the exact input to get a special move done, you know the pain, but the makers instead went, man what if it was that fight, plus we add a bunch of exploding guys on a countdown over a pit of instant death?

author: {'steamid': '76561198096969070', 'num_games_owned': 1331, 'num_reviews': 282, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1649763581}
review:
玩了3个小时，很好玩的类恶魔城。
特色是墨西哥风格，音乐色彩都挺喜欢的，我想大多数人最开始知道墨西哥摔跤，应该来自于...牛战士！
没有魔法，没有射击，没有特色道具，完全是格斗连击，爆气、浮空，按的非常累啊！
再加上人和鸡2个形态，某些地方就得开鸡形态，同时还有暗影时空的设定，导致收集全成就会很麻烦，感觉这些并不会给游戏带来什么乐趣，只是繁琐，强行拖时长。所以收起来啦。

author: {'steamid': '76561198059955896', 'num_games_owned': 1223, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1649591574}
review:
This game gets too much praise. Although it's not a straight up bad game, it's not as good as people try to tell you. It gets very repetitive really fast and the game elements are not that much fun to hold your attention 'til the end of the game. The fact that the game isn't very long but still too long to be fun for it's whole playtime was very exhausting for me. From the half point on i hadn't much fun with the game and was already anticipating the end so that i can be done with it. Combat is really simple but get's only more annoying. Especially in the later areas, where you're thrown with encounter after encounter, consisting of enemies which are mostly the same but in greater numbers. Don't get me started with enemies which instant kill you if you don't kill them fast enough. Endgame enemies have the mechanic to randomly teleport away, which kinda breaks the flow of combat and doesn't do anything except wasting your time & combo.
Also there are some irritating checkpoints where you have to go through another area again just to reach the point where you died, which just wastes your time. This is in particular annoying in areas where you die instantly from environmental hazards. The game doesn't do very interesting stuff with it's metroidvania elements, you just get additional attacks for color code blocks which are destroyed by those attacks - apart from wallrun or the goat fly near the end of the game there isn't anything shaking up the gameplay, and backtracking for items which are not very rewarding isn't much fun either, also because the world isn't that interesting. There is a Teleport system, although the spots are often not in smart areas which led to me not using it for the most part.

All in all i can't say that this should at all be a metroidvania, and those element feel rather forced. Could be replaced with doors & keys, this game does nothing interesting with the formula - especially as the world doesn't change as you progress the games.
If you're looking for a metroidvania, play sth else. Because most games use the metroidvania elements in a better way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198810794524', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 620, 'last_played': 1647015560}
review:
Jogo divertido, cheio de humor mas também com as suas falhas. A sua jogabilidade é bastante satisfatória variando consoante os poderes ganhos e iremos descobrir bastantes segredos dependendo das estátuas descobertas, muito fluído e com variados combos. Os efeitos sonoros estão espectaculares e a sua banda sonora melhor ainda. A história é muito simples mas os desenvolvedores deixaram claro que não precisam de mais para fazer um jogo super divertido. Graficamente está perfeito tendo em conta a origem da história e estilo.
Acho um metroidvania obrigatório para quem gosta do estilo e não se irão arrepender de jogar esta obra única.
Para mim um sólido 8/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098165081', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 617, 'last_played': 1646940227}
review:
[h1] Meh. [/h1]
Pude pasarme el Guacamelee. Lo conozco desde que salió allá a principios de la década pasada.
La curva de dificultad empieza siendo MUY plana. Muy sencillo 3/4 del juego y al último se pone complicado. No me gusto que los 3 últimos jefes estén muy pegados.
El combate es divertido, pero muy imprecisos los controles. No se por qué recomiendan controles (mandos) modernos si el input no es analógico. Los saltos y los dash son muy contra-intuitivos y cuestan acostumbrase.
Me gusta el detalle (que es común en los metroidvanias, todo hay que decir)de que es muy rejugable y que tiene desafíos extra por si querés platinarte el juego.
Decididamente, quiero jugar Guacamelee 2 y ver si han mejorado estos defectos pequeños que acá menciono.
La ambientación de la saga me encanta y aunque no salga del modelo Speedy Gonzales que tienen los yankees sobres los mexicanos, me gusta.

author: {'steamid': '76561198867334014', 'num_games_owned': 247, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1518, 'last_played': 1663398074}

author: {'steamid': '76561198294246733', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 1628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1628, 'last_played': 1622024177}
review:
É um belo jogo, seu estilo de Gráfico e design é muito único, a Gameplay é fluida e bem Viva, a Historia por mais Simples que seja ainda se mistura com o estilo Próprio do game, sendo uma experiência bem Diferente, quando fui re-jogar no Hard... pqp jkjkjk, pensa num game que so quer te ferrar, fora os tiltes, platinei e foi muito Divertido.

...Tem um Mod que faz o Personagem virar o Ratinho...O RATINHO CARA.
- ★ Azure ★

author: {'steamid': '76561198872243516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 1381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1340, 'last_played': 1647146458}
review: Guacamele ! Super Turbo Championship Edition est un jeu hybride conbat / Metroidvania basé sur la culture mexicaine, avec un accent particulier sur le combat basé sur les combos, l'approche intelligente et la plate-forme. L'histoire tourne autour d'un fermier nommé Juan, qui est tué par le principal antagoniste alors qu'il tentait de sauver son ami, pour revenir en possession du pouvoir d'un masque magique, ce qui le transforme en un puissant Luchador déterminé à frapper, suplexer et bodyslammer son chemin vers la victoire.

author: {'steamid': '76561199200642397', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1166, 'last_played': 1646586272}
review:
Non mi ritengo un esperto ma voglio spendere qualche parola su questo gioco.

In Guacamelee vestiremo i panni del coraggioso Juan, un luchador intento a fermare il perfido Calaca e la sua armata di scheletri così da salvare la ragazza di cui è da sempre innamorato e impedire la fine del mondo per mano di quest'ultimo. 
Il gioco è un classico metroidvania con delle buone fasi di platform, che vi faranno mollare qualche parola poco consona, ma che regaleranno grandi soddisfazioni una volta superate. Quindi si avanzerà attraverso delle aree interconnesse tra di loro, piene di segreti da trovare, perciò occhi aperti.
Durante il gioco avremo a che fare con nemici via via più ostici, tra il mondo dei vivi e dei morti attraverso il cui si svolgerà la nostra avventura, ma grazie al sistema di combattimento, semplice ma efficace, riusciremo a superare qualsiasi difficoltà. Forse avrei gradito un pelo di profondità in più nelle combo e nel potenziamento del nostro protagonista, con qualche costume in più magari o con potenziamenti più consistenti, ma resta ugualmente molto divertente e appagante nella sua semplicità, soprattutto nelle schermate piene zeppe di nemici da sbaragliare. Interessanti le boss fight, senza infamia e senza lode.
Veramente interessante è la colonna sonora "messicanegiante" molto in tema, che varierà anche con il passaggio tra il mondo dei vivi e dei morti.
Infine mi sento di consigliare questo gioco agli appassionati del genere perché riuscirà a tenervi impegnati per diverse ore, soprattutto se volete completarlo al 100% anche se dovete prepararvi a imprecare un pò ma assolutamente nulla di proibitivo.

review: After all the FPS games I've been playing lately, it was nice to play something new for a change.  I finally got around to playing this game, and it was fun for sure.  I would give it probably a 6.5/10 though just because doing the same 3-hit combo got kind of annoying.  Would've loved to see your combo increase at least.  Also, while the platforming was fun and challenging (even the tough parts) I just really REALLY hated the damn exploding enemies.  Those were the worst parts of the game.  That aside, this game was decent.  I wouldn't play through it again though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030332092', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1521, 'last_played': 1646339716}
review:
Easy to pass, hard to complete. 100% completion is pain in the ass, but once u get it u will feel satisfaction. Doing very long one-shot combos totally rewards the pain of mastering game mechanics.
[b]Never played platform game with better movement and fighting mechanics.[/b]
Humour of the game and alternative ending is cherry on the top. Unfortunately hard mode is not so tough. Give it a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198282148408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 726, 'last_played': 1647696550}
review:
ATTENZIONE!
OGNI OPINIONE ESPRESSA E' DEL TUTTO PERSONALE!

I metroidvania: uno dei miei generi preferiti.
Adoro lo stile ed il design di questo genere e ogni volta rimango incantato: dal bellissimo castello di Symphony of the Night, al regno distrutto di Hollow Knight fino a quel capolavoro biblico di Blasphemous, uno dei miei giochi preferiti in assoluto, già consigliato qui su Steam.
E poi arriva lui Guacamelee! Arriva come un fulmine a ciel sereno e mai mi sarei aspettato di trovarmi di fronte ad un gioco così dannatamente splendido.

Il gioco gira attorno Juan Aguacate, un umile raccoglitore di agave in un piccolo villaggio in messico, innamorato della sua amica di infanzia Lupita (figlia di El presidente).
Un giorno il villaggio viene attaccato da Carlos Calaca uno stregone scheletro che uccide Juan e rapisce la donzella.
Arrivato nel mondo dei morti, Juan, fa la conoscenza di una luchadora, tale Tostada, che gli dona una maschera misteriosa trasformandolo in un fortissimo Luchador, facendolo tornare in vita.
La storia quindi segue le gesta di Juan nel tentativo di salvare la sua amata dalle grinfie di Calaca e salvare il mondo (sia dei morti che dei vivi) dal suo dominio.
La trama, seppur semplice, è caratterizzata da personaggi simpaticissimi e interessanti e perciò funziona alla grande, In più e strapiena di eventi divertenti e surreali che la rendono sempre godibile e mai noiosa. 
Ho apprezzato molto la trama di Guacamelee che, ribadisco, seppur con la sua semplicità riesce comunque ad interessare dall'inizio alla fine.

Come detto in precedenza, Guacamelee è un metroidvania, quindi vi saranno tutte le caratteristiche del genere: una mappa che si sblocca pian piano esplorandola e potenziamenti che permetteranno di andare avanti nella storia. 
Ma ciò che ho apprezzato ancor di più è la componente picchiaduro: non avremo armi o cose simili, ma solo ed esclusivamente i nostri pugni e varie mosse che potremmo imparare nel corso del gioco, che ci danno la possibilità di effettuare combo devastanti, specie nelle parti più avanzate di gioco. In più saranno presenti tante missioni secondarie da poter completare e tanti segreti disseminati per il mondo.
Guacamelee è divertentissimo, sia per gli eventi della trama, che per il gameplay in se. La durata è perfetta circa una decina d'ore di esuberanza e mazzate a destra e manca.

Non c'è tantissimo da dire, solo elogi: il mondo creato è davvero ipnotico e l'alternanza tra mondo dei vivi e dei morti è esaltante, con alcune scelte di design veramente ottime basate appunto su questa caratteristica.
Le musiche sono fantastiche, specie se si adora lo stile messicano.

Lati negativi? Non ne ho idea, sul serio. E' un gioco straordinario, sotto tutti i punti di vista.
Non so effettivamente cosa non vada in questo gioco: l'unico consiglio che posso darvi è di giocarlo, apprezzarlo e divertirvi. Lo trovate ovunque, al prezzo di neanche due caffè e la rigiocabilità è altissima.
PRENDETELO SUBITO.

PRO:
- Trama divertente e interessante
- Gameplay divertente e mai noioso
- Ambientazione e musiche messicane straordinarie
- Esuberante, simpaticissimo e longevo il giusto

CONTRO:
- finisce
- se non vi piacciono i metroidvania questo non vi farà cambiare idea

Voto: 9

review: Uma fantasiosa forma de reafirmar que a única coisa tão inevitável quanto a vida é a morte, que uma segunda chance... poucas pessoas têm e que o êxito não está apenas no resultado, mas em todo o percurso.

author: {'steamid': '76561198972527457', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2317, 'last_played': 1683947353}
review: Se tu é fã do gênero de metroidvania, provavelmente vai amar guacamelee. o jogo não é impossível, mas também não é fácil, tendo vários lugares os quais demorei para passar. A historia não é complexa e enigmática, é algo simples mas divertido igual. As musicas são maravilhosas (estou ouvindo enquanto escrevo isso). Em resumo, guacamelee é um ótimo jogo para quem gosta de metroidvania, divertido e desafiador de maneira equilibrada.

author: {'steamid': '76561198329283597', 'num_games_owned': 1400, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 1120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1118, 'last_played': 1702608083}
review:
Не супер глубокая метроидвания, но идеально ведёт за ручку, не сбавляя темп.  Я бы даже назвал Guacamelee! "Call of Duty от мира метроидваний". К концу игры ты и сам не понимаешь, как выполняешь все эти комбо-пируэты, успевая убивать врагов крутыми сериями подкидываний в духе Devil May Cry и набивая по 200 ударов без получения урона, при этом не падаешь в лаву, маневрируя между двумя мирами. И не забываем про курицу, чтобы надыбать лут из очередного секретныго прохода, где нас будут ждать юморески. 
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2740474336

author: {'steamid': '76561198864620265', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 2437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2437, 'last_played': 1643265557}
review:
[h1]Guacamelee STCE-entre vivos y no tan vivos:[/h1]

[h1]Contexto:[/h1]

Es un videojuego que mezcla muy bien la exploración, acción y aventura en unos escenarios fantásticos, cada combo de golpes que haces te llena de determinación.

[h1]Historia:[/h1]

Tomamos el papel de Juan una persona ordinaria que pronto dejaría de serlo para entrar a un mundo de golpes, huesos rotos y muchas tortillas, de inicio a fin podemos ver la evolución de nuestro enmascarado, así mismo el macabro cambio que esta haciendo al mundo el villano Carlos Calaca con el único propósito de cumplir su ritual para unir ambos mundos.

[h1]Destacado:[/h1]

De este juego me encanto mucho los escenarios, la banda sonora que los acompaña, el cómo varía dependiendo la dimensión en a que estes, la satisfacción enorme que genera completar el juego al 100%, los distintos trajes que puedes usar, entre otros temas alucinantes que valen  la pena.  
   
[h1]Puntos negativos:[/h1]

El único punto negativo es que tiene una ligera torpeza al momento de usar las habilidades especiales y que no se puede jugar multijugador en línea, solo se puede local.

[h1]Para Resumir:[/h1]

Es un juego que vale la pena tener en la biblioteca, puedes adaptarte a su modo de juego fácilmente, ir de prisa o disfrutar de los escenarios, personajes y enemigo, aparte de todas las diferencias ocultas que el juego tiene para ofrecernos, mientras escuchamos soundtracks como en el gran templo.

[b]Mi Puntuación Es De: 7.9/10:[/b]

Gráficos: 9/10
Historia: 10/10
Jugabilidad: 7/10
Escenarios: 10/10
Banda sonora: 10/10

[h1]!!Gracias por tomarse el tiempo de leer, un abrazo!![/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198115956636', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1636235416}
review:
Guacamelee es un Metroidvania en toda regla. Se inspira en la cultura de la lucha libre mexicana en cierto sentido como parodia, con su humor propio un poco tonto pero divertido. Tienes muchas habilidades y zonas qué ir desbloqueando conforme progresas en la historia y te invita a explorar cada zona minuciosamente. Las peleas son divertidas y hay una gran variedad de enemigos en cada zona, que mejoran progresivamente su dificultad. La historia es todo un pretexto para repartir golpes y llaves pero en general está bien. Y se vuelve muchísimo más entretenido cuando lo juegas con amigos. Finalmente, la estética de los gráficos es muy hermosa, a muchas de las escenas dan ganas de sacarles captura y usarlas como fondo de pantalla o para enmarcar. De las mejores cosas que ofrece. 

RESUMEN
- Gráficos hermosos. 
- Peleas entretenidas y variadas.
- Muchos poderes y zonas qué desbloquear.
- Infinitamente mejor al jugarlo con un amigo o más. 

P.D. Aunque sólo tengo 0.9 horas jugadas al momento de la reseña, lo he terminado en Xbox y de ahí mi opinión. Gracias por leer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134704427', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1643168903}
review: A perfectly solid action metroidvania. Combat is good, platforming is decent, music and world design are nice. However, I wouldn't exactly call this game outstanding. As someone who does appreciate a bit of atmosphere and immersion I thought the very game-y feel and constant references to be a little annoying. Though I can't really fault the devs for making a creative choice that I personally dislike, and if you are more tolerant of those elements then I would certainly recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198317717303', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 498, 'last_played': 1642443269}
review:
It looks fun, it plays fun, it is FUN!
Guacamelee Super Turbo Championship Edition brings out everything I love about Metroidvanias in 2D.
The only issue I had with the game itself was the silence that followed whenever you switch between the worlds of the living and the dead. Though it seems to play with its atmosphere in music, muffling the fun soundtrack whenever you do the jump between the worlds, it definitely seems to have some kind of music sync bug?
But in any case, the game is fantastic.

8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198340847703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 310, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1641971955}
review:
Quick Description:
-I just played both Guacamelee Super Turbo Championship Edition and Guacamelee 2 back to back.  Interestingly enough, I absolutely loved the sequel but was left very divided on how I felt about the original.  The sequel expands upon everything that is introduced in the first game, and cleans up every problem area that I ran into.  It's a true labor of love, and a clear example of how an Indie team can turn a promising yet deeply flawed game into a true work of art.  Unfortunately, the first Guacamelee can't compete w/ average beat 'em ups and offers very minimal metroidvania elements, while also being very rough around the edges.  This is a shame b/c there is so much charm, humor, and love put into this game, but it just doesn't quite all come together in the end.

What's Good:
-There is a ton of creativity and charm in this title.  I can't think of another beat 'em up metroidvania that offers bright colors, Mexican folklore, and breaks the third wall w/ humor constantly.  There are a ton of bright, likeable npcs throughout the game that really add life to the world.
-One of the smartest choices that the devs made was to make most of the major mechanics act as duel functions.  The uppercut is essential in combat, but also plays a role in breaking red bricks that block pathways, and is essential in platforming and secret hunting.  The dash punch also will be used in combat, platforming, and gatekeeping.  
-The impact when punching, dodging, and slamming enemies is perfect imo.  This is another area that this game really shines.  One of the biggest disappointments of Ender Lillies was how lifeless some of the attacks and dodges felt.  When you perfectly dodge an attack, the game slightly slows down to emphasize that movement.  When you hit an enemy, you really feel the impact, which adds weight to every combo.
-The dimension swapping ability, although underutilized, has so much potential.  This is another use of duel functionality.  The dimension swapping ability allows for every biome to have two different biomes w/ unique secrets and enemies.  It also adds another layer to every platforming section and becomes a focal point of late game content.
-Secret hunters will be delighted, as there are tons!  Most of the secrets are in fairly obvious locations, but there are quite a few secrets that are very difficult to find.

Could Use Some Changes:
-The biggest complaint that I have, is that this feels like a game w/ a lot of great ideas, but they just aren't executed to their full potential.  Combat feels great, but the enemies and even bosses are so easy, that they never feel like a real threat.  You can see that this could be a really unique metroidvania, but it's just not an organic, interconnected world that gives a sense of wonder during exploration.  The chicken power is basically only used for a few secrets and some mandatory tunnels.  This game kind of reminds me of Ori and the Blind Forrest.  I saw incredible potential, but it kind of felt like an extended tech demo instead of a fully coherent game. 
-This isn't really a metroidvania.  It's a beat 'em up w/ some very light metroidvania elements sprinkled in there.  It's exceptionally linear, and the game always tells you exactly where to go.  Even if you try to go out of your way to go to a different location, you will likely run into a literal brick wall.  The world doesn't feel interconnected, it feels much closer to a stage based action platformer.
-The pacing of this game feels off.  The first 3-4 hrs are extremely slow and dull.  If you are remotely experienced in this genre, then by hr 5, you will be so overpowered b/c finding health and stamina upgrades are really easy early on.  The game starts to hit it's stride near the 7-8 hr mark, but just as that happens, the game abruptly ends.  
-This is an extremely easy game.  All of the secrets are either health or stamina which is really helpful, but very boring.  Not every game needs to be challenging, but outside of the final boss and some optional secret hunting and side quests, there are close to no real threats in this game.  You can brute force your way through pretty much everything, especially all combat situations.  The platforming is the only area that is even remotely a challenge, but even that is fairly simple the first 2/3 of the game.

Thoughts:
-So I got this game for free during a giveaway about 2 years ago.  I then went and bought the sequel for a couple of bucks, but both have sat in my backlog ever since.  I want to make it clear, that I will be giving an absolutely glowing review of Guacamelee 2 and that I highly recommend it.  However, I can't recommend this one.  There are so many average beat 'em ups that are simply better than this, and this doesn't even compete w/ middle of the road metroidvanias.  I can't think of a single thing that this game offers that the sequel doesn't expand upon in a better and more creative way.  The sequel fixes every issue that I mentioned above and feels like a truly finished project.  So, the only ppl I would feel comfortable recommending this to, are ppl that loved the sequel, but just want more Guacamelee.  I personally, would rather just play the sequel over again.

Consensus:
-Bottom Shelf Gaming (Tier 5 and makes up 10% of my reviews).  It pains me to do this, b/c clearly this is an Indie studio that deeply loves this gaming franchise and put so much love in both of these games.  This is one of the rare cases where the sequel is so much better than the original, that the original becomes a game that is hard to market to players.  I review games based on a curve and compare them to everything that I have played b/c I think it's important to evaluate whether there is another title that offers better value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198433817009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1642080681}
review:
こんな見た目でしっかりとしたメトロイドヴァニアです。
日本語未対応ですが、本筋に対する誘導は丁寧なので英語が全く分からなくても最後まで迷わず遊べます。

ゲームの進行に応じてアクションが増え、探索範囲が広がるという点は一般的なメトロイドヴァニアですが、本作の特徴はそれらが同時に戦闘アクションとして優秀である点です。派手な格闘アクションで敵に空中コンボを叩き込む様はまるでデビルメイクライ。
オーソドックスなメトロイドヴァニアと最高の2Dアクションが楽しめる贅沢なゲームです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198027357658', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1641244225}
review:
I honestly dont want to thumbs down this game, but I also cant reccomend it. Despite the gorgeous visuals, sound fx and overall theme, gameplay falls flat of being an actual metroidvania and feels more like an ellaborate beat'em up. It is TOO linear to be a metroidvania and most of the upgrades dont give you the rush you would get from similar power ups in game such as Super Metroid and Castlevania SOTN. 
Combat gets tedious early on, not mention sudden and unfair difficulty spikes (enemies with shields that require different skills to be broken at the same time).
Exploring the map feels like a drag, since the collectibles and pickups are generic and uninteresting (mostly just health and stamina upgrades). Also, the story is very shallow and theres no character development (although the designs are great).
It might be appealing to younger audiences, but fans of classic metroidvanias will most likely be dissapointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048761215', 'num_games_owned': 1093, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 764, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 764, 'last_played': 1641168648}
review:
Guacamelee, es un juego de hack n' slash muy divertido, te ofrece múltiples formas de rematar enemigos y hay acción a raudales. 
Posee una historia decente para este género y los gags, además de las referencias con otros juegos, son la cereza en la torta. Especialmente cuando la historia se centra en luchadores de lucha libre. 
Es una gran experiencia especialmente cuando lo juegas con amigos ya que, desde mi punto de vista, ese es el verdadero potencial del juego. Terminarlo con los amigos y esta versión del juego te permite jugar entre 4 (si no me equivoco) haciéndolo una gran experiencia que cualquier fanático del juego debería probar.
Lo único malo fue que no le hicieron un homenaje justo a la cultura mexicana, solo enfatizaron la lucha libre cuando tenían mucho más por donde explotar, la música es adecuada, enemigos difíciles si no estás acostumbrado a los mandos (ya que literalmente en mucha peleas usas todos los comandos que te enseña el juego) 

Lo bueno:
- Mucha acción
- Buena música
- La mezcla de poderes que puedes realizar en los combates
- La lucha libre.

Lo malo:
- Historia un tanto genérica
- Misiones secundarias muy escasas como para que sean relevantes
- El juego muy corto

Calificación: 3/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198314042821', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1464, 'last_played': 1641425388}
review: Guacamelee pode ser definido em duas palavras: DIVERSÃO e DESAFIADOR, um metroidvania que teve sua versão definitiva (STCE) lançada em 2014 e que ainda hoje não perde em nada para novos jogos no mesmo estilo, a temática mexicana com tom cômico é um diferencial bem-vindo e aliado a uma jogabilidade simples e bem fluida tornar Guacamalee um ótimo jogo de ação com plataformas.

review: You can feel the love the devs put into the game, you can see all the influence. That be callbacks to other metroidvanias or just celebrating mexican culture. Guacamelee is a great game with lots of charm and is great fun

author: {'steamid': '76561198083924705', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1115, 'last_played': 1640843338}
review: After a 100% run of this game, I would highly recommend it to anyone who enjoys a great Metroidvania game and/or a humor filled experience. The game has unlockable powers and secrets as you go, like most games in the genre but they found a way to bring their humor into some of their abilities as well. Combat feels amazing with plenty of combos for you to enjoy the whole time. There are plenty of times where bosses and environments will push your mechanical skill, plus a few extreme jump puzzles to find later in the game as well. It took me about 8 hrs to beat the story with extras and a total of 14-15 hours to 100% (not including hard mode). A great value for the price, I look forward to playing the 2nd game!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197965772702', 'num_games_owned': 1037, 'num_reviews': 210, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1657426111}

review:
망자의 날 느낌 물씬 나는 게임

단조롭지 않게 적에 맞춰 다른 대응을 해야함
공격 타격감도 좋음

중간 중간 퍼즐도 나름 재미있음
무엇보다 생사를 오고가는 것이 정말 신박함

무슨 레슬링 게임이야? 하며 시작했음
영어 무시 무지성으로 플레이 딱히 걸리적 거리지 않음
할인 추

author: {'steamid': '76561198047307884', 'num_games_owned': 805, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1640762992}
review: Really fun game, not the most metroidvania-y but still totally worth your time. Has a really fun combo based combat mechanic and the same combat abilities play a bit role in the platforming. Definitely worth playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127543057', 'num_games_owned': 226, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1640561014}
review:
Comecei a jogar esperando algo mais focado em plataforma (não sei por que, só decidi que era) e acabei recebendo um metroidvania muito focado em combate, habilidades diferentes e criação de combos. 
E nem de longe foi uma surpresa ruim, apesar de as vezes frustrante, o combate do jogo é muito divertido e a combinação das habilidades são muitos gostosas de serem usadas. A maioria dos chefes são fáceis, mas no final o jogo aumenta bastante de dificuldade, dando um bom desafio.
É um jogo curto e divertido, além de ser bem bonito mesmo com o estilo de arte simples, vale muito a pena.

review: 和Gold Edition一样还是很爽，给还没买的人说一下，GE（Gold Edition, 旧版）相对来说比较简单，难度会低一些；STCE（该版本）在GE的基础上增加了新地图，新boss，新敌人，新战斗机制，还有不少跑酷关卡，难度也比GE高一些；个人建议如果有一点手残的或者单纯追求拳拳到肉的快感的玩家可以只买GE

review: 类银河战士恶魔城游戏，不难。

author: {'steamid': '76561198276559404', 'num_games_owned': 148, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 3436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2642, 'last_played': 1644725508}
review:
这么冷门的银河城游戏没人玩有点可惜了，技能&摔角（主要是强制抓取）的手感很优秀，多种costume的灵活选择，不算太肝的金币和道具搜集，可以说除了面具碎片的隐藏剧情这游戏主线难度剧情还是可以的（tule tree的上山之路真的是非常恐怖，兄弟）。
苦手收集党慎入~

author: {'steamid': '76561198053290695', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1639463558}
review: I found it to be a decent metroidvania, but nothing amazing. Combat often felt kinda messy and stunlocky, I wasn't big on the writing/atmosphere and certain visual effects were horrible to look at. I was invested enough to complete it, but it was starting to drag so I'm glad it wasn't any longer and I had no motivation to backtrack or really do anything other than directly follow the linear progression path. I'd probably give it a 6/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014785746', 'num_games_owned': 2807, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1910, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1910, 'last_played': 1639266413}
review:
Znakomita metrodivania, co tu dużo pisać.

Stylistycznie bardzo fajnie nawiązuje do meksykańskiego dnia zmarłych i lucha libre. Fabuła jest pretekstowa i stawia raczej na humor. Duży nacisk położono na walkę - wręcz, jak na wrestlera przystało. Progresja jest stosunkowo liniowa, eksplorować (w tym wracać do ukończonych sekcji ze nowo zdobytymi umiejętnościami) warto jednak by polepszyć statystyki bohatera - i odblokować najlepsze zakończenie. 

Sprawia to wszystko mnóstwo frajdy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025240136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1661000667}
review:
This game is the perfect combination of beat'em up, metroidvania and precision platformer, and I say that as someone who sucks at precision platformers and gets easily frustrated.

The base game mechanics is platforming and fighting enemies with different moves that you unlock throughout the game.

The progression of the main story is more or less linear, but you always have to go back to previously visited areas to open new passages once you acquire new abilities that allow you to pass through them.

You might think that the beat'em up part of the game means it's going to be quite repetitive, but in reality the game offers a decent sense progression and variety by giving you new, more powerful abilities, making you face newer, stronger enemies, and presenting you with some challenges of what you would call precision platforming, that are neither too easy, not too hard, so most people will find them enjoyable.

Now, if you're not quite a fan of precision platforming, don't worry. I kinda like games like Celeste, but they seem quite difficult and frustrating to me, too. Guacamelee, however, gives you the right amount of precision platforming for those who like to casually play precision platforming, but don't like when it becomes too hard. In other words, the precision platforming elements of this game are kept to a minimum, and are well-balanced in terms of difficulty: neither so easy that would make you bored, nor so hard that would make you quit (although you might be at the brink of quitting a couple of times).

Having said that, sometimes you might get frustrated and quit it after a few attempts, but it's often the case that when you come back to the game the next time, you'll manage to do it. This has happened to me a couple of times. So my advice to you: Don't give up!

Overall, the game is real fun if you like platforming.

God no... don't get this.
Annoying screen clutter, awful colour distinction in some areas with enemies, Enemies that spam moves, awful timing(you can get perma stunned and die, no time to recover), dodging is awful, bosses are ok, final boss is awful, has terrible timing with your moves, you get knocked down instantly. 
Nah... this game was not fun, not even the story.

Also too many references, remember metroid? remember *videogame reference* every 5s very annoying.
I liked the graphics very good looking.

author: {'steamid': '76561198355354852', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1860, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1071, 'last_played': 1688917806}
review: Hell yeah! This game is one of the most fun games I've played in quite some time! If you like a good platforming metroidvania game, Guacamelee is the game for you. Great graphics, fun fighting, the game gets more and more difficult as you play, but every challenge in it give you a lot of satisfaction. Took me 15 hours to achieve 100% on normal mode and, damn, I there were moments I really wanted to throw my pad out the window. Still, this game is something I'm gonna return to some time in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090063812', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1097, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 755, 'last_played': 1709913646}
review: Лучшая метроидвания. Идеально ведет игрока по сюжету, к концу ты и сам не понимаешь, как тебе удается так легко в прыжке применить способность, отскочить от стены, одновременно сменив мир, увернуться от шипов, и сделать точный второй прыжок. Проходишь очередное сложное место и чувствуешь себя крутым мастером платформеров, а все благодаря тому на самом деле, что игра тебе постепенно подкидывает челенджи, которые дают новые навыки плавно и незаметно.

author: {'steamid': '76561198446337017', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1638320354}
review: If you go into it with the expectation of playing a metroidvania, you're going to be disappointed. It's super linear, and even though it has an open world, there's no sense of exploration. You're just guided from one location to the next. The combat is unique but feels somewhat bland, which is unfortunate considering that it's supposed to be a focal point. Enemy variety is also sorely lacking; 95% of the mobs are the same. The platforming is probably the highlight of the game. However, the level design feels very samey once you look past the stylized art. With that said, the game has a lot of character and the dialogue is quite funny. It’s more of a friends and family type game than something you can sit down and play for hours without getting bored. 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198273585591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1160, 'last_played': 1637982916}
review:
This game is an amazing ride from start to finish. The story is kinda basic yes but even that aside, it has so much great on its corner that I can't help but recommend it

For starters, the look and feel is so obviously influenced by Mexican culture. It's just so beautiful to look at. Everything is just infused with this colorful and lively style which I really like. Fair warning tho but sometimes it may get too colorful to the point that the creators had to put an epilepsy/seizure warning for the game. 

The difficulty is just the right kind of piss me off hard that I'm looking for. I wouldn't say it's the most difficult MetroidVania I've played (Hollow Knight still holds that honor cos I can't finish it to this day huhu) but that does NOT mean it's easy. There are a lot of parts that need split-second decisions and then it does the wrong move and then you blame the controller for not reading it right! It's that kinda difficult. But still I was able to finish it. It took a few good hours of work and determination to get what I needed especially for the True/Good Ending.

The gameplay itself feels just right at home with most modern MetroidVanias in the sense that it doesn't have a levelling up system akin to CastleVania or BloodStained. Instead, it's all about getting new moves or augments to your arsenal to make you stronger. One more thing, in this edition, it has something called Intenso mode which was not available in the Gold Edition. It's a neat addition but I rarely found the use for it. It's cool and you're stronger but I feel that it drains way too quickly anyway and it's just as much a bitch to refill it. Very rarely did I use it like when enemies were too difficult for one part so it made the task easier or go faster but for the most part, it was unnecessary for me. I used it about 5 times max throughout the game. It's also probably cos the control for it is pressing down both the analog sticks. Why not use the L+R trigger instead? Maybe it's meant to deter players from using it so that they don't need to depend on it so much? But whatever, gameplay is still rock solid

Highly recommended if you just love the look of Mexican culture and a right amount of difficulty.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165686988', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 605, 'last_played': 1586779592}
review:
플레이타임: 약 10시간
난이도: 살짝 어려움. 근데 이게 메트로배니아치곤 쉬운편임. 진엔딩은 엄청 어려움
볼륨: 메인스토리만 밀어도 10시간 조금 덜걸리는데, 히든요소가 굉장히 많다.
특이사항: 많고 많은 패러디. 당신은 몇 개나 알아볼까?
[hr][/hr]
정석적인 메트로배니아. 그런데 멕시칸 루차도르를 곁들인.
겉으로 보기에는 전형적 메트로배니아 게임이지만 차별화 요소가 매우 많다.
우선 주인공이 루차도른데, 덕분에 호쾌한 레슬링 기술을 이용해 싸운다. 파일드라이버 타격감이 끝내준다.

이 게임의 특징이라면 다양한 키를 사용한다는 점이 있다.
공격, 잡기, 특수공격의 3가지 키가 기본인데 잡고 난 뒤에 던질지 매다꽂을지 방향키로 정해야 하고, 방향키에 따라서(상,하,좌,우,정지) 특수공격도 5가지가 있다. 벽에 붙었을 때 벽타고 달리기도 있고, 벽차고 날기도 있고, 이승과 저승 반전도 하고, 닭 변신도 한다. 진짜 누를게 더럽게 많다.
어떻게 보면 다양한 레슬링 기술이 구현되어 시각적으로 즐겁고, 게임 디자인 측면에서도 언제 어디를 가야 할지 보여주는 효과가 있어 좋지만, 헷갈리는 건 어쩔 수 없다. 손이 막 꼬인다. 그래도 방향별로 정해져 있어서 익숙해지면 할 만한 편.

스토리는 지옥에서 올라온 해골이 주인공의 약혼자를 제물로 바쳐 이승과 저승의 왕이 되려 하자 약혼자를 구하고 악당을 무찌르는 것이다.
악당 부하들 하나씩 잡고 마지막에 약혼자 죽이고 괴물로 변한 최종보스를 잡으면 된다.

최종보스는 딱 최종보스다 싶은 패턴과 난이도였는데, 개인적으로 다른 보스들은 좀 아쉬웠다.
첫 번째 보스 누님은 첫 보스다운 패턴에 난이도라 그렇다 치는데, 불꽃돌이는 총쏘는것 빼면 좀 심심하고, 재규어맨은 그냥 엘리트몹이랑 싸우는 기분이다. 그래도 왕커다란 샌즈 삼총사 보스 '죽음의 삼 인조'는 내 게임인생 최고의 보스였다 생각한다. 얘는 진짜 재밌게 싸웠다. 심지어 최종보스보다도.

노말엔딩에서는 약혼자를 살릴 수 없지만 진엔딩에서는 약혼자를 살릴 수 있다. 근데 그게 좀 빡세다.
숨겨진 것들을 모두 찾으면 약혼자를 구할 수 있는데, 그 중에 악마 챌린지가 난이도가 상당히 높다.
사실 악마 챌린지 말고 다른 것도 더럽게 어렵다.
