author: {'steamid': '76561198363998209', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 505, 'last_played': 1590095628}
review:
GUACAMELEE! SUPER TURBO CHAMPIONSHIP EDITION
Да название довольно большое))

С чего же начать, гуакамоле или гуакамиле довольно интересная и ХАРДКОРНАЯ.
Не знаю как дела с Темными душками(не играл), но не думаю что он сложнее чем гуакамеле.


В общем о самой игре, фишках и сюжете.
Не знаю сделан сюжет для галочки или всерьез, но он довольно...крутой,но в тоже время не чем не отличается от похожих историй.
Вы в роле "Лучадора", что то типо бразильского воина в маске и ваша задача спасти свою возлюбленную которую похитил скелет злюка и его приспешники. По ходу игры вам предстоит убивать боссов, полу-боссов и обычную знать.

Как вы уже возможно догадались действия игры проходят в Бразилии, а чем славится Бразилия? Праздником мертвых, это одна из фишек этой игры.


С самого начала игры вам говорят что лучше использовать геймпад( и это правда ._. ) и не зря ведь попотеть нужно будет(ну, а последний босс...)


По ходу игры ( сорян за повторение) вы будете получать СУПЕР-ТУРБО способности( в основном связаны с козлом...иронично) способности разные, но все они делать(почти) айайай врагам.


!ВОЗМОЖНО СПОЙЛЕРЫ!
Боссы(всех назвать не смогу, но попробую):
1. Первый босс от которого вы будете просто убегать ведь он будет в самом начале, а в самом начале вы как бы Л.О.Х.
Это, что ли демон, что ли дракон, но в общем тварь ещё та.
2."Бабеха" крикливая тварь, которая вам поможет   ( !И да забыл сказать что почти все боссы после смерти будут жалеть о том что они делали ._. ... конченые!)
3."Пламенное лицо", "Огненное лицо", "Палахающейся лицо", называйте как хотите.
Будет встречатся 3 раза и только на 3 все таки решит сделать игроку айайай. Имеет пистолет в кобуре, ну и с его имени можно понять что он горячий.
4. "Тупа банда музыкальных скелетав", в общем всегда боссов по одному, а тут ситуация такая что вам предлагают 3 в 1(акция в общем)
5.Киссссссса - киса которая будет угрожать вам ещё с начала игры, и в конце битвы скажет кое что угарное.
6.Если не ошибаюсь последний босс, а именно "Calaca" какой то чел который подписал уговор с дьяволом и стал скелетам...ну а потом этого дьявола превратил в курочку(да кст это его фишка)



Если решитесь купить эту игру то знайте козел всегда прав.
Ну в общем это конец, надеюсь для кого то этот обзор станет полезным.



Пи.ся. Отдельно спасибо Humble Bundle за бесплатную игру ( ͡$ ͜ʖ ͡$)

author: {'steamid': '76561198150805663', 'num_games_owned': 236, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1558271231}
review:
Oyunu Humble Bundle'da beleş verilmesi sayesinde aldım bir deneyeyim bari dedim ve oyun beklediğimden çok daha güzeldi. Bölüm tasarımları, boss fightları, combat sistemi, grafikleri her şeyi yerli yerinde çok güzel oyun. Oyun da parkurlarda var ve bazıları zor ilk deneyişte yapamayabilirsiniz bir süre takılıp kalabilirsiniz.

<> Arkadaşınızla oturup coop bir oyun oynayalım derseniz tam sizlik eğlenceli vakitler geçirebilirsiniz. Oyun 4 kişiye coop destekliyor.
<> Oyunun Gold Edition'unun Metacritic puanı "88" , bu versiyonun "80"  ama pek bir farkı yok galiba arasında bu daha sonra çıkmış ve bazı fazla özellikler var galiba.  Metacritic puanına bakarakta oyunun güzel olduğuna karar verebilirsiniz zaten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198264721545', 'num_games_owned': 273, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 745, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1559650405}
review:
Diese Nintendo Easter Eggs die in diesem Spielt versteckt sind, sind so göttlich. 
Ans ich ist es ein sehr gutes Spiel. Die Steuerung passt, Grafik ist auch eigen und die Jokes sind auch verschieden.
Mit 13.99€ hätte ich mich zufrieden geben können, wenn ich das Spiel nicht gratis bekommen hätte. Erinnert mich teils auch an eine Mischung von den Mario&Luigi RPGs und den 2D teilen. Ein "Boss" Stirbt auch auf Super Mario Bros Bowser Style. Also die Altbekannte Axt die es am ende einer Burg gibt. Sehr unterhaltsam.

>Enemigos poco memorables (incluso algunos jefes)

I have problems even getting through one bit of the game because I can't physically and mentally do the quick well time jumps. I love the game, but I not good at playing platformers nor games like dark soul. btw for the asshole of the "get good" toxic community not everyone is going to have the same physical and mental ability to play those games so... shut up you entitled brats.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051890211', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1558208554}
review:
Pues es un juego que he conseguido gratuito gracias a Humble bundle, y la verdad esta divertido. 2h sin parar, bastante viciada me he pegado.

Es un clásico plataformas con historia detrás.

Su estética es muy de cómic y tiene toques de humor que hacen un juego divertido y para todo los públicos.

La verdad es excelente,  y tiene una jugabilidad con mando muy buena.

Pros
Jugabilidad buena
Humor y historia curiosa
Gráficos divertidos.

Contras
- Enemigos repetitivos, como cualquier plataformas vamos.
NOTA 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198170906225', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 517, 'last_played': 1558186419}
review:
HB加一好评，大概四五年前在机核上听说过这款游戏，当时应该还是PSV平台，当时机核众说这游戏牛逼疯了，今天喜加一发现关卡设计者的很牛逼，解谜动作都有，而且对反应力要求还是蛮高的，在生者和死者的世界来回无缝穿梭真的很精髓，场景和BGM都会随之改变，一些支线也需要运用这些系统，不过有些存盘点设置的不是很合理，而且为什么我不能打和我不在一个位面的敌人他们却能打我？？？另外，自爆怪和四手乱锤怪的亲妈请原地去世。

画面美术风格 9/10
BGM 10/10
游戏性8.5/10
关卡设计 8/10
BOSS战 8/10
自爆怪&四手乱锤怪 -100/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198311451090', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1618448049}
review: So i got this game for free on Humbel Bundel and i started playing, and it was fun you collect buffs coins , learning combos and fun stuff. But after like 2 hours of playing you littrly have to play twister with your keyboard and pourkore at very hard jumps whilst there is a shit ton of monsters shooting you. Apart from that the game is cool, the mexican graphics look very cool also.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001650469', 'num_games_owned': 4147, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 650, 'last_played': 1563036070}
review:
플레이 해본지는 좀 오래됬지만,
험블에서 무료로 풀린 기념으로 이제와서 이 게임에 대한 리뷰를 한번적어보자면,

남미 루차도르의 소울이 느껴지는 메트로배니아 플랫포머 액션의 걸작.
타격-잡기-타격으로 끊임없이 이어지는 콤보시스템의 타격감이 정말 재미있다.
멕시코 스타일의 흥겨운 OST는 덤.

정도로 요약 가능하겠다.

가끔가다 난이도 어렵고 조작 불편하다는 사람이 있는데, 그건 뭐 개인차가 있는 부분이니....
(참고로 나는 별로 불편한걸 못 느꼈다)

빠르게 달리면 5,6시간안에 도전과제 100%달성이 가능하긴 한데,
그건 골드에디션을 한번 해봤다는 전제 하에 가능한거고,
아마 처음 시작하고 도전과제 100% 도전한다면 대략 15-20시간정도 걸리지 않을까 한다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058159844', 'num_games_owned': 1055, 'num_reviews': 276, 'playtime_forever': 484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1558253127}
review:
[i]Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition[/i] reminds me very much of the [i]Star Wars[/i] special editions. It looks better than the original version, and there is, strictly speaking, ‘more’, but the things that have been added serve only to spoil the flow of the game with awkwardly-inserted new areas and artificially crank up the difficult by thoughtlessly pasting crowds of enemies into various rooms that had previously been well-balanced.

The way this re-release has been butchered demonstrates a lack of restraint typical of amateur developers. I’m sure plenty of creators have the ‘George Lucas’ problem where all they want to do is go back and slightly adjust old products to match the changes in their vision for the game that have occurred since its release. From Software did this with [i]Dark Souls II[/i], splitting its online player base in two by releasing a touched-up edition full of enemies randomly splashed about with no substantial gameplay changes to match.

It’s a shitty, stupid thing to do, especially to something as acclaimed as [i]Guacamelee[/i]. It’s a great game, and I’d love to recommend this version over the original, but unless you want to play with four players in co-op rather than two, just stick to the [i]Gold Edition[/i]. All this version otherwise offers is updated memes on billboards and a slightly padded play time.

[url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/oked/recommended/214770]My review for [i]Guacamelee! Gold Edition[/i].[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198044373377', 'num_games_owned': 487, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1558728766}
review:
ได้เกมนี้มาเพราะมันแจกฟรี แต่เห็นภาพสวยดีเลยลองเล่นขำๆ แต่พอได้ลองเล่นดูกลับติดลมจนแบบเลิกไม่ได้ จนไม่คิดว่าจะแจกฟรี

เกมจะเล่นแบบสไตล์ Castlevania ก็คือการเดิน+สู้ เพื่อเปิด map ไปเรื่อยๆ และเราจะไปทางใหม่ๆได้จากสกิลที่เพิ่มเข้ามาเรื่อยๆ รวมทั้งการเปิด map เก่าที่ตอนแรกยังไปไม่ได้ และแน่นอนว่ามีพวก Boss Fight ด้วย นี่เล่นไป 5 ชั่วโมง ยังไม่ถึงครึ่งเกมเลย (แต่ก็ไม่รู้ว่าอีกไกลไหมจะจบนะ)

ส่วนที่ชื่นชอบคือการออกแบบตัวละคร ออกแบบฉาก ออกแบบเรื่องราวได้น่าสนใจ ดูแล้วจะคิดถึงหนัง COCO ขึ้นมาเลย / เพลงก็เพราะนะ

ส่วนที่ไม่ชอบคือมันเหมาะใช้จอยเล่นมากกว่าใช้คีย์บอร์ด แล้วมีหลายฉากก็ค่อนข้างยากและใจร้ายกับคนเล่น ที่ต้องโดดไปตายๆเพื่อไปฉากต่อไปด้วยการแก้ปริศนาว่าจะใช้ท่าที่มีผ่านฉากนั้นยังไง ซึ่งบางฉากก็แอบยากจนชวนหงุดหงิด คิดภาพ Rockman ต้องโดดไปบนบล็อกแว่บไปแว่บมา แล้วด้านล่างเป็นหนามที่ตกไปตาย (แต่ถ้าบังคับจนคล่องแล้วก็คงจะง่ายขึ้นนะ)

โดยรวมให้ 9/10 หักนิดหน่อย เพราะฉากมันไม่ได้ซับซ้อนมากแบบ Castlevania เกมเลยอาจจะยังมีมิติที่ไม่ค่อยลึกเท่าไหร่ แต่มองในอีกมุมมันก็เข้าถึงง่าย ไม่ซับซ้อน ไม่หลงทางน่ะนะ

author: {'steamid': '76561198050773591', 'num_games_owned': 487, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1558073345}
review:
[h1] СУУУУУПЕР НАЧООООО!!!!! [/h1] 

Метроидвания на тему мексиканского фолклора. Бегаем борцухой либо другим скином, который не влияет на обращения местных неписей - хоть скелетом нарядись. Ну и типичная черта метроидваний - облизываемся на недоступные локации, закрытые до получения определённых возможностей. Как всегда главный герой в таких играх просто ничто и поэтому приходится бегать сломя голову из одного конца карты в другой, пока неписи вокруг просто пинают балду.

В этом есть и напряг подобных игр, всё здесь происходит по сюжету. Есть стандартные побочные задания - принеси то, принеси это. И при этом не очень симпатичная блеклая квадратная рисовка. Может я просто не поклонник всех этих мексиканских мотивов. Но они у меня всегда представляются с тем, что живут эти несчастные мексиканцы бок о бок просто с мегастраной, которая поставила весь мир на колени и при этом Мексика - страна третьего мира, где опять же у бандитов развязаны все руки. Но и также это оплот мексиканских сериалов про очередную касту буржуев с их соплями.

Поэтому я к этой игре так же отнёсся со скепсисом. К тому же она вся на английском, и от бесплатного перестали давать карточки. 

Но русский стоило бы добавить, потому что этих метроидваний без русского просто уже неисчислимое болото. Поэтому можно порекомендовать лишь Бэтмэна блекгейт в подобном жанре - там хотя бы русский есть. Хоть и тоже как в типичной метроидвании куча беготни туда-сюда. И это реально напрягает в подобных играх.

author: {'steamid': '76561198195741163', 'num_games_owned': 744, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1622105722}
review:
A Mexican styled Metroidvania with beautiful 2D landscapes and amazing character details, easy to learn controls, quirky and interesting characters, and an even more interesting plot..you basically get a second chance at life after being killed in the overworld (real world), and then pitted with the task of going around and beating the living crap out of skeletons. 

There's also different costumes with different abilities and debuffs available for both the main protagonist, and the supporting character named Tostada. You can either go around punching enemies while looking like a class clown, or being speedy as hell with a slight debuff holding you back slightly.

If you're wanting to get this game right now, free of charge,  go over to Humble Bundle and grab it there for free for the next two days.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157453094', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1558039175}
review:
With a title like Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition, I was hoping for a fighting game but instead I got some shoddy 2D platformer with RPG elements.

You play as luchador (Mexican wrestler) as you beat up skeletons in sombreros. The combat is incredibly simplistic and gets dull quickly. As you explore the world, you find there are lots of people to talk to but I don't exactly find it enjoyable to talk to a bunch of dull NPCs, most of whom having nothing consequential to say. The graphics style is rather disappointing.

Not much to say other than the fact I was really bored playing this. Got it for free so I cannot really complain but I definitely do not recommend paying for it.

Gameplay: 3.5/10
Graphics: 5/10 (for the style they were going for)
Controls: 5/10
Replay Value: 1.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198432336238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 583, 'last_played': 1557749015}
review:
Lo recomiendo PERO, y es un 'PERO' muy grande, NO VALE LA PENA. Me explico:

15 € por un juego muy mediocre no me parece bien, eso ya para empezar. Hay demasiados metroidvanias mucho mejores que este, Hollow Knight (el mejor metroidvania de la historia), Sundered, etc. En cuanto a Guacamelee!, los escenarios están bien, el arte y los gráficos están bien, el diseño de niveles podía estar mucho mejor, ñe, pero donde más quejas tengo es en la jugabilidad, los controles de las habilidades son horribles, le mando hacer la habilidad X y me hace la habilidad Y, me pasó cantidad de veces, los bosses son facilísimos menos el último que lo tienes que hacer casi perfecto o te mueres, me llevó casi media hora pasármelo, además, cuando te golpean, el personaje se cae y se tiene que recuperar lo que le lleva 1-2 segundos pero en una pelea contra 10 enemigos distintos se hacen eternos para que nada más levantarte te vuelvan a golpear sin tú poder hacer nada. Y los enemigos, variedad 0, habrá  menos de 15 enemigos en todo el juego y unos cuántos son variaciones de otros. Podría hablar mucho más de Guacamelee! pero aquí me quedo.

Lo recomiendo, SI NO TIENES NADA A LO QUE JUGAR Y ESTÁ DE OFERTA. No te esperes mucho, es muy mediocre, le daría un 5/10 si le tuviese que dar nota.

author: {'steamid': '76561198192755490', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 700, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1597004198}
review: Un jugazo, es un plataformas original , divertido, multijugador, con una gran banda sonora

author: {'steamid': '76561197970396267', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 1712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1712, 'last_played': 1556974559}
review:
A fun and colorful Metroidvania-Brawler. You are Juan and you try to save the princess and the world. While you explore the world you get new powers that not only help you fight the evil skeletons, but also help you reach hidden places. 

It looks great, is full of bright colors and has a good soundtrack. All in a Mexican setting that feels fresh. The combat flows quite well, is easy to learn and has some depth to it. The platforming parts can be a bit tough sometimes, but are manageable, the hardest parts are optional, but they hide the alternate ending behind them, wich is not so great, I think, but overall the story is nothing new but told in an amusing way wich really matches the warm style of the game. I had my fun. After finishing the game once, you unlock the hard mode in wich tests if you got the fighting concept down, or if you just pressed some buttons to win! The was great, sometimes a bit frustrating if not everything went according to combo-plan, but sadly I lost my savegame after finishing 3/4 of the replay, a quick google seems to suggest that happened to other people too. But what can you do? Someday, I will start again!

Got this on a sale but would not have regretted to pay full price for this one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198049368166', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1556572898}
review:
so far its been a fun beat em up / platformer while i haven't played the full game i will give my first impressions. DON'T USE YOUR KEY BOARD. i never thought i would reach for the steam controller but this is a game that needs it. ever see those crazy combos people do in things like smash or street fighter. this game makes you pull off those combos to move places i don't know how it expected me to press L shift  then S then UP ARROW + D to do a dodge roll  to a mid air jump then a extended jump upper cut to get onto a platform but fuckin hell i did then it wanted me to do it again and said screw it i will come back to this. 

the game looks cool plays cool but makes you do crazy shit. buy it on sale and be ready for crazy some fun ALSO ITS 4 PLAYER screen share get some friends and have a good time

author: {'steamid': '76561198204897399', 'num_games_owned': 772, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 1604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 688, 'last_played': 1557412151}
review:
Not a Metroidvania but a surprisingly good game

I had Guacamelee in my library for a long time before I decided to play it. I finally went to it because I was looking for more Metroidvanias after Hollow Knight. It turned out to be a pretty good game.

On the positive side, the graphics are awesome and the music is cool. The game is dynamic, fast paced and full of details. I also really enjoyed it's humour and second degree.
The story however is basically a classic "out of no where save the princess" story and is just an excuse for having a game.

However the game is not really a metroidvania. So yes the world is open with a single map (except zones loading times) but no this is not enough. A metroidvania should feature guided non linearity, a feeling of being lost at some points, interconnected zones and give you the possibility to handle totally or partially them in different orders.

In Guacamelee you will rather go zone by zone in the linear order the game wants you to follow. You can't even access them and explore by yourself because they usually will be locked and will unlock not because of specifics action but because you reached a specific point in the game. You will use new abilities to backtrack but only to complete the game and get some items that you actually do not need to progress in the game.

So this game is more a "Monster boy in Cursed Kingdom" like with "fake level structure" than a real metroidvania.

However it is still good and enjoyable. On the very original side the game often looks more like a "jumping puzzle" than a classic plateformer. It's really interesting, sometimes frustrating, but this kind of plateforming was new to me and I enjoyed it. Gucamelee introduce some extremely interesting plateforming mechanics and, if for one thing, it should be checked out because of that.

The fighting dynamic is really fun, it's based on the same upgrades that you need to open paths, however the enemy pool seems limited and you will have see what you have to see pretty quickly. Only regret is that move are too "square" and that the character always seems to stop to perform a move, this come as a brake in the game dynamics.

On the downside, the upgrade limit themselves to open new paths materialized by color blocks rather than simply allowing you to explore more so once again it feels more like an artificial construct than a natural world where this hill is "just a bit too high for you". 

And this brings me to my last point: the game world feel not "real". This is a plateforming game and no effort was made to hide it. Moving plateforms are just moving plateforms when it could have be hidden into, for instance, ridding an enemy, challenges are materialized by temporary locked places when you could, say, fall into a pit. When I play a metroidvania or so called game, I really enjoy that it is not screaming "I AM A GAME", so I can plunge more its world and story. This is not the case here.

Knowing that, that's a good game and you will probably enjoy it but if you are looking for an Hollow Knight experience you will be disapointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149635341', 'num_games_owned': 245, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1608, 'last_played': 1556193252}

author: {'steamid': '76561197966414350', 'num_games_owned': 715, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 591, 'last_played': 1545511539}
review:
I'm a big fan of the metroidvania genre, but its also become very over saturated.  There are some masterpieces and there are many many duds.

Guacamelee falls flat for me,  I probably wouldn't even call it a Metroidvania just based on the level design.  You see, the most important aspect of a Metroidvania next to its combat/game play is the level design.  Level design is so essential in this style of game, you need the right level of a desire to explore and discover with as little backtracking as you can make it.  Sure, backtracking will be apart of the game, and sometimes its fun to go back to areas you know you needed a skill to get through earlier but just couldn't get through it yet.  The level design has to give you the illusion of an open ended game play while it still guides you through the intended path with branching secrets to keep you satisfied.  Hell, a metroidvania can even have skilled players find ways through areas they shouldn't be able to get through yet with skill and creativity.

So can you guess what I think is lacking in Guacamelee? Yes, its the level design.  Its so bland, so linear and not exciting, it does none of what a good metroidvania should do, which is why I may not even consider this a metroidvania. Each area is just a connection to the next one, they may have different puzzles in each section, but that puzzle just gets you to the very next section you need to go.  The branching paths are small and just give you minor upgrades to you which help slightly to even out the rising difficulty, not that the game is hard.  The design leaves a lot to be desired that's for sure.  

But what about the game play? I did just mention the game is not hard, well, that's true. It's actually too easy.  Oh sure, there are some challenges here or there with bosses, but once you figure out their pattern they're also nothing.  The game is basically a button smasher anyway.  Yeah, there are combos and such and you can pull them off sure to keep variety of the game going.  The combat is not terrible, the combos can keep it interesting.  But in the end, you'll just be button smashing beat-em up style game.  You get some RPG elements like increasing your health and what not throughout the game, but it all feels unnecessary.

The story of the game is forgettable ( I already forgot it to be honest, it was not engaging), the game play is pretty dull and the level design flat out sucks.  The one thing the game has going for it is the artwork, it builds a cool luchador atmosphere and that in itself is pretty fun, but not enough to recommend this game.  It was okay, but overall bland.  There are far better games in the genre if you haven't played them yet, and if you're this low into the genre, you've found all the good ones and its time to move on and wait for something new to come out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053066446', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1555825463}
review: O jogo em geral é genérico. Ao longo da gameplay o estilo metroidvania que esse jogo aponta ter, é ofuscado pela linearidade de jogo e exploração medíocre que sem tem nas cidades e "side quests". Ao longo do jogo, parece ser um jogo bem fácil de se jogar, mas conforme se implementa novos comandos, o jogo se torna mais de puzzle do que de ação e "exploração". E depois da luta contra o cara de cabeça de fogo, as batalhas ficam absurdamente mais dificeis e as vezes até injusta. Pois o jogo quer implementar todas as funcionalidades que você coletou até ali, mas pra mim prejudica nos estilo de combate do jogo. E outra, as lutas contra os chefes são MUITO, mas MUITO fáceis. E a história é bem medíocre. Não sei o motivo de esse jogo receber tanta avaliação positiva, sendo que ele tem bastante pontos negativos e por de ter as "mecânicas" de um Metroidvania, a linearidade dos objetivos não força o jogador a explorar o mundo do jogo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029616618', 'num_games_owned': 206, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1553770025}
review:
作为一个一小时玩家，不明白为什么这个游戏评价如此之高哎，在我看来除了画面有特色，对白逗逼没别的优势了。
你们说手感好，我不知道好在哪里了。
最常用的操作竟然是一个近乎BUG的操作，三连击把敌人打飞在击飞的瞬间再抓住敌人再扔到天上，落下来继续锤。
技能的判定范围也很怪，升龙拳打不到正上方的敌人，还要错开一段距离。
敌人非常单调，玩了一小时就只有3种敌人，只有一种能前冲的敌人打起来需要操作，其他的平A就能过。
关卡设计中规中矩，谈不上精巧。
角色升级这块就是简单粗暴的攻击，血量，能量。
整体评分7/10，为了均衡一下评分我选择差评。

author: {'steamid': '76561198082969137', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 680, 'last_played': 1553817934}
review:
With how positive the reviews were for this game, I ended up finding myself severely disappoint by Guacamelee. Maybe I'm just spoiled by the master class games of the genre like Metroid, Castlevania and Hollow Knight, but even comparing Guacamelee to Axiom Verge, another indie Metroidvania, I found Guacamelee to be lacking.

First off, while the game has a great visual style and most of the game looks good, game's presentation lacks polish, with menus being extremely basic and usually ugly to look at, sticking out like a sore thumb from the rest of the game. This is more of a nitpick, but I still feel like mentioning it.

Second, the game's combat is fun on the surface, but the deeper you go the worse it becomes. With the exceptions of a few moves used for exploration, namely running up walls, shooting off walls to fly until you hit another wall, turning into a chicken and dimension-flipping, all the new abilities you get are special attacks that all do the exact same amount of damage, but move your character differently. 
The game implements these moves similarly to Super Smash Bros. where you use the same button for all of them, and your directional input is what determines the move you use. You have an uppercut that helps to gain height, as dashing punch for extra horizontal movement, a body slam that moves you down, and a headbutt where you stay in place. These work fine, but the simplicity and similarity between them means there's practically no difference between them aside from how they move you. For the most part you just do the first two parts of your basic 3-hit combo, use a special move, and then repeat until you run out of specials to use since you can only use each special move once until you touch the ground again. The lack in variety of the actual functionality of these moves makes combat repetitive regardless of the enemy type you're fighting, of which there aren't that many, and it only gets worse with how challenge is added.

Rather than giving the enemies better AI or giving them more complex patterns with multiple moves, they do two things to add challenge. The first is the different shields, colored shields require use of a certain special move to break, while white shields take multiple hits in quick succession to break. These are everywhere near the end of the game, which seems very lazy, and some of the last bosses even have them, including the final boss, which makes it seem like they didn't know how else to make bosses challenging. The biggest offender here, however, is that late in the game some enemies will dodge out of your attacks mid-combo. This includes elite skeleton variants with black bones, and in what seems extremely lazy they don't just dodge, they teleport out of the room for a few moments before re-appearing somewhere else. They're still the same enemies, albeit they do more damage and have more health, but rather than actually make them challenging to fight, like with new attacks or the ability to jump around, they just have them teleport away from you mid-combo, and there's absolutely nothing you can do about it. It's lazy and does nothing but add tedium. What's more is that the weaker enemies that don't dodge or teleport out of your combos are on the weaker side and don't have much health, so the combo system ends up being completely unused. The weaker enemies that don't decide they don't feel like being combo'd any more die before you can really get creative and try to perform extensive combos, while the stronger enemies with enough HP to be combo'd either dodge or teleport away mid-combo, or are virtually immune to hit-stun and can't be juggled in the air. What even is the point of have this combo system if none of the enemies can be extensively combo'd in the first place?

Another problem I have with the game is that while it's considered a "Metroidvania", the exploration is very limited. The areas are set up to be extremely linear the first time through, making it feel more like an action platformer that just has backtracking when it really has no business doing it. The vast majority of the exploration you can do is really just rooms blocked off by blocks you need certain special attacks to break acting like small challenges for a piece of a health or stamina container. Even what the game considers a new area, the Tree Tops, is really just a long vertical challenge room. Because of how the game handles barriers blocking access to areas that require backtracking the game is extremely limited on secrets too, because most side areas are highlighted with brightly colored blocks.

Finally, and this is more subjective, but for all the advertising I didn't find the game to be that funny. The game has some decent dialogue, but it never stuck out to me as funny at all. It could just be that I have an abstract sense of humor, but the best this game got out of me was some smiles from references to other video games, like "Los Super Hermanos" or "Los Casa Crashers".

To sum up, Guacamelee was disappointing, even when I bought it on sale for 4.50. The game's exploration is bare bones, the combat is shallow and adds challenge by being tedious, and for all the advertising I seldom laughed during my playthrough. If you're looking for good Metroidvanias get Hollow Knight or Axiom Verge instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021551803', 'num_games_owned': 5277, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 1145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1145, 'last_played': 1541184380}
review:
[table]
[tr]
	[th][b][i]Byte sized review[/i][/b][/th]
	[th]Spicy...but not in a good way[/th]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td][b][i]Graphics[/i][/b][/td]
	[td] [b]3/5[/b] - [b][i]Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition[/i][/b] reminds me of a pinata that has been cracked open and has spilled its candy all over the place. It's a very colourful adventure, often garishly so, and while the animation is rather simple I did find it fitted with the aesthetic the developers were trying achieve.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td][b][i]Performance / Bug & Issues[/i][/b][/td]
	[td] [b]5/5[/b] - I didn't encounter any bugs or performance issues while running [b][i]Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition[/i][/b], and considering that it's a re-haul of the previous Gold version released a year earlier, I would assume most - if any - of the bugs or irritations would have been ironed out for this re-release as I did not experience any.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td][b][i]Story[/i][/b][/td]
	[td] [b]6/10[/b] - Contains a fairly rote and standard trope of a story about luchador who can flip between life and death and his quest to save the princess (I mean El Presidentes) daughter from the evil clutches of the Master of the Dead. Pretty stock standard stuff although it is infused with a wacky sense of humor to make it stand out that sometimes works and sometimes falls completely flat.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td][b][i]Gameplay[/i][/b][/td]
	[td] [b]5/20[/b] - I love Metroidvania's. A lot. [b][i]Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition[/i][/b] did absolutely nothing for me. As time progressed the repetitive gameplay loop started to slowly grate on my tits until I got to the point near the end of the game where I was completely ambivalent towards the game (some could say bordering on malice). I just found it irritated me more than it challenged me and the further I progressed the more I soured towards it. This is a shame because so many friends recommended this one to me. It was also lovingly reviewed by the critics so I expected a lot more. What I got fell far short of what was promised. Maybe I would have enjoyed the Gold version a lot more because I am told the late game is not riddled with elite enemies like this one.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td][b][i]Sound / Voice / Music[/i][/b][/td]
	[td] [b]5/5[/b]- This is the one area [b][i]Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition[/i][/b] excels because not only are the sound effects on point it has an absolutely wonderful Mariachi band music that I found to be the best part of this misfire.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td][b][i]Replay value[/i][/b][/td]
	[td] [b]3/5[/b] - The game forces you to play through normal mode before hard mode is unlocked and there are numerous costumes to collect, done via coins collected in the game, plus achievements so I suppose you could consider this enough for most, however, I don't ever see myself coming back to this one.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td][b][i]Fun Factor[/i][/b][/td]
	[td] [b]4/10[/b] - While my early encounters with the game where enjoyable, the moment the game started to throw elite enemy after elite enemy at me and the repetition of the gameplay loop started to settle into a grind, my patience for the game started to wear thin. By the time I finally finished the game I was no longer having fun but simply pushing through so that I could mark it as completed. Your mileage may vary of course because our experiences are all different. I am giving it a Steam thumbs up but would prefer if they gave me a neutral option.[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td][b][i]Overall score[/i][/b][/td]
	[td][b]50%[/b][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
	[td][b][i]Rating[/i][/b][/td]
	[td]https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=869454819[/td]
[/tr]
[/table]

author: {'steamid': '76561198061048547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 951, 'last_played': 1634923327}
review:
Innecesariamente tedioso.

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[list]
[*]Diferentes trajes con diferentes propiedades.

[*]Estilo artístico muy interesante.

[*]Bastante humor: las referencias por el mapa a otros juegos, el poder de transformación, los nombres de algunos personajes...

[*]Los movimientos especiales de combate son los mismos que te sirven para desbloquear caminos. Cada uno de ellos sólo se puede ejecutar en una dirección concreta (de abajo arriba, de arriba abajo, a los lados...). De ese modo, aunque encuentres un obstáculo para el que ya conoces el movimiento con el que desbloquearlo, también necesitas atacar desde un lado en el que puedas dirigir el poder que necesitas contra el obstáculo. De esa manera se consigue que no sea trivial desbloquear caminos con poderes que ya tenías.
[/list]

[h1]Contras:[/h1]
[list]
[*]No tienes ningún log para llevar la cuenta de las misiones secundarias.

[*]Un plataformero no lineal no debería decirte a qué parte del mapa tienes que ir continuamente como si fueras tontito del culo perdido. Debería animarte a que cuando llegues a un punto sin salida y consigas una nueva habilidad, busques por tu cuenta por cuál de los caminos que habías dejado atrás puedes avanzar ahora.

[*]La exploración queda hecha una mierda por culpa de la inmensa cantidad de puzles, secciones de plataformeo y oleadas de enemigos que no dejan de cerrarte el paso y obligarte a superarlos para continuar.

[*]Muchas secciones de plataformeo y de oleadas de enemigos están ajustadas al milímetro y son muy intransigentes:
[list]
[*]Tienes que andar probando y repetitiendo cuarenta veces por haberte quedado un pelín corto al saltar o descoordinarte por una fracción de segundo con una plataforma que se moviese. 

[*]En algunas oleadas de enemigos que tienes que superar para avanzar, comienzan a aparecer enemigos bomba a los que tienes que derrotar antes de que exploten o si no te hacen daño. Muchas veces comienzan a aparecer sin límite, mientras todavía tienes que derrotar a otros enemigos.

[*]Hay un desafío que consiste en encadenar unas secuencias de golpes que te van diciendo. Son dificilísimas de hacer porque cuando golpeas al objetivo este sale volando fuera de tu alcance sin que tú puedas evitarlo. Además, las secuencias se acaban haciendo demasiado largas para memorizar y tienes que andar leyéndolas mientras las vas ejecutando, lo que te impide fijar la vista en tu personaje y en el objetivo al que estás pegando y hace [b]aún más fácil[/b] que este se te escape del alcance.
[/list]

[*]Me ha ocurrido que he reventado un cofre de monedas, he muerto y al volver desde el punto de guardado, el cofre no estaba pero las monedas ganadas no se me habían guardado.
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198148620362', 'num_games_owned': 433, 'num_reviews': 506, 'playtime_forever': 885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 885, 'last_played': 1551528675}
review:
这是一款制作非常精良的类银河战士恶魔城作品。
+++ 虽说整体剧情线性，但丰富的支线能使玩家感受到探索的快感。
+++ 战斗系统易于上手，难于精通，打击感十足。
+++ 墨西哥风格（虽说有点刻板印象）的画面和音乐给这部作品锦上添花。
++ 出色的关卡和谜题设计，和机制紧密结合。
+ 整体适中的游戏难度，让本手残玩家也能通关。
+ 遍布整个游戏的各种其他游戏的彩蛋，看到熟悉的元素总会让人心生暖意。
+/- 多结局，但真结局所需条件十分严苛，本人已经几近放弃......
[spoiler]感觉最难的就是在地狱挑战的17个房间里要拿到10块金牌，最终BOSS最狠毒的就是设计了这么一堆挑战，要救老婆是真的要下好一番功夫，制作组怕是吃狗粮吃腻了，搞这么一出，本休闲玩家身心俱疲，很难受......[/spoiler]
（2019.3.2 更新：写完这篇评测的第二天我就突然人品爆炸完成了真结局，有情人终成眷属，这口狗粮吃得幸福。这是不是从某种程度上说明我已经脱离了最手残的行列了？）
这就是我13个小时体验的游戏过程的所有优点，和一些因为难度和本人太菜的原因的一点牢骚，除此以外我个人没有发现这个游戏的任何缺点。这是一款非常优秀的作品，强烈推荐。

author: {'steamid': '76561197976782798', 'num_games_owned': 137, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 777, 'last_played': 1561974781}
review:
這是一款非常用心的獨立遊戲，視覺風格的設計讓人驚豔。除了滿滿亡靈節繽紛的色彩元素外，製作團隊在每個細節的刻畫上別有用心，更別說是遊戲中對於生死兩界不同的有趣刻劃，光是視覺饗宴已經讓這款遊戲值回票價。

但別以為製作團隊花費大量心思在視覺設計上，遊玩體驗就會打折扣。這款遊戲無論是故事節奏、戰鬥操作、忍耐任務或甚至是支線解謎都別有用心。故事雖然簡單卻不無聊乏味，大量的多變的隱藏地圖使遊戲進行和探索上多了許多樂趣；忍耐任務及解謎任務更是巧妙地運用了劇情中所習得的各種戰鬥招式，使得遊戲節奏的連貫性非常強；戰鬥的操作上更是令人驚艷，我都不知道原來簡單的幾個動作可以做出一系列多變又華麗的連段打法(唯一的限制是玩家的想像力)，中後期的怪物更是多了不同屬性的加成，使得戰鬥更是多了幾分刺激感和變化。最重要的是遊戲不管是戰鬥或是忍耐任務都有一點挑戰度，但是絕對不會給玩家惡意感，整個遊玩體驗是非常的陶醉愉快。

總結一句話，

「好遊戲不玩嗎？」

不要買Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition
請買 Guacamelee! (STCE) + Guacamelee! 2

支持如此優秀的製作團隊，也是造福廣大的玩家能夠繼續玩到更優質的大作！

author: {'steamid': '76561198250525326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1187, 'last_played': 1548660897}
review:
*edit: differences from the Gold Edition listed at the bottom

Awesome game - just freaking awesome! A Metroidvania with amazing controls, a colorful and vibrant world, some silly tongue-in-cheek humor, a style like a zoot suit it has no trouble rocking. Some of the platforming can be pretty challenging and will require many retries; keyboard is DEFINITELY NOT the way to go with this game. Some of the optional Infierno challenges and some out of the way collectibles will REALLY test your platforming and combat skills.

Like a good Metroidvania, it's got movement-related powers to unlock, optional challenges, plenty of "hidden" collectibles - some actually really well hidden! - to find and power yourself up further. There's costumes you can buy from "silver" you earn in game that change up your character a little bit with new strengths and weaknesses i.e. regenerate health for slower stamina regen, take more damage but deal more damage, etc.

Combat is really fun and really ramps up as you unlock new powers that require stamina (each of them movement-based and color-coordinated) and upgrade your fighting moves with the coins you that drop from dead enemies and collectible chests. Once you damage enough an enemy you can grapple them and throw them for easy crowd control or a non-special "special" move to do a little extra damage to them. Some of the optional Infierno challenge rooms take away your abilitiy use special powers, dodging or grappling, and these may be unique challenges depending on your combat style. If you want those 100% cheevos and/or the alternative/true ending, you'll have to suck it up and get good. But it's a testament to how well the gameplay is designed when even failure after failure the challenge inspires you to get thing a little more perfect each time - shave off a second there, finally get that 120 hit combo (not as scary as it sounds), make that jump with that timing, etc.

I've yet to play the previous editions, but the Super Turbo Championship Edition (STCE) comes with the new "Intenso" mechanic from the PS4 version. It's a super meter that builds up with your kills and can be used to help you out with the worst challenges like being swarmed or not being quick enough to smash through shielded enemies' color-coded shields. It can even regenerate health, so it makes things a LOT easier at times. You may have to purchase some of those upgrades with the gold that drop from enemies though.

Oh, there's local co-op mode too. Up to four players can play at one time with two unique characters and two recolors. If you're playing with someone who isn't as coordinated as yourself, you might want to solo some of the platforming sections that have very tight time windows. I won't say precision timing because the game does give you a little leeway, but it can still be a very demanding window of time/opportunity at times.

This game is really fun, and strikes a good balance between the macabre (Mexican culture and death are VERY intertwined - if you've seen Pixar's Coco, you'd kind of understand what you'll be jumping into) and good-natured joking around. If you ever wanted your gaming experience to be more than going around and beating up random enemies, but rather performing as a kick-butt magical luchador/superhero for an audience of you? This is the perfect game for you. For those of you who didn't want that already, then this is the game you never knew you needed.

*edit: Having played the Gold Edition now, STCE is superior in every way. There's more areas to explore (with lore and sprawling beauty galore!), many more player-friendly tweaks like enemy health bars being displayed, no slight screen pause when an enemy is ready for grappling, the "shadow" enemies being the same black outline rather than some black and some white (though I see what you did there, devs), many formerly red-colored enemy attacks being re-done in glowing white and vice versa, all of which add to greater visibility, the deflation of gold items from the shop by adding new currency for costumes, mutliple save slots with costumes that carry over, new costumes like the pinata that helps you earn gold faster at the cost of being more fragile (a great challenge to add to your Hard mode run!), the added ability of Pollo Bomb adding just a little more exploration and a new cheevo, and Intenso for crowd control being much more appreciated... although the way they calculate combos is a little different - in Gold Edition you got +5 hits for grapple/throws and however enemies the thrown enemy hit, but in STCE the combo meter is much more stingy. Some of the meme-y artwork has been redone or removed, like I'm sure the house with Wario's portrait in Gold doesn't have it anymore in STCE. Still, both are great fun - although I may not have loved the game AS much if I'd started with the Gold Edition.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009405448', 'num_games_owned': 405, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 539, 'last_played': 1548617484}
review:
Played in January 2019.

It's a really good metroidvania. It has the typical collecting powerups so you can go back and collect health upgrades, etc. You even get abilities from knocking over Chozo statues!. Where it mixes the formula, it adds in a brawler mechanic, encouraging combos, and has some pretty intense platforming. But it respects your time - checkpoints are frequent, and backtracking is rare (except for when you want to go get some powerups). 

I'm not sure how I feel about the art style... I've never really been into the campy luchador thing, and this game uses that a lot. But the fundamental mechanics and gameplay were solid enough to pull me through.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070024706', 'num_games_owned': 387, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1548586526}

author: {'steamid': '76561198043066997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 864, 'last_played': 1552160595}
review:
This is the most complete edition of Guacamalee, Gold edition has less content.

A dynamic action platformer with Mexican flavour.

Not too hard to go through, but some parts will keep you on your toes. The optional content especially is challenging, some rooms will make you die a lot. I think it's a nice change of pace, if it proves too hard it can be safely ignored to move on to the story. Lots of fun ideas with platforms.

Combat is a nice touch too and is sometimes mixed with platform to the best effect.

If you are used to that kind of games, you might want to know that there is a hard mode that can be unlocked, either by beating the game once or checking the pinned thread... But you'd better not be affraid to die a lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008635209', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1548036206}

author: {'steamid': '76561198038168123', 'num_games_owned': 629, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 691, 'last_played': 1548002413}
review:
Excelente metroidvania, con un apartado estético que me encantó, una jugabilidad muy divertida y, sobre todo, un humor de lo más hilarante! Con muchísimas referencias a otros juegos tanto del género como de otros! XD

La verdad es que lo recomiendo muchísimo, me la pasé muy bien jugando, riendome a carcajadas con algunas cosas.

Me gustaría tener algo negativo que remarcar, pero la verdad es que no se me ocurre nada. No es el mejor metroidvania que he jugado (ese puesto lo sigue teniendo el Hollow Knight) pero cumple con lo que promete y uno lo pasa muy bien jugandolo. Recomendadísimo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009856414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 1044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1044, 'last_played': 1547394153}
review:
一开始是想跟老婆一起玩的，但很显然老婆根本玩不下去，因为太难了……

玩之前都不知道这游戏是个 Metroidvania，上手后被逐渐攀升的操作难度震惊了，也被精妙的设计吸引了，在我浅薄的 Metroidvania 游戏经历中，上一个有这般舒爽体验的游戏是 Ori and the Blind Forest，但 Guacamelee 这个游戏还要难得多。

完全符合墨西哥风俗的设定，活人世界和死后世界的转换，融合迷宫探索、精准动作操作、平台跳跃等等元素，这游戏完全是一个集大成者。

如果只是通关，7-8小时即可，难度逐渐攀升；但这还没完，如果要达成真结局，还要有一番收集 Luchador 面具的折腾，Tule Tree 的面具碎片获取堪称一大难点，还要在挑战关里打出10个金牌；但即便打出了真结局，也还有更多挑战关等着去攻克，部分挑战的难度简直了，成功打消了我全成就的念头。

总之从游戏体验和设计上看，这游戏都是一绝，值得一玩。等大促买2代了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198087118863', 'num_games_owned': 485, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1764, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1583, 'last_played': 1547266563}
review:
Guacamelee resultó ser una grata sorpresa. Si bien es un juego corto (me llevó 22 horas sacar casi todos los logros, me falta terminarlo en dificil), es muy divertido y entretenido. Destaco la jugabilidad la cual es muy fluida y brinda un gran repertorio de habilidades para los personajes, lo que sí, por momentos te saca canas verdes, sobre todo si se quiere sacar los ultimos secretos del juego. Otro punto es la música y banda sonora, la cual sienta muy bien con el ambiente propio del juego. Es una mezcla de ritmos típicos de México con sonidos y samples derivados del hip-hop, que dejan un resultado muy interesante y agradable durante la experiencia. Creo que el mayor punto a destacar es el humor que abunda en el juego. Todo el tiempo tira gags, guiños y referencias a otros juegos o elementos de la cultura gamer que creo más de uno va a poder identificar. Si bien yo lo terminé en solitario, el juego cuenta con modo multijuagador que permite hasta 4 jugadores en simultaneo de forma local, lo cual supongo sería una gran experiencia.
En conclusión juego corto y cumplidor, recomiendo comprarlo en oferta y creo que está muy bueno para rejugarlo en modo multijugador.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073536304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1656554573}
review:
Excelente juego estilo Metroidvania, lleno de referencias a otros juegos, un juego rapido, dinamico, con un exquisita jugabilidad lleno de nuevas habilidades que estaras obligado a utilizar para ir superando los puzzles y descubriendo el mapa, peleas a dificultad justa, moriras pero no hasta frustrarte, el sistema cooperativo esta muy bien implementado y ayuda a no estorbarse con el compañero o a depender directamente del compañero para avanzar como pasa en muchos juegos de este tipo, puede hacer uno u el otro el puzzle y el otro se vuelve una burbuja, el unico problema cooperativo es que puedes quitarle la camara a tu compañero pero es algo obvio en estos juegos y coordinando bien con tu partner no es algo molesto. Historia entretenida, bien narrada. Graficos agradables. Durabilidad creo que justa para que no se vuelva monotono y latero, en mi caso (coop-local) unas 7 horas aprox. en general muy buen juego creo que te no tengo nada malo que señalar. Totalmente Recomendado. 

Mi Nota: 9 / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198114572396', 'num_games_owned': 231, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1512138759}
review:
[h1]Al puro estilo Mexicano WEY!![/h1]

Arreglar los problemas a chinga-dazos :v como buen Mexicano.
Excelente juego de plataformas para pasar el rato, mas por su estilo Tacos al pastor. No se pero siendo yo mexicano el estereotipo que tienen del pais y nuestra cultura es algo chistoso jaja.

Algo complicado al principio pero conforme se avanza se va adquiriendo más práctica, es algo castrante luchar con ciertos enemigos que suele desesperar. Y pues para conseguir el 100% de los mapas se tiene que regresar una o varias veces a repasar los caminos.

Si eres una persona que se desespera al estancarse en un mismo punto por horas una y otra vez, este juego no es para ti :U.

[spoiler] :'v alv compa yo si me desesperé mientras jugaba, ya que no cuento con mucho tiempo libre sptm[/spoiler]

Controls are better than average but it is really eesy to make wong moves.

author: {'steamid': '76561198423307752', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 556, 'last_played': 1546185883}
review:
为什么？
我打的那么辛苦！终于打完boss！
竟然不给我一个完美结局！
还要收集什么面具碎片？？？
为了通关，我都换了几个手柄。。。不对，是换了几对手了！
唉，算了，我还是注定悲剧的。

操作、画风、BGM都很棒，很久没玩过这么爽的横版游戏了。
手残的就和我一样，随便通关，爽完就完事，千万不要追求什么完美结局，不然在收集面具的过程中，你会渐渐失去那股激情。
那些追求完美结局的，衷心鼓励，加油啊！

author: {'steamid': '76561198044310929', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 616, 'last_played': 1544591646}
review: La verdad es un superjuego, apenas lo terminé en modo cooperativo (2 jugadores) después de 9 horas. Al principio puede parecer un poco simplón, pero conforme avanzas los movimientos y los niveles adquieren más complejidad y profundidad. Ya para el final te quedas con ganas de jugar más. Sin embargo no diría que es un juego demasiado corto como dicen en otras reseñas, creo que la duración es adecuada. Es un juego con personalidad y es memorable, se nota que los desarrolladores le pusieron empeño. Afortunadamente ya salió el Guacamelee 2 para los que se quedaron con ganas de más.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097148019', 'num_games_owned': 148, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1073, 'last_played': 1545223456}
review:
This game is fun, well designed, pretty and the music's great.
Progressing in this game is a real pleasure as the new abilites you get are fun, useful all the time (and not just after you get them) and exploration never feels boring or unnecessary, as it always rewards you with a fun challenge and a chest at the end (with stuff like money to buy upgrades, hearth/skull/talisman pieces to upgrade your health/stamina/"ultimate" bar) and maybe items that unlock the true ending.
Plataforming and combat are also great.
I had a real blast with this game and even going for 100% (which includes a second playtrough on hard mode), I feel I can still play once more without getting burnt out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078638229', 'num_games_owned': 333, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 885, 'last_played': 1588171856}
review:
Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition is the definitive edition of Guacamelee!, adding more content to the original game. IMO its not worth having both. I shouldve done a research before buying the pack.

Guacamelee runs almost perfectly in my computer, which means that enigma itself would be able to run this. 

Level design is pretty nice, but it has the "well, i want most people to not 100% the game, so i will create an extremely difficult area that barely makes any sense". Idk which one of you game devs invented this bullshit, but it accomplishes nothing. Would be perfect if not by that.

The attention to detail is fantastic. I cannot imagine the amount of effort they put into visuals. Looks really fu**ing amazing.

Play with the controller. i mean, you only feel the difference when doing the pollo combos or the infierno challenges, but still.

Story is a bit generical (become luchador, save mujer), but the characters are pretty well done and it makes perfect sense.

I wasnt expecting anything from the soundtrack, but god damn, it amazing. The Desierto Caliente one is my favorite. I dislike the boss one, tho. Doesnt fit.

I wish to see more games based around a specific culture in the future.

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197993240792', 'num_games_owned': 744, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1543881026}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009166712', 'num_games_owned': 1406, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1050, 'last_played': 1558632345}
review:
At the time of writing this, this is my absolute favorite metroid-vania themed game.

[b]Pros: (From my Guacamelee! Gold Edition review.)[/b]
-It's easy to pick up and play.
-The combat is fantastic, attacks feel like they have weight to them and dodging attacks is super satisfying.
-The music has a great mix between traditional mariachi with a combination of electronic and chiptune. It sounds weird but it really does flow well together. 
-Workshop support to create and download custom outfits for your luchador, as well as unlockable outfits and abilities in-game.
-And just the overall charm. The art, visuals, music and gameplay really flow well together.

[b]But that's just that's just relating to the previous version. Pros I also adore from this version:[/b]
-Even more content! Completely new areas, enemies and even a new boss.
-Controls for hanging off walls / ledges feel so much better now.
-2 more additional save slots. Finally you no longer have to detail your previous save if you wanna start a new game.
-Tostada (The Co-op character) actually got more backstory. People may overlook this but I thought this was a nice touch.
-Removed a majority of the memes from the previous version and replaced them with video game references.
-Removed all the epileptic seizure problems that plagued the previous game as well. This version is safe to play!

[b]Cons:[/b]
-Co-op is restricted to local co-op only. (However this can be fixed using programs like Parsec.)

I really don't have much to complain about. This is the definitive way to play this game, I highly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040303801', 'num_games_owned': 439, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1450936130}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198088043194', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 632, 'last_played': 1541306245}
review:
I got this game from the Not a Metroidvania bundle and, based on other metroidvania games I played, this game is great.

Gameplay
----------
This metroidvania game focuses on platforming and fighting (mostly wrestling moves since you are a luchador). The platforming is fairly difficult but fun for me (since I love challenging platformers). I do sometimes find controlling the character to be a bit clunky and finicky, but overall satisfying. I find the fighting gameplay fun to do. You can do combos, but I do not find them too useful. I can get away with it by repeatily hitting and suplexing them.

Characters & Story
--------------------
The style makes me think of Lucha Mucha. Many metroidvania games tend to be gloomy and dark, but the look of the game is the complete opposite. I really like the character designs and personalities. The story is simple and easy to follow. The jokes in the game are pretty funny, although some of them miss the target in my opinion. Of all the games I played, this video game has SO MANY REFERENCES! They are not bad; I find them interesting and fun to see.

World Design
--------------
I find the world and level design to be solid. It is mostly linear with objectives to help you know where to go. The colorful design of the blockades allow you to know exactly what skill to use to destroy them to progress. Some people find that annoying, but I find it useful as it allows me to know if I am able to access an area just by looking at the map. The map itself is not blocky like some of the other metroidvania games and the areas in the map get revealed as you explore.

Bosses
-------
There are bosses in the game, but you don't fight them until the second-half of the game. The boss fight designs are pretty good. I was able to easily figure out how to beat them. In other words, the bosses were not annoying.

Music
------
The music is upbeat and exciting. I like that it fits with the Mexican-style theme along with some synthisized sounds.

Overall
--------
If you are looking for a metroidvania game with fun and challenging platforming and fighting, along with a fun atmosphere, get this game. I really enjoyed myself playing this game and it is on my top 5 favorite metroidvania games.

review:
As a metroidvania style game, Gucamelee! is full of charm and character. The controls are good and the art style, while appearing simple, is unique and the game works with them. The optional outfits provide the player a variety of methods to play as. In addition, the skills are introduced in a metroid manner, with a humorous npc describing them.

I would highly recommend this for fans of the metroidvania style genre, or if you want to have a good laugh and enjoy a fun game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198398478327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1610310489}
review:
[h1]Incredible game (chickens)![/h1]
Played this both alone and with two other people, and the plaforming, together with the hectic combat and fluid dodging, make for a great experience ([i]CHICKENS[/i])! Each new move feels like a natural and necessary addition ([b]C H I C K E N S[/b]), as if they are pieces of a puzzle fitting in. The dimention switching platforming feels amazing, and makes you feel really smart for pulling them off ([spoiler]POLLOS![/spoiler])
The soundtrack is awesome, each song fits really well and they even change slightly when traversing dimentions.
The bosses are a disappointment, though. But that's about the only negative I have with the game.

11/0.1 - Needed more chickens.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025476828', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 994, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 994, 'last_played': 1542045935}
review:
I'm not a huge fan of the mexican culture, and so it unfortunately tended to detract from the gameplay for me, but the game is still great. It's a fantastic example of metroidvania gameplay. Some of the levels tended to feel a bit more linear than I'd like.

It's got good, tight combat controls. I only ever got annoyed by little things here in there, as an example there appears to be a frame or two while swapping between moving and standing still where the game won't allow either of the special moves (there's one while moving and separate one while standing still). This on rare occasion resulted in me pushing the special attack button and nothing happening. It was pretty rare though. Dodging breaks you out of most animations, as it should. Good gameplay mechanics and creative use of them kept the game interesting. Good platforming challenges. I have no substantial complaints.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085638436', 'num_games_owned': 277, 'num_reviews': 162, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1527470773}
review:
Lançaram o jogo como se fosse uma continuação ou aprimoramento do anterior, mas na verdade é quase igual. Alguns jogos que fizeram coisas semelhantes que tenho na biblioteca: Gas Guzzlers e Dark Souls 2, onde lançam uma versão melhorada, mas mantém o jogo antigo para que o jogador compre sem saber, e assim saindo no prejuízo.

Agora vamos ao jogo. Primeiramente, que trilha sonora chata (principalmente a da cidade), tira qualquer vontade de alguém de tentar zerar o jogo, juntamente com o combate e puzzles meia-boca, o jogo se torna massante em pouco tempo.
Recomendo apenas se pretende jogar co-op com alguém.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038133830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 683, 'last_played': 1540258486}
review:
Guacamelee is a 2D beat-em-up platformer in a comedic Mexican setting. I've heard it described as a Metroidvania because it allows backtracking and because the level design is occasionally non-linear, but don't expect to do a lot of exploring for secrets here. The main emphasis is on combat and platforming, and these are done really well.

The beginning of the game is pretty easy, but the difficulty does increase over time and it gets hard by the end. You really have to have quick reflexes and good timing to beat some of the later parts and the optional challenges. High-skill players will likely find this acceptable, as long as they're willing to endure a few easy hours at the beginning. Low-skill players might find too many frustrating roadblocks. It's kind of unfortunate that there is no option to make the game consistently easy or consistently hard. Instead we're all stuck with a compromise option that isn't perfect for anyone. There is a hard mode, but it only unlocks after you beat the game once, so there's no getting around this problem. It's not a huge problem though...just understand what you're getting into here.

I have mixed feelings about the flavor and presentation. I hated the incessant mariachi music and turned it off after a few hours. I like the Mexican setting, the art style, and the animation. The story really isn't great though. The main character has basically no personality at all; he's just a mute luchador. The plot is the same thing we've seen in a thousand other games: villains are making trouble all over the world, and they kidnap your girlfriend, so now you have a reason to travel around and beat them up. It's supposed to be comedic but most of the humor didn't work for me. I do love Flameface though.

So really the main reason to play this game is that the combat is very good. Considered purely as a beat-em-up, it's one of the best of its kind. There's a good variety of moves, and the controls are great for the most part. The dodge roll is a little unforgiving - you really have to have perfect timing with it - so I wish they would have loosened that up slightly, but that's my only real complaint about the move set.

A lot of the enemies are just skeletons, but they come in different types and occur in enough different settings so it doesn't feel too monotonous. There are some other enemies too, and all of them are fun to fight. The boss fights are a particular highlight, and I wish there were more of them. The final boss is very fun, memorable, and challenging.

The game performs reasonably well on a technical level, but there are a few hiccups. I experienced one camera glitch, but it fixed itself after a few seconds. There are loading screens - a bit unusual for a 2D game - but they are pretty quick.

It took me around 8 hours to beat Guacamelee, and for the most part it was pretty enjoyable. I would recommend it to just about every fan of challenging beat-em-ups, and I think you could enjoy playing through it more than once.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065539562', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1326, 'last_played': 1540717006}

author: {'steamid': '76561197963269143', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 795, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 795, 'last_played': 1444866267}
review: This is an awesome Metroidvania.  It's like Super Metroid, only with an additional Light World/Dark World mechanic.  And you play as a luchador instead of Samus.  Most of the combat moves are actually integrated into the environment puzzles as well.  One thing to keep in mind...this is a VERY difficult game, especially some of the puzzles.  I'm currently playing this game on the Switch - the last time I played the PC version it didn't work properly with an Xbox One controller, but I'm sure that's been fixed by now.  But this is well worth the cost.  I obviously recommend picking it up on Switch rather than a PC if you have one (the game is identical on all platforms graphically - and the portability of the Switch version sells it).  But if you don't, the PC version is definitely worth a look as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044205078', 'num_games_owned': 413, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1534136066}
review:
Con la reciente salida de Guacamelee 2, vale la pena revisitar esta primera entrega para ver qué la hace un juego tan especial.

Guacamelee es un juego 2D del sub-género Metroidvania en su estado más puro. Es decir, exploramos un mapa abierto en el cual vamos desbloqueando habilidades a medida que avanzamos, las cuales a su vez nos permiten acceder a nuevos lugares del mapa. En este sentido, no se está haciendo nada extraordinario ni innovador.

No obstante, cada elemento está implementado de forma impecable, el movimiento es fluido, el mapa está bien diseñado, el ritmo del juego está bien desarrollado y el combate es simplemente espectacular, de lejos el punto más fuerte del juego.  A todo ello lo complementa un estilo artístico precioso y único basado en la cultura y el folclor mexicano que le da su propia personalidad.

El juego se puede terminar en unas 6 u 8 horas, pero las distintas dificultades, los trajes desbloqueables, los mods y la opción para comparar nuestro tiempo en speedruns con el de otros jugadores en internet, le dan una rejugabilidad bastante alta para su precio. A pesar de no ser particularmente retador, es un juego al que todo el mundo puede acceder.

Recomendadísimo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157594460', 'num_games_owned': 547, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 1174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 936, 'last_played': 1701459290}
review:
El metroidvania mexicano, es un gusto que hayan representantes latinos dispuestos a demostrar lo que es capaz la industria de los videojuegos en esta region, aunque en ciertas ocaciones llega a ser dificil, no es algo con lo que un poco de practica no pueda solucionar
Si eres latino o eres un amante de los metroidvania, tienes que jugar este juego

review: Un juego que muestra la percepcion del contexto mexicano clasico que se tiene a nivel mundial, un juego plataformero muy entretenido, colorido y divertido que recuerda a las clasicas sagas de metroidvania.

author: {'steamid': '76561198197775993', 'num_games_owned': 375, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1732, 'last_played': 1539929818}
review: I was initially unsure of this game. When I first saw it I wasnt sold on like art style so I held off for awhile until a friend of mine got it, and said that they were enjoying it (and we both thought it had online multiplayer, not just local). So I decided to buy it and give it a try. It did not disapoint. This game was so much fun, and quite funny actually. There was so many little easter eggs in the game, and just all around making fun of metroidvania games as a whole in a loving sort of way that tully made a great and (like I said) funny game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975388306', 'num_games_owned': 1069, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 698, 'last_played': 1538954229}
review: A Metroidvania with a sense of humour, which is rare enough as it is, but it's also got melee-centred combat. The Mexican-inspired art and music are both gorgeously done. There are cool unlocks and plenty of side quests. My only complaints, really, are how outrageous some of the platforming can become, and that some of the bosses feel too punishing for an otherwise-not-so-difficult game. I'll definitely be grabbing the sequel sometime soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198329965394', 'num_games_owned': 435, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1377, 'last_played': 1539726281}

Ya lo he completado y pienso volver a hacerlo en modo difícil.

review: Divertidísimo metroidvania que rezuma carisma por los cuatro costados gracias a su ambientación de Día de Muertos y por la gran cantidad de referancias hacia los videojuegos y al cine que expone, aunque peca por su corta duración, pero como se dice "lo bueno y breve, es dos veces bueno".

author: {'steamid': '76561198061092032', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1536951224}
review: I really wanted to like this game, but it didn't grab me like I expected it to. After completing Hollow Knight 112%, I was hungry for more, and Guacamelee didn't scratch that itch. I really enjoyed being able to switch to a female character, but the controls didn't feel as fluid as I was expecting, and it was more combat based, rather than platform/puzzle based. The game is beautiful, funny and the sound track is good, but it just wasn't what I was wanting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198207251465', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2901, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1012, 'last_played': 1689834515}
review: Si estás leyendo esto es porque te gustan los metroidvanias, este juego tiene todo lo que buscas, aparte de diversión y un estilo visual que lo hace muy agradable de jugar

author: {'steamid': '76561198174890498', 'num_games_owned': 341, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 849, 'last_played': 1538783708}
review:
Guacamelee. Um metroidvania INCRÍVEL, com sua temática mexicana muito divertida. O jogo é repleto de referências que é impossível não notar nenhuma. Os cenários são muito coloridos, a gameplay é muito viciante e a trilha sonora é muito boa.

A história infelizmente pra mim, é clichê. Uma princesa que foi raptada por um cara mal e você tem que passar por um inferno pra salvar ela. Vamos combinar que a gente já viu isso muitas vezes pelo nosso amigo bigodudo (tanto porque tem uma referência a isso em um diálogo). Mas tirando isso,o jogo é muito bom e engraçado.

 A dificuldade do jogo não é baixa, você vai sentir raiva em diversos momentos. Eu deixo meus créditos pro final, que eu simplesmente fiquei tão nervoso que dei uma pausa de algumas horas pra acalmar.

É um jogo bom demais, bem curto, da pra zerar em algumas horas, muitos coletáveis e desafios para se cumprir, algumas conquistas que vale a pena tentar pegar e um grande mapa para se explorar. 

Enfim, Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition 10/10 recomendo!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198369468238', 'num_games_owned': 1324, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 789, 'last_played': 1538654722}
review:
Diese Version läuft wenigstens im Gegensatz zu der Vorgänger Version....
Es ist ein nettes Spiel mit vielen humoristischen Verweisen auf Klassikern wie Metroid, Super Mario usw.
Hier & dort etwas nervig kniffelig, aber dennoch ohne Probleme zu meistern. Es hat auch sehr viel Spaß gemacht. Wenn Teil 2 im Sale ist, werde ich mir das auch noch holen.
Für alle die auch überlegen sich dieses Spiel zu holen: Das Geld für die "Guacamelee! Gold Edition" könnt ihr Euch sparen, denn es scheint quasi das gleiche Spiel zu sein, wie die "Turbo Championship Edition", nur das es ständig einfriert und man es über den Taskmanager beenden muss.
