author: {'steamid': '76561198054057140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2032, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2030, 'last_played': 1581870698}
review: Somehow, I only remembered I bought this game due to seeing Guacamelee 2 now being available. My biggest regret is not playing this earlier! Really fun and controls are tight. Probably a bit on the harder side but if you've played megaman x before, this is slightly easier. Completing 100% requires challenging platforming but they never felt unfair (yes, even the dreaded "most frustrating area of the game" seems unfair at first but after studying that part more and enough practice, you will be able to finish it). Enjoyed it so much I finished all achievements save for beating it in hard mode - will probably do that later on though. All in all, very good and unfortunately underrated game

author: {'steamid': '76561198035908252', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1535381008}
review: It probably has the best power of all metroidvania, transform you into a chicken. I think it's enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047661279', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1037, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1037, 'last_played': 1537015326}
review:
Guacamelee is a campy platformer inspired by the the metroidvania format and set in a mexican universe.
I fond it quite enjoyable, though a bit short/linear.

Pros:
-Solid gameplay and mostly gameplay focused.
-Challenge always ramps up and involves new unlocked abilities.
-Some higher difficulty optional interactions
-A lot of humour and pop culture references
-Character progression is simple, but I find it works very well due to the eccentric personas

Neutral
-Muliplayer - not sure how that works as I played strictly solo.

Negatives:
-Overall it's on the easy side. (though this may be a positive for some people, as my experience of difficulty may be different)
-Short - I got ~17.3h after beating it twice - once 100% on normal, and a second quick run on hard (with the viper skin which made me die in 1 or 2 hits for a bit of extra challenge)
-Linear - backtracking and exploration are minimal and entirely optional, though they are there. Based on this it's also difficult to classify this game as a metroidvania.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117689758', 'num_games_owned': 1258, 'num_reviews': 420, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1486397875}
review: guud game

author: {'steamid': '76561198027264523', 'num_games_owned': 861, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1536802557}
review:
VIDEO REVIEW:
https://youtu.be/8ExjUMAK3Yg

Metroidvanias are a dime a dozen these days, to the point where the best way for a Metroidvania title to distinguish itself is to either be incredibly good or have a high-concept art style. Thankfully, "Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition" fits both criteria, trading in the dread, loneliness, and isolation endemic of the genre for bright colours and a sense of fun and frivolity. With gorgeous art and vivid, lively gameplay, "Guacamelee!" is the life of the party in the Land of the Dead.


STORY
"Guacamelee!" takes place in a funhouse-mirror version of Mexico, where Luchador wrestlers are literal superheroes who save the day for the local villagers. Carlos Calaca, a man who was once tricked by the Devil and has taken over Hell in retribution, kills our protagonist Juan and kidnaps the Mexican President's daughter as part of a ritual to merge the worlds of the living and dead. Juan is destined to become the next guardian Luchador after finding a special Lucha mask in the underworld. Juan and his new companion Tostada go out to save the day with the help of Uay Chivo, a cranky mentor and shapeshifting goat who hides special powers for Juan in Choozo statues - not that he likes it when they're broken.

The story is rich with telenovela melodrama; the game knows this and plays it all for equal parts comedy and drama. The lively characters have a lot to do with this, especially the villains. Calaca himself is a bit generic, but the villain ensemble more than makes up for him. Flame Face is a literally hotheaded drunkard who never seems to learn that his guns need reloading; X'tabay desperately wants to be a femme fatale but is having relationship troubles with her uncaring boyfriend Calaca; The Trio of Death is a hilarious boss that combines musical gimmicks with parodies of kickstarters; and Javier Jaguar is this game's version of Ridley from "Metroid", a proud and honourable warrior who will fight Juan to the death without any gimmicks in a pure test of strength.

It's a funny, entertaining romp through affectionate exaggerations of Mexican culture, and will leave you chuckling right to the end.


PRESENTATION
What really makes "Guacamelee!" stand out is the aesthetic. This game is both a giddy tribute and lampooning of Mexico and its traditions and history, referencing everything from Dia de los Muertos to Olmec colossal heads to charreada. It's also a gentle parody of Mexico's passion for Lucha Libre wrestling, and the near-folkloric status given to Luchadores like El Santo, Místico, and Blue Demon; in fact, the design of Juan's mask draws heavily from Blue Demon's iconic mask.

The art style is gorgeous, and every character is painstakingly animated and flows beautifully. The only exception is X'tabay, oddly enough; her hair has a noticeable loop that resets during certain animations. In the grand scheme of things, however, it's an incredibly small nitpick, as the rest of the game's animation is so expressive and beautifully crafted. It's also complemented by a catchy and inventive soundtrack by Peter Chapman and Rom Di Prisco, which can best be described as Chiptune Mariachi Electronica.

The PC version runs fairly well, though I ran into some issues in windowed mode when recording footage for my video review. While full screen supports every resolution imaginable, the bordered window mode is locked at 720p and doesn't support automatic resizing to any other resolution; players will have to manually resize the window and potentially get a stretched-out screen, or hit the Maximize Window button and play the game at 720p upscaled to 1080p or 4K. The game also V-sync in windowed mode; though thankfully anti-aliasing and shadows can be toggled in windowed mode, an upgrade from the previous "Gold Edition" release. Despite these issues, I only experienced framerate stuttering and slowdown once or twice in the five hours it took to beat this game, and it looks amazing no matter what the resolution.


GAMEPLAY
While its aesthetic is new and exciting, "Guacamelee!"'s gameplay is deeply rooted in tradition, borrowing heavily from both namesakes of the Metroidvania genre. Up to four players explore a large, interconnected map, acquiring new abilites and conquering three main dungeons, two mini-dungeon detours, and a final level. The game combines the large-scale combat, heavy cutscenes, clear mission objectives and dual-world gameplay of "Castlevania: Symphony of the Night"; with the focus on item collection and heavy backtracking of the "Metroid" series. The current mission objective is always clearly labeled on the map, but rarely will the player be forced to seek it out.

Juan's moveset combines speed and fighting prowess, with a double jump, dodge, wall jump, late game equivalents to “Super Metroid”’s speed booster and shinespark, and a chicken form with limited combat that is an obvious nod to Samus' Morph Ball. Juan is also able to jump between the worlds of the living and dead, at first using portals, and later with a simple button press, which is used for both puzzles and combat. The controls feel pitch perfect, whether in human or chicken form, and the platforming is excellently balanced and well-designed, with a good difficulty curve on the main path and difficult challenge rooms that reward the player with upgrades to their stamina and health bar.

What truly distinguishes "Guacamelee!" from the Metroidvania crowd is its titular melee system. Instead of guns, swords, or space lasers, Juan, Tostada and company use the power of fisticuffs and Lucha Libre. All fights are hand-to-hand, with one attack button, a grapple, and five special moves tied to the B button with directional influence. These moves can be used both in combat and to break special barriers blocking passage to new areas, but use up stamina. Every move can be cancelled with a dodge, and almost every enemy attack can in turn be dodged with the right timing, which makes combat fast, energetic, and frantic, though depending on the position of the camera, it can sometimes be easy to lose track of Juan in all the chaos. The game further encourages aggressive play by making Juan invincible while grappling. These wrestling finishers are very powerful, though it is fairly amusing to see Juan using a piledriver despite the move apparently being illegal in Lucha Libre.

While it’s pretty clear by now that I love this game, I do some have some small but notable issues. Canal de las Flores and Pico de Gallo, two new side areas added for this edition of the game, are bolted onto the story path in a blatantly obvious fashion. Canal de las Flores also has a gimmick unique to the area, rotating platforms with spikes on one side, that is completely at odds with the rest of the game's platforming, and slows the pace of the level unnecessarily. Additionally, the game has pallette-swapped "Elite" enemies in the late-game. I don't mind enemy recycling normally, but the Elites in "Guacamelee!" are unfair and cheap; not only are their attacks way too powerful, but they can teleport after taking too much damage, will randomly appear in another part of the arena (usually right next to Juan) and immediately attack with little time to react. The game also has a habit of placing one or two Elite enemies in a group of regular foes, making it very difficult to keep track of which is which.


CONCLUSION
"Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition" is a blast to play. It's fun, funny, challenging, colourful, and it just feels good. This is the second rerelease of an already great game, and by this point, nearly every kink has been ironed out, leaving an impeccable experience that deserves to be played by everyone, Metroidvania fan or not.

VERDICT: 5/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198064783185', 'num_games_owned': 854, 'num_reviews': 275, 'playtime_forever': 521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 485, 'last_played': 1536850761}
review:
Un Metroidvania basado en el folklore mexicano del día de los muertos, donde encarnaremos a Juan, un pobre campesino que se convierte en luchador para salvar la tierra y rescatar a la hija del presidente.
PROS:
- Aunque la historia no es increíble, cumple bien su trabajo
- Gráficamente es genial, y te gustará pasar entre el mundo de los vivos y los muertos solo para ver como es en 'el otro lado'.
- Las habilidades que recibes las utilizarás durante todo el juego, tanto para las partes de plataforma como para los combates, y ninguna queda en el olvido, cosa que se agradece. 
- Personajes, aunque pocos, son carismáticos.
- Durante la mayoría del juego, se hace ameno y con una dificultad adecuada, sin parecer demasiado fácil pero sin que sea frustrante.
- Secciones de plataformas en las que a veces tendrás que plantearlo como un puzzle.
CONTRAS:
- Aunque el combate en general es agradable, al igual que los controles, la esquiva en el aire es un poco extraña, y no siempre te evade, al igual que si golpeas primero, a veces recibes golpe y otras no.
- La sección final del juego (el templo) creo que es la peor zona con diferencia. Sí que es verdad que exige todo lo que has aprendido, pero se me ha hecho demasiado largo. Además, el boss final, en ambas fases, al inicio puede ser extremadamente frustrante, ya que tienes que aprenderte los ataques al milímetro para no recibir daño (con cuatro tortas te mata) y evitar atacar con todo, dejándote atacar solo un golpe entre ataques suyos, todo lo contrario al resto del juego, donde se busca obtener mayor número de combo y utilizar todo lo que tienes.
FINAL:
Apenas son cosas malas las que le veo al juego, y queda bastante recomendado, sobretodo para los amantes de los metroidvania. 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198207868297', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 1005, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1666828562}
review:
Guacamelee desborda carisma, identidad y brillantez, aunque es muy cierto que no es innovador y no arriesga en su propuesta, es un titulo muy solido que no te dejara indiferente.
Hablo desde mi experiencia habiendo jugado La Gold Edition y ahora esta STC Edition, sin duda esta ultima revision del titulo original es la más completa y extraordinaria aventura mexicana, añadiendo algunas zonas nuevas, poderes y personajes, una obra sobresaliente que todo amante del estilo metroidvania debe probar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167173649', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 1001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 887, 'last_played': 1624547259}
review:
TL:DR - Better version than Gold addition, added detail and area and feels more fleshed out, best with a controller


This is going to be almsot same as my GOLD EDITION review but this game improves and fixes what was wrong with that version.
This one has another area and even tells the backstory to a character that was treated like NAVI for the most part. 
Area's have also been improved with added detail to houses and dialouge to characters that needed it so nice touch in some cutscenes.

I am glad they fixed the flashing screen when you get a power-up or collectable completed. It is more pleasing to the eyes and not annoying to sit through.

The music is nice and art style is just beautiful to look at specially in an added area they included in this version. 
Out of both versions this one is a clear winner. It is satisfying to pull off big combos and dodging feels so smooth to keep the combo's going.


The only BUG I found however and it can be a game breaker for some, is the new enemy type. They can teleport around the areana, problem is 3 times they have teleported (1 at the start and 2 at the final area before the final boss) have teleported outside the areana and not came back, forcing me to quit and start where it last saved. Can be annoying to have this happen specially in hard-mode.


I understand why they sold this as its own thing and not upgraded it on the GOLD EDITION but even if they did I feel it would of meant players having to lose their save file due to different chest locations, some chests changing what they have and even some challenges are easier/harder than the other version. It would of been too hard to transfer it over safely without players losing everything or messing up what they had collected.
I can only hope those who had the GOLD EDITION got a discount when this one came out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982928934', 'num_games_owned': 353, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1075, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1074, 'last_played': 1686674227}
review:
Um jogo sensacional com uma enorme variedade de puzzles que, em muitos momentos, realmente te desafiam.
Muito divertido e te leva a querer dominar os combos e especiais.
A história é um tanto quanto simples, mas nem por isso deixa de ser cativante, tanto que ao terminar os bosses, te garanto que vai querer correr atrás dos tesouros que ficaram pra trás e reunir todos os coletáveis, além de querer completar com excelencia os desafios no inferno (não deixe de conferir esses, haja vista que podem passar batidos ao completar sua história). 
Copiei até aqui da minha análise da versão gold,  agora falarei um pouco do modo "muy macho" exclusivo dessa versão. 
Muy macho nos da uma sensação de poder incrível que combina muito bem com a história, abre opção de diversas combinações de poder com fantasias diferentes e me fez tentar platinar o jogo (ainda sofrendo no modo hard sendo o último troféu pra conquistar)

author: {'steamid': '76561197991845568', 'num_games_owned': 2241, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 813, 'last_played': 1535141223}
review:
Before playing Guacamelee 2, I wanted to refresh the first game, because only thing I've remembered was that it was short, tearing my hair out, because I was playing on keyboard and drama with re-release not being free for owners of the original.
I remember Gold being heavy on my eyes and having to take breaks after one hour of playing, because I was getting headaches and even though I had no history with epilepsy, this game was tiresome to play.
With this edition, they thankfuly got rid off of all of the crazy flashing and contrast is much lighter, so if you had problems like I did with the original, you should grab this one. Game also got some improvements and is slightly longer, because they added some stages. There is also intenso mode, which is really cool addition.
But for the game itself.
I remember not being impressed by it back then, but now by playing STCE and all those years passing by, I fell in love with this game. Graphics are beautiful and mexican style of everything feels right and is perfect. 
Combat isn't boring and doesn't go stale. 
Soundtrack is wonderful.
Platforming and stage design is almost top notch, because it can get incredibly annoying sometimes when camera is too zoomed in and you don't know where you have to go. But overall stages are well crafted, especially last temple. I absolutely love what they did there and instead of going with convoluded, overcomplicated and tiresome stuff, they did one giant temple without labirynth stuff (like for example Skyward Sword - personally, I hated final cube dungeon). You need all of your powers, but it is not tiresome at all, but as fun as all of the other temples!
There is full plethora of jokes, references and easter eggs and most of them are fit very well and are fun.
Thing that could've been better are the bosses - nothing more than bumrush and many of them suck hard.
There is also story that gets in the way or in the middle of boss fight. While the story itself is ok, it sucks that you can't skip it.
Other thing little disappointing is lack of content  - it takes around 10-12 hours to 100% the save and if you just want to be done with it and don't care, it's around 5-6 hours, which in my opinion is incredibly short. But it is somewhat replayable, so that's a good thing.
So to sum it up, overall excellent game and I enjoyed every single minute of it. If you didn't play it and miss some good ol' Metroid, but already played Hollow Knight to death, pick this one up. Pure fun and joy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062025694', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 312, 'playtime_forever': 945, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 945, 'last_played': 1535147095}
review:
Un metroidvania de los que vale la pena jugar.

El juego está ambientado a la mexicana, donde somos un luchador que intenta salvar a la hija del presidente que es secuestrada (una princesa secuestrada y que debemos rescatar, es uno de los varios guiños que veremos a Mario Bros.).

La jugabilidad es es bien fluída, hay que usar hartos botones en este juego, y a veces, se tornan levemente enredados, sobre todo en niveles donde necesitamos mayor habilidad motriz. Comenzamos con combos simples, y a medida que avanzamos vamos adquiriendo super golpes que nos permiten abrir nuevos sectores en los niveles, una situación típica en los metroidvania, donde a medida que tengamos más poderes, debemos ir rejugando niveles para encontrar más cosas ocultas (aunque para terminar el juego no es necesario, sólo para los que quieren sacar el 100%).

Hay una buena variedad de enemigos, los jefes no son muchos pero no se sienten repetitivos en general los enemigos.

La banda sonora es bastante buena (otro guiño a Mario), y el estilo visual también acompaña de buena manera el juego.

Muy recomendable para los gustosos y nuevos del genero.

review: Del estilo de juegos de Metroidvania nos llega este platformer con tintes de cultura mexicana, ejecutado de manera excelete con una historia entretenida y jugabilidad refinada, Guacamelee nos da horas de diversión garantizadas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043712617', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 639, 'last_played': 1534639065}
review:
Com gráficos vetoriais simples, super coloridos e de excelente bom gosto. Somados a uma trilha sonora boa o suficiente para não ser irritante ainda que não boa o suficiente para ser marcante, Guacamelee STCE não inova em nada, porém faz tudo o que propõe fazer da maneira correta. Mistura de forma satisfatórias elementos dos gêneros MetroidVania, plataforma e Beat'n'up. Garantindo assim uma boa experiência de gameplay de uma forma geral.
Os cenários receberam uma bocado de atenção da DrinkBox studio e de longe formam o elemento mais bem feito e marcante desse título.
Como pontos baixo Guacamelee STCE tem a exploração. Você até tem uma margem para isso porém, ela e seus bônus (power ups) não são tão necessárias para uma boa experiência ao do gameplay e como outro ponto baixo tem a curva de dificuldade do jogo, você não terá muitas dificuldades em passar pelos desafios mesmo que ignore os vários power up's que o jogo praticamente esfrega em sua cara.
Um jogo divertido, bonito e de certa forma relaxante (graças a sua dificuldade não muito elevada)
Um título 7/10 que vale à pena jogar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025848743', 'num_games_owned': 615, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 1431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1401, 'last_played': 1532187402}
review:
Beating Guacamelee took me a long time. More than once I quit in frustration and made breaks. Before the last break, I made it to the final battle against Calaca but quit again in despair. Another break of two weeks and new motivation helped. I finally did it, six weeks after starting it. In hindsight, the final battle wasn't that difficult once I figured out what to do and used the chicken costume to regain some health.

I really like the style of this game. The luchador theme is gorgeous, the graphics and the sound fit perfectly. The platforming is challenging and the fights were tough. Guacamelee's difficulty is at the limit of what is manageable for me. Some scenes were frustrating and I needed many tries and luck to pass them. Any Metroidvania harder than this will be too much for me but I'm glad that I played and finished this one. I would have rated it even better if it hadn't raised my frustration level to great heights at times.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995684381', 'num_games_owned': 1062, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 904, 'last_played': 1534208546}
review: The art is good, the music is fun, the characters are entertaining, but the game is not. The stretches between interesting parts like bossfights are too long, and filled with nothing much except samey "punch punch throw" combat. Even the special moves aren't a whole more than dashing in different cardinal directions. Seriously, there's a special move that's "Dash up", another one for "Dash forward", and one for "Dash down". And another for "Dash up a wall". The repetition just sets in too quickly. Combine that with a lot of backtracking and you get something you can examine yourself because I've already moved on to something else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025478065', 'num_games_owned': 736, 'num_reviews': 355, 'playtime_forever': 582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 582, 'last_played': 1529824425}
review:
Guacamelee est un metroidvania avec un combat de beat'em up dans un univers puisant dans le folklore mexicain.
C'est un jeu très sympathique avec des graphismes chatoyants et un système de combat plaisant. J'aime bien les personnages, notamment [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1466664153]ce pistolero en flammes[/url] dont je raffole.

Un problème récurrent des metroidvania est qu'on ne peut annoter les cartes. Ici, les obstacles sont indiqués par la couleur du pouvoir nécessaire pour les traverser donc je ne me suis jamais perdu.
Le jeu a une durée de vie tout à fait correcte même s'il y a une baisse de qualité dans la dernière section.
Il n'y a pas tant de différence que ça par rapport à la version précédente (la Gold Edition). Je n'ai pas essayé le mode en coopération.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993566384', 'num_games_owned': 1241, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4009, 'last_played': 1588040447}
review: So, I have probably spent way more time in this game than is needed, so I can honestly say this is an amazing game. I have loved it from the first time I played it. The music and aesthetics are just absolutely mind blowing. The controls are incredibly tight to the point that if you mess up, it does feel like your fault. The story is where is lacks a little. It's your generic evil bad guy kidnaps the damsel and you rescue her. The damsel isn't even given a name other than El Presidente's Daughter, which i hope will change in the sequel. The challenges are just about right, the only exception being that on hard mode, with a partner, it is really hard, to the point where it is easier to go solo. Honestly I can't wait for the sequel!

author: {'steamid': '76561198263316031', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 462, 'playtime_forever': 624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 624, 'last_played': 1533009405}
review:
Me ha gustado, pero como metroidvania no me parece de los mejores. Talvez de no haberlo jugado inmediatamente despues del hollow knigth, me pareceria mejor, pero me resulta un poco forzado eso del backtracking y las habilidades, no todas pero si algunas.
Lo que si brilla en el juego es el sistema de combate, que es bastante divertido con varias combinaciones que solo aumentan conforme avanzas y una variedad de trajes, que cambian tu estilo de pelear, los secretos me parecen bien colocados, y me gsuta que te marquen en el mapa si te falta algo en esa seccion, asi no tienes que buscar en toooodo el mapa.
Los retos tambien agregan divercion al juego, pues no son muy muy dificiles pero no son un regalo.
Toda la hambientacion y la musica, pues estan bien, no me hacen especial ilucion peroe esta bien. En cambio los personajes me gustaron mucho, los villanos y tus aliados, me parece que tenian personalidad.
Asi que, lo recomiendo, no es el mejor juego pero es divertido, lo probe por que lo tenia de hace tiempo y vi que ya pronto viene el dos y queria estar preparado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262626587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 373, 'playtime_forever': 908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 908, 'last_played': 1593579141}
review:
What is Guacamelee ?

When I first started playing this game I was kinda satisfied with it, the game got beatiful visuals, I love colorful games something about those distinct style makes the game look very attractive to me, the game also had very good setting, a nice soundtrack and an overall fine controls and gameplay, guacamelee is mostly a sidescroller platform games that you see a lot in the indie scene, theres a few metroidvania elements here but its not a full-fledge metroidvania game, its mostly linear and you dont have to backtrack much at all, the game even has a fast travel system between areas of the map, level design (initially) was fine and the combat aspect (initially) is really good too, punching and throwing enemies around like a true luchador felt fun and the game was balanced (initially) too, it has a story going on but I didnt really care much about it, felt the characters werent properly explored, I was going to recommend the game until the second half hit.

What was a formulaic but well-done game became a frustrating chore to play that I just wanted to be done with, noticed how I said initially in parenthesis above ? because intially everything was working so well, the platforming was fun, the level design left nothing to be desired, combat was also fun altho the excess of moments where our passage was blocked and we were forced to fight waves of enemies became an annoyance, it just felt like the game had a shift in direction and another person was chosen to take over the direction of the game and whoever got in charge of designing probably forgot to take game design classes, the game started introducing new and stupid mechanics that ruined the pace and just felt really tacked on like those stupid dimension shift stuff and that annoying orb teleporter, the level design became insufferable and less detailed, the combat became worse and a chore to get through now with color-coded enemies (really ? people complains about that in every game that does that, just end this stupid unlikable trend), the boss battles were pretty crappy where the boss just had the same movement pattern repeated over and over without barely any variation, the boss fights would look challenging initlially but all you have to do is die a few times to learn the pattern of the boss moves and it becomes a cakewalk, the quality of the game took a huge fall in the second half, the later locations had much worse level design that it just became a unforgiving frustration, theres a difference between making a game challenging and making the game a chore to play, having to repeat countless sections over and over to learn a pattern and having those forced excess of combat encounters with color coded enemies and poorly done platforming is just not fun at all, they fucked up pretty bad here.

I managed to finish the game in 6 hours and all I was feeling when I saw the credits roll was dissatisfaction, like I wasted my time, there was a few stuff left to do in the game like stupid useless sidequests, getting upgrade items and collecting some random garbage for a true ending but I couldnt care anymore and just uninstalled it, theres coop here but again I couldnt care at all, if the game maintained its first half quality and was a satisfying game to play I would certainly recommend it but the hacks that made this game failed pretty hard as the game kept going and it just became a bad, poorly designed crap, not sure how it even got a sequel when it doesnt deserve one, just dont waste your time with it, there are better indie games out there more deserving of your time that does everything this garbage does in a much better way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125119090', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1533043718}
review:
Guys, guys, who programmed this game...
I really wanted to recommend this game, really... But there is too many irritating problem with it, what made me downgrade this, in basic, awesome game. For example, who in the right mind programmed the evasion to the Left Trigger? i had to make a lot of challenge for a million times, because I couldn't press the trigger faster. But the Pollo power is in the Left Button... The luchador power, which are in the B button, they are responded correctly for the joystic in 15%, which made almost the all puzzle-s, the challenges and fights a nighmare...
The game is good, the story meh, but funny, (however, the end is irritatingly anticlimatic), the athmosphere is masterpiece...
Guys, guys, who programmed this game...
I loved your game, as much as I hated it. For the second game, pleeeeeeeeeeeeeease: MORE GAMEPLAY TESTING, TESTING, TESTING, TESTING, TESTING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198064506534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1174, 'last_played': 1532766495}
review:
muy buen metroidmania, con un sistema de combate bastante original que lo distingue de los demás del género. El sistema de combate resulta algo complejo al inicio, pero cuando empiezas a sentirte cómodo con los distintos ataques resulta addictivo, al estilo de los viejos beat-em up.

En cuánto a puntos fuertes destaca por encima la banda sonora y el artwork. Como única pega quizás la curva de dificultad; muy asequible hasta que llegas al tramo final del juego donde te encuentras con partes de habilidad o zonas de combate un poco desquiciantes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961780979', 'num_games_owned': 1698, 'num_reviews': 361, 'playtime_forever': 1089, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1089, 'last_played': 1532063439}
review:
橫向墨西哥惡魔城  正常漢化  通關九小時  好結局13小時

畫面不錯  不過人物動作是不是跟皮影戲有點像

音樂好評!!

操作打擊也很流暢  爽

普通難度偏易  倒是陷阱躲避操作比較難一點

劇情非常簡單  拯救被壞人抓走的公主  其中不少搞笑

後期能自由進入生與死的空間  畫面與音樂隨之變換  尤其是音樂真滴棒!!



漢化在評論區頂端  就是讚最多的那個  可正常使用  雖然有些地方沒翻到QQ

可買衣服換裝  衣服都有不同能力  其中一件好像還跟成就有關係

不過衣服無法全買  銀幣有限所以別亂買QQ

招式按法也很簡易  想怎麼接招就怎麼接招  也有訓練屋教你怎麼高階技巧接招

有四個收集要素  對應血量體力怒氣跟結局


最後偷偷問一句  地獄完整度跟金牌有關係嗎  我的只有75%  0.0

author: {'steamid': '76561198309149695', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1531055242}
review:
Guacamelee Super Turbo Championship Edition é uma versão melhorada do Gold Edition.
É um jogo bem divertido com enrredo engraçado e com uma dificuldade desafiadora na maioria das vezes tanto nos momentos boss (chefes) como em ocasioes situacionais em que voce tem que pular dar dashs etc, esse é um game de plataforma 2D de combate com tema mexicano, com aquela trilha sonora gostosa de se ouvir, e pra melhorar! voce pode também jogar coop local! entao chame um amigo e se junte as aventuras do nosso el luchador Juan.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085588145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1016, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 526, 'last_played': 1621808854}
review:
Demorei pra jogar, estava com receio de ser um jogo chato. Engano meu, foi um dos melhores indies que eu tenho jogado.
Se estiver em dúvida de comprar, na primeira promoção não perca a oportunidade, valhe muito a pena.
Tem muitas referências de variados jogos, quem já jogou metroid de Snes por exemplo vai se identificar e muito com algums coisas no jogo.
E mais, o jogo é um sarro, os vilões principalmente, não tem como vc jogar ele inteiro e não esboçar sequer um sorriso no canto do rosto huahauhauahhua.
Os gráficos embora simples, são excelentes e não deixam a desejar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084284781', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 588, 'last_played': 1530725462}
review:
Having played Metroidvania games with only cute, small and agile characters, I wasn't too convinced with on this game when I first found it. If it weren't for the highly positive reviews on Steam and Reddit, I would not have bought it.

With that said, I'm glad I tried this game. There's so many attention to details in platforming, gameplay, art style and NPCs. I enjoyed my entire playthrough and highly recommend this game to anyone who likes Metroidvania games.

The game loads very fast. The story is quite engaging to keep you interested until the end, the NPCs and characters are funny and it has a lot of references to other video games and modern culture.

The platforming is quite fun, it's not the hardest but it has enough variance to keep you from getting bored after a while. I also like the use of different block types that you have to destroy from the bottom, top or the sides, it encourages the players to explore more areas to solve them, and they reward exploration well. There's always a prize every time you find a hidden corner somewhere. 

I don't use the map a lot but I really like that they have clear markers on things that I can discover within my area, a lot of other games don't even bother to do this and you ended up wasting time and find nothing in the area.

This game is quite combated heavy, there are variety of moves that you can chain to make combos and the combat is very satisfying. It's not the hardest but it keeps you engaged.

The  "normal" difficulty is quite balanced, although I found that the platforming is very forgiving, as an example, if you fell into the acid river it will just send you back to where you stand before, without any damage. I can't say I'm complaining because I failed a lot and definitely would have died a lot if it wasn't for this mechanic.

There are areas that feel like puzzles, since you can turn into little chicken to go through small areas, or travel to "other dimension" to make walls appear/vanish, and they are quite fun.

With that said, there are some complains I have about this game. The music is one, I just prefer 2D platforming with "calming" music since it sets the ambiance better for me. I had to turn down the music volume in this game just to feel that way.

But overall, Guacamelee is truly a gem and should be placed among the greatest Metroidvania games up there. I give it 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198325147810', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 643, 'last_played': 1601202362}

El juego te puede dar+/- 10 horas de juego muy entretenidas y más si sacas provecho del Cooperativo local de hasta 4 jugadores. Obligado en tu biblioteca si eres fan de los juegos de plataforma 👍

author: {'steamid': '76561198146450963', 'num_games_owned': 334, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 1633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1633, 'last_played': 1430259369}
review:
Time for a trip to Mexico to become a luchador, save El Presidente’s daughter and become a legendary hero in Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition.

[h1]The Good:[/h1][i]Solid game all around. Nice treat having a Mexican setting to the game.[/i]

Alright, let’s get the obvious out of the way, this is an outstanding game. The gameplay is fluid, the soundtrack is catchy & memorable, the graphics are nice to look at (save for the risk of Epilepsy seizures), and the game’s price tag is good.

Another thing that should be noted is the fact that I can’t really recall another good game that had Mexican culture as it’s main premise. Nothing from what I saw looked out of place or out of line, and this game has lots of references, whether it’s from the visuals, like the various Nintendo items you’ll notice through your adventures, or the dialogue, like when you clear one area only to be greeted with the famous line “Your princess is in another castle.”

[h1]The Bad:[/h1][i]No significant difference between Normal & Hard modes.[/i]

Playing through both difficulty modes, I was rather disappointed by the lack of differences between the two. The enemies & bosses barely showed any difference, save for maybe more health; the checkpoints for the most part wasn’t changed or shortened; and not even the level design showed any changes. In general, hard mode is not hard.

[h1]The Ugly:[/h1][i]Missed potential for online co-op play.[/i]

Really, there wasn’t much that I could think of in terms of any other negatives for this game. The only other thing that I could think of, or in this case, looking at the other reviews done by the steam community, was noticing a lack of online co-op play.

Guacamelee! has had 2 additional versions of the game in Gold and Super Turbo Championship Editions and all of them, including the original, have a co-op option available. The latter version was a missed opportunity to try and make co-op gameplay available online.


Guacamelee! is a superb game, one that should be in anyone’s game collection. There’s little problems with the game itself that it gave me some difficulty in getting this review complete, but it’s done now and it gets an easy recommendation from me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092329986', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1329, 'last_played': 1530403579}
review:
Un juego con mucho carisma, un arte visual/sonoro increible, una jugabilidad adictiva y un estilo "metroidvania" facil de seguir sin caer en lo simplista. La historia es sencilla, y lo agradezco.

Si tuviera una "pega" con este juego es su dificultad. No es dificil si lo comparas con otros de su genero, principalmente cuando hablamos de sus jefes, llenos de carisma pero carentes de desafio. 

Guacamelee! es un buen juego que no busca estresarte con desafios o laberintos enrevesados, pero ojo, que tendrás mas de un dolor de cabeza. Me parece un juego muy divertido que vale la pena comprar, simplemente porque sabe lo que quiere ofrecer y no le falta nada.

author: {'steamid': '76561198289280303', 'num_games_owned': 375, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1525631572}
review: Guacamelee é um jogo de plataforma e ação 2D com espaço pra coop local e pra uma gameplay bem divertida e viciante até. Atire seus inimigos em outros inimigos,desça a porrada neles e alterne entre o mundo dos vivos e o mundo dos mortos para salvar sua amada, a história é bem simples a experiência definitivamente vale a pena, é um jogo muito bom

author: {'steamid': '76561198117208868', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1529978385}
review:
Guacamlee! STCE al igual que su versión normal son unos juegos muy entretenidos, los niveles, mecanicas, música son simplemente geniales. Esta versión incluye un mapa nuevo junto con un jefe, diferentes habilidades para el jugador y enemigos. y lo mejor, un reto mayor al de su versión original.
La experiencia del juego no cambia mucho pero se distingue del anterior lanzado.
Totalmente recomendable para cualquier clase de jugador que guste de un buen plataformeo, pluzzles complicados o sólo una aventura por completar y admirar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006135085', 'num_games_owned': 222, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1686, 'last_played': 1529856761}
review:
I had an awesome time playing Guacamelee. The art style is really bright and colourful, and matches the humour presented in the game. I had a dumb smile throughout most of it thanks to the silly dialogue, story and characters. 

The actual gameplay itself is pretty great. I liked exploring the map and trying to find all of the collectibles without a guide. Most of them were cleverly hidden and weren't too obscure except for one. The enemies posed a good challenge, and the boss fights were entertaining. The music was good, but could have definitely used more variety.

My biggest complaints are mostly technical. I hate how there's a constant black bar over the top of the screen, telling you to press a button on another controller for co-op. Also, some of the enemy encounters could be VERY annoying. Specifically with the Chupacabras that fly around and shoot fireballs at you, or these balloon enemies that self-destruct with a timer. If they're paired up with other specific enemies, then it can be annoying to dodge them / get rid of them, especially when you're in an arena. Not only was it annoying, but also really difficult to build up a combo. 

One thing that I like about games that have some kind of a combo system is that the game usually enocurages you to actively pursue a higher combo, which involves digging into the games mechanics and mastering it. For most of Guacamelee, that's totally the case, and it's fine. But there was more than a handful of encounters that were just downright annoying, no matter how good I got at the game. Hopefully these issues are addressed in the sequel.

Overall, a flat 8.0 / 10, it's a great game. Most of the problems can be overlooked due to everything else being tons of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131234496', 'num_games_owned': 699, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 685, 'last_played': 1530829051}
review:
After the certain BOOM in platformers and metroidvanias, an old game from DrinkBox Studios appears... Guacamelee. In a nutshell across this game you will play a newly reborn Luchador and take him on a journey to save your childhood crush. A game plagued with cultural references and memes which has certainly taken a new spin for the genre.

The pros: 
- The game has an amazing fighting system, it will seem easy at the begining... come back when you finish the game.
-The soundtrack is amazing and really helps to put the characters in context
-Talking about characters... Every single one of the NPC's have a well thought personality that compliments their design 
-Platforming is of a moderate difficulty but most of the time it's fair.
 -THE POWER OF MEMES
The cons:
-The story is nothing new (Good ol' save the damsel in distress)
-Lots of areas are locked by progression, you feel like been directed towards the objective
-Im still butthurt for Jaguars Javiar AI
-YOU NEED A CONTROLLER

8.5/10

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198125799682', 'num_games_owned': 449, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 1154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 722, 'last_played': 1623368833}
review:
[h1]Uno de los pocos juegos de su género y dificultad que me consiguió enganchar hasta el final.[/h1]

Posee una [b]jugabilidad bastante cómoda[/b]. La dificultad de este juego trata de hacerte exprimir sus mecánicas al máximo, cosa que hace resaltar en ciertas ocasiones algunos pequeños detallitos sin pulir.

[b]Con respecto a su duración[/b], cumple con lo que promete (y más teniendo en cuenta su precio). Es de esos juegos que parecen eternos pero a la vez te los terminas pasando rápido.

[b]En cuanto a la banda sonora[/b], solo puedo decir una cosa al respecto: 10/10.

Por último he de mencionar el único problema "grave" que le vi a esta versión: la imposibilidad de comprar los soundtracks (me decepcionó un montón :'c). La única manera posible de comprarla es si posees la edición Gold (la cual tiene menos jefes y niveles que esta) o mediante Bandcamp.

PD: Aún no he realizado todos los finales posibles, cuando lo haga es posible que modifique la reseña.

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198088744262', 'num_games_owned': 394, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 611, 'last_played': 1528491920}
review:
If you don't like metroidvanias for the kinda "bs" stuff, then this game might allow you to accept the genre without having an aneurysm.

Positives:

 - L U C H A D O R R R R R R

 - Movement feels great.

 - Abilities feel pretty unique.

 - Combat is great(you can do super cool shit out the gate).

 - Level design is pretty good, especially when they make you use tons of powers in conjuction later.

 - Vania "powers" All felt super useful.

 - Art style is very pretty.

 - 4 player local co-op

 - A H I D D E N E N D I N G T H O S E A R E N I C E WOO

 - An amazing super mode that just makes me nut.

Negatives:

 - Felt pretty short.

 - Local co-op only.(PARSEC REEEEEEEEEEEEEE)

 - Linear when starting out

 - Lotta backtracking if you want collectibles(Honestly didn't feel like going back for them and I usually go crazy for that)

 - Hard mode locked from playing in the beginning. Honestly don't care for it. I guess its replay value though.

I like Metroidvania like games. I've played a few, sadly I don't think a lot of them aged well or have that good of design to them. This game oddly blows it out of the water, and the special areas mix and match everything to make a very satisfying conclusion to each level.

Final level was pretty cool. Hidden collectibles are uh. Either pretty easy or extremely challenging. Good thing they're optional.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979215168', 'num_games_owned': 8053, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 931, 'last_played': 1410961666}
review:
What is "Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition" ("Guacamelee")?

First of all, it is some years since I played this (in late 2014). Guacamelee is a Metroidvania game where you play a guy who is possessed by the spirit of a Luchador (Mexican wrestler) and must defeat enemies, overcome challenges, all the while learning new moves, finding some secrets, etc. in typical Metroidvania style.

Gameplay
The gameplay is very smooth, the challenging but never unfair difficulty makes it able to retry rooms without any issues - there is no death penalty other than having to restart the current room. This formula that is also used in Super Meat Boy etc. - getting right back into the game after failure - makes this game enjoyable until the end. You explore a world full of Mexican style, including some bonus levels in this version. Every now and then you meet some bosses to overcome, you can explore a small Mexican village, and with your powers gained throughout the game you defeat countless enemies, culminating in an optional (but necessary for achievements) pit of challenges. At the end of the game you will be the best Luchador in all of Mexico, but is this enough to break free of your destiny?
Minor spoiler: You can switch between the world of the living and the dead, reminiscent of the both greatest Zelda classics A Link to the Past and Majora's Mask, but you switch at any time - after having gained that power.

Story
The story is okay, but forgettable. If I remember it correctly, you die at the beginning and then try to resurrect. Or something like that. And some woman is also involved that you must rescue, I think. Or maybe just some chicken. Not sure anymore.
However, the characters are written in a fun style, and especially the chickens who teach you new moves are worth a laugh or two.

Controls
A controller is recommended, but with it controls are absolutely great. Everything is easily accessible except one special move that you use maybe once or twice in the game where you must press the joystick (you have to know this is even possible on the XBOX controller). I think it was used only once to solve a puzzle. Other than that, everything feels great. You can save at any point.
The negative point is that I think there is only one savegame.

Music
Are you even asking? The soundtrack is great, and I think I had also reviewed it. So read that review, or just listen to it on Youtube.

Recommended:
If you did not understand it by now, this is one of the best games I have ever played. It is short, only 12 hours long maybe, but every minute of it is enjoyable. Currently it is on sale, so grab it! Or wait for a better sale, as 8.39€ is a bit much possibly. But if you ever get it for under 5 Euro, it is a must-buy and must-play! And please get all achievements, there is nothing missable, I think. Or maybe you can miss something by entering the final boss without having gotten everything, but then that would be entirely your fault. And an opportunity to play that great game once more. ;-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198171033130', 'num_games_owned': 456, 'num_reviews': 375, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1528313196}
review:
Well done action platformer overall, although it is somewhat mechanically cluttered.


Nice music, art and the thematic design in general is very nicely done and capitalizes well on the cultural elements of the game. The combat has a really good balance to it and does not devolve into one specific thing, players have generally equal advantage in using any of their abilities or attacks. Lots of clever platforming puzzles which break up the combat and also balance out the gameplay.

It seems though that the game tries way too hard to be varied mechanically. The platforming puzzles can be very confusing since the player has multiple different platform based actions they can perform, and it is up to the player to figure out which goes where which just involves trial and error. It is not a horrendous problem, but it does stall the game when the player has to stop and figure out which specific move is meant to be used for a specific puzzle when multiple moves do similar things but only one will work in this situation.

The game gradually introduces what are essentially hoops the player has to jump through when fighting enemies. Press this button to be able to hurt the enemy, use this specific attack to be able to hurt the enemy. It really does not add onto the experience, because it is not combat, it is just a micro-chore the player has to perform to unlock the ability to hurt the enemy. Each special attack has its own designated colour, each enemy shield has a corresponding colour; stop what you are doing in the middle of the fight to remember which colour matches which ability and then use that specific one on that specific enemy otherwise it is invincible. It really just holds the combat back, limiting the players ability to just do what they want which is what the combat initially excels in until it decides to start gating itself.

There are some minor issues with like, this being a controller designed game yet there is no option to turn off controller vibration. Many games which are not designed exclusively for controllers, have this feature. There is also no option to turn off screen shake, which is unfortunate for those with motion sickness. The camera also has little smoothing on it despite the protagonist being very fast, which is also potentially unfortunate for those with motion sickness. It would be great if the movement controls were tighter in general, as they are somewhat loose which makes it awkward to make precise jumps which the game does demand sometimes. And the pointless fetch quests in the towns, totally could just not exist. Really just a way to waste the players time if they are not going to be designed to be interesting in some way.


Solid game though, certainly does well in terms of the combat balancing and the platforming design, just would of been a lot better if there were less unnecessary mechanics holding the flow back.

author: {'steamid': '76561198413442663', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1525606919}

author: {'steamid': '76561198823306456', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1106, 'last_played': 1527887705}
review:
Loved it.  Excellent visuals, music, lots of secrets to find and great battle and combo system.

Only gripes are some crazy difficulty spikes with some optional quests and a few super fustrating platforming bits.  Wish multiplayer was more in depth too.  Wish there were teamup attacks or the ability to help each other more in platforming bits (like the ability to throw the other players across a pit or something).  But as it stands, it's vastly easier to do hard platforming bits solo and having another player during platforming sections is just basically doubling your chances of failure!

A few fustrations but overall this is an excellent game.  Eagerly awaiting Guacamelee 2!

review:
Aparentemente fácil, mas após 2 horas de jogo você percebe que não é tão simples assim.

O modo co-op deixa tudo melhor, deixa o jogo mais engraçado e a raiva das mortes diminui muito.
Não jogo solo nunca, e não recomendo uhauha.

Enfim, um jogasso que estará logo logo com a sua sequencia open para desfrutarmos dessa genialidade de game, parabéns.

VALE O DOBRO DO PREÇO!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006426555', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 620, 'last_played': 1526240908}
review:
A nice game, that takes about 10-15 hours to complete (I guess depending on how 'completionist' you are playing). I like the easthetics of the game, and I like the music (but it does get a bit too repetitive after about 8 hours into the game). Combat controls feels good. Some platforming sections can get a bit frustrating, so be aware of that if you are looking for a beat'm up but don't like platforming. If platforming is your thing however, I can wholeheartedly recommend giving this game a try.
(There is coop in this game, but I haven't given that a try.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198016989392', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 576, 'last_played': 1588952833}
review:
[b]Ready Player Juan[/b] is a side-scrolling action-adventure game in which a poor agava-farmer browses the internet and finds the mythical Know Your Meme. He's [i]muy[/i] enthralled by all the [i]contenido[/i], so much so that the power of meme-magic turns him into a powerful Luchador. Can he save El Presidente's Daughter from the evil Calaca?

i dunno lol ¯\(°_o)/¯

With crisp, colorful 2D graphics; chuckle-worthy writing; a good soundtrack (hope you like trumpets!), as well as the fact that punching not only kills [i]esqueletos[/i] but also helps you platform - Guacamelee! is troubled by pacing issues (in part due to the many 'arena' fights), frustrating puzzle-platforming and little reward for exploration.

Guacamelee! is like that friend who made you a cookie - but they eated it.

review:
Gerçekten çok eğlenceli bir oyun. Özellikle gamepad ile oynamanızı tavsiye ederim.

+ Dövüş mekanikleri ve kombolar güzel.
+ Klasikleşmiş oyunlara ve indie yapımlara bol bol gönderme var ama çoğu gözden kaçabilir.
+ Hikayesi eğlenceli.
+ 8-10 saat civarı sürüyor oyun. Bu tarz bir oyun için gayet yeterli bence.
- Oyun sonlara doğru can sıkıcı şekilde zorlaşıyor. Aynı yeri 20 kere oynamak bunaltabiliyor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123354974', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 1238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1238, 'last_played': 1524177092}
review:
I had no idea what to expect from this as I went into it blind. I had mixed feelings about this game at first, but it only got better as I played.

[H1] Pros : [/h1]
-Unique and colorful art style with fantastic execution.
-Good music
-Great combat
-The atmosphere varies a lot
-All abilities are exploited and given a spotlight.

[H1] Cons : [/H1]
-The combat is a joke outside of hard mode. There's nothing wrong with a game being easy, but there's no oomph to it.
-Out of the very few bosses there are, only the very last couple of bosses are fun/challenging.
-There is very little enemy variety, especially if you don't count reskins.
-The metroidvania elements are lacking, the sense of discovery isn't very present since everything is so obvious and color coded.
-The good ending is locked behind a gauntlet of things no ordinary player would want to go through, let alone find.
-The story in general is lacking
-The level design in platforming could probably turn off quite a few people.

Ultimately, my first run through this game was nothing short of underwhelming. It was only until hard mode that it all started coming together and started being enjoyable, as weird as that may sound.

If you're looking for a metroidvania, you can definitely do better than this. Especially these days, where there's quite a few great games of the genre on steam. Although, this game does have a unique flair to it that isn't seen in other games.

I'd reccomend it on a sale if you're interested in this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075463521', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1522876922}

author: {'steamid': '76561198118810016', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 612, 'last_played': 1524056680}
review:
First off, if you're interested in metroidvania/platformer games with upgrade-gated exploration with backtracking and a satisfying combat system (especially if you're looking to experience it with friends as it has up to 4 players local co-op) - you owe it to yourself to play this game as it counts towards the top games of the genre, in my opinion.

In this game, you start out as an agave farmer with barebones fighting capabilities whose world gets turned upside down and is set to become the greatest Luchador to make things right again - save the world from evil. Pretty cookie cutter premise but the way it is getting delivered, mixed with the art style, visuals and humour of the characters, makes it a truly memorable and funny experience.

The tutorial and general explanation of the abilities you have and will obtain during the game is superb as they build up on the principles of using the abilities in a really smart way. Here it's important to point out that in this game, the new upgrades/abilities you get double as a new way to explore the world and open up places you couldn't reach before AND can be used in the combo brawler fighting system as a means to deal hefty damage and make crazy combo chains happen. 
First, you're faced with a simple challenge and a tooltip with instructions that makes you use your ability in a very basic way, but the game builds upon those challenges with ever-so-slightly harder tasks that never feel out of place or break the curve of the learning experience. Hands down one of the best ways to introduce people into the mechanics of your game. They also come together beautifully in the mid- and late-game for some truly remarkable platforming/combo challenges.

The fighting system in this game adds to it nicely as the new abilities open up new ways to beat enemies up (quite literally). The combo brawler fighting system is a breath of fresh air for the genre and honestly one of the strongest selling points for this game as coupled with the ability to roll and jump makes for some really satisfying gameplay as you watch those combo streak numbers rise up (there's achievements for these, too, so you can feel extra rewarded for making them happen!).
Death is not a harsh punishment in this game and is a wise decision in this game as it can be very fast-paced and merely puts you back to a point in the room you've just died, making for quick re-attempts at even the most tricky platforming challenges. If you intend to close the game and continue later, you're gonna be at the last check/savepoint.

The world and level design is great and comes together really nicely as each area has a distinct art style and theme to it. As in all metroidvanias, it's basically one huge map you're bound to explore in bite-sized segments and each area feels fresh and never overstays its welcome. There's no out of place spikes in difficulty, which I mentioned in the way you explore upgrades earlier already, and all the challenges feel adequate for the amount of practice and challenges you've had to do before you face a certain obstacle. New options to traverse said world also make re-exploring the areas for collectibles and secrets very pleasant. There's plenty of check/savepoints which double up as places to get upgrades and costumes at - another genius decision. Costumes can be obtained through obtaining a certain in-game currency to style up your character and all come with their own bonuses and drawbacks. (You also don't have to be afraid to finish the story/game before haven't unlocked everything as the game gives you the option to revisit your save file to collect whatever you could've missed.)

The soundtrack felt pleasant and pumped you up for upcoming big encounters. It really fits this mix of Mexican/Luchador feeling this game is trying to convey to its players and helps you immerse in the world of this game greatly. It makes you want to keep going and keeps you entertained in this magnificent world Drinkbox Studios have crafted here. Heck, I find myself humming or having the soundtrack stuck in my head when I'm not playing the game, so that should say something about how catchy it really is!

The only small complaint I have about the game is a certain type of enemy that isn't really used more than a handful of times that have (clearly telegraphed and the game informs you about that) attacks that you can't avoid through dodge rolls which seems to go against the grain of the combat system they have in place. They're a tad bit annoying but nothing that's going to halt your game progress as they really only appear a handful of times during the game so I don't feel that this should have any weight.

Length-wise it added up to 9h for my first playthrough for the first ending but there's tons of collectibles and a 2nd ending you can unlock on top of a new mode once you finish the game for the first time, so there's a lot of replay value to be had for this game and honestly for the 1,39€ I picked it up at the sale, it was a pure steal. (To emphasize, this game totally is worth its full price and that shouldn't keep you from buying it if you're into any sort of platforming/metroidvania games and are looking to scratch that itch!)

All in all, I hope this review could help you make a decision about whether you wanna pick up this game or not and if you do, which I sincerely hope, I wish you a lot of fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198150333066', 'num_games_owned': 630, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1329, 'last_played': 1608812324}
review:
Excellent plateformer metroidvania fait par un studio de Toronto. Pas de fusil, des grosses claque sur la gueule de luchador dans un Mexique fantaisiste avec le monde duel des morts et des vivants (un clin d'oeil au concept de polarité dans Ikaruga, Outland ou Metroid Prime 2). Beaucoup d'humour de clichés et de parodies, références pas trop subtiles que ce soit en décor ou en élément de premier plan à une tonne de jeux de d'autres franchises (Castlevania, Zelda, Castle Crashers pour n'en nommer que quelques-uns).
Juan le héros à droit à un magasin pour dépenser ses pesos pour améliorer ses compétences de bases et l'argent ramassé à la fin d'une arène de combat ou comme récompenses d'un coffre bien caché lui permet d'acheter de nouveaux costumes changeant la façon et les compétences drastiquement de Juan. Possibilité de jouer jusqu'à 4 en même temps mais j'ai pas essayé.
Des séquences de plateformes assez précises, le jeu est de difficulté moyenne mais le finir à 100% pour avoir la vrai fin risque d'en faire rager certains (l'orbe de l'arbre en particulier est un parcours à obstacles intense sans compter certains défis proposés par le guardien des enfers). Les boss sont intéressants et attachant à la fois et la musique est accrocheuse voire excellente. Un mélange de musique latino guitare sèche sur un beat électronique. Le thème du boss est ma favorite. 
En ce qui concerne les différences entre la version Gold et la Super Turbo, celle-ci est un remake du Gold avec plus de contenu ainsi qu'un leaderboard pour les amateurs de speedrun.
Fortement recommandé aux amateurs de plateformer 2d classiques, une dizaine d'heures minimum est requise pour le finir une première fois (si on s'attarde pas trop à ramasser tous les power-up et les collectionables).

author: {'steamid': '76561198169433494', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1410, 'last_played': 1588128398}
review:
I. Loved. This. Game. 

I haven't played many different metroidvanias in my day, and the ones I did play, I really didn't enjoy. I automatically disliked the fact that I was walking past secrets all the time that I couldn't access. This game changed that for me. Most secrets are locked behind colored blocks that you need certain moves to get past. This caused me to fall in love. The secrets that I missed were easily visible on the world map, and when you've gotten a few certain items, you get to fly. 

Another thing, this game was super fun to speedrun (currently #29 at the time of writing this). It was challenging, beating the game with limited resources, and I had to find an unconventional way to beat the final boss, as I'm not that creative.

(minor spoilers ahead)
Finally, hard mode, was HARD. I played hard mode after beating the game on normal and finding most of the secrets. When I played through hard mode, I pretty much went straight to the final boss, finding very little secrets along the way, which ended up with me getting my ass handed to me by every group of enemies, which, in turn, sorta forced me to git gud and learn 2 dodge. I would say that the final boss wasn't even super hard on hard mode, my biggest challenge (which took me ~45 mins to beat) was the cheetahman boss, who would 3 shot me at my health. He is very, very fast on hard mode and causes you to learn his patterns and use TONS of patience to beat. The final boss, while also hard, was actually easier to predict, and therefore easier to beat, because he's no different than he was on normal, he just does more damage and kills you a lot. 

Now, even though I loved this game, It has its downsides as one would imagine. 100%ing the game was frustrating to say the least, because looking up guides really didn't help me at all, and online forums are at odds at what the 100% achievement requires. In this version of the game, you just need 100% in all areas (look at the top right of your map), as well as all collectibles, golds in all infierno challenges, and all side quests. 

In the original game, some areas had more than 100% for their completion. In this game, the max is 100%, JUST TO BE CLEAR. I probably spent 2-3 hours searching areas that I already had 100% in when I didnt need to.

Overall, great game, (I got it on sale for like $1.50, but I would definitely purchase it at full price).

author: {'steamid': '76561198403131064', 'num_games_owned': 540, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 2091, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 807, 'last_played': 1608384349}
review:
Gran gran juego, el control es muy limpio, la historia es muy entretenida y divertida sin mencionar que esta plagada de referencias ingeniosamente colocadas. 
Es un plataformero con segmentos de lucha pero tiene uno de los mejores diseños de niveles que jamas he visto, es decir, todos los movimientos son absolutamente utiles y no se siente que este ahi solo por hacer relleno sin mencionar que es indispensable que haya un dominio de ellos para logra acceder a ciertas zonas. 
Jugue la historia en solitario, incluye modo cooperativo de hasta 4 jugadores locales, admito que temo que el multiplayer conserve la esencia del juego ya que ahi las muertes son menos penalizadas pero no se, solo jugue un poco con un colega. 

Aun asi creo que es un juego que merece la oportunidad, me diverti cual gordo bastardo y su musica es realmente hermosa muy acorde al juego.

review: La tematica del juego es genial, sobre todo el gran numero de referencias a la cultura mexicana (Muy graciosas, por cierto); Los enemigos, aunque en un principio parecen faciles y repetitivos, a medida que avanza el juego se vuelven un verdadero reto por lo que el combate se vuelve realmente entretenido, sobre todo por los movimientos especiales. Tambien, alcanzar el 100% en cada zona resulta una travesia, pues alcanzar esas zonas escondidas no es nada facil. Un juego bastante recomendado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025674597', 'num_games_owned': 2059, 'num_reviews': 607, 'playtime_forever': 1166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1166, 'last_played': 1523631252}
review:
Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition is an upgraded version of Guacamelee, a metroidvania game inspired by Mexican culture. I already wrote a review for the original version, but this one deserves a review as well.

The story centers on Juan Aguacate, an agave farmer living in the outskirts of Pueblucho, a small Mexican town. During one Day of the Dead, an evil spirit who goes by the name of Carlos Calaca has a plan in mind for the worlds of the living and the dead. He kidnaps El Presidente's daughter (Juan's childhood friend and love interest), and kills Juan, who is then revived by a mythical Luchador mask. Juan then embarks on a quest across the worlds of the living and the dead in order to stop Calaca's plan, coming across many interesting characters along the way. The dialogue is pretty good, going from serious "we need to save the world" moments, to humorous jokes about the different characters, which still work very well.

The gameplay, like I mentioned in the opening paragraph, is that of a metroidvania platformer, with some combat mixed in. You start the game with a basic punch combo, and as you progress through the level you gain new moves as well as abilities, which then open up alternate paths in previous levels, leading you to new areas, or some hidden treasure. There's also a couple of "hub" levels, where you can get a few sidequests and also complete some bonus challenges. You can also unlock upgrades and costumes (which specific bonuses) using in-game currency, which is obtained when killing enemies. Talking about the enemies, there's a wide variety of them, from regular melee mooks, to flying enemies or giant, heavy hitting enemies.

Going into level design, it's pretty good. Plenty of large spaces to explore, with new areas that become available as you gain new abilities, which means you'll be revisiting areas all the time without feeling like they're repeating content. There's almost always something new to discover when the story sends you back to an already visited area. Also, the game uses a dual-world mechanic, with almost all levels having a World of the Living and World of the Dead version, and each version has its own unique aesthetic design; while the World of the Living is bright and colourful, the World of the Dead is dark and somber.

The soundtrack is top-notch. I'd say it's some kind of electro-mexican mix, and it fits the game very well. Not only that, but there's practically two versions of each song, since both worlds use their own music. While they share some similarities, there's differences in tone for the tracks of the World of the Living and the World of the Dead.

Now let's talk about the Super Turbo Championship Edition proper, in comparison to the Gold Edition. While the Gold Edition was already a pretty good game, the STCE (I'm not typing the full title again) adds two brand new areas to explore, several new enemy types, and a new boss, plus a couple of new abilities, including the Intenso mode, which allows you to tear through enemies with ease, plus some changes here and there. All in all, some pretty good content.

So, do I recommend Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition? Of course I do, it's a fantastic game, and if you enjoy metroidvanias, you'll really enjoy this one!

author: {'steamid': '76561197997453217', 'num_games_owned': 707, 'num_reviews': 193, 'playtime_forever': 1163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 917, 'last_played': 1523843019}
review: Metroidvania back again, with a colorful Mexican twist. The usage of Mexican folklore is mostly lip-service, but it's a nice coat of paint overtop an addictive and expressive combat system and well-ordered level and ability progression. The world-design is a bit cookie-cutter (Can't get past the red block until you get the red ability, then the blue ability for the blue block, then the green, then the etc...), and the dialogue is more throwaway than tongue-in-cheek, but the character design is charming and the main gameplay experience make for a worthwhile purchase. A bit on the short side, with too few bosses, and a plain menu/UI, but still recommended if on sale or for fans of the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271871580', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1523447986}
review:
挺不错的一个游戏！！！值得玩一下！！！

墨西哥超级英雄大混战超级冠军版，还有一个是墨西哥超级英雄黄金版，冠军版是黄金版的升级版。在黄金版的基础上增加了一些东西，我也不知道增加了什么，我也是百度了解的！！我只玩了冠军版，黄金版并没有玩。

版本无所谓了，推荐买游戏包吧！反正游戏包打折挺便宜的，都可以拿到手，还有原声乐，反正不亏，听说要出二代了，挺期待的。
游戏画风挺墨西哥风的，挺有质量的一个2D横版类游戏，不过对手残来说，游戏有点难度，（比如我，难受啊！）一定要用手柄！！！！键盘估计在某些关卡你会砸了！！

[h1] 优点：[/h1]
画风好评，人物画风都挺好看的，很有墨西哥的风格，操作挺流畅的，还可以随着游戏剧情学习技能，BOSS关卡好评，每个BOSS都有自己的特色，收集要素挺多的，每个城镇还有有一定的支线任务，到游戏的后面还可以在现实和亡者的世界场景随时切换，场景也有变化，感觉制作组挺用心的！（切换的目的就是为了找路！！！！）有多人模式，可以和好友一起玩。

[h1] 缺点：[/h1]
有些地方难度有点大，有些地方对于手残来说真的是折磨，要挂个N次才能过关。不支持在线联机，只能在本地和好友玩！

剧情：总的来说就是英雄救美，不过最后都死了，虽然死了，但在亡者世界过上了幸福的生活。

我通关后在额外内容里看到还有两个未解锁的游戏CG，然后我看别人说，在游戏中收集全面具碎片，有另一个结局片，所以还有一个是困难模式通关？会有另一个CG？我是不想在打一遍了！！！！对手残来说很不友好，很难受，收集也不想收集了，路痴更难受。

author: {'steamid': '76561198057027074', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1092, 'last_played': 1525593520}
review: This game isn't that good.  There just aren't enough bosses, and that's even though they added another one for this version, it seriously needs at least 4 more.  The abilities double as attacks and are fun to use, but this game is very blatantly linear.  Hard mode is better than normal mode, but you have to beat normal mode to get it and normal mode is super easy.  I tried doing a no upgrade hard mode run, only to discover that without a power added for this version it's completely impossible.  Multiplayer is fun but only if everyone really tries, and you have to do the little beginning thing to get there so that's dumb.  I just can't reccommend this remake, wish I played the original even though it's worse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068158926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1494818485}
review:
Low playtime since I beat this game on PS4.

One of the best Metroidvaniasthere is. Fun and fluid platforming, satisfying and diverse combat (Feels like Brawlhalla or simplified Smash Bros.), gorgeous artwork, varying environments, and a good sense of humor. It's got a great difficulty curve and integrates your movement abilities into combat and exploration nicely.

Metroidvanias I liked more: Castlevania SOTN, Dark Souls (If you count that as Metroidvania)
Metroidvanias I liked less: Hollow Knight, Ori and the Blind Forest, Dead Cells (also a rougelite), and Metroid Fusion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048913108', 'num_games_owned': 577, 'num_reviews': 311, 'playtime_forever': 1526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1526, 'last_played': 1523548433}
review:
At first, after three years that I've reviewed the Gold Edition, I think I can come back to this and gives a thumb up.

But the main weakness of the game still comes from poor design controller button combination. It feels too frustrated to love the game anymore, though other aspect of the game such as art, music, story, are really, really great!

There's a very, very thin line that separate a good challenging game (practice a lot and I can do that), and a fuck-up-your-mood-with-too-complex-challenge-design game (luck play major role in order to pass the challenge). Sadly, this game fall into the 2nd category.
