author: {'steamid': '76561198024069127', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 630, 'last_played': 1659816328}
review:
Увидел у друга статус о скидке на данную игру и заинтересовался. После рекомендации друга и скриншотов/видео решил приобрести (на момент покупки скидка была довольно большая)

Пускай в первые 5-10 минут игры она может и не поражать чем-то невероятным, но после прохождения пролога игра раскрывается на все 100.

Плюсы:

- Визуальное и звуковое исполнение очень понравились. Игра правда очень красиво выглядит.
- Множество мелких деталей, которые можно замечать в разных вариантах одной локации (ее версии в мире живых и мире мертвых).
- Управление персонажем и боевая система хоть и простые, но очень удобные.
- Забавные персонажи и юмор, хоть последнего чуть меньше, чем хотелось бы видеть в подобной игре.
- Большой игровой мир, разделенный на локации (что типично для жанра). В локациях много секретов, которые становятся доступны после открытия новых способностей персонажа.
- Множество костюмов для персонажей (наглядный пример - костюм курицы). Ближе к середине игры можно будет даже (небольшой спойлер) [spoiler] превращаться в курицу, чтобы исследовать закоулки, куда обычно не пролезть [/spoiler].
- В игре есть кооператив для 4-х игроков, но увы, только локальный.

Минусы:

- Хотелось бы, чтобы игра была подольше (прохождение с обеими концовками заняло 10 часов).
- Отсутствие игры по сети.
- Управление хоть и простое, но мне пришлось конкретно перенастраивать клавиши под себя. Зато стало крайне удобно.
- Крайне много backtracking'а. Понимаю, что жанр игры такой, но лично я не особо это люблю.

Насколько я понял, это последнее и самое полное издание игры, в котором исправлено множество недостатков предыдуших версий. Если я не прав, то я оказался не прав.

TL:DR: Отличная игра в жанре "Metroidvania". Взял по скидке и не жалею ни капли.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119875437', 'num_games_owned': 387, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1572, 'last_played': 1523179552}

author: {'steamid': '76561198091787231', 'num_games_owned': 336, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1076, 'last_played': 1523624736}
review:
It's hard to find games that are good in both platforming and combat, this game does it wonderfully.

It's another metroidvania, if you played one of these, you'll know what to expect. It has a nice and colorful artstyle, the characters are fun and likeable, the soundtrack is incredible. As you progress, you get new power-ups that you use to break blocks that block your path. They're also needed for breaking enemy shields, doing some sweet combos and going through some very well-made platforming sections. So the game gets better and better with more power-ups, and ends with one final level which will throw everything at you. There were a few small problems I had when I searched for all the remaining chests after beating the game. There was some boring backtracking and many chests had money, but at that point I already bought everything. The difficulty (in normal mode) is just right.

Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition is great and you should play it

Now off to hard mode

Update: Hard mode beaten. It honestly wasn't as hard as I expected it to be. Enemies do more damage, have more health, bosses are a bit different, etc. If you beat normal mode without much trouble and know some good combos, this mode won't be so hard for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158429750', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 646, 'last_played': 1522921564}
review:
2편이 출시된다길래 1편을 빠르게 클리어해봤습니다.
짧게 평하자면 코옵이 되는 플랫포머/액션 게임이라 단평을..

매트로배니아의 오픈월드구성에 구간마다 챌린지를 클리어하는 식으로 만들어져있습니다.
분위기는 애니메이션 코코에 나오는 멕시코 죽의자들의 밤/축제 같은 분위기 입니다.

단점으로는 메트로배니아 특유의 탐험느낌을 받을 수 없었습니다. 말이 메트로배니아지 스토리라인은 거의 선형구조라서
메트로배니아의 장점을 살리지 못했다 생각합니다. 
스킬을 얻으면 못갔던 새로운방향을 탐험하는 느낌이 없이 내비게이션만 따라가기만하면 클리어되니 차라리 내비게이션을 없애는게 나았을수도 있다 생각합니다.

오히려 플랫포머의 재미는 더 있었다고 생각되네요. 챌린지 구간마다 액션이나 플랫포머구성을 나름 도전할만했습니다.

review:

review: esse jogo é incrivel muito bem equilibrado e não é enjoativo

author: {'steamid': '76561198390889651', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1608840950}
review:
Bom jogo, apresenta um estilo de plataforma padrão, mas tem uma jogabilidade boa, 
oferece suporte ao cooperativo local,
boa trilha sonora e, além do mais, apresenta gráficos 2D bonitos e fluidos.
Mas ele apresenta uma "jogatina" muito linear,
basicamente lutar com monstros que depois de um tempo não oferecem dificuldade,
pegar novos golpes, voltar pelo mapa, quando se está com cansado de andar pelo mapa usar o teleporte,
dentre outros pontos que o tornam um pouco chato com o passar de algumas horas.
Seguindo assim um estilo que lembra um pouco o Castlevania: Aria of Sorrow do Gameboy Advance(GBA) que foi um ótimo jogo.

Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition tem muitos pontos para ser um jogo, mas até eles melhorarem esses pontos antes informados vamos ter alguns pequenos problemas.

Atenção: Caso tenha o Guacamelee Gold Edition, pense bem antes de comprar esse, pois ele é somente a versão definitiva do game.

review:
Ein richtig gutes Spiel !!!

Das beste daran, und leider ist es eine Seltenheit, gibt es einen Koop modus, wo man die gesamte Kampanie mit einem Freund durchspielen kann.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037986993', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1524342254}
review:
Joguinho bem divertido no estilo hack and slash 2D. Peguei ele por menos de R$ 3,00 na promoção então, por esse preço, acho que vale bem a pena. Se você explorar bem deve te dar umas 9h de jogo. A música é bem legal e combina com a ambientação, além de que existem várias referências no jogo para memes e outras coisas que são bem legais. Mas é só isso, um joguinho divertido pra passar o tempo, não tem nenhuma grande complexidade como vi algumas pessoas comentando por aqui (muito pelo contrário, achei os puzzles bem simples). A história tbm é bem superficial (bem contada), mas sabe quando falta algo? Pareceu um pouco infantil demais para mim, mas talvez esse seja o grande público.

Nota: 7,5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198063495681', 'num_games_owned': 245, 'num_reviews': 157, 'playtime_forever': 1414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1414, 'last_played': 1523071326}
review:
Una lavada de cara de los Metroidvanias. Sencillo, pero fluido y dinamico. Excelente sistema de peleas, enfocado en derrotar oleadas y oleadas de monstruos con tecnicas sacadas de la lucha libre.
Lleno de humor y [i] eater eggs [/i], en un juego que se resuelve en una sentada: o lo dejas por que lo pasaste, o por que te duelen los dedos, como a mi.
Super recomendado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198291182785', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 944, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 798, 'last_played': 1522672363}
review:
The story of Guacamelee begins with Juan, a simple farmer in Pueblucho who has feelings for El Presidente's daughter. The narrative progresses as Juan embarks on a mission to rescue El Presidente's daughter after she is kidnapped in an attack on Pueblucho. While a metroidvania game like Guacamelee may not be expected to have a deep storyline, the game does a good job of incorporating well-designed dialogues with characters and a sense of humor. The bosses, including the main boss Carlos, are also interesting in their own ways.

The soundtracks in Guacamelee help create the atmosphere of its world. Prior to playing Guacamelee, I had finished Hollow Knight, and while Guacamelee may not focus on extreme difficulty, it provides a more casual experience for those who are familiar with the metroidvania style. The combat mechanics are satisfying, allowing you to defeat enemies without even touching the ground, which adds a lot of fun to the gameplay.

There are also creative side quests to complete in the towns, such as herding chickens by punching them and collecting collectibles on a complicated map. These additional activities provide a good way to further enjoy the world of Guacamelee.

And yes, one unique aspect of the game is that you can transform into a chicken, adding an extra layer of fun and gameplay variety
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1350226842

author: {'steamid': '76561198301042594', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1522748198}
review: Wegen des Preisnachlasses gekauft, wegen der Steuerung (Tastatur) zunächst verflucht und nun doch ziemlich begeistert. Eingetaucht in eine farbenfrohe, musikalisch rhythmisch begleitete Welt kämpft man sich so durch die Szenerien und schmettert trotz gewöhnungsbedürftiger Steuerung nach und nach immer zuverlässiger Skelette und Monster klein. Explodierende Hühner, Tore in andere Dimensionen, Frauen in Nöten, verzwickte Tastenkombos, Plattformen, an denen man verzweifeln könnte, kurze Dialoge, die durch das Geschehen führen... Einige Bestandteile lassen sich sicher auch in anderen Actionspielen finden, dennoch bleibt Guacamelee meiner Ansicht nach einzigartig und lädt zum längeren Spielen ein. Koop wird auf jeden Fall noch getestet, aber selbst als Solo würde ich das Spiel auf jeden Fall empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030861235', 'num_games_owned': 426, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 1423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1226, 'last_played': 1556656999}
review:
Oh, cavolo! Sono le tre di notte e non mi sono nemmeno accorto. Questo gioco ti prende come solo pochi arcade del passato potevano. Ve lo straconsiglio perché oltre ad essere divertente ed immediato, offre un adeguato livello di sfida e la crescita del personaggio che acquisisce sempre più abilità (=combo di tasti sempre più difficili da fare) lo rende sempre più interessante. Il tutto è ben caratterizzato e teso a parodiare l'uomo tipico messicano. Una ironia simpatica, che parte già dal titolo e che ci può stare. 
Probabilmente il titolo ha una media longevità. Sono ad 11 ore di gioco (tutte in un giorno... !!!!! - probabilmente l'ho lasciato qualche ora in standby) e sono al 50% del gioco. Non ho sperimentato ancora il multiplayer ma si può giocare anche in 4 sullo stesso pc. Bellissimo, per un gioco che ha anche aspetti da picchiaduro alla double dragon. Attorno ai 5 euro è un affare!!! Adesso lo prendete per meno di un euro e non potete lasciarvelo sfuggire!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198076678939', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1541081058}
review:
Yes, this section is unclearable without your super form called Intenso. Yes, we'll give you an enemy to recharge it right before you need it. Oh, and also, unlikely pretty much any other time you activate this, you don't activate it. It automatically activates upon killing that one thing that gives extra charge. So then, you see the things you need this to kill in time, and you press the button to activate it. Of course, it's also the deactivation button, and we automatically activated it. Also, when you pressed it, the amount of charge left went just below the amount needed to turn it back on. Oh, yeah, and these things you need to kill have shields that make them invulnerable until you hit them with a specific special attack, depending on the shield color, special attacks which take up a resource which needs a few seconds to recharge. Oh, and also, these enemies will explode in 10 seconds. There's 14 of them in the room, and if you don't kill them before they explode, you take damage, no matter where you are. So, now that you're left without your Intenso, facing 14 things which damage a large portion of your health each time they damage you, which have shields that make them invulnerable without the correct attack, and if you don't kill them within 10 seconds they'll damage you no matter where you are, and deal full damage, regardless of distance. Oh, and also, they won't all explode at the same exact time, and instead explode in a sequence. Meaning that your invincibility frames can't save you from taking lots of damage. 
Have fun!
But, seriously, this game is fun. Of course, in spite of the comedic tone it takes most of the time, I don't think it's ever made me laugh except by accident, and this was really annoying, but it's a fun game. 
It's also not the kind of game that keeps fairness in mind. Unlike games like Dead Cells, Dark Souls, or Enter the Gungeon, when you take damage in this game it's not always going to be your fault. It's very unfair in that regard. For example, there's one fight (I'm not sure if you encounter more of that enemy later on) in which you can't dodge attacks using the roll, your dedicated dodge button. Because it's always great to make sure the button that you're supposed to use to dodge is incapable of dodging. By that, I don't mean it's too wide to dodge, or lasts too long for the roll, I mean it ignores the damage negation of the roll. 
That would be like if in Enter the Gungeon the Dodge Rolls didn't prevent damage while in the air. That would essentially mean that you just take constant damage, and I doubt it would be possible to even get to the third floor except with extremely good rng, much less the difficult sixth floor.
This game is fun. I would definitely say play it, if it weren't for the amount of bullshit damage you take. Of course, you can still dodge most attacks (if faced alone. Not in groups. In groups you will take damage), but it's a hell of a lot more likely that you'll take damage that wasn't your fault than it would be in the games which get called hard. 
This game does let you have a lot more health though, and you'll find it randomly coming back in the middle of fights due to health orbs. The difference between these types of games and the actually hard games is that the hard game are actually more fair with their attacks, but they don't let you recover so quickly and easily.

author: {'steamid': '76561198256732029', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 573, 'last_played': 1522548287}
review:
its hilarious

edit:
i normally dont review games but i felt this one deserves it, since i played through it almost without stop.
its a metroidvania game where you start out with little but as you progress you can chain your combos together quite well and the dodge system makes combat very skillful and extremely satisfying. the humour is great, i loved it throughout the whole game. the leveldesign felt good too, never too hard but also not too easy, just right i would say. it keeps on adding new mechanics that get somewhat explained by an example room and then put to test and i thought this was genius design honestly.

the soundtrack kept being stuck in my head after playing and fits extremely well, especially the boss theme.

to some it might be rather challenging, but for me it felt very good, i would say im an advanced gamer in terms of skill but by no means a master.

i put about 9 hours into this exploring most of the stuff but apparently missed out on all the secret rooms which are apparently very hard to unlock an alternate ending, but i did not bother to do that. honestly right now for 1,50$ this is a steal, get this game.

definitely looking forward to the 2nd installment of this game

author: {'steamid': '76561198142452530', 'num_games_owned': 311, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 12942, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1393, 'last_played': 1556108478}
review:
[h1]Guacamelee: AND HIS NAME IS DOM JUAN!![/h1]

Guacamelee, sortie le 21 août 2014, par la société indépendante DrinkBox Studios, est un jeu D'action-métroidevania vraiment ahurisant. Malgré la piètre (pour moi) réception qu'il a eu niveau vente, il devrait être vraiment pour moi, beaucoup plus connu. Mais pourquoi? Je m'explique:

Histoire: 8/10

Dom Juan, agriculteur d'agave mexicain, doit aller sauver sa promise, la fille de El Presidente, des mains du cruel Carlos Calaca.
([strike]Boum Chacalaca[/strike]). Pour cela il devra franchir de nombreuses étapes et suplexer les sous-fiffres du vilain carlos (pas le calamar) afin de pouvoir atteindre son objectif. La différence entre les joueurs de Super Turbo Championship Edition et du Gold sont que l'histoire est légérement modifié. Mais sinon, cela reste une très bonne histoire dans les deux éditions.

Graphismes: 9/10

Etant un jeu parlant d'une histoire ce passant au mexique, Guacamelee contient des graphismes colorés à vous défoncer la vue. Sans dec', la qualité graphique pour un jeu indépendant 2D comme celui là, c'est de la balle. Rien à dire.

Gameplay/Game Design: 10/10

Du début jusqu'à la fin du jeu, vous apprendrez de nouvelles capacités (plutôt des prises de luchador) qui vous permettrons d'avancé dans l'aventure. Il est aussi possible de trouvé des fraguements de coeur, de crâne, ou bien de talissement afin d'améliorer votre santé, votre endurance, ou bien votre jauge de super luchador. Grâce au système de monnaie, on peut aussi acheter des prises de lutte permettant de fendre encore plus de crâne et à faire encore plus mal. Certe, tout ça est bien banal, mais pour moi, c'est parfait.

Bande Sonore: 9/10

Les sons et les musiques collent à la perfection avec le thème choisi et permettent au joueur de bien savourer les doux sons des guitares sèches, et des bonnes raclées que vous mettez. 

Note Final: 94/100

Si vous voulez tout simplement mon avis, Guacamelee STCE est pour moi le jeu indé de 2014, et est un chef-d'oeuvre que je ne me lasserai jamais d'y jouer. Le multi-joueur en vaut la peine aussi. Même si il coûte 14 euros, c'est un must have absolue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008532878', 'num_games_owned': 408, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1390, 'last_played': 1521389594}
review:
레슬링의 멋진 기술 & 호쾌한 타격감과 메트로바니아의 특징을 잘 융합한 게임이다. 같은 게임의 골드 에디션에 비해 도전과제의 개수도 줄어들었고 게임 자체도 많이 쉬워졌다, 만 하드 모드의 난이도 설계는 조금 이상한 것 같다. 중반에 갑자기 어려워지더니 후반부는 노멀 모드랑 다를 게 없이 아주 쉽고...

물론 도전과제 달성 등을 신경 쓰지 않고 1회차만 완벽 플레이 + 진엔딩 보기에는 아주 만족스러운 게임이다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000368827', 'num_games_owned': 1253, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 611, 'last_played': 1553007800}
review:
This is almost a perfect game, amazingly well designed and balanced, buttery smooth, gorgeous visuals, amazing soundtrack, tons of good quality humor and references; a perfect iteration on the Metroidvania genre, improves what needed to be improved and dropped what needed to be dropped; you can play however you want, there are plenty of combinations of gameplay styles and a truckload of secrets and uprades to find and unlock. The game difficulty is pretty much perfect, easy and fun to play but hard to master, with plenty of optional challenges to try when you're feeling sassy; I've played ~9 hours so far and I'm not done with the main story yet, not to mention the optional stuff; I'm not sure what the replayability will be, but based on what I've seen, it's gonna be high. 

9.5/10, one of the best games I've played in years.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006077632', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 815, 'last_played': 1520824037}
review:
Guacamelee Super Turbo Championship Edition (STCE), where even the name is a reference. 

By Drinkbox Studios, who also made Severed (worth playing), Guacamelee is a Metroidvania/beat em up where you play as one Juan. I didn't catch a last name, but he probably has one. He dies, dons an Undead luchador mask, then chases after his childhood love who's been kidnapped. Which is a bit risky and unique for a plot, haven't seen it done before. Especially with a mute protagonist.

Having 100%'d both this and Gold, STCE is a flat improvement over Gold. Graphics improvements being the least of it, stuff like changing boss movesets so they go toe-to-toe with you instead of being puzzle bosses improves on some heavy issues I had with the original. That's without mentioning the changes to the forgettable challenges.

Regardless of the rest of the review, if you're choosing between this and Gold, go with this.

[h1]"Juan?? It's you?"[/h1]
[i]- There you, the damsel's entire arc in a nutshell[/i]

Juan rescues the damsel, I don't remember her name after two games, by following the large waypoint marker on his map to the next segment or boss. You can access side rooms off the main path for collectable upgrades, take a punch or two more to the face, but generally you're just lead by the nose which conveniently pokes out of the Luchador mask. 

Along the way, you fight a fair few enemy types with a combat system that is, in theory, alright. You hit an enemy with a launcher and can chain every special move together before landing. Combine with a basic combo and you can get some decent variation going on with your Luche Libre antics.

It's a shame that every single enemy in the game will either die midway into a combo, even on Hard, or will just break out of it whenever. It boils down to "launch enemies and alternate attacks to amuse yourself". 

Their idea of a challenging enemy type is one with undodgeable (just jump instead) attacks that breaks out of combos super early. Amazing.

[h1]"Poncho? Don't go into the light!"[/h1]
[i]- The combo chicken mourning his skeleton employee called Poncho. They think this is hilarious[/i]

You've got a jaunty soundtrack to all of this. I didn't have any problems with the music, but my roommate said it was drilling a hole into his skull so I don't know, take that one as you would. Aesthetics remain alright and they pushed the tween style to its limits, it worked out well.

So you've got an alright game, that isn't particularly mechanically special or notable but has a decent premise, right? So how'd they handle this, writing-wise?

With a constant litany of garbage, me-too referential nonsense and incoherent attempts at humour in every turn. Every screen is a reference, every dialogue is a reference or terrible pun. You never get away from it. And there's no kind way to say it isn't funny, but it just isn't funny.

[h1]"Oh no, you broke my Chozo statue!"[/h1]
[i]- Fuck you[/i]

Luche Libre beat-em-up with some exploration. That carries a game by itself, it didn't need any of this writing done so badly it's disgusting. No, 2008 memes, prattling on about mothers, puns or "dude ponchos and sombreros" is funny. None of it. It was awful to sit through.

Overall, Guacamelee is a fantastic premise, that has a pretty rote tired game attached that manages to drag, and is attached to some of the most obnoxious, grabbag, referential humour that'll make you taste bile. 

I recommend it to lobotomy patients and people who want to be disappointed in life.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997831552', 'num_games_owned': 1717, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1135, 'last_played': 1520790932}
review: Uno de los juegos más divertidos y balanceados que he jugado. La progresión esta increíblemente bien balanceada y el reto se hace proporcional a la cantidad de horas de juego y habilidades desbloqueadas. Partes como un alfeñique y terminas siendo la reencarnación de Blue Demon. 100% recomendado.

review: Um jogo de plataforma sensacional, muito bem ambientado, cheio do estereótipo mexicano, com um humor verdadeiramente engraçado, os personagens são muito bem feitos, com bons diálogos (principalmente o Jaguar Javier), a tradução para o português está excelente (inclusive as gírias), a estória é boa, o tempo de duração do jogo é bom, a progressão das habilidades acontece até o final do jogo, a dificuldade é muito boa também... Enfim, um jogo excelente de plataforma... Recomendadíssimo ! ! !

author: {'steamid': '76561197989091200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 1162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1162, 'last_played': 1519458443}
review:
Excellent platformer.

Gameplay:
Fluid, tight controls. A beat-em up that finds the perfect balance where it's not a mindless button masher, but also not so complicated that you need to memorize crazy combos (there is a part like in the training gym, but it's optional). You're able to pull off flashy combos if you care to, but even the simple stuff is fun and satisfying. The game has a lot of optional challenges as well if you want to push yourself to the limit. The game has plenty of secrets/upgrades (much like metroid, and the game isn't pretending that it isn't metroid-inspired). Parts of the game will require you to input some pretty complicated button combos to get through (relative to many other platformer type games), and the game is at its best when you're using all of your skills to get through stuff. The boss battles are also good, without ever devolving into a button masher.
There are also plenty of in-game unlocks, which is how things should be... so sick of "unlock the costume DLC".

Story:
Serviceable. The game sets up characters that you care about (both good and bad), with a "save the princess" goal (which is fine). Plenty of humour, plenty of references put in (although nothing is hamfisted in). The good and bad ending are both good and worth seeing.

Sound:
Soundtrack is very good, and the in game sounds are great as well.

Art/Environment:
Beautifully animated, with plenty of variety in the scenery... especially when you start going in between dead and living world, some of the variations are quite creative and beautiful to look at.


Overall:
This is a very good title. If I had to assign an arbitrary score, it receives a solid A- to A. (For reference: Hollow Knight recently took my top A+ spot, with Super Metroid coming in behind that somewhere).
If you like platformer/beat-em up/Metroid, and are interested in a more light-hearted, but still highly polished and fun game, pick this up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198295003615', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 877, 'last_played': 1478772390}
review:
This game's graphics are gorgeous not lying when I'm saying that I consider this one of the best metroidvania games I ever played a long with metroid, castlevania, Ori and the blind Forest and Outland for sure. The vibrant graphics are beautiful, the the power-ups were very creative and also how it makes nods to and poking fun at metroid element were entertaining as well the challenge room were very entertaining as I practise a lot to overcome it. Also the combat system was good with combos and the array of moves it's impressive. I find this game even better than Hollow Knight

As I would say every time I play this game "Let's Lucha"

author: {'steamid': '76561198106851461', 'num_games_owned': 8601, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1517262904}
review:
En Guacamelee controlaremos a un aguacate que se convierte en luchador por azares del destino, también conocido como raptan a la mujer. 

[b]¿Qué me ha gustado?[/b]
[list][*]La ambientación, la verdad que el Día de Muertos de México es bastante interesante, diferente.
[*]La música está bastante bien también.
[/list]

[b]¿Qué no me ha gustado?[/b]
[list][*] No me he hecho a los controles, los combos me resultan incómodos y ha terminado siendo un machaca-botones. No disfruto con el control.
[*]La historia, sin llegarla a terminar, resulta algo cliché. Diría que está por estar.[/list]

La verdad que le tenía bastantes ganas, la mayoría lo pone bastante bien, pero en mi caso el control me ha parecido mediocre. Lo que ha lastrado toda mi experiencia de juego convirtiéndolo en el machaca-botones que comentaba, sin tener una sensación de disfrute al hacer combos.

Lo mejor del juego sin duda es golpear a las gallinas y romperle las cosas a la cabra loca.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994372877', 'num_games_owned': 513, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 686, 'last_played': 1518490941}
review:
As a game goes, it's okay. As a Metroid game, it's rather poor however. The level design stretches on and on but the areas never loop back on themselves.  As a consequence, the game really relies on you using the Moai Heads to fast travel too much.  But that's only between areas.  When traversing in a single area, there's rarely a way to quickly from one end of an area to another.  The game needed a few more shortcuts and/or the levels needed to intertwine a little bit more to be better. The combat is good, but the movement can be a bit sticky at times, causing some unnecessary headaches.

I recommend this game, but merely as an individual product. If you're looking for a good Metroid game, go somewhere else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065068952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1504036357}
review: Guacamelee is a classic in the metroidvania genre, and while much of the game feels somewhat dated by modern standards, it's still an excellent game. If you like metroidvanias to any degree, I highly recommend you get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998343607', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 929, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 929, 'last_played': 1517941684}
review:
➕ Good soundtrack
➕ Fun combination of Metroidvania and Beat 'em up.
➕ Many improvements from previous release "Guacamelee! Gold Edition" such as: Multiple save files, Four player coop, New Boss and boss theme, Two new zones, Two new costumes, Two new powers, More enemies, Enemy Health bars, Change to power screens so they aren't as seizure inducing, improved design of breakable blocks and undodgeable attacks.

➖ MEMES

Originally played Gold edition and got tired of it. Went back to play this version not really knowing all the changes and I had a lot more fun.
Totally recommend this to anyone who likes combo heavy violence where you throw skeletons around and juggle them in the air with punches.

Only negative I have to say about the game is the use of memes. They're everywhere and they aren't very funny. It's just memes in spanish.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970314107', 'num_games_owned': 2304, 'num_reviews': 917, 'playtime_forever': 580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 580, 'last_played': 1516608515}
review:
I was not real pleased with the original Guacamelee, I’ll tell you that right now. What started off as a comical romp through a technicolor fantasy Mexico turned to acute frustration about halfway in. Too many aspects of the game left a bitter taste, like the complex fights and the punishing platforming and the secrets that weren’t even clear on if they were obtainable or not. It was enough to ruin the game for me, and almost enough for me to ignore this edition of it. Thank goodness it didn’t though, because the Super Turbo Championship Edition addresses my complaints so cleverly and so completely that it has rocketed up to one of my favorite platformers on Steam.

Juan is but a poor agave farmer on the outskirts of tiny Pueblucho, a town made notable by the sudden appearance of the skeletal Calaca. Señor Skelebones makes off with el Presidente’s daughter for a diabolical ritual, and Juan is felled trying to save his old flame. Luckily for him the worlds of the living and the dead are crossing at weird angles, granting him the divine power of the luchadores and another shot at life. On the trail of Calaca, Juan will discover a world of colorful landscapes and zany characters including Tostada the ghost luchadora, Uay Chivo the goat master, Flame Face the disgraced gunslinger, and even the devil himself. Oh, and there might also be a few hundred skeletons to beat up and items to find, too.

Guacamelee is a metroidvania in the modern mold of Outland and Insanely Twisted Shadow Planet, one with wide-open levels and very obvious gating. As you progress through the game you’ll earn new moves like headbutts and uppercuts that  can destroy certain colors of blocks, allowing you to revisit previous areas and crack open their delicious secrets. Powers aren’t just limited to combat moves either, because you’ll score some obvious ones like double-jumping and wall-running and less obvious ones like turning into a chicken. Guacamelee also has the novel power to flip between two worlds (remember, the original Guacamelee dated from when this was still novel) and give you access to different platforms to scale and different enemies to suplex.

That last power is a pretty good example of what you’ll face in your spirited romp. When you first gain it you’ll use it to phase walls out of your way or make platforms up to new areas appear. Once you’ve gotten comfortable with it you’ll have to flip dimensions mid-jump to cross some hazards. And by the end of the game you’ll be using it in conjunction with your mobility powers to run up one wall, phase through it, run up a second wall, phase through spikes, launch off the top and phase through six more pillars in your way. The movement and controls in Guacamelee are incredibly smooth and responsive, but they need to be to keep up with the borderline-absurd challenges you’ll have to overcome with them.

You’ll be facing just as much resistance on the combat side of the game as well. Guacamelee is designed as a brawler, complete with combination attacks, grabs, launchers, air combos, and specials to mix into the, well, melee. Once you get the hang of it you can body slam a skeleton, boot him into his pals, falcon punch them into a flying uppercut and headbutt them into oblivion. You won’t need to do that, thankfully, but the controls make it easy enough to string attacks together into delicious smoothies of pain. What you will need to do is break colored shields with the corresponding powers, or wear down shields with repeated attacks, or shift dimensions to attack shadow enemies, or pound down exploding foes before they blow up the screen. Despite all of your neat moves the battles will still find ways to limit your options and kill you if you slip up at an inopportune time.

These two points, the complex combat and punishing platforming, were what put me off the original Guacamelee. Apparently the developers heard that from a lot of people, so they set about fixing it in this version. They smartly toned down a bunch of the platforming so that, while still difficult, it’s not quite as maddening as it was before. The combat, though, they fixed in an absolutely brilliant way. Rather than change the encounters or challenges, they added a new system called INTENSO over the whole thing. When your INTENSO meter is full enough you can transform, making your attacks stronger, faster, and able to punch through shields no matter the color. Plus you can upgrade INTENSO to last longer and regenerate health, and you can turn it on and off at will as long as you’re above the minimum. It’s an entirely optional system that’s a ton of fun to use, and lets you blow clean through any battle that’s giving you trouble.

I mentioned upgrades, and there are more than enough to keep even the most jaded metroidvaniahead busy here. You’ve got the common extensions to your health, stamina, and INTENSO meters, found in pieces in chests or from doing hilarious sidequests for residents. Then there are chests containing the game’s two currencies, coins for buying basic upgrades to your moves and silver for buying costumes with dramatic passive effects. If you are particularly daring you can also seek out the five gateways to Chac Mool, a secret realm that hides the key to the game’s good ending (which you will probably want, it’s very sweet). This will require overcoming five very different challenges that will push your mastery of the game to its limits, though. They’re clever in their designs and I enjoyed conquering them for the most part, but they are the kind of obstacles that can have you pulling hair.

Guacamelee isn’t for the faint of heart, even with the upgrades of the Super Turbo Championship Edition. It’s not mean-spirited like Ori or foreboding like Hollow Knight but it expects you to master its mechanics to a level that most games don’t. It does it with a smile, though, between the hilarious dialog and the zany characters and the cartoonish battles. The bright, bold, papered art style is absolutely perfect for the game, and the upbeat soundtrack will keep your blood pumping as you pound skeletons. I might not have appreciated it before but I adore it now, and I would put Guacamelee near the top of any platformer list just on fun factor alone.



Did you enjoy this review? I certainly hope so, and I certainly hope you'll check out more of them at https://goldplatedgames.com/ or on my [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/11322459/]curation page[/url]!

author: {'steamid': '76561197999967823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 815, 'last_played': 1515857424}
review:
идеальный представитель платформера/метроидвании 

ни разу не заскучал, дизайн уровней выше всех похвал, не приходится в пустую пробегать пол уровня для того чтобы 
попасть в новую зонеу как это было в Hollow Knight 

боевка отличная

есть места где придется попотеть, но все это находится на золотой серидине сложности, где после десятка попыток вы все равно пройдете участок, а не будете сидеть с сотней неудачных попыток на подгоревшем стуле. 

10 из 10 и маст хэв для любителей жанра

author: {'steamid': '76561198403964341', 'num_games_owned': 62, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1396, 'last_played': 1513321997}
review:
Soy Méxicano y apruebo este juego :D
La ambientacion, es colorida y aun que que algo caricaturizada, representan de buena manera el folclor del lugar en el que se basa.
La jugabilidad es buena, apesar de que hay poderes opcionales que rompen con la dificultad del juego y lo hacen demasiado facil y de que aveces el tiempo de respuesta de los controles es demasiado rapida provocando un ataque doble.
Juego recomendado, aunque no he probado muchos juegos con este tipo de jugabilidad, tal vez piensen de otra manera los fanaticos este genero.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124199218', 'num_games_owned': 832, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 970, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 950, 'last_played': 1514789315}
review:
Guacamelee is a colorful metroidvania styled platformer reminiscent of the older Super Metroid and Castlevania games. If you enjoyed playing these games chances are you will enjoy Guacamelee.

Pros:
+Beautiful Mexican themed world that feels unique.
+Responsive controls so no frustration.
+Great combo system which allows you to chain together combos easily.
+Easily earned currency in game which you can use to upgrade stats or change wardrobe to gain certain bonuses.
+Learning curve for the game isn't hard.
+Unique bosses to fight throughout the story.
+Pollo Power!, Yes you can turn into a fighting chicken.

Cons:
-Game can be a bit on the easy side since difficulty doesn't really come from the enemies but rather traversing obstacles and solving environmental puzzles.
-Game can be a little short especially for those only concerned with playing through the story. However if achievement hunting you could possibly get some more hours of gameplay.

review: Three different PC's, three different controllers.  Every combination the game crashes at the same point.  I'd love to be giving this game a thumbs up 'cause from what I can play it seems great.  It's just, 15 minutes in and I have to ALT-F4.

author: {'steamid': '76561198255276307', 'num_games_owned': 441, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 636, 'last_played': 1516065335}
review:
[h1] Introdução	[/h1]

Guacamelee! STCE é a versão definitiva de "Guacamelee", trazendo ajustes, novas fases e chefe e alguns elementos da jogabilidade. Trata-se de um Metroidvania com elementos de beat 'em up tendo o folclore mexicano como tema. Nele controlamos Juan, um aldeão que sonhava em ser um luchador, que é morto pelo vilão Carlos Calaca, um esqueleto que deseja usar a filha de El Presidente num ritual que fundirá os mundos dos vivos e dos mortos, para que ele governe sobre todos. No mundos dos mortos, Juan é escolhido pela máscara de um lendário luchador e retorna para enfrentar Carlos...


[h1] Jogabilidade	[/h1]

Guacamelee! STCE funciona como todo metroidvania. Um jogo 2D de plataforma com um vasto mundo aberto cujas "fases"desbloqueiam à medida que o jogador adquire as habilidades necessárias para alcançar novas localidades, como pulo duplo, escalada e até voo. Seu grande diferencial se dá pelo sistema de combate, um puro beat 'em up cheio de golpes e combos incrivelmente divertido com movimentos típicos de lucha libre. Um poder que permite transitar entre os dois mundos cria um fator chave no jogo e em seu sistema de transição entre as fases e solução de puzzles e missões. Há ainda o medidor "muy macho", uma espécie de modo berseker e uma das novidades desta versão do jogo.
Guacamelee! STCE pode ainda ser jogado por até 4 players, e possui uma variedade grande de skins que conferem habilidades aos personagens (Juan e Tostada), além de suporte para as skins criadas na Oficina Steam.
Seus pontos fracos, são dois. O primeiro, o jogo é muito curto, podendo ser facilmente concluído em menos de 10 horas.
E o segundo, a forma como se apresentam os bloqueios de caminho do mapa. 90% deles se resumem a pedras coloridas que só podem ser quebradas por uma habilidade de mesma cor. Isso tira um bocado do desafio, pois, ao invés de precisar descobrir como passar, qual habilidade nova irá permitir que você prossiga, a informação está lá desde o começo. 

[h1] Visual	[/h1]

A arte de Guacamelee! STCE é simplesmente fantástica. Sprites grandes, coloridos e muito bem animados, uma arte que combina o estilo cartunesco dos anos 2000 com a própria arte mexicana e aqui um destaque para este elemento. Os cenários, os NPCs, inimigos e todo o mais são cultura mexicana pura. A ambientação é perfeita, bela. Vilarejos, templos antigos, e até mesmo uma ilha de bonecas estão presentes. O jogo ainda faz inúmeras referências a jogos famosos nos diversos cartazes espalhados pelo seu mundo.

[h1] Som	[/h1]

O grande destaque sonoro vai completamente a trilha sonora, que assim como o visual, encorpora perfeitamente o folclore e a cultura mexicana. Música tradicional do México, e muito bem reproduzida, com uma versão normal e uma versão "Mundo de los Muertos" para cada faixa. Para quem aprecia folk, vale MUITO a pena comprar a trilha sonora do jogo.

[h1] Em suma...	[/h1]

Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition é um jogo demasiado divertido. Um metroidvania muito bem construído com um sistema de combate divertido e empolgante. Desafiador na medidade certa, com personagens carismáticos e um conteúdo robusto de cultura e folclore mexicano. A falta de criatividade nos bloqueios de caminho do jogo pode ser algo negativo, mas, não ofusca o brilho desta obra, ela apenas poderia ser ainda melhor. Seu único problema mesmo é ser curto, mas, o elemento multiplayer e o desejo de completar o 100% do jogo podem manter aceso o desejo de um replay.


[h1] NOTA	[/h1]
✫✫✫✫

author: {'steamid': '76561198126975019', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 753, 'playtime_forever': 719, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1659365481}
review:
It's a very beautiful game.

It has an incredible concept based in the idealization of Mexican culture, the whole game plays like a fantastical tale from old times, the characters, and universe, are fantastic, the story is interesting, and filled with charm.

The aesthetic, and, or, art style, is beautiful, and distinctive, incredibly colorful, and goes perfectly well with the themes that this games deals with.

The game design its fantastic, incredibly simple, and straightfoward, yet intelligent, and with a lot of depth.

The puzzles, platforming, and combat systems, and areas, are fantastic, different, and enjoyable to play through.

The game also has great replayability with upgrades, secrets, and different endings to achieve.

It might also be one of the few "metroidvanias" that I like because it actually gives you a general idea to which area you need to go next.

It is a very intuitive, casual, yet deep, intelligent, and beautiful game.

Totally recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078437944', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1375, 'last_played': 1566687429}
review:
So I am adding one to the many positive reviews, becasue its a absolutely fantastic game!!
I'm not even that far into it yet hour-wise but it has

+ very original nice and capturing story (this one of the few games that just kept me playing and playing  because I was simply sucked into it and its story and wanted to know how things will continue. That is what a game should be like!!)
+ awesome artstyle
+ very nice music
+ funny elements (in conversation of the characters or also gameplay/story-wise)
+ cool fighting combos that you actually have to use in many parts of the map to get on with the game (and I'm saying that as someone who doesnt even have a controler)

I do understand some people are upset that this game is like a re-relaease of previous versions except that it has a bit more content. I was lucky enought to buy the game now when the other versions have been out for a long time, so I could just see which one is the best version. But I guess not everything always goes smoothly in life so maybe the game coming out like this (again) was just how things went. 
Nevertheless the game for itself is awesome and I cant even remember but i think it has differen difficulty settings and at the moment I'm on normal. So after I finish I really wanna try the others too which means theres a lot of content.

Haven't found any cons yet really.
Definitely recommend!

EDIT: Game is so absolutely awesome!!!!! ^_^ I used to have a note here that said my rating goes down a bit because of the games ending, but now I came back to change that becasue what I was thinking before doesnt apply (as much) anymore. (Don't want to mention what it was as not to spoiler, but as I said my former point is irrelevant now anyways ;) )
Therefore no minus for this awesome, challenging, graphically and acustically beautiful game!!!
Buy buy buy now! You will not regret it!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197985246687', 'num_games_owned': 633, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 1286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 744, 'last_played': 1512918750}
review:
Решил я всё-таки купить Super Turbo Championship Edition спустя более года с прохождения золотого издания и не пожалел. Игра действительно расширилась. Если память мне не изменяет, в игру было добавлено целых две больших локации и ещё всякие мелочи. Слишком давно я играл в оригинал, чтобы вспомнить всё, чего там не было.

Вообще Guacamelee! - очень даже хорошая метроидвания. У игры очень правильная продолжительность (около 10 часов), способностей у главного героя предостаточно, противники более-менее разнообразны и требуют разного подхода. Игра имеет мексиканский колорит, что придаёт ей шарму. Из минусов отмечу не очень плавное управление (не столь критично) и бесящее падение героя после каждого удара (этой же болезнью страдает Hollow Knight).

В общем, Guacamelee! даёт всё, что требуется от Метроидвании, не вызывая при этом особого разочарования и раздражения. Второе прохождение игры (после первого на Gold Edition) вызвало больше положительных эмоций, особенно тем, что удалось без обращения к интернету достичь истинной концовки. Если у вас есть Gold Edition и вы сомневаетесь в покупке Super Turbo Championship Edition, ждите скидок и покупайте. Лично я не пожалел о приобретении, особенно учитывая, что оригинал достался мне в составе Humble Indie Bundle.

Всем любителям метроидваний рекомендую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150106380', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 353, 'playtime_forever': 879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 788, 'last_played': 1492887648}
review:
以14小時來完成這個遊戲, 有以下感想:
1. 動作遊戲來說, 不是很難但是也不容易, 有時要試十數次才能過關.
2. 遊戲畫面也算美觀, 以小型遊戲來說算不錯.
3. 這款遊戲有一個好設定, 就是當跌落遊戲活動範圍外, 會在最後的位置重新來過, 因為這樣可以減少不斷重覆的"跳跳". 有時在難度高的關卡, 要重新來過真的讓人很失望.
4. 以石頭頭像來傳送不同地點位置, 若果隨時可以用位置轉移的功能便更好.
5. 遊戲中只有一個儲存檔, 有時想從某一個位置重新遊戲,也沒有方法.
6. 投擲功能有點沒有實際作用, 除了擲仙人掌外, 就只有捉雞和蟹的小遊戲才用到.
7. 最後首腦有點難度, 本人也要回去找未開啟的寶箱升級, 才能打敗它.
8. 有一個很多玩家也不清楚的問題, 就是不知道SUPER TURBO版本和GOLD版本有甚麼分別.也不知道玩那一個版本才對.

結論:
1. 2D動作遊戲, 若果以這遊戲般的"高難度跳躍", 是遊戲中可得到樂趣的最大阻礙, 很多類似的"跳跳"遊戲, 也讓人不能快樂地完成遊戲. 因為很多也是以反應來過關, 而並非考驗用甚麼方法去過關.
2. 這遊戲的打擊感也很好, 至少讓人有在攻擊的感覺.
3. 建議"跳跳"遊戲可以在最後跳躍失敗的位置重新來過, 因為不斷重覆沒有意義的跳躍, 對遊戲的耐玩性可能成反比(因為不是每個人也會喜歡重覆一個關卡十數次來玩). 本人也說過遊戲太難, 不是"玩家"玩"遊戲", 而是"遊戲設計師"玩"玩家".

author: {'steamid': '76561198019773768', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 1052, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1049, 'last_played': 1549076219}
review:
Alto juego!

Hace mucho lo había jugado ilegalmente y encima sin tener joystick. Cosa que era un dolor testicular muy grande manejar todos los movimientos con teclado.
Ahora jugándolo original y con Joystick lo recontra disfruté.

Mi género preferido es el Metroidvania, cosa que este juego suma muchos puntos para mi, todos los guiños que tiene a distintos juegos son geniales. La jugabilidad y los desafios también son geniales.
Humor, música y... se puede jugar de a 4! Es brutal para jugar con amigos eso.

Si tuviera que remarcar algo malo del juego... la verdad que no se me ocurriría nada.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045637460', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 639, 'last_played': 1652688694}
review: Great Game ! A solid Metroidvania style game with fantastic art and music that really brings theworld to life. The combat is great and the levels keep you going forward with little back tracking needed though recommended for final boss where the game revs up the difficulty. The side quests are few but memorable and theres tons of easter eggs from games such as Journey, Mario and Castle Crashers. It can be beat in under 10 hours but if you explore every nook and cranny for power ups it can take around 15 hours in total. 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198019112527', 'num_games_owned': 1395, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 584, 'last_played': 1511841508}
review:
Very fun game, i liked the art, the story, the characters and the power ups and the music. It's defined as metroid style because with the new abilities you earn you need to go back t different areas to do stuff.
The first problem about the game were the shield auras, i couldn't differenciate between the different colors and was problematic, because i needed to use 3 different ways to break a single shield because i didn't know what attack to use.
The secon problem is that some boss battle, especially the last one to make it more difficult just increases the damage and the lenght of the attacks so they ocuppy more screen space. I read that was a cheap trick to make a game "difficult", the problem also cuphead suffers. 
The ending is pretty cute.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070032058', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1511741583}
review:
Hello there. I bought this great looking game due to the positive reviews and the fact that I like 2D action games such as Dead Cells and Ori. Usually I am not afraid of ingame challenges, but this game has started to really upset me due to the combination of bad controls, very challenging jumping sequences and unfair mob AI. I will try to sum up my personal pros and cons below.

Pros:
+ great music (at start)
+ funny main character
+ possible co-op
+ nice graphics and design
+ stable game (so far)
+ fair price and content

Cons:
- very annoying music (might be due to the countless retries...)
- several try & error jumping sequences
- unfair enemy mobs (e.g. shielded enemies hid in corners stacked up on each other)
- inaccurate and overloaded controls (makes fights and agility sequences very hard)

At the time of writing I had to give up mid-game and I am not sure, if I will give this game another chance...

author: {'steamid': '76561198177062287', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 690, 'last_played': 1511451545}
review:
Guacamelee！ IGN9.1分神作
之前玩过 ps3 的 Gold Edition ，拿到白金奖杯，此次补票。Super Turbo Championship Edition 包括 Gold Edition 全部内容，并新增几个角色能力、怪物、BOSS及关卡，没有玩过 Guacamelee！的建议直接入 Super Turbo Championship Edition，拥有本作的不必再入 Gold Edition
游戏是典型的2D横版过关动作游戏，类银河战士恶魔城标签，支持本地4人合作，娱乐性会提高不少。没有中文，但影响不大，任务地点都会标注在地图上，到达目的地随即触发剧情，跑图过程中会多次碰到伪装成山羊的老巫师，授予你新的能力，使用不同的能力来冲破阻碍道路的不同颜色的石障。随着游戏进展，难度会呈指数增长，在学习了阴阳切换技能后，频繁需要你多种能力技能完美衔接来跑图，容错率较低，一旦失误 ，重新来过[spoiler] 简直丧心病狂:)	[/spoiler]好在保存点比较多，又没有生命数限制，不建议键盘游玩  [spoiler] 你们会抓狂的:)	[/spoiler]。
建议购买人士：银河战士恶魔城类游戏玩家（不过相信你们应该都有了！）Platform类爱好者
不建议购买人士：路痴及手残玩家
+迷之墨西哥元素 +各种彩蛋 +阴阳切换机制
+整体艺术水平和执行力 +别出心裁的打击感设计 +能力构造出的连击系统丰富
-BOSS设计 -关卡设计
如此多的要素使得本作成为一部无比绝伦的优秀作品！[spoiler] 即使原价也绝对值得入手	[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198041710437', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2557, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2553, 'last_played': 1492292602}
review:
If you're wondering if this game is worth buying or not, just buy it already!

I first played Guacamelee Gold Edition in Normal Mode, and thought it was awesome.
Then I played it again in Hard mode for the achievements, and enjoyed it very much.

When Guacamelee Super Turbo Championship edition came out, I had my doubts if it was worth, for someone who had already beaten Guacamelee Gold Edition twice, with 100% conclusion... but now, I tell you: IT IS!!!

This version of Guacamelee improved what was hard to improve. Added more characters, scenes, enemies, skill, maps, all while exploring Tostada's past and telling her story (!).

This new version gave me several new hours of gameplay, and got me and my girlfriend so hooked that we played Normal Mode and Hard mode on my steam, and are planning on doing it in hers, too (we also already bought it for her account!).

That's how good this game is. I'm seriously expecting a sequel in the future. Games of this level surely deserve.

author: {'steamid': '76561198178462658', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1058, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1058, 'last_played': 1511272175}
review: I love this game but, it has it problems.  Mostly with the controls, for me I played with a controller and as I was playing the dodge kept going off mid-air for some reason for me which made it hard to do jumping sections but I ignored it.  About the wall jump mechanics,  it was a great concept but grabbing to walls was a pain and I barely grabbed to walls without it failing horridly because of the game no being able to tell I was on a wall or dodging (might have been my controller being unresponsive).  Other than that it's a good game and basically the same as GOLD edition but with some improvements.  The enemies has great designs but felt weak and the throwing the enemies made the game feel too easy which makes me wonder why hard mode was locked until you beat the game.  Also the bosses were great with great designs and fights which weren't too hard but were tough enough so you feel joy when beating them.  I beat this game and got the true end and I'm happy to wait for the upcoming sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198206999976', 'num_games_owned': 1110, 'num_reviews': 510, 'playtime_forever': 608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1510937646}
review:
[h1]Review zu Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition[/h1]

GUACAAAMELEEEEE! SUUUUPPPEEERR TURBO CHAMPIONSHIP EDITION!
Und so schreit dich das Spiel beim Starten an. Es zeigt schon von Anfang an, welche Art von Spiel man sich da gekauft hat. Eines das sich selbst nicht ernst nimmt und es dem Spieler unter die Nase reibt.
Ich muss ernsthaft gestehen, dass ich ursprünglich höhere Erwartungen an Guacamelee hatte. Ich habe einst von diesem Spiel gehört, nachdem es als "eines der besten unbekannten Metroidvania" betitelt wurde. Tja, da hab ich wohl meine Erwartungen zu hoch geschraubt. Versteht mich nicht falsch, das Spiel ist gut, hat jedoch so seine Macken.
Besonders lobend möchte ich noch den Humor des Spiels erwähnen. Dieser wird nicht jedermanns Sache sein, aber mindestens ein kleines Schmunzeln wird wohl für jeden drin sein!

Kommen wir für die Schnellen unter uns einfach mal zur Pro-Contra-Liste:

[u][b]Pro:[/b][/u]

+ Stimmiger Soundtrack mit lateinamerikanischem Flair
+ Koop vorhanden
+ Der Humor des Spiels ist stellenweise echt lustig und manche Charaktere sind einfach nur zum Schießen. Verraten möchte ich da jetzt nichts.
+ sehr kurze Ladezeiten
+ Diverse Anspielungen auf andere Videospiele, Filme und Serien. Da wären z.B Super Mario, Metroid, How I met your Mother, Star Wars etc. (Ich habe bestimmt noch nicht alle entdeckt!
+ Das Kampsystem ist erschlagend! Es fühlt sich einfach nur großartig an Skelette zu verdreschen!

[u][b]Contra:[/b][/u]

- deutsche Übersetzung ist fehlerhaft
- Falls die V-Sync aus ist, so gibt es ein kleines Flackern auf der horizontalen Achse des spielbaren Juans. Irgendwie nervig und mit nur 60 FPS möchte ich nicht spielen...
- Selbst wenn ich mit dem GamePad spiele werden mir manche Tasten bei der Bedienung der Karte noch in der Tastaturvariante angezeigt.
- Es gibt eine Gegnerart, die Knochen auf dich wirft. Sollte man gegen eine überschaubare Anzahl von Gegnern kämpfen so kann man diese gut sehen und auch entsprechend ausweichen, doch in manchen Stellen des Spiels ist dies einfach zu penetrant... Überall riesige Gegner, kleine, schnelle und diese roten Skelette die einen mit Knochen abwerfen... Irgendwann ist es ja dann wohl mal genug oder?

[u][b]Prontra:[/b][/u]

+- Durch den Skelettshop renne ich am Anfang des Spiels gefühlt jede Minute hindurch. Liegt allerdings daran, dass dies die Speichermethode des Spiels ist. Dennoch irgendwie nervig, da dann das Spiel für Bruchteile einer Sekunde stoppt. Jedoch sind die Checkpoints sehr fair platziert, selbst im letzten Teil des Spiels.
+- Die Symbole auf der Karte sind mir zu groß.
+- Die Bosslebensanzeige ist in der vorherigen Cutscene, oder Diskussion wenn man so will, oben einsehbar und nimmt einfach die Spannung, ob man einem Boss gleich gegenüberstehen muss oder nicht. Sehr schade eigentlich...
+- Sollte man von einem Gegner getroffen werden, so ist die [i]Knockoutzeit[/i] (nennen wir sie jetzt einfach mal so) deutlich zu lang. Man wird sogar richtig zurückgestoßen. Heißt man wird dermaßen bestraft, wenn man in einem Raum voller Gegner mal getroffen wird, was für normale Menschen ansich eigentlich kaum unversehrt möglich ist.
+- Die Fähigkeiten, die man sich im Laufe des Spiels erwirbt, um neue Gebiete zu erkunden, sind irgendwie einfallslos, aber was will man anderes erwarten, wenn man mit seinen Fäusten, Füßen und seinem Kopf kämpft... Die Fähigkeiten sind halt eigentlich nur diejenigen, dass man verschiedenfarbige Blöcke zerstören kann. Naja.
+- Steuerung könnte manchen etwas zu fummlig sein, aber wie sagt man so schön? Übung macht den Meister!

Ich kann das Spiel also empfehlen. Habe mir persönlich mehr Fähigkeiten gewünscht um mehr Abwechslung zu garantieren, aber dennoch ist Guacamelee ein Spiel, dass definitiv von jemandem mal gespielt werden sollte, dem das Metroidvaniagenre liegt! Der Normalpreis von 13,99€ ist ansich in Ordnung und ein sehr fairer Preis!

Ich danke fürs Lesen und wünsche sehr viel Spaß beim Spielen! ;-)

http://store.steampowered.com/app/275390/Guacamelee_Super_Turbo_Championship_Edition/

author: {'steamid': '76561198219262127', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1545715828}
review: Great game!  Combat was interesting and the combo system feels natural and smooth.  The enemies with several different attack patterns keep you on your toes, and the story isn't terrible, at least the characters are more than just "good guy" or "bad guy".

author: {'steamid': '76561198186389322', 'num_games_owned': 437, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 784, 'last_played': 1597263865}
review:
Эту игру можно охарактеризовать, как таже самая игра год назад, только к ней добавлено DLC. Только это дополнение отдельно не купить, а необходимо покупать ещё раз туже самую игру за полную стоимость. Ничего сверъестественного, всё по старому. Если брать, то комплектом с первой версией, именно там указана реальная цена за игру с DLC, а не за две цельные.

На основе вот таких игр хочется попросить администраторов Steam ввести дополнительную кнопку для оценки "Нейтральную". Вроде и поставить отрицательный незачто, но и палец вверх ставить смысла нету.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116361480', 'num_games_owned': 41, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1289, 'last_played': 1510671930}
review:
Che dire..un buon Metroidvania/platform,divertente e spensierato. Dal mio punto di vista un gioco abbastanza facile anche alla modalità difficile(non che sia un difetto,ma io personalmente preferisco un po di sfida in più),platinato in circa 20ore.
Consigliato ? si,da giocare senza impegno però.
Non resta che attendere il secondo capitolo ora !

author: {'steamid': '76561198026637457', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1510623795}
review:
Started this expecting a Metroidvania as a brawler, and it is. The metroidvania elements are pretty bad though, felt pretty linear and was always guided where to go.
However, this is some fantastic combat. Feels somewhat similar to a Smash Bros game, and you know we don't get that Subspace Emissary anymore. Very simple combat commands, all are just a single direction+a button, and they all have great crowd controls, throws, and can chain them easily. Only problem I would have is dodging enemies is too easy, felt like I was a psycho just mindlessly attacking everyone. Enemies lose their attack animation when you attacked them, so once you get that first punch in, it becomes easy. There's lots of gigantic guys where this is not the case, but it's still too easy to dodge them. Maybe this problem is solved on hard, but overall the enemies themselves are lacking in AI and attacks.
The setting is great, but the music is very lacking. It's not bad, but it feels like there were only 5 songs the entire game.
This game is great, but I hope the sequel expands on all it's shortcomings. The potential is all there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140330102', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1500041094}
review:
[h1]타코맛 매트로배니아 게임[/h1]

평점 : 5/10
플레이타임 : 5~7h

장점
+독특한 그래픽과 흥겨운 멕시코풍 노래
단점
- 맵디자인이 비슷비슷함
- 참신하지만 [b]귀찮은[/b] 시스템
- 쓰는것만 쓰게되는 특수기술
- 단순한 적 패턴

구아카밀레 슈퍼 터보 챔피언쉽 에디션은 멕시코풍이 풀풀 풍기는 매트로배니아입니다.
주인공이 힘이 넘치게 되는 복면을 쓰고 여자친구를 구하기 위해 적을 소탕한다는 내용으로, 여러지역을 떠돌며 스테이지를 하나 클리어할 때마다 하나의 특수능력을 얻고 적을 깨부숩니다.

이 게임의 대표적인 특징중 하나는 차원변화입니다.
막혀있는 길을 차원변화로 뚫거나, 때리지 못하는 적(그림자)를 차원변화로 때릴 수 있습니다.
나중에 가면, 이 차원변화를 수시로 이용해야하는 스테이지가 나오게 됩니다.
이 시스템애 대해선 불만이 있는데, 그건 아래의 단점에 몰아서 서술하도록 하겠습니다.

또 하나의 대표적인 특징을 들으라고 한다면 그건 특수능력으로 깨부술 수 있는 보호막입니다.
중반부정도 가시면 왠 색깔을 띈 보호막을 가진 적을 보실 수 있을 겁니다. 그 적들은 그 색에 맞는 특수능력을 써야지 타격을 입힐 수 있습니다. 보호막은 깨지면, 얼마 뒤에 다시 재생됩니다.
이 시스템에 대해서도 불만이 있어서 이후의 이야기는 단점에 몰아적도록 하겠습니다.

긍정적인 평가가 많아서 기대했는데 솔직히 실망감이 좀 큰 작품입니다. 아래에는 대표적인 단점을 적어놨습니다.

[b]1. 게임의 시스템에 대하여[/b]
우선 차원변화에 대해 말씀드리겠습니다. 솔직히 말해서 귀찮습니다.
플레이어가 머리를 굴리도록 맵디자인을 잘 짜면 뭐라고 하질 않겠는데, 구아카밀레에서는 이 차원변화라는 시스템을 잘 이용해내지 못했다는 느낌이 큽니다. 구아카밀레에서 차원변화를 이용하는 경우는 크게 3가지입니다.
1. 그냥 막힌 벽이 보일 때
2. 그냥 그림자적이 있을 때
3. 딱봐도 차원변화 적용하면서 이동해야할 때
위의 사항들을 보시면 알겠지만 차원변화는 머리를 굴려가며 쓴다기보다는 그냥 무의식적으로 깜빡이켜듯 쓰는 것밖에 안됩니다.
특히 적들과 싸울때 그림자적(차원변화를 해야 때릴 수 있는 적)과 그냥 적이 있는데 차원변화 하면서 때리기 귀찮습니다.
그래서 현재 차원의 적을 다 쓰러트리고 난 뒤 무의식적으로 차원변화를 쓰게 됩니다. 솔직히 깜빡이랑 크게 다를 게 없다 느꼈습니다. 

그리고 보호막 시스템도 영 좋은 평가를 내리지 못하겠습니다. 짧은 게임분량을 숨기려고 시간을 질질끌게 하기 위해 만들었단 생각이 듭니다. 참신하다고 다 좋은 건 아닙니다. 중요한 것중 하나는 게임의 흐름을 방해하지 말아야하는 겁니다.
뒤로 가면 갈수록 특수능력이 늘어나는데, 거기에 비례해 적들의 보호막색도 다양해집니다. 그럼 그 보호막색을 기억하고 특수능력의 커맨드를 기억해야 합니다. 저같은 경우에는 그래도 막힘없이 하긴 했지만 여간 귀찮은게 아닙니다 이거. 기억하고 있던 특수능력으로 부술 수 있는 보호막색을 한 번 까먹으면 귀찮게 모든 특수능력을 다 때려박아야됩니다. 이게 게임 흐름을 끊어먹는 1등공신입니다.
제작진도 그 점을 아는 지 이번 확장팩에는 색 무시하고 때려부술 수 있는 업그레이드가 추가되었습니다. 근데 이걸 얻는게 후반부라는 걸 생각하면 영...

이 게임은 퀘스트도 불편한 데, 주는 보상이 영 시원찮아서 하고 싶은 맛이 안날 뿐더러 퀘스트자체도 썩 재미있진 않습니다
이것도 마찬가지로 왜 있는지 모르겠습니다. 그냥 게임에만 집중하게 만들면 더 효과적일 것 같다는 생각이 드는데 굳이 이런 [b]불필요한[/b] 퀘스트들을 만들어서 게임의 흐름을 방해하는 이유는 대체...

[b]2.게임자체[/b]
경쾌한 멕시코풍의 노래와 독특한 스타일의 그래픽같은 것들은 좋은 점수를 줄만합니다.

그렇지만 별 다를 바 없는 맵디자인은 까이기에 충분합니다. 지형이 달라져도 다른 곳과 비슷하다는 느낌을 받았습니다. 왜일까요?
비슷하게 쓴 색, 곡선이 일체 존재하지 않아 비슷해질 수 밖에 없는 디자인때문입니다.
매트로배니아하면 다른 지역으로 갈때의 두근거림이 있어야 하는데, 이 게임은 그런게 없습니다. 제가 캐슬배니아를 하면서 새 지역에 들어설 때 그 지역의 이름이 나옴과 동시에 처음보는 지형이 나올때의 두근거림을 생각하면.....

적들도 영 맘에 안듭니다. 이 게임은 적들과의 인카운터가 자주 발생하는 편인데, 적의 종류가 적을 뿐만 아니라, 적의 패턴도 단순합니다. 다른 게임은 맵디자인으로 똑같은 적이라도 다른 느낌을 연출해낸다면 이 게임은 그런게 일절 없습니다. 이걸 그나마 차원변화시스템이 커버해주고 있는데 위에서 말했듯이 결과는....

author: {'steamid': '76561198076984824', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 506, 'last_played': 1504984734}
review:
De lo mejorcito en juegos indie. Estilo metroidvania con graficos coloridos y una estetica y ambientación sublime
El juego tiene una historia sencilla pero muy divertida. Te encontraras referencias a Metroid Fusión, Grim fandango, Super mario entre otros. 

Ambientación Mexicana mezclada con ese toque del día de los muertos muy coherente y acertada

+Animaciones pulidas
+Controles bastante pulidos
+Multijugador local hasta 4 jugadores
+2 Finales en función de los coleccionables
+BSO muy buena
+Personajes (sobre todo los enemigos) Muy carismaticos y chocantes
+Duración 8-10h a ritmo pausado pero invita a rejugarlo para conseguir ambos finales

9.5/10

review:
————第一人！！！Steam版汉化问题完美解决————

由于正版更新，3DM和游侠的汉化出现乱码闪退，楼主根据以前《行尸走肉第一季》的经验替换掉了游戏根目录的部分文件实现了STEAM版本完全汉化。
使用的是游侠破解版文件，以替换exe等文件为主，大小为500mb，再打上目前最好的游侠1.0终极版汉化，完美进入游戏。

百度盘：pan点baidu点com/s/1oAcaVeq  ，请给个赞，让更多人看见。
使用方法：1.在游戏根目录X:\steam\steamapps\common\DrinkBox_Game4覆盖原文件
                  2.然后打上里面附带的汉化。

成就方面已测试，可以解锁。

关于破解文件的bug，游戏过快的解决办法：在选项中关闭垂直同步。
因为百度云盘对国外是锁区的，本人不会用国外网盘，可以推荐一个简单的留言给我试试。

85分

通关2遍
优点：
爽快的战斗
挑战玩家手指灵活度的跳跃关卡
墨西哥文化（音乐与色彩）

author: {'steamid': '76561198336608168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 2028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1280, 'last_played': 1538738608}
review:
Manqueando, episodio taytantos. Hoy... Guacamelee.

Debo reconocer que cuando me lo compré, fue más por oir decir esto o lo otro que por convicción. La verdad es que no me llamaba la atención ni lo más mínimo. Y despues de ver 10 min. en casa de un amigo, me dió por jugar. Tenian razón.

El asunto es un metroid de manual, que incluso se toma licencias de la saga de nintendo. Plataformas, combate, mejoras, backtracking... todo lo que necesita un juego de este tipo, pero además con mucho sentido del humor, y con un buen nivel de calidad en todos sus apartados. La dificultad es en algunos momentos desesperante, pero no siempre.

Lo único malo que le he visto es que en ocasiones, durante los combates la cosa se vuelve un poco confusa, llegando a perder de vista el nino por segundos. No es que sea muy frecuente, pero ocurre.

Las cosas buenas no las voy a poner, mejor las descubrís vosotros jugando, como debe ser.

Asi que le cascamos un 8'5 y cooooño, claro que lo recomiendo!

En el proximo episodio de Manqueando... "Momodora Reverie under the musgo"

author: {'steamid': '76561198241040582', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2153, 'last_played': 1510552760}
review: Guacamelee STCE has the perfect balance of ridicule, story, arena fighting and challenging levels. It's an amazing platformer that will make you chuckle more than once and make you burst a vein from all that screaming at your screen. The main storyline is not that hard to beat, but if you're a completionist like me, you're in for a wild ride. The (extra) levels are absolute hell, but incredibly rewarding and once you're done, you'll wish you had more. I don't intend on playing the other versions of Guacamelee, this edition had it all for me. Also, I must say that as a Mexican it was an incredibly gratifying experience to see a game with our culture being pretty much its only influence, treated with such humorous tones.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009956005', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 749, 'last_played': 1509522341}
review:
Game World, Story and Theme
Guacamelee is a Metroidvania.  The level design is solid and the locations varied.  There is quite a bit of optional content to play through and explore.
The game has a Mexican theme.  This is exceptionally well done and infuses every aspect of the game.  The visuals are beautiful and detailed.  The soundtrack is one of the best I have encountered.
The story is simple, but beautifully told.  The game has a great sense of humour, and the characters you meet are highly memorable.

Gameplay
Guacamelee is a beat-em-up with a focus on combos.  It is intense and fun and has a dynamic and forgiving combo system.  The combat has a feeling of weight and impact.
There is also a strong platforming element.  This is very well done, as it presents creative challenges to overcome.  Platforming often involves an element of puzzle solving.
Exploring the levels is fun, as you gain some neat abilities as you progress.  The combat and platforming can both be quite difficult at times, and some of the optional content can be extremely difficult indeed.

Conclusion
Guacamelee is a delightful and funny game with a memorable theme and awesome, varied gameplay.  I would highly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035393188', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1509309525}
review:
Habe das Spiel einzig für den Vier-Spieler-Couch-Coop gekauft. Achtung, es fängt langsamer an als andere Multiplayer-Titel. Das Tutorial muss der erste Spieler alleine spielen, und danach geht es sehr zäh los - richtig Spaß macht es erst, wenn man die ersten zusätzlichen Moves freigeschaltet hat.

Wenn man sich durch die erste Viertelstunde durchgebissen hat, ist es aber eine großartige Prügel-Orgie. Mich erinnert es an Rayman Origins/Legends, das war im Multiplayer ähnlich: Wer stirbt, wird wiederbelebt - es ist also egal, ob alle Spieler gleich gut sind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1643039701}
review:
Tags: Platformer - Metroidvania

TLDR: Its an instant classic basically.

With heavy brawler influences. Guacamelee has excellent Xbox360 pad support. Additional players can hotswap join at any time during single player campaign on local co op by push of a button. Decent complement of graphical options and real PC monitor resolutions support. Controls are fluid and slick, mapping on controller is intuitive and makes sense. Level design is a bit confusing to me but I am not a veteran of metroidvanias. Game has awesome animations, decent sprites and character models, and great audio presentation. Menus are slick UI is mostly unobtrusive and helpful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014385314', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1508801385}
review:
Guacamelee es uno de los juegos más divertidos que he jugado nunca. Una temática muy original sobre los luchadores y la vida pueblerina de México que se enlaza perfectamente con un apartado jugable bastante bueno y divertido. 
Si te gustan los metroidvania, este es uno de los mejores que puedes jugar en Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085484172', 'num_games_owned': 216, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 698, 'last_played': 1508697497}
review:
Came in for the metroidvania, stayed for the surprisingly deep combo system. It's pretty much Mahvel. [spoiler]There is even an XFactor, not kidding[/spoiler]

Throw in some great humor and great level design and you have a perfect combination that is fun throughout it's entirety, [i]and I'm including the scavenging for the last collectibles for that 100%[/i].
Simply put, it controls great, it feels great, it sounds great and overall, it plays great.
Extremely fun in coop as well, I highly recommend going through it with a friend or two if you have the chance, although it is fun in solo as well.
Highlights to those hellish "secret" optional hardcore platforming sections.

It also has what the majority of non-AAA (and even some AAA lately...) games lack.
Proper localization to various languages. Even puns are localized, and very well.
I can't say anything about the other languages, but the spanish translation is [i]flawless[/i].

The only gripe I would have with the game is the final boss being a bit too easy relative to the other bosses.
It hasn't given me near as much grief as the damn four-armed wrestlers.

All in all a real 10/10 you should absolutely play

author: {'steamid': '76561198000729756', 'num_games_owned': 523, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 818, 'last_played': 1482683226}

Can't believe I haven't reviewed this yet.

It's hard, but fun. Very punny, reminscent of Castlevania but with Mexican luchadores and a combat system and soundtrack that more than satisfying. Game will definitely frustrate you, but it'll also make you appreciate it in hindsight. Got the Gold edition on GoG, and happilly replayed it for the game itself, not just the new content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198257459836', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 971, 'last_played': 1508795697}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198059321573', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1508601957}
review:
I'm a big fan of metroidvanias, and this was on my bucket list of metroidvanias to play. I have to say, I was pretty disappointed:

The difficulty is too easy until the last parts of the game. I'm not asking for the game to be Dark Souls, but I expect the difficulty to be somewhat consistent, and if the game is going to be making Metroid references, I expect it to not be a complete pushover. Instead, the early and middle parts of the game give you so much health, health regen, and health-refilling checkpoints that I could carelessly walk into attacks without consequence and beat most bosses first try. At least the last sections of the game put up a fight.

The "gates" that stop your progress until you find the appropriate item feel so bland. In other metroidvania games, you might have a platform that can't be reached until you get double jump/dash, or a piece of the environment you can't interact with until you get a specific item. I mean, a veteran of metroidvanias could easily recognize the gates when they see them, but at least those try to be a bit subtle or creative. In Guacamelee, you break yellow blocks with the yellow power, red blocks with the red power, blue blocks with the blue power, etc. It reminds me of Fischer Price toys where you put the square in the square hole and the circle in the circle hole.

The level design is bland. I can remember about two areas of the game. The color palettes, textures, themes, enemies, and room layouts of the areas are homogenized to the point where I can barely tell them apart. The jungle area feels like "rocks with grass", the desert area feels like "rocks with sand", the temple area feels like "rocks with engravings". Every single area of the game has the same kinds of enemies. The platforming manages to be more distinct from area to area, so I'll give the game credit for that. Compare this to a game like Hollow Knight, where I can remember almost every single area of the game because they all have distinct textures, color palettes, themes, enemies, etc. Hell, the entirety of Castlevania Symphony of the Night took place inside a castle and I can remember its areas better. Maybe the individual regions of Guacamelee are too small to properly develop any real personality.

On top of the areas being so forgettable, they feel very unrewarding to explore. The level design is incredibly linear, so most of the time, you're just going straight along the path the game tells you to go along. The linear level design also makes the secrets incredibly easy to spot: if you see a branching path, that's a treasure chest, go grab it. Remember those colored blocks I mentioned earlier? The map labels every single one of those automatically, so you basically already know where to go if you're backtracking to discover secrets you couldn't get on your first run through an area. Oh, and basically every single treasure chest in the game is either money, health, or stamina. The only interesting rewards you'll find are the mask pieces.

The enemies have no variety. The majority of the enemies are skeletons. You got regular skeletons, skeletons that throw bones, fast skeletons, big skeletons. The endgame skeletons are basically the same as the early game skeletons, except they have shields, or are elite, or come in massive numbers, something along those veins. The bosses would are actually kind of interesting, but unfortunately, most of them are complete pushovers.

I'll give the game credit for its good art, good music, and somewhat enjoyable combat and platforming.

Overall, the game wasn't bad, it was just mediocre. Why settle for mediocre when there are great games though? Before you consider this game, go buy Hollow Knight, Ori and the Blind Forest, Momodora, Axiom Verge, or any of the countless metroidvanias on Steam that are so much better than this first.
