author: {'steamid': '76561197996305573', 'num_games_owned': 223, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 455, 'last_played': 1506528746}
review:
I'm a bit torn on giving Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition (STCE) a thumbs down, but I feel it's important for prospective buyers/players to know that STCE is significantly worse than Guacamelee! Gold Edition. 

STCE brings a number of modifications to Guacamelee, all of which are negative (apart from the 4P support). First, there are two large new areas, both of which serve as filler, breaking the flow of the game while not introducing any new concepts. Arguably the best part of the second area is the new character that serves as a boss, but said boss fight is relatively simple and the character takes focus away from the stronger original cast. Secondly are the combat changes: the "rebalancing" of enemies and the Intenso power. Javiar Jaguar, the stand-out boss from the original game, has been nerfed to an absolute pushover. Moreover, the Intenso power is absolutely game breaking, making every combat encounter in the game a joke. That wouldn't be so bad if you could ignore it, but the developers added certain combat encounters where the difficulty goes through the roof if Intenso isn't used (rooms with multiple enemies with white shields, hitstun-immunity, and/or non-dodgable attacks).  These rooms generally feature Intenso-refilling barrels or enemies as well, so the intention is clear. Of course, there's plenty of Intenso to go around even for easier rooms and bosses, trivializing combat entirely. 

In short, STCE is still a good game, but the original release was a GREAT game, without the broken combat "rebalancing" and padding. Please buy/play Guacamelee! Gold instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976370569', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 746, 'last_played': 1468248249}
review:
Rarely do games get love from all aspects, gameplay, sound and visual design. This is one of the more enjoyable experiences I have had in a game - though a bit simplistic, the tight controls, sound level design and visual diversity do not limit the enjoyment throughout. The soundtrack is amazing, dabbling through latin interludes and matching soundtrack change with visual change. The pre-fight and running section tracks are worth the price of admission alone. In a stark defiance of the greys/browns etc of recent releases, Guacamelee is beautifully bright and vivid - visually stimulating, unique and the overall design is a positive that you will keep with you after finishing the game.

In short, a fun, bright and audibly well presented game. Though not a super challenging experience, enjoyable throughout and a worthwhile gaming experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198409656355', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 833, 'last_played': 1504769001}
review:
Guacamelee STCE é, sem sombra de dúvidas, a versão definitiva.
Para aqueles que já jogaram a versão original, caso esteja em promoção, vale a pena comprar.
A trilha sonora é muito boa, combina com o os cenários.
O jogo possui muitas referências à outros jogos; os diálogos são cheios de humor, o jogo é muito divertido.
Altamente recomendado para quem gosta de jogos no estilo Metroidvania.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990347787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 592, 'last_played': 1504947153}
review:
Très bon Metroidvania/beat'em all
L'univers est fun et coloré
Le combat est abordable aux noobs comme moi, mais pose du challenge quand même
Un peu de plate-forme et de puzzles, l'équilibre avec les phases de combat fonctionne bien
Les upgrades qu'on débloque se résument un peu à "Casser le bloc de telle couleur" mais améliorer ses capacités de mouvement en enchaînant sauts et dash est satisfaisant

author: {'steamid': '76561198188469585', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2699, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1335, 'last_played': 1584150438}
review:
Pros
Beautiful graphics, good soundtrack, and variety. The way the game uses abilities you learn in different ways over time for platforming segments really amazes me. The way a side dash could be used to break a specific block but then you must immediately switch dimensions to avoid a hazard and then take out the enemies is really fun to do. Giving you 3 different base combat approaches, 4 special abilities that get throughout the game ("that uses an ability meter"), a grapple move with different add-ons, and 2 special movement abilities. That does not even include the other forms and their abilities. As you can see, there is a lot of variety in this game.

Cons
The more does not always mean the merrier, as a seasoned guacamelee player, you understand the moves how to use them, and the game can be pretty fun. But to a friend or sibling you are bringing in later to play, they become confused and overwhelmed with the amount of things you can do. The dimension swapping is used beautifully in platfroming segments, but not as well in combat. Some enemies cannot be attacked in one dimension, so you have to switch. That is good design, but the enemies can always attack you, regardless of dimension. Later in game, when they pile on multiple enemies from multiple dimensions, instead of getting challenging, it gets frustrating. This caused me to loathe any combat segment later in game. Also most bosses are very "cheap", with too much health and a very small window to attack them. But I've always felt that was the problem for most metroidvania bosses. When they are to weak, you breeze through and completely forget them. When they are too HARD (Final Boss), then it isn't fun. You are no longer a fighter against a very powerful foe, and you must learn their technique to win. You are waiting for them to attack, dodging, attack, waiting, dodging, attacking, losing, repeat, repeat, REPEAT. This wouldn't be so bad if it didn't happen that often, but later in game, bosses become harder, and more of them.

Best Parts of the game:
Abilities (you must learn them)
Enemies
Platforming segments
Graphics style
Music
Characters
Story
The Arena section

Worst Parts of game:
Bosses (most)
Enemies (Later in Game)
Difficult learning curve (if you come in later)

With so little Cons, you'd think I love the Game, and I do, but those few nagging details were so prevalent, especially in the last third of the game, that I can't recommend this game. I do love it, and I'm glad I bought it, but it  left me with such a sour taste that I cannot recommend it. If you can deal with those issues. Then buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038027462', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 598, 'last_played': 1504303150}
review:
Very traditional in terms of gameplay at first, the switching world mecanic adds an interesting depth during combat and platforming. It might be underexploited for some people but since the game doesn't aim to be a puzzle game, I feel like they made the right choice. The game shines with its universe, respecting the cheerfulness of the Day of the Dead in Mexico. The soundtrack is good without being one of the greatest. The only weakness is the conventional plot.

I highly recommend the game, even if you're not into Metroidvania because the locations are very linear and getting to where you want is pretty easy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018715489', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 432, 'last_played': 1430398547}
review:
Salut à toutes et à tous et bienvenue dans cette nouvelle review qui aujourd'hui va-nous amené à parler de ses fameux sites de ventes de jeux en quantité "très limitée"....

Car oui, ses derniers temps, il faut le dire, mais nous sommes véritablement submergé des petits jeux indépendants sortant sous forme de version "limités". Effet de mode du au succès d'un certain "Limited Run" ? Surement, mais il faut bien l'avouer, ses petits jeux font très mal au portefeuille lorsqu'on est collectionneur ou que l'on désire posséder tous ses jeux indépendants fort agréables...  Et dans ses jeux en version "ultra limitée", il y eut dernièrement ce jeu qui fit battre mon coeur à 200% lorsque j'ai appris qu'il sortait en version physique... Ce jeu n'est autre que Guacamelée SUPER TURBO CHAMPIONSHIP EDITION !!

Le sourire, le coeur qui palpite, je ne pouvais raté cette occasion de pouvoir possédé une version de ce jeu qui m'a vraiment marqué ! Et quel jeu mes aïeux ! Découvert totalement par hasard dans un bundle de jeux sur PC (90% des jeux indépendant je les connais grâce à leur sortie PC de toute façon...), c'est avec plaisir que j'ai découvert ce jeu réalisé par le DrinkBoxStudios, un petit studio canadien qui avait auparavant opérée sur Tales from Space : About Blob qui fit un petit succès bien que trop peu connu du grand publique...

Sortie en 2015 sur toutes les plateformes actuelles, Guacamélée STCE est issu de la rencontre de plusieurs genres totalement différents que sont le Beat m'Up, le plateformer mais aussi et le plus curieux... Le Metroidvania !

Mais avant de parler du Gameplay, parlons du scénario dantesque que Guacamélée dispose ! L'histoire se concentre sur Juan Aguacate, un jeune paysan vivant paisiblement au beau milieu des champs qui un jour, pile au moment de la fameuse fête des Morts au Mexique, va voir son destin totalement basculé lorsqu'il va retrouver son amour d'enfance, la jeune fille del présidente ! Hélas ! Malgré leurs retrouvailles, cette dernière va se faire kidnappé par un horrible personnage nommé Calaca, un homme mi-mort/mi-humain qui va éliminé Juan devant les yeux de la jeune demoiselle... Laissé pour mort et plongé dans l'autre monde, Juan ferra la rencontre d'une mystérieuse luchador dénommée : Tostada qui va lui remettre un objet bien particulier... "le masque du luchador". Prenant son courage à deux mains, Juan enfilera ce fameux masque et partira à la rescousse de sa chère et tendre !

Un air de déjà vu ? Oui, cela reste encore une nouvelle fois le fameux héros qui va sauver sa princesse, mais contrairement à tous ses autres jeux, Guacamélée s'en moque totalement et joue justement sur ce cliché pour proposer une histoire originale totalement barrée avec des personnages secondaires uniques en leur genre. Les dialogues sont même à mourir de rire par moment et font d'ailleurs d'énormes clins d'oeil soit au jeu vidéo en général ou bien carrément à la pop culture. C'est du scénario solide, il n’y a pas de doute !

Vous allez me dire, comment Beat m'up et Metroidvania peuvent-il cohabité ? Et bien, c'est très simple ! Guacamélée se joue de long en large comme un Metroidvania, le joueur peut avancer dans des niveaux ouverts ou tous les chemins sont possibles pour avancer à condition d'avoir les bonnes capacités ou événements activés. Bien sur sa route, Juan rencontrera des ennemies qu'ils tenteront de l'arrêté dans son aventure...

En tant que Luchador, Juan devra utiliser ses compétences de combattant pour envoyer ses fameux ennemis au tapis ! Bourrant les différentes combinaisons sur la manette, le panel de mouvements de Juan est très complet et peut réaliser tout type de combo pour anéantir ses ennemies. De plus au cours de l'aventure, le joueur aura aussi la possibilité d'acquérir des techniques spéciaux pour pouvoir à la fois détruire ses adversaires de façon spectaculaire, mais aussi, et comme dans tout Metroidvania, passé certains passages complexes pour pourvoir débloqué de nouvelles routes qui était alors inaccessibles sans cette dernière.

Et c'est la qu'on se rend compte que le Beat m'up et le Metroidvania peuvent être compatible ! car certes on se bastonne face à des hordes et des hordes d'ennemies, mais cela reste dans des environnements ouverts ou le joueur peut accédé à plusieurs chemins possibles et/ou trouver des passages secrets permettant de récupérer des upgrades pour Juan !

Car évidemment qui dit Metroidvania, dit forcément Upgrade dans des zones cachées (même si Guacamélée n'est pas aussi pervers que Super Metroid il faut l'avoué...). On y retrouvera l'upgrade de vie qui permet d'avoir plus de vie. L'upgrade d'endurance, permettant d'utilisé plusieurs fois ses compétences spéciales et enfin l'upgrade d'INTENSO, qui plus loin dans le jeu permettra au joueur d'avoir plus de temps pour utilisé son INTENSO, mais je vous laisse découvrir ce qu'est ce fameux "INTENSO".

Bref vous l'aurez compris, c'est un Gameplay au petit oignon et véritablement fun ! Il y a vraiment de bonnes idées partout et on ne se lasse pas un instant du jeu. Surtout qu'en plus le jeu est même jouable à 4 simultanément, ce qui nous réserve des heures de fun en COOP. Et il nous propose même des réalisés des quêtes annexes sympathiques en échange d'upgrade ! Que demandé de plus ? Ah oui ! Comptée 7-8h pour finir le jeu et plus du double si vous voulez absolument tout avoir et finir toutes les quêtes annexes !

En plus d'avoir un Gameplay des plus corrects, Guacamélée peut se vanter par sa réalisation technique fantastique qui envoie véritablement du rêve ! Graphiquement, le jeu est très propre, coloré et nous plonge parfaitement dans cette drôle fête qu'est la fête des morts mexicaine ! Les développeurs ont été très minutieux dans chaque détail du jeu qu'ils ont même jusqu'à intégrer quelque easter egg en arrière fond dans le décor ou bien tout simplement en fessant des allusions évidentes et visibles au premier regard !

Pour la musique, on a le droit évidemment à des compositions originales avec des instruments typiques de la musique mexicaine ! Elle est plutôt agréable à écouter et joint avec le jeu, la musique fait vraiment passe-partout... Cependant il est quand même dommage qu'aucune de ses musiques n'arrive à vraiment sortir du lot... Car pour nos amis mélomanes qui écoute les bandes-son de jeux sur leur baladeur favori, ne vous attendais pas à écouté la bande-son en boucle... J'ai tenté et cela m'a très vite lassé ...

Concrètement je n'ai pas de vrai défaut à donné à ce Guacamélée qui est comme vous l'avez compris dispose d'un scénario et humour bien ficelé, d'un Gameplay au petit oignon, de réalisation plus que correcte et surtout une durée de vie assez conséquente pour tout joueur qui se respecte !

Finalement que demandé de plus ? Le jeu est très bon, ne coute pas cher, est disponible sur tous les Marketplace et peut se jouer jusqu'à 4 joueurs simultanément ! Avec cette review qui je l'espère vous à convaincu, foncé acheté le jeux si ce n'est pas déjà fait ! Je peux vous garantir qu'il vaut largement le détour et vous passerais d'excellentes heures en compagnie de Juan !

Et c'est ainsi que fini cette nouvelle review, encore une fois je tenais à vous remercier pour la lecture de cette petite review, j'espère vous retrouvez bientôt pour une nouvelle review, d'ici la, portez-vous bien et à la prochaine !

author: {'steamid': '76561198044777820', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 713, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 381, 'last_played': 1491171533}
review:
Man, this game is as fun as it is ridiculous. I guess my only problem with it is that it's too short. And the last level..... oh man, the last level. Other than that, the combat is fun, it's very metroidvania, and the music is catchy and draws you in.  Don't expect a cake walk though, this game has some very challenging moments.

8.0/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198028857023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 929, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 929, 'last_played': 1503617051}
review:
A fun Metroidvania style beat em up. 8/10 if bought on sale.

PROS:
-Solid platforming and combat
-Four player local coop
-Fun art style
-Good humor

Cons:
-A bit short for the price tag 
-Gameplay is broken up by frequent, unskippable dialogue. Especially tedious on subsequent playthroughs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146663055', 'num_games_owned': 53, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1314, 'last_played': 1685081274}
review:
[h1]INTRODUCCIÓN[/h1]
Guacamelee! es un Juego de plataformas de la categoría "Metroidvania", llamado asi porque toma el sistema de plataformas de Metroid y el combate de Castelvania, mezclandolos para así patentar su estilo de juego. El juego se ambienta en la Cultura Mexicana, y nos cuenta la Historia de Juan, un Hombre que se dedica al destilamiento de Tequila en su Pueblucho, hasta que el proclamado rey del mundo de los muertos; Carlos Calaca, desea fusionar ambos mundos, el de los vivos y los muertos, para asi ser el máximo gobernante, Juan impulsado por el secuestro de Su amada, se embarca en una aventura para detener a Calaca, con la ayuda de la legendaria máscara del luchador, y la guardiana de la Misma, Tostada.

[h1]PRESENTACIÓN[/h1]
El juego es presentado con una estética "Flat", es decir diseño plano, y hay que admitir que se ve simplemente hermoso, está bien pulido, es colorido, es dinamico, y los personajes son reconocibles, se ven muy bien, y se mueven acorde a su diseño. A esto se le suma la espectacular estetica basada en México, Detalles como los fondos, las paletas de colores, los acabados de objetos como casas, templos, pueblos, ciudades, valles, estatuas, simplemente el juego grita a viva voz (En el ambito de diseño) "VIVA MÉXICO", describirlo en texto no basta, debes verlo con us propios ojos. Entre otras cosas el presentar una historia basada en la que quizas es la festividad mas importante de México, el dia de los Muertos, le da un plus bastante alto, algo cliché tal vez, pero bien ejecutado, se hacen referencias a la festividad, por ejemplo [spoiler]Los puntos de guardado, que asi mismo son la tienda, son las muy reonocidas Calaveritas de Azucar en un pequeño altar[/spoiler], es una bonita referencia a la festividad, y no es la única hay muchas mas, y no solo eso, el juego todo el tiempo Hace referencias a otras franquisias, juegos e incluso Memes de Internet, y darse cuenta de las mismas te puede sacar una sonrisa, son detalles pequeños que alegran tu experiencia de juego, y que te impulsan a encontrar mas. Oh y la Banda sonora... Es simplemente exelente, el juego implementa los intrumentos tradicionales Méxicanos, y se denotan generos como la Balada suave y la Serenata, y en partes en las que hay bastante acción, como areas de exploración y combate, la música se ajusta a la misma, mientras que en areas como ciudades o pueblos la música es serena y tranquila, muy bien ejecutada, es buena hasta el punto en que no te cansas de oirla.

[h1]JUGABILIDAD[/h1]
Guacamelee! Esta plenamente y obviamente inspirado en Juegos como Castelvania Symphony of the Nigth, y Super Metroid (Hasta su descripción en la tienda lo Menciona), aparte tiene un sistema de combos en el cual puedes encadenar varios ataques y luego agarrar a tu enemigo para lanzarlo o darle un golpe de gracia, esto está muy bien establecido, es un sistema de combate divertido, facil de aprender, y funciona muy bien incluso si hay ordas de enemigos. Ademas cabe mencionar que desde su ultima actualización, el juego se puede jugar hasta con 4 prsonas en pantalla (Antes esto estaba limitado a solo 2 Jugadores), lo cual da para una muy buena experiencia en multijugador, ya que entre todos se puede planear una estrategia para derrotar a enemigos mas facilmente o completar el juego mas rápido, bastante [spoiler]INTENSO![/spoiler]

[h1]VEREDICTO[/h1]
[b]8.5/10 - BUENISIMO[/b] ¿Vale La Pena?, Vale Cada **** Peso. AHORA COMPRALO GÜEY!.
Vale la pena, definitivamente lo vale. Guacamelee! es basicamente una carta de amor al genero de las plataformas, un juego divertido, visualmente hermoso, entretenido, con una historia muy bien estructurada, y personajes carismaticos.
Tiene una cantidad justa de logros, y una duración justificable y visto y considerando que el juego tiene [spoiler]Mas de un Final[/spoiler] Vale la pena experimentarlo y saber en que termina la historia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043268130', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1453, 'last_played': 1503794604}

author: {'steamid': '76561198048791474', 'num_games_owned': 538, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 617, 'last_played': 1503665821}
review:
Говорят, что Guacamelee сложная, но я не согласен. Если вдвоём играть - да, наверное будет сложнее координироваться в акробатических моментах. А если в одиночку, то при наличии контроллера и хотя бы небольшого опыта по платформерам - игра пробегается довольно бодро. Не припомню моментов, чтобы я где-то забуксовал больше, чем на 3-4 попытки (включая финального босса).

К самому жанру (metroidvania) я охладел уже довольно давно. И в Guacamelee в плане игрового процесса совершенно нет ничего оригинального. Она абсолютно обычная (если не считать оформления), но и не пытается казаться чем-то большим. И она берёт своё стилем и юмором.

Я вообще давно не припомню, чтобы мне было так весело в платформере. Может только в Rayman Origins, но там веселье спадает через какое-то время и начинается рутина и борьба за бонусы, а в Guacamelee - всё отлично до самого конца.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077987889', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 494, 'last_played': 1506939688}
review: I can count with my hands how many platformers I've played, never played a metroidvania game, so this was an absolute spicy treat. The puzzle elements this game throws at you are intriguing and frustrating at times but you feel great once you figured it out( at lest I did anyways). The combat is a blast, I loved the variety of powerups you recieved and how you can go back to older areas and unlock new paths. Which is where I had an issue, the backtracking can be a pain, even with the insta-teleport system, it's not that terrible just a slight issue I had. The variety of pop culture refrenences are hilarious and quite fun to spot. The characters are charming and add life to Guacamelee, the music is composed with it culture and adds more depth to this game, the slight changes to environment and music when you are in the land of the dead is very detailed. Took me 8hrs to beat this fantastic game. I got Guacameele for $4 which was a steal, buy this game whenever you see it for sale it's definitely worth the pickup.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030637029', 'num_games_owned': 736, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1502374158}
review:
https://youtu.be/ousAJlpb9f0

ce jeu est vraiment cool à faire, il est travaillé sur tous les plans (sonore, visuel, gamplay, level design...).
il peut etre assez long a se mettre en place

le principe
[list]
[*]l'histoire est assez simple : le roi du monde des mort veut prendre sa revanche sur le monde des vivants et enleve la fille d'El presidente, votre amie d'enfance, vous partez donc à sa rescousse, et tenter de sauver le monde par la même occasion.
[*] c'est un jeux d'action/plate forme en 2D, vous aurez donc des attaques avecs lesquels  vous devrez battres vos adversaires avec des combos (les meilleurs que vous pouvez
[*]jouable de 1 à 4
[*]l'humour yes assez présent sans être trop lourd. (mais je reconnais que parfois c'est franchement pas fin)
[/list]

le gameplay
[list]
[*]on est dans une sorte de monde ouvert en 2D
[*]les attaques que l'on a au début suffisent a faire des combos bien sympas notement la possibilitéde faire des projections dans certaines conditions. Les coup appris au cours de l'aventure augemntent grandement les combinaisons possibles et d'ouvrir de nouveau chemins.
[*]en terme de gameplay le jeu n'invente rien mais est trés efficace
[*]la possibilité de naviguer entre le monde des vivante et celui des mort ouvre la porte a la difficulté dans les phases de plateformes et durant lmes combats (les obstacles et ennemis pouvant se trouver dans les 2 en même temps)
[*] il y a des boss
[*]des magasins et items caché vous permettront d'avoir des amelioration (les costumes vous offre un bonus trés appreciable mais un malus les accompagne ces 2 chose impactent grandement la maniere de jouer) 
[/list]

l'ambiance du jeu :
[list]
[*]l'ambiance mexicaine du jour des mort mélanger au culte de la lucha libre est aoriginal et est trés présente dans le scénario
[*]l'ambiance visuels est très propre et fonctionne à merveille
[*]l'ambiance sonre l'est tout autant et les deux réunis est un régal avec beaucoup de cohérence.
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198046919234', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1464451597}

author: {'steamid': '76561198003837486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1503681093}
review:
Un jeu assez prenant au début, joli, avec un design original. Pas mal de nouvelles attaques sympas, puis viennent les boucliers de couleur sur les enemis, les ronces, et encore plus d'attaques qu'il faut arriver à enchaîner dans un ordre et avec un timing parfait pour pouvoir passer un endroit, et quand il ne faut pas en même temps passer d'un monde à un autre...

Et si vous n'y arivez pas? Il n'y a pas d'autre chemin posssible, donc vous êtes bloqués et vous avez payé un jeu pour rien... Passer 2h à essayer de passer un endroit trop peu pour moi...

De plus, si vous êtes daltonien comme moi et 10% de la population mondiale, ce jeu est difficilement jouable car basé sur des couleurs (les boucliers), et il n'y a rien de prévu pour ca...

En gros, si vous aimez le travail à la chaîne, ce jeu est sûrement pour vous.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973084271', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 989, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1503790288}
review:
WOW THIS IS FABULOUS. Bright colors, techno mariachi music, and beautiful, BEAUTIFUL 2D platformer handling. And sometimes I get to be a chicken. It is everything I didn't know I wanted in a Metroidvania. 

Before I bought it, I thought this was a go-to-the-right-beat-em-up like the arcade version of TMNT or THE SIMPSONS. But then it came up during a lookup of Metroidvanias and I had a closer look. I still wasn't quite sure if it was the game for me. THEN there was a sale--get the Super Turbo Championship Edition, Gold Edition, AND soundtrack for $6. I couldn't pass up the deal.

Since the Super Turbo version looked to be the more "complete" version of the game, I deleted the Gold version and started my GUACAMELEE journey.

This game does a ton of things right. Checkpoints are generous. The beat 'em up sections are fun to complete, even when playing on a keyboard. Miss a platform jump (in a series of them over water), and instead of going back to a last checkpoint, you go to the last bit of solid ground you stood on. THANK YOU, GUACAMELEE, FOR RESPECTING MY TIME.

I groused at first about the lack of double-jump, but in the end, I was glad they made me use the Rooster Punch so often, because then I discovered its versatility. Then when I did get double jump, I found myself using it differently. 

Within hours, I was zipping across the neon landscape like a champ, goat-jumping off walls while switching dimensions and punching skeletons in the face like a stud. THAT'S what I play platformers for.

The abilities upgrade system is a little weak -- at times it was hard to see how spending pesos improved said abilities--

As a kid, I fell in love with Castlevania: Symphony of the Night for its dark-yet-fun horror-gothic vibe. I grew up with the Donkey Kong Country games. I've played nearly all the Nifflas platformers, which have a chill mystique. GUACAMELEE has the wonderful quality of movement of ALL those games PLUS a zesty feast for your eyes and ears, the most festive, fun platformer I've played in a L O N G time. 

Come for the platforming, stay for the art. And chicken.

review: I love Metroidvanias, I love the aesthetic of this game, and I love that the Devil grants you the power to turn into a chicken.  I don't know how I feel about the large open spaces of the map, but I still really enjoyed the game.  The core plot is also pretty boring, with a by-the-book "save your 'childhood friend' from an evil magical dude who turns into something really huge" plot and an ending where one of the main characters dies that changes depending on whether you got all of a collectible, but the details and backstory were pretty entertaining.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089943640', 'num_games_owned': 1438, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 1251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1251, 'last_played': 1500270049}
review:
I 100% completed this game in 20.9 Hours. Story mode can take about 4-7 hours without completionisting.

A metroidvania beat em up? Sign me up! A wonderfully fun game that anyone will love. The levels are wonderfully designed and the music works perfectly for each place even though it does get repetitive after 10 hours. Any challenges are always fair and will test you on what the game has taught you while you play. Spamming is not an option here.

Completionists will have a decent time here. Nothing is hard to achieve it just takes a ton of time to finish it. Prepair to collect everything by passing puzzles that'll test you on your knowledge of the game. You'll also have to play through the game twice for the hard mode. So just be patient and you'll complete this in no time. Good luck!

I recommend this game at any price if you plan on 100% it. Maybe a bit cheaper if you want to just play through quick which is a bad idea.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989188746', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1496616057}
review: I had never heard of Guacamelee until I received it in a Humble Bundle, but I was pleasantly surprised to find a solid Metroidvania with satisfying combat, a lot of interesting abilities, and a big, varied map. The tone is silly and lighthearted, and falls short of funny, but also didn't get annoying, which is a real danger in comedy games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048008412', 'num_games_owned': 489, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 976, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 954, 'last_played': 1590285758}
review:
I personally don't really enjoy most of the metroidvania type game that I've played, but loved Guacamelee.
It's fast paced, light hearted, and quite fun.
The game has heavy Mexican/Mesoamerican (and a little Incan) influences, ranging from the mythical to steryotypical, but never get too out of hand. The game also is willing to make jokes about typical game mechanics and make some refrences, but again doesn't go overboard with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061604773', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 260, 'playtime_forever': 760, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 730, 'last_played': 1500572108}
review:

  [list]

    [*] Novos Inimigos
    [*] 2 áreas novas para se explorar

    [*] Melhoria e algumas mudanças na jogabilidade
    [*] Novos Upgrades
    [*] Novas Fantasias
    [*] Nova transformação para o personagem e alguns inimigos
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561197971039128', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1499129728}
review:
This game is splendid.  It's a solid brawler with Metroidvania influences, with the latter influences being implemented tastefully as to not waste the player's time with tons of backtracking (a common complaint in other Metroid-influenced games).

The music is fantastic, and the humor tongue-in-cheek.  I was surprised this was made by a bunch of Canadians as the subject matter, while funny, is a little bit casually-racist.  Didn't bother me at all, but I could see it being a barriers to others.

I would definitely recommend playing this with a controller, as all 2D platformer games.  With that said, controls are nice and tight , though I recommend using the D-pad over the Thumbstick as the combos definitely benefit from that precision.

All in all, this comes recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038830259', 'num_games_owned': 823, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 2175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1499604927}
review:
Overall this game is really good

The colors, the art direction, everything about it screams mexico in the best way

every detail in this game I like, from the houses having different people in dead/alive mode, I like the music and how it changes so easily.

And of course the combat is the best part, its fluent, fun, and fast, and if you like to combo, god damn this game has a combo chicken just for.

the only issues are that at time the requirment for combos can be annoying, by the end of the game you feel sick and tired of skeletons in every aspect, and the fact that there is no ng+ for people to explore after they have beaten it.

this is honestly a super fun, detailed expereince, that when you play you can FEEL the passion in every corner of this game, well done to the devs for staying so true to mexican culture with this game and creating one of the most colorful and fun worlds I have ever seen.

Would 100% pick up and play, I mean it 15 dollars you gotta give it a shot, and if its on sale GET THIS SPICY DEAL.

review:
Amazing visuals and concept.
Worst controls I've ever experienced in a platformer.
Certain bosses force you to cheese the game instead of playing it properly.
Extremely frustrating at times, utterly impossible without borderline cheating at others.
Really dropped the ball on the grapple mechanic, it's pretty much useless.
Surprisingly linear for a metroidvania.
Skip it and get something worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040842672', 'num_games_owned': 3000, 'num_reviews': 192, 'playtime_forever': 405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1498767364}
review:
Guacamelee! is a action platformer with combo-based melee combat and exploration elements. You play as Juan, a farmer who gains superpowers after finding a mysterious luchador mask. You fight through throngs of enemies in a Mexican-inspired setting on your quest to rescue El Presidente's kidnapped daughter.

Super Turbo Championship Edition is rather pointless (and frankly greedy) rerelease of the game with rebalanced encounters, some new content and a poorly implemented new mechanic. In hindsight I should have just played the earlier Gold Edition instead of buying this one. Rather annoyingly there's no discount anymore for upgrading from the Gold Edition and you have to pay the full price for this one even if you own the earlier release .

[h1]Visuals[/h1]
The game has a strong visual style that fits the theme well. Unfortunately the visuals leave a lot to be desired on a technical level. A lot of the artwork is rather poorly done and the animations in particular are terrible. Also, the game does not properly support 16:10 resolutions.

The game also suffers from rather heavy tearing on my system. Enabling vsync will fix the issue but leads to nearly unplayable controller lag.

[h1]Audio[/h1]
The sound effects are decent enough although there seemed to be issues with the timings of some sounds. The music is well done if rather repetitive and fits the theme well. There's no real voice acting.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
The game plays like a fairly typical metroidvania with combo-based melee combat. You explore the maps and unlock special powers that let you progress to new areas. These powers are pretty standard from wall climbing and double jumping to various attack moves that let you break through special color-coded walls.

You also gain the power to switch between the land of the dead and the land of the living, although nothing particularly inventive is done with this ability. In practice it's mainly used for a lot of rather repetitive and tedious platforming sections.

My early impressions of the combat were quite positive. Chaining the combos is fun and the combat flows quite well. Unfortunately as you progress the game keeps adding more and more gimmicky elements that mess up the core gameplay. Having to constantly break enemy shields and switch between the land of the dead/living just breaks the flow and makes the combat lot less enjoyable.

Way too much of the combat also takes place in small closed-off arenas. I certainly felt that this was a rather baffling design choice in a metroidvania game and would have preferred more open-ended encounters.

[h1]Difficulty[/h1]
I found the game pretty easy on normal difficulty, although this will be heavily dependant on your ability to pull of combos and your platforming skills. The final area is certainly a big step up in difficulty and some of the optional puzzles and areas are quite a bit harder too.

[h1]Controls[/h1]
The controls are pretty solid on a gamepad. Some moves can feel slightly imprecise, however.

[h1]Story and Writing[/h1]
The story is very basic and cliché. The writing is pretty terrible too and the jokes in particular are extremely cringeworthy. I felt that much more could have been done with the Mexican theme.

[h1]Bugs and Glitches[/h1]
Overall the game is fairly polished and I didn't encounter any major bugs.

[h1]Final Verdict[/h1]
Personally I found Guacamelee! a somewhat disappointing game. The core gameplay is solid enough, but the game introduces way too many poorly implemented powers and gimmicky enemies that end up making the combat lot less fun. The writing is pretty terrible too and the exploration aspects are not particularly satisfying. It's not a terrible game by any means, but I still didn't find it enjoyable enough to recommend.

It took me little under 6 hours to play through the game on normal. I didn't bother with most optional areas, just completed the main story.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998648357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1115, 'last_played': 1498423981}
review:
Really fun and challenging metroidvania in a Mexican setting with luchadores, chupacabras, demons and chickens!

Art style is really good, music too, and there is a lot of humor and easter eggs referencing other games and memes which makes it more funny. Some of the power ups really remind me Metroid games, and the combats are like a Beat Them All or fighthing game (lots of combos).

There is an extra ending and lots of special challenges for extra replay value!

PS: buy the Super Turbo Championship Edition which is more complete (new powers, new levels, ...) than the Gold Edition. Also, as far as I know, Gold Edition save games are not transferable to STCE.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969054179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1497232839}
review:
I really wish there was a middle-ground between thumbs-up and thumbs-down, because that's what I would choose.

The good: this game has a gorgeous art style, a lot of humor, and is overall a pretty fun platformer.

The bad: the game focuses more and more on being able to pull off combos as you progress, which is something I hate. I reached a point where I just couldn't proceed because I don't have the physical and/or mental dexterity to pull off the exact correct button combinations at the exact correct times. That's just not fun gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104042806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2106, 'last_played': 1517458525}
review: Guacamelee! Super Turbo Chamionship Edition a very fun Metroidvania-style game with solid controls, a fantastic soundtrack and challenge to beat (especially when collecting all the mask pieces). The Infierno challenges will REALLY put your platforming and speedrunning skills to the test. While for the most part, the challenge is fair, there are some parts that are downright frustrating (I'm looking at YOU Tule Tree and Sierra Moreno mask pieces!) but if you keep at it you will eventually get the hang of it and come through victorious. If you are a fan of the Metroidvania genre, this game is a must buy!  8.5/10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198146109663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2074, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2013, 'last_played': 1542524831}

author: {'steamid': '76561198126423888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3037, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1501875512}
review:
It is a 2d side scroller with fun, 'beat-em-up' style combat, and as the game progresses you learn new combo moves that will help you in combat, as well as in navigating the world. 

So many tricks and nuances to the combos make this game require both skill and strategy to progress. 

Great fun, and replayablility! You can also select characters with different strengths and weaknesses based on your gameplay style. 

I first played Guacamelee on my cousin's PS4 when it was available as a free download in the PS store and I LOVED it.
Since I only own a PC, I waited patiently for the game to go on discount in the Steam Store. I got the Guacamele Complete for 4 bucks (what a deal!). 

I started playing instantly but had one major challenge.... no controller! This game is quite difficult and clunky on a keyboard. I was only able to play for about 30 minutes on a keyboard before reluctantly giving up. 
I am now waiting anxiously for Amazon to ship me an x360 controller so I can once again play Guacamelee.

author: {'steamid': '76561198345826696', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 4232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3615, 'last_played': 1536322039}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197983624763', 'num_games_owned': 1382, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 737, 'last_played': 1488656035}
review:
No fim, resolvi zerar esta versão em vez de começar pela Gold, porque até onde eu vi a Turbo muda pouquíssima coisa da Gold (apenas 1 boss a mais e o modo 'muy macho'). Então, vou colar minha analise que fiz pra versão Gold aqui pois minha opinião é a mesma :)
--

Muito, mas muito bom. Nada como um bom e delicioso metroid-vania, e esse é um belo de um deles. A arte é massa demais, eu curto muito esse estilo! Inclusive fico tirando prints adoidado das cenas, porque é uma melhor que a outra haha! A história é clichêzona (mocinha raptada, resgatar do vilão e tal), porém muito divertida e cheio de referências cult. O combate, pra mim, é o ponto forte: é bem fluído, precisa de timing e habilidade e muito prazeroso. Lembra um pouco Dust An Elysian Tail, só que mais tático. Você tem que pensar nos movimentos que vai fazer, e não simplesmente esmagar botões. Quando você pega o jeito, é muito relaxante e satisfatório. Tem puzzles, mas não dá bem pra chamar de "puzzle"... eles requerem mais habilidade do que raciocínio. Bem desafiadores. O jogo sempre te puxa pro limite do que ele te ensina em seguida, o que é ótimo.

Recomendo demais, vale muito a pena!

Pretendo zerar este e depois jogar o Turbo Edition.

Edito quando fechar

review:
Un buen juego de plataformas al estilo "Metroidvania".
Como mexicano me gusta mucho el estilo que imprimieron en este juegazo, un poco que ver con las costumbres y la temática de luchador de AAA muy propio del país.

author: {'steamid': '76561198282268282', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2202, 'last_played': 1494235852}
review:
Juego de plataformas muy entretenido acompañado de mucha acción. Goza de buena imágen, coloridos y una buena banda sonora, se nota que ha sido trabajdo cuidadosamente y ofrece lo que puedes esperar de un metroidvania.

En oferta es una compra muy muy recomendable si te gusta este tipo de género. No lo dudes pues disfrutarás jugando.

El juego no es muy largo, cumple con lo esperado, en unas 8 horas puedes terminarlo, con la opción de rejugarlo en modo difícil y completar todo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049147498', 'num_games_owned': 463, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1186, 'last_played': 1661039278}
review:
Recomendo sem dúvidas.

Vale frisar que gosto muito de jogos [b]METROIDVANIA[/b], então se você também é fã do estilo COMPRE! 

As artes e animações dos personagens dão vida ao game, tudo muito bonito para apreciar.
Personagens carismáticos e engraçados, conquistam o jogador.
Musicas impecáveis e imersivas, da pra perder umas horas com a trilha sonora.
Mecânica de jogo e habilidades sensacionais, é muito satisfatório fazer combos.
Jogo desafiador, desafios aumentam gradativamente em base na habilidade do jogador.
Toneladas de referências de games e paradas da interwebz

Mas o mais importante: POLLOS, EVERYWHERE !!

author: {'steamid': '76561198016365353', 'num_games_owned': 1032, 'num_reviews': 304, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1494028845}
review:
Un metroidvania semplice e lineare, dai colori vivaci e scanzonati, divertente e mai frustrante. Bello da vedere, divertente da giocare, grazie ad un buon sistema di combattimento con il quale sbizzarrirci a suon di suplex o pile driver, calci acrobatici e capocciate atomiche: ci metterete qualche secondo ad abituarvi alla tempistica dei comandi, ma in breve diventerete padroni del pad e del potere dei luchadores.
Se vi piace il genere, è un buon titolo con cui spassarsela.

Cheers...al maestro capra!

author: {'steamid': '76561198210979096', 'num_games_owned': 316, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1492462474}
review:
I’m not giving this review a non-recommendation because this is a bad game, maybe it just doesn’t float my boat.

I like the music in this one, they are unique and fits each area just right, the Mexican folklore is awesome and very well done, but that’s about everything I like about this game.

I’m confused with the graphics choice here, I feel that sometimes it wants to be a 2D HD game, and sometimes it wants to be a Pixel Art or a Retro kind of graphics, it wasn’t easy on the eyes.

Also the gameplay have its share of imperfection, you only have a limited type of enemies, and the combats are so far in between the platforming sections, there is no joy in leveling up or killing enemies simply because there is not enough reward in doing so, you can only collect hearts and skulls to slightly upgrade your stamina and health, and few more boring abilities to buy.

The platforming is good, although it’s majorly flawed by some confusing and dull mechanics, like the portal that you have to go into to make some platforms appear and disappear, or the climbing up and down to reach new areas, they all sounds good on paper, but the execution is awful in my opinion.

The map is confusing, even the mini maps are confusing, you don’t know what’s what until you start to memorize areas.

Again, maybe it just me that can’t enjoy this one, it felt like a chore in the 4 hours I spent in, it’s boring and uninteresting. Couldn’t beat and the game and don’t have an interest to do so, this game gets an eyesore of 4 out of 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998212552', 'num_games_owned': 801, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 819, 'last_played': 1492547439}

Une direction artistique originale, des ennemis redoutables, plein de mécaniques de jeu à assimiler (à la fin notre héros est surpuissant, c'est très gratifiant !), de l'humour, des boss très sympas et déjantés.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138439940', 'num_games_owned': 1735, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 716, 'last_played': 1492318433}
review:
Nunca joguei a versão anterior, então minha análise será com visão somente nesse jogo, sem comparativos, etc.

Guacaranged (Keepo) é um jogo de plataforma estilo metroidvania (?) ok, ele tem tudo que um bom jogo do estilo tem para oferecer.:

[list]
    [*]Boa jogabilidade.
    [*]Boa história.
    [*]Muito boa trilha sonora.
[/list]

Sempre gostei das histórias/filmes de luchadores, quando abri o jogo vi que não seria diferente com ele. É bem humorado e cheio de referências, e na parte de humor digo que ele acertou em cheio, perdi as contas de vezes em que perdi o fôlego rindo, a trilha sonora é muito boa e combina muito bem com os cenários.

Uma coisa que eu gostaria de elogiar também é a dificuldade do jogo, no modo normal (única dificuldade disponível para um viajante de primeira viagem), é muito bem trabalhada, há muitas partes em que não é fácil, mas também não chega a ser impossível de forma que acaba atrapalhando a experiência.

Para concluir, devo dizer que é um jogo bem divertido, comecei a jogar ele ontem, e praticamente terminei a campanha principal, ficou faltando apenas o último boss que enfrentei hoje quando acordei.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002075954', 'num_games_owned': 480, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 583, 'last_played': 1491596376}
review:
Долго думал что поставить Да или НЕТ. Склонился к Да.

Только не вздумайте брать эту игру если планируете собирать все ачивки. Некоторые из них практически невыполнимые, только если вы не задрот проводящий около компа 24/7

Ах да, ну и само собой даже не вздумайте покупать эту игру если у вас нет джойстика.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077185468', 'num_games_owned': 913, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 713, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 713, 'last_played': 1491485925}
review:
Having finished Guacamelee Gold Ed. back in the days and being really convinced by it, I also decided to give the STC Edition a try after getting it on Humblebundle. I finished in two days because again I couldn't stop playing. The extra content is not really that much, though, but still well-implemented.
The whole Luchhador atmosphere immediately dragged me in again with it's nice design and soundtrack. Also, the game is still one of the best Metroidvanias in terms of gameplay and coop because it runs supersmooth and the controls feel natural. I will try to 100% this as well, because I will definitely come back for finishing hard mode and the extra challenge rooms.
For all that don't know this yet, expect about 20 hours of superfun wrestling your way through hordes of skeletons to rescue your love,

Also, the Devil is a chicken, how can this get any better?

9/10, because the upgrade to STC Edition should be patched in to the main game. If you haven't played Guacamelee, get this Edition. If you already did, only get it if you are a big fan like me, the extra content is not that much.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990419262', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1491854707}
review: Eléggé ott van.

author: {'steamid': '76561198290238998', 'num_games_owned': 99, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 574, 'last_played': 1484746732}
review:
I just want to say first that Guacamelee has great gameplay. However, good gameplay can only go so far and the rest of Guacamelee's element fall short.

The thing about Guacamelee is that it has a good premise. It looks really fun, colorful and wacky and all these qualities hints that you are about to enter a wonderful and original world full of spectacles. But it is sadly not the case and you start realizing it when you notice that there is barely no interesting NPC hanging in the couple of towns there is and all the temple look like one another making hard to remenber your adventure in Guacamelee. Even the music is pretty bland and forgettable. Then come the bosses. They all have cool design and are indeed interesting by themselves, but they still end out as flat and boring. They try as hard as they can to have emotion and something interesting to say, but all that effort is wasted when Juan (the protagonist) just stand there, emotionless, waiting for them to shut up so he can move on.

It was a mistake to take the silent protagonist route with Juan and if, they had to do it, they should have done it the same way Zelda does by having the hero emote and having a lot of interesting NPC filling the void that Link leave.

Overall, I still had fun with this title and the ending sequence is the only part where I can say, weirdly enough, none of these issues I mention are present and I really felt satisfied at the end. But still, I though there were going to be more charm and personality in this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025392065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 682, 'last_played': 1441941582}
review: I wish there were more games like this. Combat & gameplay are so well balanced. Good pacing and exploration. Bright colors, cheery tunes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025187473', 'num_games_owned': 688, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 530, 'last_played': 1491593977}
review:
Good platformer, but not a fun game, the difficulty climbs to absurd levels.
This game is good, but it is not meant to be fun.

I was looking forward to beating it up until the final boss's second form.
The final boss spams screen-wide attacks and is invulnerable to damage until you break his regenerating shield for a few seconds to do minimal damage to him no matter what you do.
The final boss also does large chunks of your health per hit, if I did not have maximum health I would not have been able hot survive five hits.

You need to master the game in order to beat it, which is bad game desgin, at the very least you should have to get good to beat the game, not be forced to master it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065716697', 'num_games_owned': 2171, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 1208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1203, 'last_played': 1490798026}
review:
Бывает находишь классную игру с приятной графикой и саундтреком. Она втягивает тебя и ты уже думаешь, что ничего не может ее испортить.. 

НО ВДРУГ ОКАЗЫВАЕТСЯ, ЧТО В ИГРЕ ЕСТЬ ЧЕЛЛЕНДЖИ КОТОРЫЕ ОБЯЗАТЕЛЬНО ПРОХОДИТЬ. ПРИ ЧЕМ ИХ НЕВОЗМОЖНО ФИЗИЧЕСКИ ПРОЙТИ С ПЕРВОГО РАЗА... РАЗРАБОТЧИКИ, ЗАЧЕМ ПОРТИТЬ ВПЕЧАТЛЕНИЕ ОТ ИГРЫ ЭТИМ НЕНУЖНЫМ МУСОРОМ. 

Окей, допустим челленджи можно легко взломать и получить золотые медалики.

НО ЭТОГО НЕДОСТАТОЧНО ТАК КАК РАЗРАБОТЧИКАМ БЫЛО МАЛО НЕРВОТРЕПАТЕЛЬНЫХ ЧЕЛЛЕНДЖЕЙ И ОНИ РЕШИЛИ ДОБАВИТЬ ИСЧЕЗАЮЩИЕ И ПОЯВЛЯЮЩИЕСЯ ПЛАТФОРМЫ... ЗАЧЕМ БЛ*ТЬ????

Разработчики, если вы добавляете в игру подобное, то надеюсь после вашей смерти, в аду, вас будут вечно заставлять проходить подобное раз за разом >:(

1000000000000000000 смертей от еб*ных платформ из 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198102365221', 'num_games_owned': 371, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 881, 'last_played': 1590208851}
review: Viva México, cabrones.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977088954', 'num_games_owned': 685, 'num_reviews': 228, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1490182938}
review:
Guacamelee.. es un juego de plataformas muy entretenido.
Tu eres un luchador que tiene que rescatar a la hija del alcalde de las garras de Calaca.

La jugabilidad es muy buena, los enemigo son lo suficiente variados para no aburrirte y con los movimientos y ataques que aprendes cuando avanzas en la historia hacen que las peleas sean divertidas.
Graficamente se nota que lo han hecho bien, no tiene unos graficos como el Battlefield ni nada de eso. Son mas bien de la epoca de los 90 aunque mas detallados.
La ambientación es muy buena, tanto la música como el tiempo o el entorno acompañan siempre bien y no te cortan la motivación de avanzar.

Lo recomiendo. La verdad es que me ha gustado y tiene el puntito ese que te hace seguir un nivel mas y otro y otro.
Se me ha hecho corto. jajaja

author: {'steamid': '76561198038366350', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1320, 'last_played': 1638224310}
review:
I enjoy platforming games and this one has nice platforming challenges alongside a great soundtrack and very colorful theme.

[h1]Platforming[/h1]
The platforming evolves to be more difficult as you progress to take advantage of your power-ups. There's also locations early on that you can revisit once you have those power-ups to find secrets or to just unlock new areas. The mechanic i hate the most in platforming games are the insta-death traps (usually spikes). Fortunately, this game doesn't have much insta-death traps; i think it's just the lava levels and the grinders. At least for those, there's a save point nearby so it's not a big deal. The platforming involves skills like accurate jumps, timing, and switching phases. There are some tricky spots, but you never need to be "pixel-perfect." Sometimes backtracking is a real PITA though. There are stone heads you can talk to to warp between areas but you have to get to the stone head; you can't just warp wherever you want.

[h1]Controls[/h1]
I played this on a Dualshock 3, and you're definitely going to want to use a gamepad to play it. There's no input lag or sloppy controls, but you do have to be somewhat precise. If you're a button-masher when it comes to combat, you may struggle a bit especially since trying to change direction will NOT interrupt. There are special moves to unlock and you can chain them together like a basic fighting game. Doing the special moves depletes stamina as well, though it regenerates quickly when you stop.

[h1]Soundtrack[/h1]
The soundtrack es muy bueno, i think it's worth buying if you can afford the extra cost. Every area has it's own theme music for each the living world and the world of the dead (so two songs each). I didn't buy this soundtrack because i didn't have the extra money at the time, but when i bought the sequel, i made sure to get the soundtrack too.

[h1]Presentation[/h1]
The theming in this game is fantastic. It's full of bright color and culture. There's plenty of art to admire in the backgrounds as well. The living world and the world of the dead contrast significantly and completely change the scenery (and NPC's!). There's plenty of tributes to things like Strongbad, Castle Crashers, Metroid, and more.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
This is over 7 years old but it's still worthy. I liked it so much that i bought the sequel too (on another platform).

author: {'steamid': '76561198208989408', 'num_games_owned': 629, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1491245542}

author: {'steamid': '76561198054674251', 'num_games_owned': 660, 'num_reviews': 338, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1574468862}
review:
Great game. A mash-up of a side-scrolling brawler and Metroidvania with its own proper spirit and art style. Fun and funny, albeit short (under 12 hours for full completion). A 100% for-sure buy for those who have yet to play the game.

I'd like to play through the game with a friend, but alas, there is no online co-op, even in this penultimate version of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067476568', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 776, 'last_played': 1489707622}
review:
O produtor de Super Metroid havia dito em entrevista que não tinha mais espaço para um Metroid 2D porque as ideias esgotaram nesse sentido. O que houve depois foi um limbo: não teve metroid no Nintendo 64. Só voltariam a existir Metroids novamente na forma 3D, na série Prime, ou no GBA, finalmente em 2D, mas décadas depois. 
Guacamelee prova que um metroidvania tem ainda muitas possibilidades de mecânica sem precisar ser hermético. É um jogo divertido, engraçado, e com easter eggs por toda parte, recompensando a exploração, não só com itens, mas com lembranças. Fica evidente que os desenvolvedores puseram muito amor no jogo, porque são muitas homenagens, tornando tudo muito pessoal. Joguei o jogo no modo normal e o desafio foi na medida. De qualquer forma existe um post-game bem técnico e segredos para os jogadores mais exigentes, como num bom metroidvania. Outros destaques são a trilha sonora, que fica na sua cabeça depois que você para de jogar, principalmente a do Canal de las Flores e a direção de arte, que foi um ponto decisivo para eu comprar o jogo: tudo é muito minimalista e vibrante ao mesmo tempo. A temática mexicana é constante e até a adaptação dos poderes do luchador seguem a temática. Super recomendado!

author: {'steamid': '76561198273445941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1489098427}
review: Pretty fun game. Starts out really simple, but gets progressively better as the main character gains new abilities and a wider variety of enemies are introduced throughtout the game. The attempted humor falls pretty flat, but it's never too cringeworthy, and the lighthearted art style works really well. Definitely worth a playthrough at a good price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022717686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 520, 'last_played': 1489595368}
review: Un metroidvinia más, con estética mexicana cuidadísima. Si bien no tiene el encanto plataformero de otras, si que resulta un juego muy entretenido y a todas luces, muy sólido. Bastante facilón en cuanto al combate (aunque tiene su relativa profundidad) a veces sudarás tinta con ciertas secciones de plataformeo. Por lo demás, muy divertido. Un 8,5.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974085922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 313, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1489389998}
review: Absolutely nothing wrong with it, so I can't not recommend it, but I didn't love it.  I think it's probably mostly just the theming.  I'm not particularly interested in luchadors or mexican culture so the game wasn't really doing it for me.  You'll probably know going into it whether you're interested in that sort of thing or not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198173443603', 'num_games_owned': 545, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1500865892}
review:
One of the much better platformers i've played, with a decent story line to boot!
Here's the lay down: 
Graphics are good, nothing crazy but all the art is done really well, and the animations are nice and smooth as well.
Gameplay and combat is fun, regular fighting doesn't get old quick, and there's a variety of special moves to work with.
Enemies are good for the most part.
All around a really good game worth the price tag!

EDIT: The fact that the workshop lets players customize create and share new costumes makes the game at least 25% cooler and worth getting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083488873', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 720, 'last_played': 1491498059}
review:
Guacamelee super turbo championship edition è un esplosivo gioco indie platform/azione in 2D, sviluppato e pubblicato da DrinkBox Studios. Il gioco è stato rilasciato il 21 agosto 2014 per Pc, Ps3, Ps Vita, Ps4, Xbox One, Mac OS e Linux.

La storia, che ha luogo in una località messicana in cui elementi sovrannaturali e leggende del folklore si intrecciano, narra dei piani di conquista del mondo dei vivi da parte del grande Carlos Calaca, il signore del regno dei morti. Per poter attuare il suo diabolico piano, egli rapisce la figlia del presidente di un piccolo villaggio di contadini. Juan, un uomo forte e coraggioso, innamorato della ragazza, cerca di fermarlo ma invano, venendo ucciso con poco sforzo da Calaca.
Mentre finisce nel regno dei morti, viene a contatto con una misteriosa maschera che non solo lo resuscita, facendolo tornare tra i vivi ma lo trasforma anche in un potentissimo luchador, in grado di affrontare l’esercito di morti di Calaca e i suoi eccentrici compagni. Con l’aiuto di Tostada, guardiana della maschera e degli strani poteri elargiti dal vecchio maestro Uay Chivo, Juan comincia il suo viaggio, per fermare i folli piani di Calaca, liberare la figlia del presidente e salvare il regno dei vivi e quello dei morti.

In questo gioco, leggende del folklore, personaggi strani e animali antropomorfi si intrecciano a formare una storia epica, dai tratti malinconici ed esplosivi. Durante il viaggio da una località all’altra, con foreste, miniere, caverne oscure, città piene di vita, templi abbandonati protetti da creature feroci, deserti roventi e vulcani, dovremo farci strada attraverso orde di scheletri, chupacabra e molti altri nemici che compongono l’esercito di Calaca, da sconfiggere a suon di pugni, calci, lanci pazzeschi e poteri come la schiacciata del rospo o il montante cedrone.
Il design delle zone, dei personaggi e dei vari nemici è ben realizzato, le musiche sono esplosive e coinvolgenti in ogni località che esploriamo, con segreti da scoprire grazie ai vari poteri che sbloccheremo nel corso del gioco. Inoltre, per poter risolvere alcuni enigmi o per sconfiggere certi nemici, dovremo destreggiarci tra il mondo dei vivi e quello dei morti, completando anche una serie di quest nelle varie città in cui andremo, per ottenere monete per acquistare nuove abilità e potenziamenti per i personaggi.
 
La storia viene narrata attraverso i filmati di gioco ma anche tramite le varie situazioni assurde e i siparietti comici tra Juan e i vari personaggi della vicenda. Le zone del mondo, i nemici, i personaggi e gli scontri contro i Boss sono realizzati in maniera eccellente così come le straordinarie musiche che ci accompagnano nel corso della nostra avventura.
Rispetto alla versione Golden, la Super Turbo Championship Edition può vantare nuove sfide, nuove zone da esplorare, nuovi poteri (come la modalità Intenso, uno stato mistico che ci permette di buttare giù anche i nemici più ostici), nuovi costumi con abilità pazzesche (lanci più potenti, stamina che non si esaurisce, ecc…), nuove varietà di nemici, la fantastica possibilità di giocare in co-op fino a 4 persone in contemporanea e nuovi Boss da sconfiggere. Nonostante le zone del gioco non sia molte da visitare, grazie alle nuove modalità Normale e Difficile la giocabilità è assicurata, sia giocando in singolo che divertendosi con altri amici in co-op, grazie anche ai nuovi nemici di classe Elitè, nuove abilità e arene esplosive, dove massacrare gli avversari con stile, violenza inaudita e potenti bombe pollo.

- Trama 8.4/10
- Personaggi 8.8/10
- Grafica 8.8/10
- Sonoro 8.6/10
- Rapporto Qualità/Prezzo 9.0/10
- Sviluppo della Storia 8.4/10

Voto Personale 8.6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198052982921', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1488603432}
review:
So, first things first, controller is greatly required to play this one. Default key mapping is pretty crappy, but at least it allows you to remap keys to whatever you want. Fun fact, it is the literal first controller support game I play, that doesn't recognize my cheap PS2 knockoff at all, no big deal tho, just used Xpadder. Another detail is that the game randomly crashes when switching areas, had it crash twice at temple of rain, and one when returning to Santa Luchita. Laptop hugely exceeds requirements, so not a specs issue.

On to the game, it feels pretty fine, a well done mashup of a platformer beat-them-up, altho the tutorials feel somewhat clunky and, by the time you reach the guy who explains your moveset, you already had to clear your way thru a few baddies and thus, already know what he has to teach. Fighting feels fluid and not overly complicated, just button mash and dodge at the right time, platforms make good use of your moveset and feel compelling.

The atmosphere feels pretty colorful and lively, and while the mexican theme is laid out quite a bit over the top, it feels right in sync with the rest of the game. Colour palletes are well used and the game feels right. Story is not the most original and character names are... wonky, but work well with the atmosphere the game is trying to set.

Got this one as part of a big Humble Bundle along with lotsa other stuff, so I paid like a buck for it, ofc at that price, game's a steal, and well worth what I paid for it, but even at full price, it's worth its salt. Haven't tried out local multiplayer, which is a feature less and less games seem to still carry now, so a big plus for that, however without true controller support, I wouldn't be able to either way (Xpadder only turns controller into a makeshift keyboard), and honestly, I'm not coughing up the cost of a XBOX controller for one game, when every other recognizes my generic one just fine. Other than that, sure, get it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037530686', 'num_games_owned': 520, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 956, 'last_played': 1488318409}
review:
Un jueguecillo que tenia ahí perdido en la biblioteca de Steam desde que me tocó en un sorteo. Hace unas dos semanillas mi sobrino quería jugar al ordenador y me dije "po este mismo" el niño se aburrió enseguida de él pero yo le vi potencial, y vaya si lo tiene....
15 horas me ha llevado pasármelo (pero porque soy un cansino y lo tengo TODO, imagino que el juego, yendo a lo que hay que ir, durará unas 5 horitas más o menos).
El juego es un Metroidvania, de este tipo de juegos que tiene un mapeado con muchas zonas y a medida que vas desbloqueando habilidades puedes acceder a zonas a las que antes no podías, la historia del juego no es gran cosa, cumple sin más. Pero eso sí, hay partes INFERNALMENTE difíciles, sobre todo algunas que sirven para coger algunos objetos que son necesarios para ver el final bueno (ojo, que tiene dos finales, yo me he hecho los dos).
"Pa" echar un ratillo mola, además el juego permite multijugador, ¡hasta 4 jugadores!, imagino que en local, aunque no me ha dado por mirar si también tiene online porque no conozco a nadie que lo tenga.
En fin, que a mi me ha gustado ^^.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106594996', 'num_games_owned': 314, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 699, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 651, 'last_played': 1488133559}
review:
Местами очень сложно и раздражающе. Последнего босса, дабы сохранить лишний килограмм нервов, убил только с читом на бесконечные жизни. А когда игра предложила начать новую игру с высоким уровнем сложности, я рассмеялся ей в лицо и удалил ее. 
А так вообще неплохой платформер. А еще при покупке этого издания дается вдобавок Gold Edition, играть я в него конечно второй раз не буду, но + 1 игра в коллекции и лишние пять карточек.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004565666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 296, 'playtime_forever': 732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 652, 'last_played': 1489345571}
review:
This is one of the best Metroidvania's I've played in recent memory. Combat is great fun, with all your special moves being fun, useful and feeding into fluid combos. Enemy design is good. Level design is very good, and makes excellent use of each power you gain. I especially love all the creative ways they used the light-world/dark world mechanic. It's got secrets and extra challenges galore for more hardcore gamers.

Also, the heavy mexican and day-of-the-dead themeing does a lot to make the game feel fresh compared to other videogames, and thematically cohesive. It also has a good sense of humor.

Criticisms: Using a keyboard, the controls for some of the special moves are finnicky--you can't do the rising uppercut unless you let go of the left/right arrow keys, for instance. And for people who have trouble with even mild colorblindness, you'll have a lot of trouble with colored shields some enemies (and bosses) get which can only be broken by the corresponding move. The red and green ones are very similar shades and they can get muddied further by ambient lighting effects in some areas (ie fire). The game would have benefitted from a colorblind mode.

Other than that though, this is a solid game that I highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198286075366', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 691, 'last_played': 1492310341}
review:
Guacamelee es un juego repleto de sorpresas del cual no esperaba nada salvo divertirme tirando madrazos como todo buen luchador. Pero poco a poco me fue atrapando la belleza de sus escenarios, la solidez de su jugabilidad y, sobre todo, la historia, que es muy, muy triste...

Una joyita.
