author: {'steamid': '76561198001600041', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1488007224}
review:
Guacamelee! is a Metroidvania style beat 'em up. I've played this game two times through. Once with this edition and once in the Gold Edition. But there is a few things that really ruined things near the end for me. 

[h1] Care [/h1]
The first issue I found was what felt like a lack of caring for this game from the developers. I understand that this is the third time this game has been sold, and it was originally a PS3 game. However, if you play as Toastada, none of the dialogue is changed, originally she was intended as the player two character Why should I get the option if they're not going to do anything to identify the fact I am playing as a different character? Not to mention the UI, because Drink Box made this as a four-player party game, which the tight platforming sections would beg to differ. The developers stuck Press Start 3 times across the screen at the top, it is very distracting and ugly.

[h1] Difficulty [/h1]
The next problem I have is the difficulty. The game is very stilted and boring in the majority of the game. The game is well placed but there is a lack of enemy variety that becomes apparent after the desert section of the game. Which post that area of the game, you hardly see new versions of enemies until they give 5 or 6 enemy types "Black" versions, which are the same in every way but they randomly break your combo and flow by teleporting.

[h1] The Story [/h1]
I had no feeling for any of the main characters. The writers spent too long trying to make you feel for the antagonists. The only thing I supposedly know about the love interest is "She is smart and Beautiful" A quote from an old lady in the beginning of the game. I don't know her name because she is called "El Presidente's Daughter" I've played it twice and that's the only name I know her for. Beyond that the new section of the game added in the DLC from Gold Edition, is to explain Toastada's past. She saved a village from a volcano. I'd argue it's the best written portion of the game, but even that is lacking in the writing department.

[h1] Fighting [/h1]
The fighting was dry, just mash X or whatever your basic attack is, until you can grapple, supplex, repeat. Outside of that, having to switch dimensions on the fly in battle adds the smallest layer of interest, outside of that switching between the two worlds only serves to add frustration, because you can't impact enemies in the other world at all. As for the shields, they either come back too quickly or are pointless. Essentially the shields come in two varieties, either you must combo a white shield away in order to dish out damage, or use a super move to break it. Also on the occasion I felt the controls glitch out, using a super move then going to attack on the occasion will launch you into another super move.

[h1] Intenso [/h1]
Intenso gives you the ability to buff your character temporarily. I'd argue this could be the best part of the added content. Intenso let's you bust through the combat and murder enemies outright.

Spoilers down here!
[spoiler] [h1] Mask Pieces [/h1]
There are five mask pieces to get at the end of the game for the true ending. Unless you're going for completion, it's pointless to get them, it doesn't add anything besides flight for chicken mode. Which flying only is helpful for people looking to get 100% of the maps. Each mask piece offered little challenge to me, except for the one in the second to last temple or so, Sierra.

[h1] Final Boss [/h1]
The final boss has a random difficulty curve. In his first form Calca teleports around the screen, which at first feels unfair, but once you understand the general pattern and how to avoid him, it is easy to avoid him and it is rather well put together. His second form mad me originally quit the game. Two years ago when I 'finished the game' I couldn't because his fight was poorly put together and expects you to last throughout the gauntlet of health he has. On my second play through Intenso made him kneel before me, and with the devil suit I easily survived the fight. This is the only portion of the game I'd argue is hard, but it is for the wrong reasons.

[/spoiler]

[h1] Art [/h1]
Okay the game is beautiful. The artist(s) used a Mexican-Inspired artstyle and it shines throughout the game and it truly charms me. I believe the only reason I played this game again is because I thought it looked awesome and I needed to beat Calca, not many games I haven't beaten because they were too hard and only because of that.

[h1] Memes [/h1]
This game suffers from being of it's time. All over towns you can see posters referencing other games, or internet memes from 2012 or so. And it feels like it's trying to force you into liking the game.

[b] I'd rate this game a C+ [/b]
Which is not okay from a developer releasing this game for the third time. If a company like Nintendo or Blizzard did this with a game being released three times within 2 years or so, I'd be a splotch on their credibility as a company.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119665939', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1456, 'last_played': 1487468217}
review:
Al principio no me llamo mucho la atención este juego. Pero es un gran juego. La dificultad aumenta progresibamente a medida que ganas habilidades y poderes. Pero las luchas no lo son todo. Desplazarse por el escenario también representa un reto y quiere conseguir todos los cofres y orbes.

No dejes de probarlo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061332612', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 790, 'last_played': 1490311428}
review:
Ich kann mich in ein Huhn verwandeln. Und bin eigentlich ein (toter) mexikanischer Wrestler. Und ich zerstöre Chozo-Statuen umd mir von einer Werziege neue Moves beibringen zu lassen.
Dazu noch ein spaßiges Kampfsystem und ein (im positiven Sinne) interessanter Grafikstil. 
--> Kaufen!

P.s.: Optional kann man dem Teufel helfen in sein Büro zu kommen. Der wurde leider in ein Huhn verwandelt und hat nicht die praktische Fähigkeit, zwischen den Gestalten zu wechseln.

author: {'steamid': '76561198289966040', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 526, 'last_played': 1487491125}
review:
[h1]こう見えて正統派メトロイドヴァニアです[/h1]

全実績解除したのでレビュー。
かなり満足度が高かったです。

非常にバタ臭い外見とよく分からないトレーラームービーで避けてしまう人もいるかもしれませんが、それは本当に勿体ないです。
とても爽快感のあるゲームで、ほぼストレスなく最後までプレイすることができました。
主人公がこちらの思った通りの動きをしてくれるので、様々な打撃技・投げ技で敵を蹴散らしていくのが快感です。

最初は地味なアクションしかできませんが、できることがどんどん増えるので飽きません。
終盤一歩手前まで新たなアクションや敵が追加され、常に新鮮な気持ちでプレイすることができます。

Gold Editionもプレイ済ですが、そっちは全実績解除まで至らず。（下記の2周プレイが面倒だったのも一因）
GEに比べて、こちらのSTCEditionは全体的に易しく、かつ優しくなっております。[strike]界王拳[/strike]INTENSOというパワーアップ技が追加されただけでも、かなり難易度低下に影響していると思います。
なので、アクションゲームに慣れていない…という方以外は、ハードモードでプレイすることを勧めます。

本来、ハードモードを解放するには一度ゲームをクリアする必要があるため、それは正直言って面倒です。
[b]最初からハードモードを開放する方法がガイドにありますのでご覧ください。[/b]

リトライも直前からすぐにやり直しできるので全くストレスなしでした！

音楽はラテン系でテンポよく、どれも好きです。特にボス戦の曲はいいですね！
この際OSTもおすすめしておきます。

author: {'steamid': '76561198014926595', 'num_games_owned': 775, 'num_reviews': 967, 'playtime_forever': 1191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1191, 'last_played': 1487371715}
review:
(This game was a gift from ArtificialRaven.  Thanks, bro!  Ironically, it comes from Humble Bundle, the same place I got the previous version from.)

[i]Guacamelee!  Super Turbo Championship Edition[/i]...what a mouthful.  For the sake of this review (And to make it easier on the eyes), we'll snip it to SCTE.  Yes, I played the Gold Edition first...which was 3 years ago.  I heard about this edition and added it to my wishlist, I forgot about it until it landed in my lap.  So...another game, another review!  ( http://steamcommunity.com/id/Shrodu/recommended/214770  Link to the review of the Gold Edition)

So, what makes STCE so special?  Well, like it's previous counterpart (a brawler/platformer hybrid that's fun to enjoy), but with MORE content, including a few additional levels, an additional boss, an additional power, Up to 4 player Co-Op, and...MULTIPLE SAVE FILES (Gold only had 1).  STCE has half the achievements that Gold had, but it's still a nice experience.

There aren't any real gripes about this version since it essentially fixed what was wrong with the Gold Edition.  I would personally say that this game would be great at a price of around $12.  If you're thinking of getting Gold Edition, I can't stop you.  I only suggest that you get this version instead since you're getting more bang for your buck!

8/10  A great experience and a lost gem on Steam that you should definitely have in your library.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125716857', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1536340843}
review:
Я очень доволен игрой. Хоть и сразу хочется сказать что это гринлайтовское этосамое в игре много забавных моментов.[spoiler] Кроме этого ср*аного 4хрукого зас*ранца и адского последнего босса[/spoiler]
Вам не дадут расслабиться ни паркур ни враги.
Плюсы:
[list] 
[*]Приятная анимация
 -Много различных атак
-пасхалки и отсылки
-порталы
-веселая атмосфера и отличный саундтрек
-Сочетание двух миров живого и мертвого для прохождения вперед заставляет попотеть
-Некоторый троллинг
-Ломает 4ю стену не сильно но ломает
-неоднородный геймплей
-кооп
-можно пи3дить курочек и крабов
[/list]
Минусы
[list]
[*]-иногда в игре можно просто не выйти из стана(кроме как формой)
-Комбинация клавиш часто тупит поэтому приходится несколько раз нажимать одну и ту же комбинацию
-Один раз был баг после обучения перехода из живого мира в мертвый(не открылся проход) но убирался после перезагрузки
-Есть какая-то задержка после комбинации
-нет озвучки
-нет русского перевода
[/list]
10 сломанных статуй из 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198095082555', 'num_games_owned': 543, 'num_reviews': 363, 'playtime_forever': 475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1487538316}
review:
[u]Pros[/u]
+Beautiful art direction.
+Great soundtrack.
+Memorable characters and levels.
+Decently intreguing story.
+Extremely fluid and satisfying combat.
+Plenty of great secrets and extras.
+Great humor and funny refrences.
+Mod support.
+4 player co-op.

[u]Cons[/u]
-Occaisonal fights have severe difficulty spikes.
-Not many graphical options.
-Very noticable aliasing around some models. Antialiasing option in the menu only helps slightly.
-Differences between Super Turbo Championship Edition and the Gold Edition are extremely limited. (But they're the same price so who really cares?)

author: {'steamid': '76561198079103929', 'num_games_owned': 588, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 2830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2310, 'last_played': 1590110374}
review:
+迷之墨西哥元素，掺着西班牙语的搞笑台词，各种彩蛋
+靓丽的美术
+（大部分）操作感和打击感不错
+阴阳切换机制不错

-（用Xbox手柄）B键+摇杆的技能对我来说非常难控制，打出哪个来基本随缘。感觉要在按B后0.x秒再按想要的方向才能出想要的技能，20多小时下来也没习惯，想打绿色下冲技能实际打出来的概率为1/3，极其艹蛋。由此导致鸡大师的指定技能连击支线任务和地狱17挑战中的某些关卡肥肠痛苦。
-感觉主线太简单，搜集orb和地狱17金牌（和主线比）又太难，难度很不平衡……
-基本等于没有的剧情

建议玩的时候有自信的话再下定决心打出全金牌全收集，自觉手残的话就打一开始放弃附加内容，通关就得，要不就会像我一样只差一个扔鸡金牌死活打不出来，精神上十分痛苦……

PS：我在全金牌全收集时觉得最难搞地方（排名不分先后）：支线中的鸡大师之连击任务，收集orb的Cueva de la Locura，17金牌中的2分钟内扔鸡

author: {'steamid': '76561198037723723', 'num_games_owned': 362, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 784, 'last_played': 1487113152}

author: {'steamid': '76561198035101495', 'num_games_owned': 769, 'num_reviews': 656, 'playtime_forever': 620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 620, 'last_played': 1487104422}
review:
No doubts this one is best original platformer of 2013, unique puzzles and abilities, engaging and adrenaline rushing fights, beautiful art, mexican theme, story that is fun and serious when it has to be so, a lot of various collectibles, 4 player co-op, soundtrack that is still good after 10 hours of gameplay, difficulty that's right in the middle (nether too easy or frustratingly too hard).

author: {'steamid': '76561198029770392', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1692475075}
review:
Quando primeiro ouvi falar sobre esse jogo foi por um amigo animado me dizendo como esse jogo era muito bom. Bem, pelo nome eu inicialmente julguei e pensei: deve ser mais um daqueles jogos com um tema tentando ser engraçado e na real é horrivel.

Como eu estava errado.

Guacamelee é um dos melhores jogos plataformers que eu já joguei na minha vida. Com um estilo totalmente metroidvania, ele consegue capturar o charme dos jogos antigos na sua jogabilidade e controle de personagem impecaveis, artes lindas e uma dificuldade impressionantemente frustrante certos momentos do jogo.
O jogo tem uma variedade de movimentos diferentes que não servem apenas para usar no combate, mas que combinados também são essenciais para passar no plataforming.

Jogo muito bom que conseguiu alcançar a lista dos top 10 melhores jogos que já joguei.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963627405', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1486579816}
review:
Why must these new age games be so dumbed down?

Every secret or progression point i encountered was highlighted or in a different tile color, making it super obvious that you have to use your abilities to proceed. 

If you are looking for an old school metroid feeling of exploration and uncovering secrets, look for other games like Axiom Verge.

Got bored after 1,6 hours.

Otherwise great game if you like straight forward button mash. I got it on 70% sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262329408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1468804842}
review:
I love fighting games! I love them too much. Heck, I don't even like video games that much, honestly. Fighting games are usually the only games I play... but Steam sales. Oh, Steam sales. Lord Gabe gave Guacamelee a price of one... little... dollar... and a few cents. So, I picked it up because... Steam sales. All I can say is that it is alright. Not something I'll come back to, as there are way too many fighting games out there. They're all waiting to be mastered. I can't get myself to play this again for fun!

Sans has stole the president's daughter and now it is up to you, Zangief, to save the daughter for mutha russia. Yeah, I don't pay attension to stories of video games. I mean, if I did, then Street Fighter would I confused me so much... 

Anyway, this is a fun beat'em up with lots of platforming and combat. The combat is satisfing and there is plenty of enemy varity. The enemies are never unfair, just challenging and tough in numbers. 

Combos are REALLY satisfing in this game. They are performed by using all of your unique attacks in anyway you want. This game feels like playing 3.0 PM Mewtwo or Melee Fox in turbo mode. YOU'RE UNSTOPPABLE! Want to cancel shoryuken into headbutt? Feel free to. The best part is you can upgrade your abilities to wombo combo your enemies even more. You can upgrade your stamina bar to cancel into more special moves in a combo. Want to add a belly flop into that uppercut head combo? BOOM! You can now once you get the upgrades. It is easy and VERY satisfing to come up with a long combo yourself out of moves that you didn't even consider that useful in a fight. It is so tasty to try all your combos against unique opponents who require different methods of comboing. 

Heck, battles don't feel like they come often! Your mostly platforming, fighting bosses, and reading or seeing a bunch of video game/culture references. Bust it Bill: The black, angry Ralph. A wood sign that resembles Cactuar. Using an axe to cut down a bridge that a monster tries to cross to kill you to then be told your princess is in another castle. However, these jokes can be very corny at times when ALL of the games you play pretty much constantly make these references. This game does but a lot of twist on these classic references to other games, but not enough to not come across as corny. But that could be just me. A lot of people love these random references for some reason...

Great game! Pick it up for prices anywhere below 30 dollars. Except if you are me and you have too many fighting games to play. In that case, buy it if it is... a dollar. 7.5/10, above average.


PLEASE TAKE NOTE THAT I GOT THIS GAME FOR A DOLLAR.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263130832', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1531515584}
review:
The golden age of metroidvania revitalised 

This game hits all the right notes of the metroidvania subgenre while introducing its own unique mechanics and style. The arcade-style beat-em-up combat is excellent, the art style is cool and evocative of traditional Mexican culture, and the platforming is challenging yet fair. My only complaint is that the humour seems hit-or-miss and sometimes totally out of place. Possibly the best modern 2d platformer, I reccomend this to any fan of super Metroid or Castlevania: SOTN or any fan of platform games in general

review: Jeu de plateforme et combat très agréable. On rigole, on s'amuse, la difficulté est bien dosé. Des quêtes secondaires sympathiques (mais trop peu nombreuses malheureusement) sont présentes. Des défis (rallongeant la durée de vie de manière tres importante) nous sont offert. Beau, avec des pouvoirs originaux. Ce jeu vaut le coup ( de plus il n'est pas trop cher).

author: {'steamid': '76561198046311355', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1625344384}
review:
A defined and fascinating artsyle in two different worlds, that you can flip to on the fly, combined with easy to pick up and play gameplay highlight the brilliance of Guacamelee. Drinkbox really branches out with this game from the Blob games, which were great in their own right if more simplistic.

Guacamelee has personality to spare, engaging and true metroidvania gameplay, and never really outstays its welcome. If you are at all interested in the artstyle that alone is enough to play. This one is a beauty, and I really enjoy being able to switch to the dead world when I want to. It is worth it to see this in 4K. Its mechanics are all sound as well to my liking, and quite honestly the theme and tone are so creative and unique I cannot imagine metroidvania fan wanting to miss this.

Challenge can be basically chosen by the player as there are a variety of skins you can unlock. I love playing with the fragile character that gains more money. It makes the game about a perfect difficulty, and much more akin to something like Ori. And it's up there with that game too.

The writing can grate at times, but in general it's pretty cool and even funny. The Spanish language background to everything is glorious. The traditional upgrades and RPG elements round out an impressive package that was heavily upgraded itself from the Gold edition released before it. Extra levels and additions complement beautiful art and elements of Mexican culture.

At 4K with some injected SMAA along with the in-game AA you basically have very few jaggies. Looks better on PC than PS4 this way for sure. Outstanding game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999339775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1484104542}
review: Combine the satisfying, exploration-heavy platforming of Metroid with the fluid and forgiving combat of Smash Bros, and you have the foundation of Guacamelee. Add to this how faithful the developers are to Mexican culture, and you have yourself a charming and colorful game. The memes within Guacamelee will date fast, but I was impressed with how the game still managed to engage me outside of the gameplay. It feels as if they were added as a safety net, but Drinkbox makes it pretty clear that they don't need to fall back on pop culture references to create a captivating world. Not quite Grim Fandango, but surprisingly close. One last thing worth noting; if you feel the game could've ended on a better note, keep playing. You'll find some great closure if you do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198226846980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1439, 'last_played': 1502157522}
review:
This game is a gem, a pleasure to play through, with hidden wit everywhere and great challenging gameplay. While the story is not very long, It was good enough that I wanted to complete it 100%, which ended up being a reasonable challenge. I like that the acheivements are actually attainable unlike some games that would amount to "kill 1,000,000,000 skeletons." I enjoyed it immensely and would recommend it to any one who:

- likes a bit of a challenge
- enjoys small details (there's so many small details and references that make the game amazing)
- likes destroying everything
- has a sense of humor
- likes to complete things 100%

I would not recommend it to anyone who:

- doesn't like having to figure things out on their own
- only plays a game until they "beat it" (meaning the final boss)
- doesn't get much out of decimating barrels and skeletons

author: {'steamid': '76561198044010520', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 806, 'last_played': 1483391286}
review:
This little indie game of 2013 is a pearl on it's own.

Following the Metroidvania genre, this game is about rescuing a girl while punching skeletons (and some other things) luchador style. In order to progress, you'll learn a bunch of moves that help you navigate the world (a shoryuken to get some height, a ground pound, etc...). Each move can break one type of blocks and while those moves is good for traveling, they works really great for fighting as well.

While the game is mostly inspired by the mexican culture (from the design of the characters and background to the music), you'll find tons of references to other video games franchises. For an indie game, this is some of the smoothest animation I've seen of a 2D game, no movement feel clunky or out of place. Sadly, the different area are a little too cliche and don't expect a deep story, it's about the same level as a Mario game.

The game is filled with collectibles and optional challenges. The difficulty is well balanced (while the beginning seem quite easy, some enemies become tricky to fight and the platforming tight. If it's still too easy for you, you unlock hard mode once you beat the game (basically, enemies has double hp and inflict double damage). The game isn't that long but if you try to 100% it, it'll take some time (it took me ~10h to get all but one achievement : beating the game in hard mode)

You can play local coop in this game to make thing more crazy. There is even a workshop to download custom skins, without altering the gameplay. The sad thing is that the community isn't very active and there isn't that many skins to download (97 for the gold edition, 52 for this one).

Speaking of editions, on PC you can chose between 2 editions : The gold edition and the Super Turbo Championship edition. 
The gold edition is the base game, a port of the original from PS3/Vita.
The STC edition is a tweaked base game with tons of stuff added (new abilities, enemies, areas, etc ...)
Since the price of the STC is just 1€ more than the gold edition, there is no real point to get the gold edition (unless you REALLY want those extra custom skins)

Overall, a really solid game, not that ambitious but with very few flaws. I still would recommand to wait 'till it's on sale though (it dropped below 5€ this last winter sale).

author: {'steamid': '76561198139708079', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1575098130}

author: {'steamid': '76561198032632811', 'num_games_owned': 888, 'num_reviews': 756, 'playtime_forever': 455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 455, 'last_played': 1483578321}
review:
Decently enjoyable Metroidvania that loves to throw all sorts of aggressive video games references at you.
Revisiting this title sometime after playing the “Gold Edition” and found both enjoyment with and frustration towards similar aspects of the game through both playthroughs. However, I suppose that ‘Super Turbo Championship Edition’ as a tad easier due to adding the Super Meter and perhaps just getting better with time. There is still the insane challenge secrets if you’re looking for some tough stuff to get mad at.

Dislikes:
The, well, Special Moves with the B button usually have a lot of lag on them making some platforming delayed and janky. I get that for combos it’s supposed to feel good when you cancel into them but 
I love references to other games within games but, especially in the town area, it’s a bit much. Keep the references as easter-eggs or subtle things. Don’t just make the power-ups statues straight up Chozo.
Backtracking feels sluggish, there is a sort of dash but requires a wall and a straight shot. There’s a lot of open and straight planes that take a while to traverse with you want to check a lego block that you haven’t smashed yet.

Disclaimer:
[Game playable with four friends. Will make you feel lonely if finished by yourself.]

Basically:
Take it or leave it, it’s not a bad game. Buy it if you like Metroidvanias, have friends around and have some extra cash to spend. Don’t go for 100% unless you have ballz of steel.

Note to self: Lol, review for Gold Edition was very salty. My B.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081259348', 'num_games_owned': 3442, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1223, 'last_played': 1602792579}
review:
If Nacho Libre was a platformer
Funny without being corny
Beautiful artstyle
Cool story
Casual but challenging
Easy backtracking for reaccessing once hidden areas
Mexican Puns
10/10

Edit: finally got all the orbs, now I'm trying to get 100% completion. I stand by my 10/10 rating. Best platformer I've ever played. Perfect balance between difficulty and abundance of save points. You can finish the game with a moderate amount of difficulty or you can be a completionist and get your ass handed to you for a while. However, this isn't one of those poorly made platformers with bad contact detection (or whatever they call it), if you screwed up it's on you. But all puzzles are doable, they all have a strategy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144005088', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 698, 'last_played': 1482455844}
review:
Beat 'em up and metroidvania combined? This game makes it work better than you'd think. The moves are integrated seamlessly for both combat and platforming, especially the red and blue moves. And it's actually a good thing that it gets easier to get upgrades as you gain abilities even though they were accessible with an earlier ability. You'll be thankful, as this game goes from somewhat easy but not too easy early on to downright brutal in the later levels, though thankfully not too much harder between any two succeeding levels. Sadly, I lack the raw skill to take down what seems to be the final boss[spoiler]'s true form[/spoiler], though it's still apparent, as it was when I struggled on earlier bosses and level segments, that it really is my own skill keeping me from winning, and it was my own skill that carried me to victory up until now.

The plot and villains are nothing to write home about, but they're still lovable and entertaining and, importantly, carry the excellent gameplay.

The Mexican style is a nice touch, though sadly the style of music is not to my liking (and the boss music especially doesn't sound much like boss music), but I'm being more fair to this game because of that.

So, overall, if you want either a beat 'em up or a metroidvania and can tolerate the other, especially if you'd appreciate both together, this game is for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198320092347', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1505008395}
review:
Un verdadero juego de plataformas...

Muchos años han pasado desde que un gran jefe, se convirtierea en un SEÑOR jefe, la juagabilidad es esquisita, y durante todo el juego esta bien diseñada la manera de aprenderla y dominarla, combinado con sus casi nada discretos guiños se vuelve un verdadero juego de plataformas con ese toque sandbox que es necesario para ser una aventura no epica si no intensamente epica, (quienes lo haya jugado entedera el juego de palabras), la estetica es si duda brillante, la musica esta a punto y los chistes pasados de la linea infantil a el humor adulto equilibran de manera interesante el juego.

Bien si este juego sin duda tiene el potencial para volverse una joya, la falta de INTENSO en su historia tanto principal como de las secundarias (mas claro en las secuandaria), no lo vuelven malo al contratio, pero nos deja ese sabor de queres mas, de saber que se pudo explotar esas historias a su maximo potencial.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006768995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 665, 'last_played': 1481797367}
review:
Es geht um HÜhner.

Einleitung:
Guacameleea ist ein Mix aus Plattformer, Metroid-Prime, Double Dragon und viel Hommage an bekannte Spieletitel. Ich wollte es zuerst aufgrund der Koopfähigkeit kaufen, hatte aber dann keine kompetenten Mitstreiter gefunden, bzw. überhaupt jemand, der gerne diese Art von Spiel mit mir spielen wollte. 
So unscheinbar es am Anfang auf mich wirkte, sodass ich nach zwei drei längeren Spielesessions die Lust verlor, so hat es daraufhin irgendwann diesen süßlich schweren aromatische Geschmack wie Club Mate entwickelt, der zwar anfangs befremdlich doch dann immer angenehmer wird, bis man schließlich immer wieder gerne davon nippt.

Geschichte:
Man(n) ist Juan, ein Luchador, naja, erst mal ein Junge vom Felde, der dabei zusieht, wie die Tochter des Bürgermeisters entführt wird und nun darauf aus ist, sie zu retten.
Sein Gegenspieler ist Calaca und seine Untergebenen, die alle ihren eigenen Charme versprühen und zu den guten Bosskämpfen gehören, die das Spiel zu bieten hat. Der Humor kommt dabei nie zu kurz, auch wenn mein einglisches Vokabular nicht ausreicht, um alle Verweise 100% zu verstehen.

Spielstil:
Das Spiel ist ein Beat-Em-Up, in dem man von Areal zu Areal wechselt und dort Gegner mit Kombination (Juggling) Würfen und Spezialattacken vemöbelt. Hinzu kommt die Fähigkeit noch auszuweichen, was seinen sehr angenehmen Spielfluss ermöglicht und man gerne auf den Zähler in der linken oberen Ecke schaut, wie viele Treffer man verteilt hat, bevor man selbst getroffen wurde. 
Dabei setzt das Spiel gekonnt auch auf Pausen innerhalb der Ausführung einer Animation, sodass man Angriffe sehr gut aneinanderreihen kann, ohne das Gespür eines Street Fighter Profis besitzen zu müssen. 
Neben den Kämpfen kommen ganz viele Hüpfpassagen ins Spiel. Die sind dabei so großartig und frustierend, aber schaffbar ausgearbeitet, dass diese mir bisher mit am meisten Freude bereitet haben. Wer Rayman Legends gespielt hat und die Herausforderungen mochte, wird auch hier seine Freude haben.
Zu den Richtungen kommt übrigens noch eine weitere Dimension, die man beachten muss, wenn man solche Passagen erfolgreich schaffen möchte. Wer Giana Sisters gespielt hat, weiß, was ich meine. 

Zu diesem kommt das Finden weiterer Fähigkeiten, die wie bei Metroid andere Wege freischalten können.

Grafik
Das Spiel ist konsequent in einem Stil gehalten und der ist angenehm für die Augen, auch wenn manchmal die Charaktermodelle klein wirken. Dafür hat man wiederrum mehr Überblick über die ganze Situation, was bei einer Massenprügelei auch von Nöten ist. 
Das Spiel geizt dabei nicht an Farben, ist aber auch nicht überladen und behält diesen mexikanischen Flair bei.

Sound
Es gibt leider keine Sprachausgabe, aber die Hintergrundmelodie ist sehr unterstützend für die ganze Atmosphäre, sodass man sich selbst fast ein Sombrero aufsetzen möchte um dann getreu die Musik mitzusummen. 

Fazit
Guacamelee macht alles richtig. Es ist nicht zu lang, hat keine unnötigen Strecken, hält sich mit unnötigen Nebenquest zurück und bietet ein gutes Kampfsystem, gute Charaktere, viele Anpassungsmöglichkeiten, Hühner und das für einen ordentlichen Preis

author: {'steamid': '76561198000003530', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1481741876}

Bald kommt man zu einem Turm indem man Aufgaben abschließen soll die 
durch die teilweise komische Steuerung einfach nur ankotzen und deshalb fast unmöglich sind zu lösen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139249783', 'num_games_owned': 453, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1106, 'last_played': 1480814414}
review:
Homenaje a los grandes juegos de la historia, jugabilidad esquisita y mapeado increíblemente elaborado. 
La historia es simple, pero entretiende y los diálogos asímismo son muy divertidos. Es altamente rejugable, ya que a medida que vas adquiriendo poderes, puedes descrubir nuevas zonas y secretos.

Uno de los mejores indies "metroidvania" que he jugado últimamente.

Como pega, diría que sus creadores han lanzado tantas versiones que cuesta saber cual es la verdaderamente completa.

NOTA: 8,5

author: {'steamid': '76561198017056908', 'num_games_owned': 4175, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1481851173}
review: I recommend this game, but it can be very frustrating wtih some of the jumping puzzles and theres about a billion of them in the game. It gets a little easier as you go along because you get movement related abilities but even then it can be a headache. The combats pretty fun, the artstyles great and the story is okay, nothing amazing but okay. All in all its a good game and if you can get it at a good price pick it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041545450', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1376, 'last_played': 1590091304}
review: Uno de los mejores Metroidvanias que existen; divertido, desafiante, con un humor gamberro y lleno de referencias a otros videojuegos, además de muchos secretos y extras que lo hacen un juego excelente. Ya seas asiduo del género o quieras iniciarte es una compra segura.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158899342', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 190, 'playtime_forever': 492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1584283267}
review: Yo creia que este juego iba a ser bastante mediocre y que las criticas eran benevolentes pero al jugarlo cambie de opinion. El juego es uno estilo Metroid con muchas plataformas y mecanicas de lucha bien implementadas. El protagonista cuenta con muchisimos poderes que son usados tanto para derrotar enemigos como para avanzar por los laberinticos niveles. Yo lo recomiendo ya que es realmente entretenido y desafiante cuando se lo propone. 100% recomendado

author: {'steamid': '76561198200182527', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 575, 'last_played': 1483479467}
review:
Cara, sensacional, é quase impossível acreditar que é um jogo indie.
É um EXCELENTE jogo, com ótimos visuais, uma ótima trilha sonora, tem uma diversidade IMENSA de poderes e combos, sem contar que se você souber, pode combinar cada um deles de maneira sensacional.
No teclado, você com certeza não vai ter a mesma experiência do que jogando no controle, pois o suporte pro controle é BEM maior. Porém, dá pra jogar até com 4 JOGADORES, e pra isso, dependendo do seu PC, com certeza o teclado será necessário.
A dificuldade do jogo é um ponto interessante á ser analisado, pois se o jogo percebe que você está muito á frente da dificuldade do jogo, ele te propõe á ativar o HARD MODE (que também da pra ativar fazendo um cheatzinho, uma combinação de teclas, nada demais), que é sério, NÃO ATIVE, a menos que queira mostrar pros seus amigos quem é que manda na parada.
*O jogo também possui diálogos excepcionais e super maneiros, sem contar que a maioria deles contém referências a jogos e filmes famosos.
*[i] Guacamelee! SUPER TURBO CHAMPIONSHIP EDITION [/i] me cativou tanto, que desque quando comecei a jogar, não consigo parar, tanto que nem coloquei o drop de cartas nele, peguei todas as cartas com tempo de jogo.
*No começo do game, não senti tanto a falta de um multiplayer online, mas agora percebi que seria PERFEITO um multiplayer online no guacamelee.
*O jogo não se torna repetitivo hora nenhuma.
[h1] [b] 9/10 (devido a falta de um multiplayer online) [/b] [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198025273882', 'num_games_owned': 2212, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1473, 'last_played': 1465466954}
review:
Очень хорошая метроидвания. Берёт лучшее что есть в жанре, но не копирует, а творчески перерабатывает. 
[list]
[*]Вместо прокачки - улучшения в магазине. 
[*]Вместо эквипа - костюмы. 
[*]Вместо замка, убийцы вампиров и мертвецов - открытые локации, лучадор и-и-и... мертвецы.
[/list]
Очень приятная графика и весьма доставляющий саундтрек.
Секреты, головоломки и опциональный контент прилагаются.

[b]10/10[/b]
Серьёзно.

[spoiler]И никаких ссаных пикселей.[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561197993293074', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1841, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1413, 'last_played': 1504171299}
review: Fantastic Metroidvania with a awesome fighting game mechanics...

author: {'steamid': '76561198312578330', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2055, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 609, 'last_played': 1510414228}
review:
I must admit, I wanted it out of curiosity in the beginning, but I couldn't expect how much fun it could actually be.

The fighting system feels fast, responsive, and with a lot of potential for combos, and juggling enemies in the air. Each move you have has a specific purpose and is clearly differentiated from the others, creating a small yet varied set of tools at your disposal. Yet one can't help but think that a couple more moves wpuld help make battles more varied and interesting. The tactical side of things, later on with the addition of shielded and alternate dimension enemies you can't just  take them all on at once, you have to be more methodical, to decide which targets are a priority, which should be knocked down for later. 

The game can be pretty tactical, yet not so much so as to become slow or unenjoyable. The game doesn't ask you to make big plans about each fight, but to assess the situation and make on-the-fly choices to defeat you enemies in the most efficient, safe, fashion. And that makes it actually rather enjoyable. 

Unfortunately, however, the difficulty from battles comes more from the ammount of enemies rather than the individual enemies themselves. They never really feel dangerous on their own right, all of them being rather slow and having pretty big tells for when they're going to attack, making it easy to avoid them. Instead, the danger comes from having to keep track of a lot of enemies at once. Yet, at the same time, it makes sense, since it helps keep the flow of the game, whereas single, difficult enemies might make it slower. Overall, the combat is good and has quite a lot of potential

The art style is indeed pleasing to the eye, it looks really colourful yet clean and simple. It's nice to look at and adds character to the game, it works with it, whereas a more realistic approach, at least in my opinion wouldn't have been half as charming

However, one thing the game does suffer from, is it's really short length. I finished the campaign in about ten hours, and I really took my time and 100%'d it. And while it's true that it's better to not overstay your welcome and instead leave a good memory, I'd say Guacamelee!, however, left too early, leaving you wanting more but without much else to do, as the game doesn't really have much in the way of post-game content, other than the El Infierno and Caverna del Pollo challenges. Granted the game does have a good ammount of exploration to do to get all the secrets, it rather goes by fast

Another small problem the game has, is it's lack of online co-op capabilities. While it's understanable that it could cause a lot of problems and frustration with an uncoodinated group, it would also be great fun when it worked. It would be a really nice feature to have when your friends aren't available for some Luchador action.

As I have rambled a lot, and with purpose of making the list more approachable, I'll include a list of pros and cons:

Pros:

+Very solid and entertaining fighting style that doesn't get old
+Well differentiated moveset where every move has its clear purpose
+Lots of enemies that make for varied encounters and strategies to beat them
+Colourful and clean artstyle that adds charm to the game and has just enough ammount of detail to not feel boring
+The enemies, thanks to the art style are inmediately recognizable, and thus you are rarely confused about what you should do
+A good amount of costumes, with their own effects, that allow even more variety in your battles, and in my opinion, look pretty nice
+Chickens

Cons:

-The game suffers from a really short length, leaving you wanting more with no real way to ease that craving
-Not much in the way of post-game content. It's a small game
-The movelist, although differentiated, is rather small. It could have done with some more moves
-The platforming requires good eye-hand coordination late-game. Can become frustrating if you have poor reflexes
-A little too heavy on the memes
-No online multiplayer support

The game, overall, is really good and I enjoyed it inmensely. I'm also impressed in how well the extra areas are included in the game, I didn't know they were add-ons until I looked them up due to how well integrated they are. The only real complain I have about the game is the short lenght. It's a small game, but a really good one. I would definitely recommend it

author: {'steamid': '76561198064598898', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 806, 'last_played': 1480455684}
review: Always wanna be a luchador? This game gives you the posibility to punch, uppercut and dive on your opponent in a mexican , colourful and over-the-top action flavoroud way. It combines strong game mechanics known from beat-em-ups like smash and 2D/vania defined platformers. Also the text-based story is well written and at times funny.(grumpy grandpa goat guy thumps up ). Just get this game,  its definitely worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069953343', 'num_games_owned': 1128, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1249, 'last_played': 1433074607}

author: {'steamid': '76561198130669271', 'num_games_owned': 290, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 763, 'last_played': 1480371329}
review:
Bez zbędnego pitolniea!
Szybkie akcje, serie ciosów, akrobatyczne wywijasy wykręcające palce, świetnie stworzeni bohaterowie, w tym tona czadowego humoru. 

Kolory, światełka, skoki, prawe sierpowe i zapaśnicze rzuty. To wszystko mocno skąpane w meksykańskiej kulturze i świecie południowo-amerykańskich duchów. A na koniec kasta wojowników o kolorowych maskach z Lucha Libre, których nigdy nie zdejmują - OTO GUACAMELEE!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198123215917', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3319, 'last_played': 1677073417}
review:
Graphiquement trés joli façon cartoon, guacamelee offre un beau challenge, même en difficulté normale.
La progression est assez linéaire avec des powerups permettant d'avancer plus loin dans le jeu.
Les coups sont assez différents les uns des autres et on se prend rapidement à exécuter des combos pour le plaisir.
L'humour est présent et agréable.

Le seul point négatif est la difficulté à obtenir tous les achievements.

Pour conclure, une trés bonne surprise qui m'a tenu en jeu une bonne cinquantaine d'heures et auquel je rejoue de temps à autre en co-op.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139856813', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 624, 'last_played': 1676574327}
review:
Guacamelee je opravdu výborná hra. Krásně namalovaná, se super soundtrackem a se zajímavým zasazením do (s největší pravděpodobností) Jižní Ameriky. 
Začínáte jako místní pekař, který se připravuje na jakousi slavnost, při které má přijet prezidentova krásná dcera. S tou se znáte, jako děti jste si spolu hráli. Ale jako v každé hře, nic netrvá věčně a radost ze shledání není moc dlouhá, kráska je unesena zlým kostlivcem a vy ji chcete zpět. Díky kouzelné masce se z vás stává Luchador a vy začínáte trestnou výpravu proti všem kostěným obludám  v okolí, zabíjíte nepřátele po desítkách, kupujete si speciální oblečení, které má vše plusy a minusy, čímž vás vede k určitému vyhranění herního stylu. Nepřátelé (a hlavně bossové) jsou různorodí a nikdy nevíte, s čím přijdou. Hra je sama o sobě těžká, a ještě k tomu se na klávesnici ovládá dost špatně, doporučuji gamepad. Nechci vám toho moc spoilovat, ale bude stačit to, že jsem hru nominoval do kategorie "NEBREČÍM, MÁM JEN NĚCO V OKU" 
[spoiler] Ano, prezidentova dcera, vaše jediná láska, umře, ale vy ještě před tím stíhnete zabít zmetka, který zabil ji 	[/spoiler]
9/10
+grafika
+příběh
+komba
+hádanky
+kozí dědek - učitel
+zajímavý nápad
+přeměna v kuře

-obtížnost
-ovladatelnost na klávesnici

author: {'steamid': '76561198025290431', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 937, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 937, 'last_played': 1451930556}
review:
A Metroid inspired game with a creative world design and solid controls. There are multiple abilities that are gained throughout the game to allow the player to progress to areas they could not previously, as well as the option to upgrade your character, and purchase/unlock costumes. The game also offers interesting challenges outside of the main storyline. 

The characters, story and game environments are all vibrant and charming; this is something that really brings the game to life and gives it a lot of personality. Overall it’s a wonderful game and I had a blast playing it. I'd recommend it to anyone who has enjoyed playing a Metroidvania styled game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999904270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1700, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1700, 'last_played': 1451529691}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007307051', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 899, 'last_played': 1506366596}
review:
Ganz klares Plus ist der großartige Humor samt verschiedensten Referenzen an die Popkultur. Allein dafür hätte sich das Spiel bereits gelohnt. Aber auch der angenehme Comicstil und das Theme passen toll ins Bild eines Spiels, das sich selbst nicht ganz ernst nimmt. Dabei ist die Verteilung von Kampf- und Geschicklichkeitsaufgaben gut gewählt - man fühlt sich dauerhaft immer wieder gefordert.
Mehr Spielspaß hat man meiner Meinung nach übrigens mit dem Gamepad und natürlich bestenfalls auch einem zweiten Mitspieler. So hat es bei uns schon einige WG Abende bereichert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028312880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 631, 'last_played': 1516048359}
review: Além desse jogo ser super divertido e colorido, ele ainda apresenta aspectos da cultura mexicana, mais especificamente na "Festa del muetos" (que no Brasil é o dia de finados), em que, diferente de outras partes do mundo, os mortos são relembrados com muita festa, cores e caveiras e os famosos Altares dedicados aos mortos( que no jogo serve para salvar a fase em que esta). Apresenta ainda musicas no estilo mexicano (labucaracha) entre outras coisas.

review: Me parece un indie super refrescante basado en el folclore y cultura mexicanos, aunque con estereotipos el juego es muy divertido. La mecanica es hack an slash y plataformas con algún rompecabezas. La paleta de colores que usa el juego lo hace muy llamativo, llegando a ser bonito. Los controles van desde lo básico cuando empiezas hasta un gran número de combinaciones una vez has avanazado. Lo recomiendo 100%!.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966429024', 'num_games_owned': 468, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1042, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1561831008}
review:
So, what if instead of a sexy blond babe in power armor, you were a mustachio'd luchador? And what if instead of blasting energy-sucking amoeba, you piledrive skellingtons into the ground? That's basically Guacamelee, a metroidvania with a healthy helping of spicy hot salsa.

Ok, so it's got the Mexican flavour gimmick. What else? How about those supertight controls for that unusually deep combat system for this type of game? Fabulous lucha action in well though-out levels? A surprisingly nice story with memorable characters? Maybe some excellent audiovisual design with a toe-tapping soundtrack? A sense of humor and plenty of Easter Eggs? Split Screen co/op? Chickens?

This game is a champ and probably one of the best metroidvania available on pc.

I rate this game 5 out of 5 bananas.

What my ratings mean:
1 bananas - Crap. Turn around & don’t look back.
2 bananas - Bad. Not really worth it.
3 bananas - Average. For fans of the genre or a sale.
4 bananas - Good. Won't waste your time.
5 bananas - Superb. A definite must-play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122873080', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2077, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 685, 'last_played': 1529682290}
review:
I only played this version of the game, so i can't say anything about whether it's better than Gold edition or not...

But it's a very very well executed game. Everything fits together. The mechanics are well integrated and there is just the right amount of checkpoints and difficulty

And also, although you wouldn't expect it from a game like this: It has a story. The ending is the best ending i have ever seen... i think a tear fell from my eye.

Also: References. Lots and lots of references. Keep an eye on the first boss ;) you'll get it

If you're even remotely interested I assure you, this game is better than you expect it to be

author: {'steamid': '76561198255030790', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1323, 'last_played': 1606280467}
review:
Totalmente recomendado, visualmente es una joya, las animaciones, las paletas de colores, los diseños de personajes y escenarios están integrados en un todo que te absorbe rápidamente, sumando una buena banda sonora y un sentido del humor muy efectivo, el juego esta garantizado para desafiarte y hacerte reír una y otra vez.
Tiene un gran sistema de combate, va diversificándose y se mantiene fresco a lo largo del juego, aunque los enemigos se repiten una y otra vez, se disfruta cada pelea.
Los niveles están llenos de secretos y caminos a los que no se puede acceder en un solo recorrido, si eres de los que gusta sacarle el 100% a un juego esto es para ti.
Las plataformas son muy divertidas y pueden llegar a ser muy desafiantes, aunque el juego es muy benevolente al momento de 'fallar' un escenario o perder una pelea, los checkpoints están ampliamente distribuidos en los escenarios y si fallas alguna de las plataformas el juego rápidamente te reposiciona para otra oportunidad sin ninguna clase de castigo.
-PROS
+Excelentes gráficos, animación y banda sonora.
+Hermoso diseño de niveles y plataformas.
+Modo de combate amplio y fresco con gran número de habilidades a descubrir y utilizar.
+Gran jugabilidad con insuperable programación para jugar tanto con controlador como con teclado.
+Modo Multijugador
+Gran valor de re-jugabilidad.
+Divertido, lleno de referencias y tributos a los grandes videojuegos de las primeras generaciones.
-CONTRAS
-No tiene penalidades ni sistema de derrota.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109561147', 'num_games_owned': 1279, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 934, 'last_played': 1697577819}

review: This is the best platformer I've ever played, and I am not forgetting the Mario games. author: {'steamid': '76561197962958113', 'num_games_owned': 567, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1775, 'last_played': 1446928896}
review:
Moi qui pensais que tout avait été fait dans les jeux de plate-forme, j'ai pris une belle claque en découvrant Guacamelee.
La réalisation de ce jeu est superbe jusque dans les moindres détails.

- Les graphismes colorés tout d'abord, et ce style graphique si particulier.
- La jouabilité impeccable, les commandes répondant au quart de poil (manette Xbox très fortement conseillée). Les actions s'enchainent à un rythme d'une fluidité déconcertante.
- Le gameplay qui introduit de nouvelles possibilités d'actions à mesure du jeu, permettant de bien maitriser les acquis avant l'aller plus loin, et offrant d'avantage de combos à chaque "déblocage" d'une nouvelle manip.
- La difficulté bien dosée. Terminer le jeu reste assez simple, accéder à la bonne fin demande plus d'acharnement. Pour ceux qui veulent s'acharner à récupérer tous les items, il y a du défi. Et le mode difficile porte vraiment bien son nom.
- La musique exceptionnelle, complètement dans le ton. Une mention spéciale au Boss Theme.
- Le rythme, qui alterne correctement les phases de castagne, de plate-forme, et recherche et de dialogue.
- L'humour, du gros LOL en perspective à des moments souvent inattendus. Le titre annonce un peu la couleur.
- Les références geek, le jeu fourmille de détails, de références vidéoludiques, et autres QR-codes. La encore, le "SUper Turbo Chanpionship Edition" du titre est évocateur.
- Le multi sur le même écran, pas testé mais a le mérite d'être présent. Peut constituer une aide précieuse pour venir à bout du mode difficile.
- La capital sympathie, basé sur l'ensemble des critères ci-dessus, au top car on ne s'ennuie jamais.

En bref, une excellente surprise que je recommande plus chaudement que des enchiladas sortant du four !

author: {'steamid': '76561197970117795', 'num_games_owned': 501, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 821, 'last_played': 1479933336}

author: {'steamid': '76561198022253150', 'num_games_owned': 514, 'num_reviews': 203, 'playtime_forever': 866, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 866, 'last_played': 1478170874}
review:
Pro:
-Fluido e da approccio immediato
-Una bella grafica colorata
-Ottima atmosfera con una colonna sonora immersiva 
-Combat system ben realizzato e molto variegato con tantissime combo a disposizione 
-Enigmi e sfide divertenti da risolvere

Contro:
-Poche missioni secondarie
-Poco o nulla di trama
-Qualche volta potrebbe prendere male i comandi 

In conclusione: Guacamelee è un bel gioco simpatico e veloce che consiglio assolutamente a tutti, perché è il classico gioco da una partitella e via per rilassarsi. Molto divertente e immediato sin dalle prime ore di gioco con un crescendo (in difficoltà, personaggio ecc...) ben organizzato e appagante per certi versi.

Voto:8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198247174736', 'num_games_owned': 1065, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1476245215}
review:
Con poco mas de 6 horas de juego, me atrevo a escribir este analisis para Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition, el cual es el siguiente:

Apartado tecnico:
[list]
[*]Tenemos un cuidado y colorido apartado grafico (tomando en cuenta que es un port de PsVita) escenario vistozo, buena iluminacion, todo se adaptan a lo que desean reflejar.
[*]Una maquina con caracteristicas decente, lo corre sin problemas (no poseeo un pc poderosa pero si lo suficientemente 
capaz de correrlo sin problemas)
[/list]

Historia
[*]Puede escucharse un poco "normalita", cliche e incluso tosca, pero no es así, todo lo contrario; tenemos una histora buena, con buena narrativa, no podemos pedirle mas a este juego.
[*]Los enemigos son algo que tambien se tomaron del folklor Méxicano, como méxicano me alegra que nos tomen en cuenta.
[/list]

Jugabilidad
[list]
[*]La combinacion de ambos mundos (vivos y muertos).
[*]La secuencia de los combos, no es muy dificil adaptarse a ellos, en unos cuantos minutos de práctica, seras todo un experto.
[*] Los poderes que vas ganando confrome pases juegando, es otro plus que mejora tu experiencia de juego.
[/list]

Banda sonora
[list]
[*] La música suena a su ritmo, tiene muy buenos OST que ambienta perfectamente la escena.
[*]No son lo  mejor que puede haber en el juego pero, le funciona perfectamente. 
[/list]

En conclusión, el juego es bueno, tendras unas 10 horas de juego, 20 si quieres sacar todos los logros que tienen en steam, pero esa ya es cuestion de gustos. Recomendada la compra, mas si lo consigues en rebajas, no puedes perdertelo.

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198024992116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1699, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1016, 'last_played': 1636783852}
review:
So from playing both versions of Guacemelee! at 100% achievements, I can give a proper review.

This version of the game has more features and levels than gold edition but this also made the game easier (looking at you intensio). The achievements were cut in haft (so 30 achievements to unlock unlike 60 in gold) and getting costumes with special abilities require silver coins where they are found from completing arenas or chests (by the way Pinata costume doubles any chest, this includes silver chest so you may want to invest into that early).

They remove some stuff like the flashing lights from getting power ups (thank god) and some undodgeable attack that some enemies have. 

Overall, I still have fun and this version supports 4 players instead of 2 apparently! 

I'd recommend this over gold.

Have fun admiring all them references.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027307542', 'num_games_owned': 691, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 446, 'last_played': 1474463366}
review:
I want to love this game way more than I do.
This is by no means a bad game, in fact, it's an extremley good one. While the puzzles are pretty easy and I never thought twice about what to do, even though it's a metroidvania, the combat, level design and overall charm is wonderful. However, I don't think I will ever revisit this game again as the final hour of the game is filled with tedious challenges, awful enemy placement, to the point of entire sections of the game where the most difficult enemies are just packed in, and an atrocious final boss completely soiled the very fun experience I had with this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995246089', 'num_games_owned': 837, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 1416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1386, 'last_played': 1476239131}
review: good but a little too twitchy

author: {'steamid': '76561198084769256', 'num_games_owned': 869, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 1562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1383, 'last_played': 1476009538}
review:
Rapido, divertido y, en algunos puntos, desafiante.

Un metroidvania mas que recomendado en el que encarnaremos a Juan, un luchador mexicano con la misión de salvar el mundo y a su amada (simple y efectivo). Un juego rebosante de guiños, diversión y acción. Con un apartado artistico genial y una banda sonora igual de buena. De su jugabilidad diré que, aunque no jugué con mando, son faciles de aprenderse lo basico y si los dominas (tarea un tanto complicada) puedes hacer combos capaces de derrotar a 20 enemigos en menos de lo que canta un gallo sin que te rocen siquiera. Aunque debe destacarse se duración, ya que solo con 24 horas de juego yo me lo he pasado y he conseguido todos los logros.Pero aun así debo decir que es un gran juego que deberias plantearte comprar muy seriamente si te gustan este tipo de juegos.

Mi opinión? Un juego de 8.5/10. Deberias comprarlo? Si.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011957165', 'num_games_owned': 617, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1000, 'last_played': 1475366349}
review:
Contrairement à la version classique de Guacamelee! 
Cette version super Turbo championship Edition dispose de nouvelles zones et de nouveaux ennemies, et c'est là que commence les problèmes. En effet dans la version normal, cette nouvelle version tout comme sa petite soeur est d'une facilité évidente, quelques heures et essais et le jeu est fini. 
A la différence, la version difficile est hallucinante de stupidité et de difficulté, les nouveaux ennemies se feront une joie de vous empêcher complètement de continuer de jouer. 

Bref, pour la version normal je dis oui, et amis chasseur de succès, pour la version difficile, je vous conseille de jouer avec une vieille manette facilement remplaçable et cassable !

author: {'steamid': '76561198066110348', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 578, 'last_played': 1522507096}
review: Guacamelee es el mejor juego de plataformas que te tocado en muchos años, su historia sencilla graciosa pero brusca, entretenida y rapida. Con respecto a su diseño para mi es genial, muchos colores vivos y originalidad en el mismo, se nota ser un juego mexicano debido al respeto y contacto con los muertos, puedes cambiar a una fase "astral" a gusto para poder pasar ciertos desafios, y por el lado auditivo la música no te aburrira, todo lo contrario. El modo de peleas es una amalgama de juegos, preciso bastante intuitivo, muy entretenido, a medida que vas avanzando por el mapa vas consiguendo nuevos poderes, como un shoryuken o doble salto. A cualquier jugador de metroid, megaman, o cualquier juego arcade sidescroll, le recomendaría mucho este juego, pero la verdad lo recomiendo a todo mundo, no te arrepentiras!

author: {'steamid': '76561198257897302', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1476577570}

review:
A metroidvania style game, but not too hard.
If you want a nice platformer with a feel of exploration, but without having to actually explore that much or go nuts over platforming, this is your game.
Pretty solid in all, good design and graphics, nice soundtrack, polished.
A very good purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157461373', 'num_games_owned': 494, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1139, 'last_played': 1544055517}
review:
QUE.
JOGO.
BOM.

Tem uma história bem curta, mas se buscar completar 100%, dá umas boas 20 horas de exploração e de uma das melhores experiências de Metroidvania que tive nos últimos tempos. Vasculhar tudo e desenhar todos os mapas por capricho se torna muito recompensador no final, que te dá vontade de começar outro save imediatamente pra completar tudo de novo. 
Comandos precisos; temática muito interessante; diálogos bacanas; cenários lindamente desenhados; trilha sonora também; gimmicks; segredos; easter eggs e referências a memes, videogames, filmes e cultura pop... Um dos melhores jogos indies que já tive contato, e o meu atual favorito na minha biblioteca da Steam. 
Se ainda não tiver a versão original, corre e compra logo e sem pensar duas vezes essa Super Turbo Championship Edition. Tem bastante conteúdo adicional, que vão além de uma DLC: Visuais aprimorados; novas áreas; novo boss; roupas que aplicam efeitos além da utilidade estética; o modo "intenso"; três slots para save (no original, tinha somente um); fases retrabalhadas e aprimoradas... É o suficiente pra até quem tem o jogo original possa aproveitar mais que o suficiente dessa nova versão do jogo, que é de fato a definitiva.
No mais, COMPRE.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982386297', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1474492697}
review:
TL;DR Mexican Metroidvania, great action, funny dialogue and characters, rendered in a cartoon style with excellent hat-drops to past and present games (in Tech Mex style ;-) ).

Bought after recommendation from a game design podcast suggested it was a near-perfect Metroidvania and I wished to study the style for potentially creating my own.
Great fun.

Would die at the hands of skeletal death and embark on a "the princess is in the other castle" quest as a reincarnated Lucheros again!

author: {'steamid': '76561198043404278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 790, 'last_played': 1473302345}
review:
Guacamelee is a Metroidvania style game that takes place in Mexico. It has a nice mix of combat, platforming, with clever writing and charming characters.

The story is simple but is interesting and keeps you motivated to play through. You play as Juan, a simple Agave farmer living the simple life and are asked by the church to help set up for the Dia de Los Meurtos celebration. The priest who asked you there also asked the presidents daughter, who is your childhood friend/sweetheart to show up and help as well, and after a touching reunion she asks you to drop by and say hi. That's when Calaca, leader of the dead rises and attacks, kidnapping the Presidents daughter you and killing you (don't worry, you get better). Now you gotta stop Calaca from merging the worlds of living and dead and save your sweetheart. But your princess is probably in another temple.

The gameplay is pretty solid. Combat flows nicely (in a sort of beat'em'up style) and focuses on trying to juggle enemies to keep a combo going. There are only a few times I felt like I got stopped do to something out of my control in combat, but the penalty is minimal (it usually respawns you in the last room) so it wasn't too bad. In terms of the platforming they make full use of every single mechanic in the game, including an uppercut (that you'll use often as an extra jump), a dash (that you'll use to extend your jump or reposition yourself), wall jumps/climbs/boosts, hell even the headbutt that only stalls you in mid air is used for movement. The only complaint I have about combat is sometimes the controls feel a tad clunky, as in I will use an uppercut and nothing will happen.

Music is catchy, and I never felt bored listening to it. Few games have me go "I just want a new songs" so it was nice to see this avoid that, even if the same song plays for extended periods of time.

As a Metroidvania game it suits the genre pretty well, even if a lot of secrets are pretty obvious where they are (I can jump here, I bet there is something there). This is made more apparent by giant colored blocks that stand out so much you could probably see them from a mile away, and they only restrict you from getting there until you have a set ability. There is only one secret I had to search up a guide for and I still don't know how I was supposed to piece it together. [spoiler]You have to press a switch, run 3 screens over to find a now open hole in the ground that is only apparent if you open up the map and has no other indication[/spoiler].

The game isn't too challenging unless you are going for 100%, and even those parts aren't too terribly punishing. Most punishments just send you a couple screens away.

Also if you like references this game has a LOT. We are talking about posters that advertise "Bust-it Bill", main villain quoting Star-Wars... everything you can think of and more is probably referenced here, even simple memes like TF2's "MENTLEGEN?"


Overall Guacamelee is a solid Metroidvania game that makes great use of all the mechanics it gives. The gameplay is smooth, with only a few issues. Definitely suggest it if you are interested in a good Metroidvania game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141182042', 'num_games_owned': 806, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1489096799}
review:
This game is THE Metroidvania game of the 2008+ years. As long as you have a controller to play with it is a good game to learn to speedrun, casual fun, co-op with the girlfriend or just a classic hardcore gaming session.

I have had hours of fun 100%ing this game over and over again. Lots of replay value, all around fun and the fighting as well as platforming are very very satisfying.

Highly reccomended for anyone for any reason. I was hesitant at first because it seemed cheesy but now I'm having trouble finding games that compare to this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198174989667', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1590195187}
review:
Un juego de plataformas muy bueno, recomendado en un 100% bueno para pasar el rato

Pros:
-Está inspirado en la cultura de mi país :3
-Tiene muchas referencias a otros juegos (bastantes diría yo)
-Hay mariachis: v
-Variedad de misiones secundarias
-Puedes ir mejorando las habilidades de tu personaje (comprar trajes)
-Cada que adquieres un nuevo poder te ayuda a ir a una nueva zona
-Buen diseño de senarios
-buenos jefes
-Buena música (es de lo mejor)
-El "mapa" es grande

Contras
-Por defecto viene en inglés (si está basado en México almenos que venga en español por defecto)
-El final no esta tan bueno comparado con el resto del juego

Vale la pena cada peso y cada minuto invertido en este juego :3 cómpralo no lo pienses 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197999004973', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1835, 'last_played': 1473105021}
review:
It's not perfect, but it's a blast.

I got this for free on PS4 a while back, and I had some trouble. I decided to purchase it on sale on Steam, so I could enjoy it with my 360 controller. I didn't put it down for 4 days. As far as the gameplay goes, it's the proper amount of infuriating, as a Metroid/Castlevania clone should be. And make no mistake there; don't even waste your time trying to play this without a controller. 

There is little for wrestling fans here, despite the theme. It does a good job being entertaining, and despite a load of DANK MEMES in the set dressing, the game is relatively unobnoxious in regards to visuals. Although I played through the game as Juanita, the main character is entirely silent, and the 


Expect an 8-hour story and twice that if you are a completionist. Or half that if you're a speedrunner, this game is a speeders dream.

Advice: You'll have to use your GPU Vsync because the in-game VSync cuases awful input lag, and without it, there is a bunch of tearing. However, the game runs great, and I've been playing it for days.

author: {'steamid': '76561198290946251', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1476015689}
review:
This is my first review and english is not my mother language, so take it easy.

Guacamelee is one of the best plataform games i ever played, every time you think that the game have no more to show, it shows a new mechanic that shows you another form of perspective of the scenarios (and the scenarios also have one of the the most beautiful art that i had ever seen ;-;). It also have a lot of back-tracking in a Castlevania map style to got some money, health, stamina and other collectibles, plus the epic boss battle.

PROS:

-Awesome plataform puzzles
-Cool throwing battle system
-Interesting replay
-Co-op multiplayer *-*

CONS:

-The characters could have a voice ;-;

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198031544584', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 2127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 859, 'last_played': 1539685783}
review:
タイトルが某ストリートのファイターなゲームのパロディな通り、
Guacamelee! Gold Editionを無印とするとver1.5といった具合の本作。
GEではお金を使ってパワーアップを購入しないと掴みからの派生技が使えなかったが、
STCEでは最初から使えるようになり、それを前提とした難易度の調整などが入っている。
GEからの魅力はそのままに、STCEでは戦闘中の戦略性や地形を利用した敵の処理など、
様々な追加要素が盛り込まれており正当進化系といえる。

大きな変更点として、比較的序盤からINTENSOというパワーアップ要素が使えるようになった。
ゲージがあるときにこれを発動すると、一定時間攻撃力が爆発的に高まり、
一気に多数の敵を殲滅していくことができる。
使用しなくても普通にクリアは可能だが、ある程度慣れてくると
ここぞという場面でこれを発動し、難敵の集団を一気にノーダメで殲滅するといった
芸当も可能なため爽快感がある。
ただしこの発動中も無敵というわけではなく、攻撃を食らうとダメージは普通に受けるし
敵を倒せないまま効果時間が終わってしまう場合があるため、
いかにダメージを受けないように敵を倒していくか？厄介な敵の動きを
どう止めるか？という戦略性は失われていない。

Hardモードではただ単に敵をぶん殴って倒していれば良いというわけでもなく、
投げの派生技をうまく利用してクラウドコントロールを意識する必要があるなど
テクニカルなプレイングが求められるバランス。

とりあえずGEを1周とSTCEを1周、気に入ったらHardモードをプレイするだけでも
相当楽しめるにも関わらず、たまに80%オフが来る場合があり400円以下で
GE+STCE+サントラが買えてしまうという圧倒的コスパも魅力的。

author: {'steamid': '76561198041996180', 'num_games_owned': 106, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 3386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1136, 'last_played': 1529804064}
review:
Just finished the game 100% and I can say, whoo. That was really fun.

On the plus side, first thing that comes to mind is the gorgeous visuals. The whole game is just a work of art from beginning to end. You can probably tell just looking at the screenshots.
The combat system starts out really simple but ramps up with each new ability you get, where by the end of it you're basically an unstoppable LUCHADOOOOOORE and it feels fantastic. <3
If you're into "mexican" music, the soundtrack's pretty damned good too. The one song I didn't enjoy was for the Canal area.
Lastly, ff, the characters are really neat. I love the flame headed alcoholic guy. I actually felt bad after taking him and a few of the others out.
Downsides? I'd say the story feels a little hastily written. Not much there but it works. Kinda like the old school "Princess peach has been kidnapped, gotta go save her" sorta dealio. That and sometimes the challenge is absurdly difficult. I'm looking at you, Sierra mask piece. FUCK YOU.

If I were to rate it, I'd give it like an 8.5/10. Lots to love.
If you like it, also check out Ori and the Blind Forest, very similar feel to it, just with a different theme.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138470437', 'num_games_owned': 5357, 'num_reviews': 272, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1484576752}
