author: {'steamid': '76561198024629128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 969, 'last_played': 1550166298}
review: Great game. I would recommend this to anyone that likes metroidvania. However, I do have a gripe with the responsiveness of the input. When inputting the button press of what would be the B(X360) or O(Sony), the system sometimes fails to perform the move I am asking of it. I have tested with a microsoft brand 360 controller, a ds4 and a razer controller. It is unfortunate that I had this problem. It has made certain secret platforming sections much more difficult than it needs to be. I doubt that many others have had this, and I haven't seen anything in particular about this when googling. I still fully recommend this, even at the full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102399227', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1493463527}
review:
An indie game at its finest.

I bought Super Turbo Championship Edition even though I already had the original Guacamelee! and to be honest I didn't even notice any significant difference gameplay-wise. There's been quite a time gap between I played both version, so I was unable to notice anything. But, bro - we're on Steam so I ain't even mad as I got both for pennies.

The theme grabs handfulls from Mexican folklore and is decorating it with lots of humor, which makes the game fun for everyone. Graphics are nice, colourfull, swift and slick with smooth animation.  A cool mexican-themed soundtrack is playing in the background and I discovered it is ear-catchy enough, that developers decided to release the soundtrack separately (available on Steam).

Doesn't matter what version you're playing - Gold or STCE, it's a very solid game. I believe "metroidvania" is a popular term to use on such titles as it is 2D platformer with lots of backtracking, as you will be unable to reach some areas until you'll get powers requied to do so.

I am hardened PC player, but let's be honest - keyboard is a device designed for typing, not for gaming. It's been a long time since I ever attempted to play a game using keyboard instead of my X360 controller. And I'm happy to have one, because - oh, boy - I can't even imagine playing Guacamelee! with a keyboard without breaking a finger. This platformer requies a lot from your reflexes and thank god the controls are tight and well responding.

When you start the game fights are just simple button mashing and platforming is not a big deal. But of course as you progress you get new abilities like double jump, wall-jump, etc., you learn new attacks and also you get to switch between dimensions. So, Guacamelee! is not inventive platforming wise, but isn't it fun if the game is so well made? And it is actually one of the rare games, where all your abilities are not just useful, but they are mandatory to master, so you'll be able to use them in-game. You will have to train your fingers to respond quickly. Simple button mashing to fight enemies at the beginning quickly won't be any effective as you will encounter a lot of enemies that will require certain tactics to down them. As there may be a lot of enemies onscreen sometimes I never felt the fights are chaotic. They just require quick eye-to-finger response as they are challenging, but thanks to the wise use of colour palette it comes with ease to get used to some tactics. (Unless you are using a keyboard).

And mind, that your abilities are useful not only for battling the enemies, but also during platforming. There will be a lot of trial and error, especially when you'll attempt to get some hard to reach collectible.

Sometimes I really missed good old days, when side-scrolling platformers were real deal. It was actually a while since indie game developers could get to the level that was available last time on SNES (I'm not counting Gameboy). Because there's actually plenty of games in that category, but very few of them are good and even less of them are great. Thanks to Steam, we can play a lot of them on PC, as Guacamelee! was previously available only for the consoles. Guacamelee! may not be great. As I said, it is not very inventive. But there is something fresh about it and it is so damn well made, that it's just plain fun. Of course it's a modern game, so it's more forgiving than the SNES era - there are save points and lifes are unlimited. Which I consider a good thing, since the era of memorizing the whole levels is long gone, so it will keep you away from frustration. 

It is helluva fan, folks.

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198217636583', 'num_games_owned': 347, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1829, 'last_played': 1443801744}
review:
Two words: Great game. 

That alone should be enough for any gamer to at least consider playing it. But Guacamelee is so much more than that.

Nowadays platforming games are scarce, a sad thing to say but true nonetheless. Guacamelee comes in that front as a refreshingly exciting new adventure where jumping is as important as fighting. 

At the beginning you won't be able to do much, simple button combinations are all you've got to beat the early enemies, but you learn more moves the further you advance in the game. Those moves are both fighting and platforming oriented and you need to use them constatly if you want to progress.

To make things easier, you can buy diffferent perks in the store in exchange for money you get from defeating enemies, crate smashing or treasure hunting. You can also buy different skins for your character, both male and female, that will
give you useful bonuses in exchange for silver coins that you get in some particular chests and once you beat an arena.

The dfficulty curve in this game is outstandingly well done.  Forcing you to give your best in combat and platforming as well. Guacamelee's got one of the most frustratng platforming track you'll ever get to play (yes I'm referring to the saw blades) but it also's got some of the most entertaining challenge fights you'll enjoy (in hell).

Although the theme of the game might not interest you, I can assure you that it doesn't become an annoyance. In fact you're gonna be so into the game that you're hardly gonna notice it. And after a while you may even start to like it as much as I did.

As for the queer design of the ingame drawing I can only say that it fits perfectly with the story and after the first fights is not going to bother you either.

It is precisely in the story where Guacamelee turns weakest. The overall plot is average at best but you're going to be so entertained with everything else that, honestly, you're not going to care.

Lastly, I'd like to say something about reaching 100% in the game, Most of the trophies are quite easy to get, but there are some that are not. Getting the gold medal in the challenges or finding all the treasure chests is going to take time. Getting the "good" ending is demanding too, you'll have to find all 7 parts of the mask and thet will require something else. In order to succeed though, the developers added two additional powers you can get. The first one you obtain in hell and the second one gets automatically unlocked once you find 6 parts of the mask. The latter is, by far, the most overpowered ability you get in the game but frankly, by the moment you get it, is kind of useless. It would have been nice to have these two abilities available in the new game from the beginning, or at least one of them, but the developers didn't see it that way. So you don't.

In short, Guacamelee is an absolutely worthy game to play that isn't too harsh, unless you want it to be, and will surely entertain you. Don't forget to purchase it if you liked it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198052679755', 'num_games_owned': 189, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1076, 'last_played': 1443460199}

author: {'steamid': '76561198054815066', 'num_games_owned': 415, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1149, 'last_played': 1481368290}
review:
8 / 10

+
1. 훌륭한 타격감
2. 레슬링을 좋아한다면 더할 나위 없는 기술과 조작성
3. 절묘한 레벨 디자인

-
1. 취향을 탈 수 있는 그래픽과 BGM
2. 식상한 시나리오

# 평가
정말 잘 만들어진 게임 입니다.

캐슬배니아 의 팬이라면 더할 나위 없을 정도로 좋습니다.

컨트롤의 확장과 함께 레벨이 변해가는 가장 전형 적이면서 동시에 우수한 디자인을 보여줍니다.

그래픽의 스타일과 BGM이 취향을 많이 탈 수 있지만 그걸 넘어 선다면 흠뻑 빠져서 즐길 수 있을 겁니다.

-------------

이전 버전인 Gold Edition 과 비교를 해보자면 

1. 약간은 밋밋 했을지 모르는 몬스터가 보강되었고, 
2. 덕분에 각 지역의 레벨에 적절한 변화가 있습니다.
3. 새로운 레벨과 보스가 추가

이전버전을 해본 입장에서는 새로운 레벨과 보스의 추가가 적절한 변화인지는 애매한 면이 존재합니다. 게임 볼륨의 증가야 반가운 일이지만 어딘가 우겨넣은 느낌이 강하달까... 이질감이 존재합니다.
다행이도 게임 플레이에 방해가 되는 정도는 아니니 적절히 즐겨줍시다.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994839687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1814, 'last_played': 1642818288}
review:
Jesus, this game is good. It has a bunch of references to Metroid in it, which I found disappointing, because I actually enjoyed this game far more than any of the Metroid games. This game learns from all the Metroid games' mistakes to give an incredibly satisfying experience.

It's essentially if you took the exploration and fun of Metroid, tightened up all the sequences, made it hilarious, and then gave it an amazing combat system reminiscent of Smash Brothers. Speedrunning is awesome. Completioning is awesome. Everything about it is just a lot of fun, and I want to play more. One of the best games I've gotten on Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162538748', 'num_games_owned': 607, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1590, 'last_played': 1493537015}
review:
太太太好玩的遊戲了
這是我在steam上玩過的平台遊戲中，最棒最好玩的一款了。
畫風與音樂非常有中南美拉丁風味
色彩艷麗音樂熱情，畫風劇情幽默可愛
風格是我個人非常喜歡的類型

遊戲操控非常的流暢 (建議使用搖桿)
combo很容易上手，行雲流水爽感十足。
學到的招式除了用在攻擊，也是在地圖中行進突破障礙的工具。

道具上有增強能力的道具，也有裝備: 遊戲中的裝備就是服裝，例如你可穿上雞裝，每種服裝有不同的屬性。

遊戲世界是由生跟死的兩個世界重疊組成。
必須要透過兩者之間的切換，才能不斷推進劇情闖關。
除了主線任務，也有一些支線任務。
遊戲的地圖雖然沒有很大，但是每個區域都有許多地方，需要你擁有不同的能力後才能進得去。
所以每學到一些新技巧，可以回到那些區域繼續挖掘新的秘密。遊戲中每個區域有傳輸點，所以你可以遠距傳輸節省時間。

遊戲的重生點設計，是非常佛心慈悲的設計，死掉後基本上幾乎等於就地重生，所以不會有死掉後又要重頭開始的情形。

招式、地圖設計與主線劇情間的配合，感覺的到作者們花了很大的心思去安排，
安排的非常有次第，讓人不知不覺中，循序地擴展整個故事、技巧、難度。

風格、音樂、操控、劇情、節奏、地圖的整提組合，實在是太棒了~~~ 以後若玩不到這樣的遊戲怎麼辦呢~~~~

author: {'steamid': '76561198044657647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 485, 'last_played': 1470403145}
review:
Important note: this is The Version that has all there is (and a few bonuses) in any other versions of Guacamelee. Skip the others, purchase this.
Very definitely that one indie platformer-action games that tends to stand above any other would-be champions of the genre. 

It sports with accurate controls, fast-paced (but not too confusing) battles and moves, a good story and humor that actually makes you grin. It's all built up with an immersive world and unique art style and an unexpected choice of themes, which are Guacamelee's utmost aces. I mean, how many games have you played that dive into any kind of folklore? How about Mexican folklore?

You can sum it up pretty neatly in one sentence. You are the chosen lucha warrior destined to punch undead and Mexican folklore in the face, doing all sorts of manly-heroic deeds on the go. Wear your masks proudly.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990904761', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 773, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 767, 'last_played': 1564239738}
review:
Absolutely amazing game.  I got through the entire game in one playthrough.  For those of you familiar with Super Metroid on the SNES, this is pretty much like a love letter to the game.  The influence of that game on this one can be seen all the way from the abilities you earn from statues to the similarities in some of the platforming mechanics in how you use those abilities.  The only issue with the game is that it is fairly short.  However, the replay value is quite high as the fighting mechanics are simple to learn, but provide a high degree of complexity, making the game so much fun.

If you're a fan of Super Metroid, I wouldn't even think twice about purchasing this game.  It's well worth at least $20 if for nothing more than that nostalgic classic Super Metroid experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123990020', 'num_games_owned': 1734, 'num_reviews': 530, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1460236185}

author: {'steamid': '76561198149177324', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 665, 'last_played': 1422219506}
review:
Great example of the niche Metroidvania genre. It has a Mexican culture inspired aesthetic that pops out when you start going through the game. Guacamelee has all the things that Metroid/Castlevania games have had back in the day: Big environments, various collectibles that helps your character grow, big uncoverable maps, obstacles that block your way until a certain upgrade is unlocked which is acceptable use of backtracking elements, and more! The combat is not as simple as you might think for a 2D Beat 'Em Up since the unlockable moves help increase your combos and damage output.

Rating: 10/10 because I loved the 2D Metroid and Castlevania games (biased I guess). Everybody should give it a try, it eben has Steam Workshops for outfits!

author: {'steamid': '76561198033605026', 'num_games_owned': 1379, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 2068, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1689548696}

Can't recommmend this enough. 

It's fun, it's fast, it's got supertight controls in a sidescroller platformer beat'em-up/brawler that does not overstep it's own boundaries and has incredible direction and focus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044482985', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1992, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1875, 'last_played': 1489979396}
review:
¡Viva el Guacamelee!!

A los pocos minutos de comenzar a jugar, Guacamelee! se convirtió en uno de mis plataformers favoritos.

Tiene diversas mecánicas de lucha y movimiento típicas de juegos de plataforma, pero innova con la habilidad de cambiar del mundo de los vivos al de los muertos. Esta habilidad literalmente duplica el mundo a explorar y genera interesantes situaciones para el jugador. Además, cada nivel es interesante y posee una cantidad enorme de secretos y puzzles. Algunos son pruebas de ingenio, otros de destreza, y otros ejercicios de voluntad para quienes no tienen problema en intentar un nivel más de 100 veces. En definitiva: ofrece desafíos para todos los gustos. El gameplay es realmente muy complejo, pero se enseña paulatinamente a lo largo de todo el juego, entrenando al jugador hasta convertirlo en un experto y sin perder el tiempo en tutoriales.

La estética y la música son hermosas y el escenario es un gran homenaje a la cultura Mexicana. La historia es simple pero interesante, repleta de personajes divertidos y con un buen sentido del humor. Además, no deja de rendir culto a los mejores juegos del género, colocando montones de guiños para los entendidos. La ambientación está perfectamente ejecutada y cuida hasta el más mínimo detalle. Como latinoamericano, estuve particularmente atento a ver dónde se equivocaban con las referencias culturales, y me alegra no haber encontrado nada fuera de lugar.

Lo único negativo es el gameplay multiplayer, que no es malo, pero por momentos puede ser confuso. Cuantos más jugadores, más confusión. De todos modos, es perfectamente jugable de a dos e incluso las desventajas del gameplay pueden ser utiles para superar algunos puzzles y niveles particularmente difíciles.

En definitiva, Guacamelee! es todo lo que el nombre promete: Mexico + Plataformer de Combate + un enorme signo de exclamasión que implica (correctamente) que hay muchísimo más en este juego. ¡Totalmente recomendable!

author: {'steamid': '76561197979998458', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 647, 'last_played': 1438455838}
review:
This game has the worst marketing team ever.  If someone had told me years ago when Guacamelee first hit the scene that it translated Super Metroid mechanics near perfectly, I'd have paid full price instead of getting this in a bundle with 4 other games for $2.99.

If you enjoyed Samus' romps with Mother Brain then you will certainly love Guacamelee as well.  You'll even get to collect powerups from Chozo statues....no seriously, you collect power ups from Chozo statues.  The game itself is so finely crafted, I truly believe that anyone who enjoys videogames will find something they like about this title.  From the colorful Samuri Jack-esq graphics, to the Borderlands tounge-in-cheek humor, to the near perfect music all aspects deserve accolade.

10/10 ... would farm Agave again

author: {'steamid': '76561198199092345', 'num_games_owned': 102, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1501, 'last_played': 1440485780}
review: an awesome metroidvania with a simple concept and smash bros-esque combat. It's got a spirit world you can freely move in an out of, unique use of special moves, wall jumping and a double jump for tight platforming, a strange story with the antagonist a dead mexican dude who somehow defeated  the devil himself and is now seeking more power as hes replaced diablo himself and a unique art style that fits in with the tone of the game. Theres also the main character, Juan, who has been killed by diablo murderer and found a mask in the spirit world, bringing him back to life with new strength and giving him the appearance of a luchador. theres also a goat man and his "choozoo" statues which grant you new moves once broken. (apparently he's taken a liking to your mother). and the main selling point of the game. YOU CAN BE A CHICKEN. if you didnt think this game had enough, buy it just for this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097220681', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1634, 'last_played': 1437821521}
review:
[h1] 你想玩一款爽快的2D横版动作游戏么 快来玩墨西哥英雄大混战	[/h1][spoiler] 墨西哥鸡肉卷大混战[/spoiler]
游戏是典型的横版过关游戏 画风可能会让第一次接触到这个游戏的人不喜 不过玩下去才能发现原画的细致和用心 [u] 想当年我还不知Sbeam为何物的时候 曾经下载过这款游戏的豪华正版 打开因为不喜欢画风、玩了十分钟就删了 现在我十分感谢自己当时的决定 不然现在怎么能入正来体验这款绝佳的好游戏呢！[/u]
游戏的故事剧情是老套的拯救公主类 总有闲着没事干的魔王绑架公主然后也不知道为了啥的就去毁灭一下世界 不过本里真正的魔王被变成了一只[b]鸡[/b] 真BOSS另有他人
游戏的打击感做的十分到位 经典的闪避无敌设定 加上独特的投掷设定 让这款游戏玩起来十分过瘾 [u] 毕竟2D横版过关睾丸们追求的都是无伤和连击数[/u] 而这款游戏想做到无伤通关并不是一件十分难的事情 虽然制作商’并没有给主角设定大量华丽酷炫的招式[spoiler] 某泣[/spoiler] 不过简单的招式面对多种多样的敌人和精心设计过的场景 依然能给你绝佳的游戏体验 生死世界切换的系统尤其让我眼前一亮[spoiler] 深恶痛绝[/spoiler] 许多敌人在某一个世界里是不会有攻击判定的 可是他们的攻击却不公平的可以打到你 加上许多地形的生死切换设定 让Guacamelee走出了自己的风格 不再只是经典横版游戏的演绎 切换生死世界的时候请务必小心[spoiler] 不要像我一样经常连切两次导致GG[/spoiler]
游戏的画面充满墨西哥风情 刚开始让我玩的时候我是拒绝的 不过玩起来之后[spoiler]DUANGDUANG的停不下来[/spoiler] 各种场景 壁画 人物设计都十分到位 让人惊叹制作组的美术功底
本作的细节和彩蛋设定真的是十分到位 帮女孩找到玩偶后 可以看见死之世界里小女孩一直抱着玩偶 完成老奶奶美味的事物后 餐馆门口的食客也排起了长队 让人佩服制作组的用心 游戏完成度之高
游戏更是蕴含大量彩蛋 第一个BOSS红龙的追击  最后的踩斧子砍桥加上[i]公主在别的城堡[/i]无疑是向初代马里奥致敬 Santa Luchita各种暴漫表情 以及遍地的 [b] 鸡[/b] [spoiler] 火车王有话要讲[/spoiler]
本作唯一的缺点大概就是流程过短 不过这款游戏是一款难的成就佳作 全成就难度适中 到二周目大概也只需要10+小时 虽然流程战斗十分爽快 不过全收集确实是让人头痛 雪山和树顶两关更是分分钟教你做人[spoiler]所以说我最讨厌收集累的成就[/spoiler]
游戏进包多次 推荐大家一定要来玩一下 何况在我看来这是一款原价购买也很划算的超值游戏 不说了窝还差一个二周目成就 我去全成就了
哦对了 希望大家拿全了6个面具碎片后 请务必对那些扔骨头的傻X怪说一声
[spoiler]傻逼了吧 爷会飞！[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198113379084', 'num_games_owned': 1106, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1437462866}
review:
Es un buen juego, se caracteriza mayormente por las plataformas, puzzles y un poco de hack and slash, los graficos en 2D están muy bien logrados se ve bastante bien y es atractivo a la vista. En cuanto a la temática del juego es algo bastante inusual porque toma aspectos de la cultura mexicana y expresiones muy comunes de ese país lo cual para los latinoamericanos se nos hace muy familiar también.

La historia aunque es muy interesante por como se desarrolla es un tanto cliché por el hecho de tener que rescatar a la mujer de la cual el protagonista está enamorado(mario bross), pero eso es algo que el juego hace a propósito porque posee demasiadas referencias a otros títulos tanto retro como no tan viejos, el avance de la historia es fácil de comprender no posee una profundidad o reflexión muy alta sino que se preocupa más en cómo sortear los distintos niveles que se presentan.

En cuanto al gameplay es muy adictivo y entretenido, se nota que es en lo que más se enfocaron los desarrolladores, presenta retos bastante complejos y se puede decir que el juego también entra dentro de una categoría metroidvania ya que habrán zonas que no se pueden acceder hasta conseguir nuevos poderes o explorando todo el mapa.

Las habilidades que adquiere el personaje son muy interesantes tanto pra el combate como para avanzar en el mapa, éstas ayudan mucho cuando se debe pelear contra un número elevado de enemigos y cuando se presentan situaciones apremiantes, el juego posee una "tienda" donde se pueden comprar partes de salud, "magia" y aumento de poderes con dinero que se gana matando enemigos.

En sí para ser un juego indie está muy completo y bien trabajado, a mí me duró casi 8 horas explorando bastante y avanzando sin mucha prisa, lo recomiendo bastante tanto por el precio y todo lo que ofrece, si lo ven en una barata o rebaja no lo piensen dos veces y comprenlo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997159902', 'num_games_owned': 1274, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 1090, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 851, 'last_played': 1471990475}
review: This is the kind of game you beat and then start a new save on Hard immediately. A game that once you get in the rhythm of it, you become a monster combo machine and it's so satisfying that by the end of it you can't help but demand more. Drinkbox put out an absolutely brilliant game that everyone should play through. I have about 5 times now across different platforms and I still can't get enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198177159893', 'num_games_owned': 2987, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 1180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1180, 'last_played': 1437233327}
review:
平台游戏大爱！
类恶魔城，横板闯关+收集

顺便，指南里大多是墨西哥英雄大混战黄金版的指南，不适合冠军版。
然后就找到了这个网站！
http://www.trueachievements.com/Guacamelee-Super-Turbo-Championship-Edition/achievements.htm

祝大家也全成就！

author: {'steamid': '76561198038979889', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1462080013}
review: You get taught combos by a chicken and powers by a goat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198193953430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1055, 'last_played': 1463660517}
review:
Très bon jeu.

La maniabilité est irréprochable, et les combats et déplacement dans les niveaux deviennent vite prenants. Certains passages sont durs, mais l'on ne peut s'en prendre qu'à soit même lorsque l'on échoue.

Le scénario et l'univers sont très sympas. Graphiquement, le jeu est bourré de référence à l'esthétique Mexicaine, et très coloré. C'est simple et beau.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025547559', 'num_games_owned': 273, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 525, 'last_played': 1437085052}
review:
Jogo bem divertido no estilo Metroidvania e temática de lucha livre!

Gostei muito do combate e de ficar procurando os itens do cenário que vão se tornando acessíveis de acordo com os poderes que pegamos.

Acho que o jogo se alongou um pouquinho mais do que deveria, mas isso não chegou a diminuir a boa impressão que me passou.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076869733', 'num_games_owned': 1051, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 467, 'last_played': 1455843584}
review: Guacamelee es un metroidvenia, para los conocedores del genero sabran que es un plataformas con muchas exploracion que se desarrolla en un mapa enorme, cuyas partes se van abriendo frente a nosostros conforme vayamos obteniendo habilidades para nuestro personaje, en este apartado guacamelee cumple, tiene una ambientacion de la cultura mexicana muy divertida, y que tiene guiños a otros juegos, y curiosidades que son muy gratas de encontrar, la duracion es corta, pero intensa, hacia mucho tiempo que no jugaba algo que me hiciera tirar tanta groseria a la pantalla.. en fin es un gran juego que recomiendo por los motivos escritos arriba, es un gran metroidvenia con una muy buena ambientacion y es un buen reto... aunque tiene un fallo que si llegue a detestar y que hacia que la dificultad se hiciera aun mayor, llegando un poco a lo injusto, lo cual es jugar con teclado, es una proeza llegar a jugar bien con ese periferico, se debieron tomar un poco mas de tiempo para adaptar bien los controles. por todo lo demas es un juego sumamente bueno.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112581891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 1201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1059, 'last_played': 1552868258}
review:
Very entertaining mix with elements from a Metroidvania-like Game and the adventure mode of Super Smash Bros. Brawl. It offers a unique artdesign, which is not for everybody's taste but quite consequently made and in my opinion very likeable. Though the story lacks thrill it doesn't really matter because of the absolutely hilarious humor wether it's some ingame "ads" for fictional Luchador-Wrestling fights or the nicely written diaglogues with both friends and foes. Additionally the difficulty is quite challenging and delivers many different enemys with combat moves by their own and a large moveset for the player with many possibilitys using them in big combos. For my first playthrough I needed about 8 hours and for completing until 100% about 3 hours additionally.

If you like 2D Plattforming Indie Games with fun combat and nice humor you should give it a try!

author: {'steamid': '76561198029073737', 'num_games_owned': 1047, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 1223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1190, 'last_played': 1536955277}
review: Excellent metroidvania complètement déjanté basé sur le folklore Mexicain et bourré d'easter eggs, ce jeu nous met dans la peau (et le masque) d'un apprenti luchador qui voit son amie d'enfance sexy se faire enlever par rien de moins que Calaca, el patron de los muertos. Si le scénario se veut classique, la réalisation est irréprochable avec une difficulté bien dosée et une jouabilité sans faille. Le gros point fort de Guacamelee est son ambiance, on navigue dans les bons gros clichés, dans des décors sublimes et archi-colorés et sur une bande-son à tomber, un véritable voyage dépaysant au pays du WTF. Disposant d'une durée de vie correcte, ce jeu est une valeur sûre à se procurer dès que possible (à moins d'être allergique aux jeux de plates-formes).

review: POLECAM GRĘ BO JEST DUŻO KURCZAKÓW I ON JEST TWOIM MISZCZEM I TY SIĘ ZMIENIASZ W TAKIEGO I FAJNE MAKSOWANIE GRY. POLECAM

author: {'steamid': '76561198003055571', 'num_games_owned': 483, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1086, 'last_played': 1436302333}
review:
This is a really enjoyable platformer. It is witty, funny, gorgeous, and feels great to play even on a keyboard (a bit of training required, and lots of missed keys).

The controls are smooth and the combos are neatly chained and impactful.

My only qualm is that the skins are tied to power-ups and disadvantages. Sometimes I just wanted to enjoy some look but its bonuses aren't as good or my playstyle as other skins, so I just used Diablo and the monster one, mainly.

Played 2 games, normal and hard:
1st playthrough, about 10 hours, 100% completion;
2nd playthrough, hard mode, about 4 hours, rushed. I really wish hard was available from the beginning, it added some needed challenge. I played a second time mainly for the achievement, but I would've enjoyed the game a lot more in one full hard mode playthrough.
100% achievements (second run in hard-mode required).

author: {'steamid': '76561198073450392', 'num_games_owned': 1395, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1432739510}
review:
The Super Turbo Championship adds new features to the already superb original. With the steep discounts it receives, you would be mad not to pick it up if you don't already have the original and are a fan of platformers. If you are an owner of the previous version, ask yourself you want to re-explore the world with the added benefit of more amazing content.

My previous review still applies, copied below:

This is quite possibly my favourite platformer of all time. The writing is actually funny and the controls are excellent. I love the mexican style of the game and using the fighting moves to help the platforming is very unique and interesting. The combat is very easy to learn and surprisingly enjoyable. The game is quite hard and the platforming puzzles can make you want to rip your hair out, but the difficulty keeps the game interesting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085694933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 984, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 984, 'last_played': 1436145314}
review:
[h1]No mames, está ca-brón![/h1]

ÁNDALE!!!! PERO SI ES GUACAMELEE! la súper mezcla explosiva con todo lo bueno de los juegos de la vieja escuela:
[i]Guacamelee![/i] es [i]Castlevania[/i] y [i]Megaman[/i] con su acción sin descanso contra miles de enemigos.
[i]Guacamelee![/i] tiene alma de [i]Metroid[/i], por el diseño de sus niveles tan variado y puzles tan bien elaborados.
[i]Guacamelee![/i] posee la jugabilidad de [i]Súper Mario Bros[/i] por sus buenísimas plataformas y carreras sin fin por todo el mapeado.
[i]Guacamelee![/i] además te recordará a [i]The legend of Zelda[/i] por sus templos, corazones, mundo de las sombras y aventuras laterales.
[i]Guacamelee![/i] tiene el control sencillo e impecable de [i]Súper Smash Bros[/i] en sus combos de combates cuerpo a cuerpo.

Todo el juego está hecho con la mejor receta Mexicana (y lleno de pollos), con muchísimo humor gracias a sus parodias referidas a los grandes juegos de todos los tiempos. (¿Qué hace aquí [i]Manny Calavera[/i] de [i]Grim Fandango[/i]?). No nos olvidemos de su soundtrack que es soberbia pues está compuesta por una larga lista de temas pegadizos que no pararás de escuchar.
Y si todo es bueno, puede ser mucho mejor porque se puede jugar comiendo nachos con 4 players a la vez desde un mismo PC. El juego es la po-lla (que pone huevos), mola más que la sal, el limón y el tequila! qué onda!

[b]Lo mejor:[/b] música, acción, plataformas, mapeado, secretos, exploración, su lado cómico, su duración. No se le puede pedir más a la virgencita del santo chili !
[b]Lo peor:[/b] a simple vista en un video o en una captura de pantalla puede que el juego no resulte atractivo, pero una vez que lo pruebas te preguntarás... "pinche huevón ¿por qué no lo jugué antes?"

author: {'steamid': '76561198004096970', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 881, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 881, 'last_played': 1434805237}

Became a Luchador, saved the world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106825427', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 629, 'last_played': 1435553842}
review:
A fun platformer. You play as Juan an agave farmer made luchador thanks to a legendary luchador mask. He goes on an adventure to save his childhood love, the El Presidente's Daughter, from the evil Carlos Calaca. Yea it a strange story, but hey what are video games for if you can't have a strange story from time to time. The story is really entertaining and the game is constantly making references to other games. It help set up a fun atmosphere.

The game play like your standard 2D platformer, but what set it apart levels have 2 designs, a living and dead. Playing as Juan you'll find yourself having to switch between the land of the living and dead to get through areas and find their secrets. You'll also have to use you're wrestling abilities as you learn them to help you progress through the game. 

The combat involve punching your enemies enough to get them vunerable enough to throw them into other enemies or into environmental hazard. As you learn new abilities, enemies will start to spawn with barriers that can only be broken by using that ability. As you go through the game, you will encounter newer enemies that will put your new powers to the test. 

Honestly this is a fun game that knows how silly it is and it take pleasure in it. If you like luchadores, goats, chickens, skeletons, challenging platforming, and a fun "save the princess" story then this is the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996366574', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 812, 'last_played': 1435686010}
review: Vor allem im Koop Modus an einem PC ein unterhaltsames Spiel. Die Steuerung lässt zwar zu zweit ab und zu Chaos aufkommen - nichts desto trotz überwiegt der Spaß. Auch nachdem man die Story durchgespielt hat, gibt es noch einige Nebenquests und Herausforderungen. Ein außergewöhnliches Spiel mit einem nicht alltäglichen Setting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039531850', 'num_games_owned': 340, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1027, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 994, 'last_played': 1553268189}
review:
Dope game, with developers behind it which make poor business decisions. Overall, super fun though, really satisfying fighting system, nice visuals, clever mechanics and a real good soundtrack (Boss theme in particular). It's a brawler/Metroidvania and it works real well. 

I played through the whole game with a suit that makes you take double damage, I didn't realise this, don't do that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074560428', 'num_games_owned': 675, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 636, 'last_played': 1435382802}
review:
Antes de mais nada, preciso dizer que ESSE JOGO É MARAVILHOSO! 
Você é um LUCHADOR que aprende vários golpes ao longo do jogo e tem que resgatar a mocinha.
Em certo ponto do jogo você se transforma em um GALO e o DIABO, que também é um galo, te ensina a se transformar em humano  de novo conforme a necessidade.
Os diálogos são engraçados e o jogo é lindo e entretedor, não se torna repetitivo em nenhum momento, a difculdade acompanha sua evolução e os desafios também.

MAS, se você já possui o Guacamelee Gold Edition, saiba que não vale pagar o preço completo nele outra vez. 80% do jogo ainda é o mesmo. PRA MIM, só vale apena com pelo menos 50% de desconto. Esse jogo poderia muito bem ser uma DLC do gold edition, por metade do preço. 
Mas se você não tem o Gold Edition, não hesite! Compre JÁ o Superturbo Championship!!!!!!!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198199848001', 'num_games_owned': 1067, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1544326668}
review: Jogo simplesmente sensacional, extremamente divertido, mecânica fantástica, cheios de referencias a cultura pop e extremamente espirituoso, Guacamelee é um prato cheio pra fãs de jogos de ação e exploração e por que não, fãs de jogos no geral. Facilmente um dos melhores Metroidvanias junto com Super Metroid e Castlevania: Symphony of the Night.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170691582', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1517, 'last_played': 1430189594}
review:
The Good:
- Right off the top I have to admit that I’m a huge fan of metroidvania games, and so this review is definitely biased. Guacamelee excels in numerous aspects which define this genre, and so for me this was a fantastic gaming experience. The music, aesthetic, and level design are all superb. 

- I’m also a pro wrestling fan, and so I loved that the game incorporated a suplex and pile driver into the move set. 

- I didn’t have any performance issues during my playthrough. 

The Bad:
- Absolutely nothing. Guacamelee delivered in every aspect. 

Final Verdict: 
I honestly can’t see how anyone who is a fan of metroidvania games would regret purchasing Guacamelee at full price. It is definitely worth your purchase!

author: {'steamid': '76561198059896926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 483, 'last_played': 1421558303}
review:
A suprisingly excellent metroid-vania style platformer/beat-em-up. It utelizes the wrestling moves so that not only are you using them to defeat enemies and open doors, but they're also incorporated into the platforming as well. 
Just know that this game is packed full of aging memes and references that may make you cringe a bit. Though the huge workshop support may remedy that for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020097921', 'num_games_owned': 684, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1053, 'last_played': 1437542727}
review:
Pros:
-You're a Luchador
-Easter Eggs... tons of Easter Eggs
-Easy to understand mechanics
-Story isn't too deep, very linear and a wee bit predictable, but you will get immersed (well I did) and you will still get some feels.
-You're a fucking Luchador!

Cons:
-Unforgiving, like a good old 80-90's game: a few (or one) false move can destroy you or impede your progress - luckily this is still a modern day game, so they threw you a bone: infinite lives - when you die: you respawn at a checkpoint, your progress beyond the checkpoint is lost, but that's it. no "X4 lives left". -whew.
-Uncomfortable key mappings (this is for gamepad) that cannot be changed. Paired with the former cons, this makes the game more frustrating than it should.

9/10; not giving 'em a 10 not untill they fix the controller problem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012706915', 'num_games_owned': 747, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1292, 'last_played': 1423963353}
review:
I don't usually like side scrolling platformers too much (I tend to get bored of them easily) but for some reason the moment I started this game I was totally hooked.  I think it must be because I just like throwing things into other things constantly...

The combat was really great with lots of different combos to learn and the mechanics of grappling and throwing an enemy around was just really ridiculously satisfying for some reason.  The choice of outfits made things interesting too as the effects really made a difference (and I liked that one turned you into a dragon instead of a chicken!).  I also really loved the challenges and the secret rooms and the one I like to call the troll room because it was so ridiculously difficult!

author: {'steamid': '76561198071142596', 'num_games_owned': 253, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1468555786}

author: {'steamid': '76561198056092379', 'num_games_owned': 887, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1629249739}
review:
I'm on the fence about this version of the game, but I am leaning toward a yes. Be noted, this game is just Guacamelee 1.5. The fact that I had to repurchase a game I owned felt like it cheated me, but luckily I got it on sale from HumbleBundle.

Pros:
Great game
Steam Workshop
New additions
Metroidvania games are always fun
Controller support is easy

Cons:
Steep price for users that own the original.
Gold version runs on Linux, yet this one doesn't. What's up with that?

author: {'steamid': '76561198011498752', 'num_games_owned': 413, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1687982029}
review:
This is the definitive version of the game, do not get the gold edition. If already bought gold though, you may safely skip this one, as there are only some minor additions that do not really warrant another purchase.

This game has:
- a great soundtrack 
- a great artstyle and overall theme
- a slightly campy sort of humour
- a very satisfying combat system
- a shortish campaign (about 5~6 hours on the first playthrough), but with decent incentives for repeat playthroughs

In short: definitely worth a purchase if you haven't played the game yet, and pretty much a must buy during sales.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040914294', 'num_games_owned': 744, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1687574940}
review:
If you are new to Guacamelee! in general, look further down for a general review. Following is a comparison of versions.

When I first saw this, I thought it was a moneygrab. It is absolutely not. The Super Turbo Championchip Edition improves so much on Gold Edition that they are almost incomperable. The most notable additions are:
- The chicken bomb
- Rebalancing of the enemies in just about every area and stat rebalancing of enemies
- The fighting system got rebuffed and everything feels much, much smoother
- A new 'super' type mode you can initiate after doing lots of combos
- New story additions and a new boss
All in all, the game feels much fuller.

Now for a general review of Guacamelee!
Guacamelee! is a metroidvania that really knows how to mix its genres. While the basic mechanics of platforming and fighting are both there, the fighting has a good amount of depth to it without becoming overly complex. After playing for a while, combos seemlessly stream out into an arena of destruction... and it feels really good. In Guacamelee! I can punch and upper cut an enemy into the air, headbut them, body slam them, and then grab them to suplex them into the ground to knock other enemies off balance only to start another combo. And it doesn't require dozens of hours to learn. On top of the fighting system, there are many, many upgrades to find and buy. Search a large world for upgrades, find the good ending, complete some challenges, unlock some sweet costumes, turn into a chicken! Okay, that last one was a little different than the rest, but you get the idea.

TL;DR
Guacamelee! STCE is the best edition. The game is a metroidvania with more depth to fighting. Lots of upgrades. Chickens. Worth every penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125025556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 546, 'last_played': 1620457928}

author: {'steamid': '76561198133628702', 'num_games_owned': 2145, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 1016, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1009, 'last_played': 1570231679}
review:
I just finished this game on co-op and I gotta say it's some of the most fun I've had in a long time. It took us about 7 hours to beat even with the two of us. You pretty much play as a super-hero luchador in a beat-em-up style game trying to save your princess. There is tons of secrets, in which you don't unlock the 'true ending' unless you find them all. You can also unlock different costumes which gives you different benefits and you can upgrade your skills. I played most of the game with the Diablo suit which kind of made it like hard mode even on easy.

I gotta say this game really did remind me of the old-school games and some of the music even sounded alot like Mario and other games. Enemies were decently hard to beat without being too difficult, but keep in mind I did have another player helping me. Storyline is decent and there is tons of humor in the game also. It's kinda like they took everything people love about indie games and put it into this game.

Co-op design is fairly decent but the camera kinda sucks as it will only follow player one instead of expanding. Every time you die you have a timer to wait to come back and when you do you're a little orb that floats around until your teammate releases you. I felt this made the co-op fair without being too much struggle. Pretty much a fun co-op experience that adds mild difficulty to great teamwork gameplay. Coordinating certain platforming can be incredibly hectic though and we usually just let one person do all the platforming at the hard parts because it was too hard with two people to do.

Co-op is also somewhat buggy... I have a screenshot where instead of dying, me and my buddy just have 3 copies of ourselves each...

I will probably replay the hell out of this game until I unlock all of the achievements. I can't really say too much bad about the game in all honestly so I would have to give the game somewhere around a 4.5/5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055553431', 'num_games_owned': 7573, 'num_reviews': 209, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1506008737}
review:
[h1] Pueblucho si arricchisce di 2 aree nuove, di un'ottima boss fight e di un combat system ancora più vario.
E' ancora teatrale, con un level design eccezionale, nella sua doppia anima frizzante e malinconica. [/h1]

Ho giocato principalmente alla versione gold edition; questa è una revisione completa dei contenuti aggiuntivi. Ci regala qualche ora e qualche colorato abito in più, per il resto vale quanto già lodato nella versione precedente.

Molto colorato, con una doppia anima artistica molto ispirata; DrinkBox ci regala un doppio mondo di gioco in rapida evoluzione con un crescendo di abilità, umorismo e zone da scoprire condito da un sano backtracking.
Raramente si riesce ad avere in un solo prodotto 1 storia narrata in maniera interessante, un combat system profondo, un level design eccezionale in grado di esaltare un gameplay a tratti sorprendentemente tecnico e un ritmo crescente così ben curati.

Un intrecciato mondo da scoprire grazie ad una maschera; un inno a titoli ricchi di atmosfera e magia come Super Mario e Metroid, le cui statue di Choozo richiamano chiaramente l'antica razza aliena dal volto rapace dei Chozo di Zebes, che creò i Metroid.

L'aggiunta della co-op locale è una funzione gradita e troppo spesso dimenticata in produzioni moderne; se avete un/a complice con cui condividere lo schermo troverete questa opzione molto soddisfacente...se sarete affiatati! Si perchè in alcune zone la sincronizzazione dei movimenti tra i 2 mondi e tra i 2 giocatori sarà fondamentale per proseguire il livello.

Un saggio-capra vi guiderà dunque in questa telenovela in salsa messicana, in cui dovremo ovviamente salvare la principessa dal cattivone di turno oltre a tramutarci di tanto in tanto in pollo...ma la banalità non fa parte di Pueblucho, qui dimorano citazioni, modi di dire, tabelloni magistralmente dipinti con la passione tipicamente latina.

Ottimo il doppiaggio e il comparto tecnico con comandi sempre precisi in grado di approfondire le meccaniche senza lag. Semplicemente sorprendente il sonoro, con una tracklist travolgente in piena anima messicana.

Se non ci fossero stati livelli a volte troppo sbilanciati con alcuni enigmi mal calibrati saremmo di fronte ad un titolo quasi perfetto. Qualcuno lo eleverà a capolavoro, di sicuro è un indie di grande personalità che non ha paura di essere confrontato con le produzioni tripla A.

[h1]Extra[/h1]
[url=http://www.lucullusgames.com/2017/09/guacamelee-super-turbo-championship-unlocking-hard-mode.html]Sbloccare subito la modalità Hard[/url]

[code]Se questa recensione ti è stata utile clicca "[b]Segui[/b]" sulla [b][url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/26648481/]pagina Curatore[/url][/b] del mio gruppo steam: resterai sempre aggiornato con le mie recensioni, guide e soluzioni[/code]

review:
"Guacamelee!" is about a simple man turned luchadore at the face of supernatural shenanigans. 
You wanna be mucho caliente, ese? Play this game. It'll make you feel pretty badass.
"Guacamelee!" is definitely a game worth playing for fans of beat 'em ups.
Upgrades are satisfying and the costumes' status effects are pretty varied.
Level design is beautifully simple, with matching music for every location.
The dialogue is actually pretty funny, to contrast with the semi-serious plot.

I'd personally give this game a 7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197962245021', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1515386065}
review:
The game is really fun and gorgeous. It's very colorful, and the music is nice, too.

It warns you when you boot it up that the game is best played with a controller. I'm not sure if using a controller would fix this problem, but I have been using the keyboard and it can sometimes be difficult to execute moves, specifically the uppercut. This can be frustrating at times, as you're often required to use the uppercut in combination with other jumps to reach high places/execute combos. Other than that, the game is a lot of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044691652', 'num_games_owned': 1020, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 2290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1479934094}
review:
My recommendation for this game:

COMPLETELY ABSOLUTELY VERILY YES!!!

Get it.
It's unique.
It's well crafted.
It will teach you stuff on the way. And very forgiving for the most part.
Controls are tight and you don't need to worry about fiddly widdly things.

Best part of the game is its culturally immersive setting. I'm not a Native Mexican in any way. And this whole game provided a whole lot of newness to me.

Live in the Americas? No problem! Still plenty enjoyable for its awesome gameplay alone.

Think about it.

You start out as a burly guy, then a strong luchador, then you become...

LUCHAGOD!

By the time you get to the end of the game you will feel awesome.

review: Very cool, great style and gameplay. The bad reviews are maybe about it not being different enough from the other Guacamelee versions, but as someone who just buys Guacamelee for the first time this is the version to buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109860236', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 802, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 802, 'last_played': 1429126659}
review:
The definitive edition in many ways....4 player co-op, improved visual effects, 2 new areas, a new boss, new enemies, "Intenso" mode, chicken bombs and redesigned progression through the map amongst the notable additions but as a gamer that has 100% both console and PC versions of Guacamelee Gold and Guacamelee STCE there's that nagging feeling that in nerfing Tule Tree, Caverna del Pollo and the bosses for example they took away most of the challenge and what were the more ambitious, more rewarding areas of the game. 

El Infierno remains a reasonable slog.

The game itself is still one of the most polished, accessible and fun Metroidvania games available, remaster or not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012047568', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 682, 'last_played': 1429122903}
review: One of the best action-platformers I have ever played. Though there were some moments where the game felt very fustrating in difficulty, I always came back to it, and felt satisfied or accomplished upon completing the challenging bosses or segment of a level. Its challending, but always fun and creative.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993154641', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1227, 'last_played': 1425180007}
review: One of the best games I've played in a while. If you enjoy Metroidvania style games, this is a perfectly executed example. Combat feels great and the visual style is uniquely appealing. A quick note that there's not much point in purchasing both the Gold and Super Turbo Championship editions. Just purchase the latter as it has everything that Gold has with some gameplay and graphical improvements, plus an additional area to explore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100992838', 'num_games_owned': 747, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1504, 'last_played': 1428979383}
review:
When put in comparison to the Gold Edition, you would expect this game to be better. It is... but at the same time it's not. It features more content, but half the achievements are gone, and what is added isn't really that much of a difference in the first place,and could've simply been a DLC.

That being said, the visuals are really something to be seen, the soundtrack is good (and even more so when you notice the small differences when you swap worlds), the gameplay is tight, and it feels consistent... Until the bright colors get old fast, and the game will play a cheap trick and force you to play the game again to get a single achievement because it doesn't let you choose hard mode from the get go.

Speaking of the hard mode, the only real difference I felt was in X'tabay and Javier Jaguar fights. And boy, let me tell you , Javier was NOT ballanced at all. His dodging feels like the game is cheating you and the white barrier is absolutely cheap, when it regenerates and he will just dodge and swap worlds, or use his aura to blast you away.

With all that said, the game is still recommended. I just had a few bones to pick with it. It's not THAT hard, but something might not be enjoyable if you're trying to look for a game to complete. However, yes, this is a game that must be played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048638362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1428880243}
review: A game that will have you running into puzzles and combat believing them impossible to accomplish but after a few tries leaves you praising the devs for their creative level design.  Satsifying combat supports this with a full range of moves to not only navigate the world but take down anyone in your path.  Worth playing even if not a big fan of platformers or indie games, cant wait for a sequel or more games made by these devs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046589425', 'num_games_owned': 325, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1423926182}
review:
This is going to be my first negative review, and i feel so bad for giving a thumbs down for a gorgeous game like " Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition ".

I was looking for so much in this game, but i guess looks can be decieving.

It has great art, its a gorgeous game, great ambiance, and decent mechanics.

But the game itself, is so so slow, it takes a while for you to be able to do anything, it also takes a while for you to progress in the story, and will take even more time for you to understand where you're supposed to go. 

You're in a game where everything is colorfull and saturated and you want to do so much and kill people and kick ass but no, you'll walk. God you [b]WILL WALK SO MUCH[/b] you walk so much you spend hours trying to get past a map and you find yourself in a dead end and that makes you go all the way back to where you started. 

I just get that " ohh goddddddd this again. Sighs, i guess i'll just walk there again " vibe everytime i play it. At _least_ the game is pretty. meh i just expected way more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046161919', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1693324303}

author: {'steamid': '76561198046001968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 680, 'last_played': 1421573300}
review: Had tons of fun playing this game. That metroidvania feel to it is just beautiful.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960517920', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1417107897}
review:
The Metroidvania game we've been waiting for.

Very fun brawler-style combat, lots of secrets to uncover, powerups are pretty awesome (wuzzup chi-cken how you doin), and the music/atmosphere is top-notch. Animation is gorgeous.

AND IT HAS LOCAL COOP. Shame about no online multi, but for a game like this, it would've been a bonus.

Besides the added content in the STCE, obtaining new powerups now boast 95% non-seizure-inducing backgrounds! This is a huge step up from the base game, since grabbing new powers meant a trip to the neurosurgeon!

Pollos/10, one of the best Metroidvanias in a long time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124869455', 'num_games_owned': 568, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1430478803}
review:
Guacamelee is one of the best platformers I played lately. 
Is the first game that my girlfriend also enjoyed playing so we get to play it co-op(probably because she can pick the female character and she also gets to dress her). 
- also, it can be played up to 4 players co-op(which probably is too much for 1 screen)

I have to say it's far more complex and has a lot more content than what I thought when I got it: you can change dimensions, transform in a chicken(to fit through narrow places) and you have enough skills to play around with. Also you can buy upgrades or new costumes that each has benefits and drawbacks.

What I like:
- the graphics
- storyline is funny
- lot of content(10h+ of gameplay(played some offline) and it seems we're only halfway)
- some rounds require a little "puzzle solving"
- various enemies and also boss levels are cool
- you can become a chicken

What I don't like:
- Some levels require maybe too much button mashing, and you have to retry lots of times until you get it perfect
- When playing local co-op, the screen follows player one(which seems normal) but lots of times even if player2 manages to cross some intricate button mashing section it will be returned back to player1's location. While if player1 succesfully passes an area, player2 will be again automatically teleported to player1 so he doesn't have to do it also. So lots of times the levels that require perfect combos to pass them are only dependend on player1(if he passes, all pass. If he doesn't noone pass)

author: {'steamid': '76561197998497020', 'num_games_owned': 558, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 679, 'last_played': 1450542965}
review:
An absolute platforming blast. Gold edition was fantastic and even if you have beaten it I still would reccomend super turbo championship edition. It just tightens everything up; expands the story, allows for 4-person local co-op, adds egg bombs... it's just so much fun to play, especially with friends. This game has actual skill requirements for its platforming puzzles and that is where the only flaw I can imagine for this game comes from (though completely avoidable in this version with moderate skill): co-operative platforming often results in getting in eachother's way.

In gold edition everybody was locked to the same phase as eachother meaning that platform puzzles that involved phase swaps got complicated, nigh impossible, fast. IN this one everybody can control their phase independantly, which makes it completely plausible, just confusing. When we played through we usually dropped to one player for difficult puzzles to keep camera in the best location.

Overall I loved this game, my absolute favourite platformer thus far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141057220', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 542, 'last_played': 1441562285}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197995016399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2239, 'last_played': 1425694117}
review:
10/10!

Very addictive game. I even went for all of the achievements. Some were really tough.
But the game has solid gameplay, cool sidequests, hard challenges, nicely drawn art style and 
the controles feel flawless (PC version). 

Didn't play "the gold edition" but "the super turbo championship edition" is a beter version of the original game 
and has more content.

stats:
- killed the Alebrije
- killed/Redeemed  Xtabay
- killed Flame face
- killed El Trio de la Muerte
- killled Jaguar Javier
- killed Calaca
- 17/17 gold medals in all "infierno challenges"
- 100% map completion "all chests"  
- 7/7 orbs -> secret achievement "El Savior"

==> Overall a great game

author: {'steamid': '76561198082760072', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1424827970}
review:
Possuo tanto a versão Gold quanto essa nova. Não tenho propriedade para falar o que de fato realmente mudou ou foi acrescentado de uma versão para outra, pois a versão eu não cheguei a finalizar.

Mas já vou dizendo que a melhor maneira de se aproveitar esse jogo é com pelo menos um amigo para jogar junto, você tem a opção de jogar até quatro pessoas simultâneamente nessa nova versão.

O jogo em si não é muito longo, acredito que foram entre 6~7 horas de gameplay para eu e meu amigo finalizarmos o jogo. Mas posso afirmar que é diversão garantida durante as horas que você estiver jogando, principalmente com as muitas referências aos memes e os diálogos engraçados (nem todos são). Cada habilidade nova que você ganha abre uma nova oportunidade para novos combos, o que sempre vai dando aqueles gostinho de 'quero mais' até o final, pelo menos foi assim como me senti.

Sem muitas delongas, o jogo é muito bom e recomendo, mas pelo fato de não ser muito longo e pelo visto também não tem lá muito do fator 'replay', aconselho esperar para comprar em alguma promoção ou como no meu caso, em algum bundle, pois o preço cheio, na minha opinião, é um pouco salgado.

Nota: Calaquito/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198043149228', 'num_games_owned': 313, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 719, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1447520033}
review: Una de las mayores sorpresas que he tenido la buena suerte de descubrir últimamente. Un plataformas con una atmósfera noventera total, grandísimas situaciones de ingenio, un diseño de mapas fuera de serie, con un sistema de puzzles ultra trabajado, a niveles superiores de muchos otros videojuegos. Un indie con más carácter, entretenimiento y reto que muchos otros. Puede rivalizar sin ningún problema con cualquiera. Una mezcla entre beat 'em Up, plataformas, lucha, aventura Zeldera y Metroid. Simplemente alucinante.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082117469', 'num_games_owned': 12520, 'num_reviews': 568, 'playtime_forever': 1375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 716, 'last_played': 1460478652}
review:
Après le Guacamelee Gold Edition, DrinkBox Studio, nous ressort une nouvelle version du jeu qui a fait aimer le genre du Metroïdvania (même si je ne supporte pas ce nom), que dire de cette nouvelle version, des nouveatés entre plusieurs slots de sauvegardes, qui vous permettra de rejouer dans les deux modes (Normal et Difficile) et qui sait peut être faire un Speedrun du jeu.
Ajouts de nouvelles zones changeant la trame de l'histoire du jeu, par rapport à la précédente version.
Ajout d'une nouvelle technique qui vous fera comprendre la puissance du Luchador.
Les musiques restent superbes, même pour les nouvelles.
Un jeu haut en couleurs, qui vous donnera du fil à retordre si vous voulez le finir avec tous les succès.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019266495', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 466, 'last_played': 1426620545}
review:
It is with a heavy heart and a headache that I review this game. I have given it MANY times to try to save itself, but, now, at the last temple, it still fails. This game had a lot of potential, it really did. Smooth gameplay, nice combat system, funny story. But what it can't do, is be fun. The battles get so hard you can't get past areas, and with no difficulty settings, unless you are a major league, play hours a day, button mashing person, you will NEVER get to the end of this. 
For me? I am just going to watch a lets play of the last 20 minutes of the game, becaus I am done screaming at the game as it throws waves of baddies at you that stun lock you from full health to nothing in a matter of three seconds. 
Only get this game if you really want a hard time, for me? I got many other games to go play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981557797', 'num_games_owned': 5234, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 528, 'last_played': 1424547375}
review: Awesome metroidvania game.  It has more challenging combat and platforming in comparison to other games in the genre; but it's never feels unfair.  The game references and humor sprinkled throughout the game also set a great tone for the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059130731', 'num_games_owned': 672, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 2002, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1138, 'last_played': 1462485057}
review:
Last year I played and finished this game in co-op with a friend. It's one of the more satisfying things I played, plus a lot of simple good humor (specially when I speak mainly spanish).

The base game (and it's Gold Edition) is a great beat 'em up platformer with nice challenge in both aspects, but the fact of adding an INTENSO! meter and the possibility of playing this with 2 more friends is awesome. kinda remembered a coin-up arcade back in late 80s. Also, the Metroid-like exploring part is great too. I didn't had any problem at all revisiting areas looking to get that 100% on the area map. Some of the platforming to get some items is quite serious (damn you, Tule tree...), but it is not totally impossible.

If you enjoyed hardcore BTUs and platformers, you might want to give this a chance.

Guacamelee! Gold Edition is great, but this is the SUPER TURBO CHAMPIONSHIP EDITION. You have to get this one instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028320379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1157, 'last_played': 1449873146}

author: {'steamid': '76561198058456859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1556, 'last_played': 1422826846}
review:
Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition!!!!!!

Guacamelee! Gold Edition war/ist schon super gewesen.
"Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition" ist noch um einiges Besser, es kommt aufplolierter und mit frischen Texturen daher und hat auch einige neue Gegener und Levels und Bosse parat.
Und die Gegener haben nun eine Lebensanzeige, diese gab es in der Gold Version nicht.
"Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition" kann mit insgesamt 4 Leuten im Lokalen Ko-op Modus gespielt werden.

Story:
Worum geht es in "Guacamelee!" ?
Dies ist schnell beantwortet, Böser Arschloch-Kerl entführt Freundin vom Helden, dieser Held versucht Freundin zu retten, kennen wir alles schon, ja ja. . .
Egal, dennoch ist die Geschichte und das ganze Setting in sich komplett schlüssig und macht Spass es zu spielen.

Levels / Umgebung:
Die Levels (Dungeons) machen Spass und fordern, hier und da fehlt etwas Abwechslung, aber dies ist jammern auf hohem Niveau.

Was mich auch sehr gefreut hat sind die ganzen Verweise und Gags (Easter-Eggs) auf andere Video-Spiele. 
So gibt es etliche Plakte mit unteranderem "Link" oder den "Castle Crahsern" oder der "Kaktor" steht in der Wüste als Statue rum.


Alles in allem hat mich "Guacamelee! Gold Edition" + "Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition" vom ersten Augenblick an umgehauen und überzeugt und ist eines meiner Lielbingsspiele geworden.


Kann jedem dieses Spiel nur empfehlen.
10 von 10 Punkten. 
Definitv.
Kaufen.
JETZT!
Und
Spielen. !!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198049670666', 'num_games_owned': 1226, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 523, 'last_played': 1423038424}
review:
Best game ever to become chicken and run pass enemy 10/10. Haha joking.

To be honest I don't have a good time with brawl games quite a long time ago and this one really surprised me.

Cool story check ✓
Beautiful artwork  check ✓
Flawless control / Don't need to freaking press one goddam key like other brawl game check ✓
A very awesome little detail like switch the world, cool easter egg and parody reference check ✓

I bought from humble bundle but I can garuntee for sure. This game is TOTALLY worth it with full price.
What are you waiting for? Put that in your cart now.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998528153', 'num_games_owned': 854, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1423366326}
review:
I have gamed alot. I grew up in the 80's, with an Atari. I can say this game, stands out to me as a very original game. The art style is gorgeous, and the sound/music are excellently done and inspired.

The story has humor, it has workshop integration. It's got combat, platforming. Some puzzle work. A bit of everything. I dig it. You might too.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998281238', 'num_games_owned': 4729, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 677, 'last_played': 1421789216}
review:
I loved this game, as it falls into my favorite genre of games: beat 'em ups.  It's just like Guacamelee Gold Edition except a few new areas, enemies, and one new boss.   However, since it is so much like its predecessor, I found the game to be very easy.  A few arenas here and there gave me a few problems, but overall it was a cakewalk.  The bosses are a joke and offer little to no challenge (except for the Jaguar boss, though I still think he was tougher in Gold Edition.)  Overall, I liked playing the game again; I just wish it offered more difficulty.

8/10

Weird that it's an entirely new game when it's practically just an update to Gold Edition.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066339830', 'num_games_owned': 4107, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 1855, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1415, 'last_played': 1421687635}
review:
A polished action 2d platformer.

This game is an 'upgrade' of previously released Guacamelee Gold Edition.

Looks simple, but when you play it - it's a bit complicated since it requires a bit of learning mostly for combos and memorizing the pattern of enemies' shields in order to break it. Chaining combos also feels smooth in battle, if you master it literally you'll stomp on enemies. 

There's a regular platformer features like Double Jump, Air Combo, but what's best from this game is that the game cleverly incorporates it but sometimes it's irritating and requiring you to replay a part of the level again and again because it requires precise movement and fast fingers. I also like the swapping dimension between living and the dead, required when you progress through the game - quickly reminds me to Giana Sisters Twisted Dream and to some extent, Soul Reaver. 

Game graphic overall I'm satisfied, it has unique feel for me. Certainly not pixel level. Performance wise, I play no problem on my mediocre 635m with highest quality settings available for me, no screen tearing, no sudden FPS drops.

Game's a platformer, and so as it stands it's best played with controller. While combos are easy to perform (only directional button + action button each), I'm not sure how fast my fingers would be had I played this with KB/M especially when you're required to be fast finger during a fight or moving thru a tricky level.

As for replayability, when you finish the game you're given hard level to beat. And achievements adding more appeal to come back and obtain. But for one simple playthrough, game's a bit short - I'm clocking at 6.5 hours or so for my first.

There's a leaderboard supposedly for bragging, but how someone beats the game less than 30 minutes baffles me to no end. I checked around and found it requires tricks, well.... not so good in my opinion.

Verdict, good game, but if you own previous title you'll be sorely disappointed that there's no loyalty discount anymore. I'd wait for a sale or bundle since the improvements are not worth 15 extra USDs alone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058195030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 788, 'last_played': 1435440037}
review:
Easily one of the best side-scrolling brawlers of the last 15 years. Crisp controls, flawless level design, dedicated art style, various enemies, tons of hidden secrets and difficult challenges. Most important of all, the combat is superb. Every move is a staple in both fighting and platforming - nothing is wasted.

Amusing, frustrating at times, and good all around.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039319515', 'num_games_owned': 5530, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 2446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1315, 'last_played': 1654355393}
review: Epic game!! Por lejos el mejor platform que he jugado. Crear una sensación de mundo 3D en un 2D es un gran mérito. Gráficamente sencillo, pero hermoso, buena música, entretenida historia, hilarantes easter-eggs y referencias a otros juegos y un gameplay muy variado. Puedes volver a los lugares que ya recorriste y encontrar muchas cosas nuevas con las habilidades adquiridas. El sistema de batalla es simple, fluido y variado, todo es upgradeable, co-op, workshop, y un largo etcétera. Un MUST HAVE!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198039363696', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 651, 'last_played': 1421774576}
review:
I'm amazed at the prices this game has gone on sale for. I paid full price and feel I got a great deal.

This developer's love for video games shines in every facet of Guacamelee; the combat, platforming, the gameplay and control in general, the music, visual style, the presentation overall, are all stellar.

In addition to new areas and a boss, there are other changes in Super-Turbo-whatever including: a berserk mechanic, all specialty throws available by default, a new currency system for unlocking costumes, and probably more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067007099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 688, 'last_played': 1420240398}
review:
Um dos melhores jogos de plataforma que joguei na atualidade, se fosse antigo certamente seria um clássico.

O jogo em momento algum se torna chato, principalmente devido ao sistema de evolução do personagem que vai aprendendo novos movimentos que permitem chegar em locais que não eram possíveis antes para pegar itens escondidos. Isto faz você querer voltar em áreas anteriores só para descobrir novos caminhos. 

As áreas são muito bem desenhadas e com desafios cadas vez mais complicados sem deixar o jogo virar massante. 

A estória apesar de simples é bacana, interessante e muito bem contada.
